title: Great service, comfortable stay.
comment: Great service, comfortable stay.

title: Good facility
comment: Usually great rooms and service. This time however the room had a odd smell, plaster over dry wall was peeling and area's of missin plaster. Mold on some area of old pink tiles in the shower

title: Booked for my bridal suite
comment: The junior suites are an excellent size. Plenty of room for my bridal party and it was close to my venue. The beds rock and the kitchen is a nice size as the living room. Staff was accommodating and friendly. Great location to shopping. Parking is a ripoff for the price you pay for a room.. Park on street if possible, as we did and its free.

title: It's All Good
comment: I can't say enough good things about this resort. Thanks to the entire staff!

title: Great location and well appointed
comment: We were checked into the hotel very quickly, and soon began exploring the city. The proximity to Times Square, Broadway and Central Park were all excellent. It was also quite exciting having ex President Clinton, Hilary Clinton and Mitt Romney in the hotel during our stay. We would definately stay at this hotel again!

title: dsmini1229
comment: Let me start off saying that I really like Belvoir. The room at Downtown Raleigh, NC was not the standard. The carpet had soild spots and the room need to be dusted.I had two of every thing but bottle water and yes it is the little thing that count.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel has something that should appeal to all. It's great for couples, families, singles, small groups, large groups
title: This hotel has an amazing atmosphere
comment: We stayed at the Belvoir Waikiki in September and were instantly thrilled with what we saw. From Elaine who checked us in with her friendly yet professional manner to the sheer size and buzz of the hotel. All the staff we encountered were always happy and very helpful and made us feel at home. We will definitely be returning to the Belvoir Waikiki on our next vist...and hopefully that won't be too far away as we miss it already!

title: rooms nice but
comment: Breakfast at the Aqua VI resturant was cold, Service was below average. Had unreasonalby long wait for food delivery.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is not an "A" rated Belvoir Hotel
title: Dissappointed
comment: Upon arrival I had to wait 10 Minute for the front desk staff. (I was the only one there). Room had a stained dirty carpet, but it was vacuumed. There was glass ring stains on the countertops, bathroom counter was stained. Bed sheets were down halfway on the sides of the mattress. It took 3 tries to get someone from the front desk on the phone. There was a $10.00 fee to use the internet. Cup of yogurt and a muffin for breakfast cost me $15.00. Disappointed

title: This hotel is in a great location
comment: This hotel is conveniently located on the Penn campus; close to restaurants and the school locations I was interested in.

title: Rooms are amazing
comment: Staff was great, Room was a pleasure to come back to every night. Staff was help full. Hotel was always clean.

title: Temperature
comment: The service was wonderful. The temperature throughout the hotel was freezing. More than one person in our group came back sick.

title: good facility, marginal rooms
comment: While the location of this facility made it a good choice, and the friendliness of the staff was commendable, the rooms were cramped and musty smelling. We were given basement rooms and the bathrooms had no fans, which, I am sure, accounts for the damp, musty atmosphere in our rooms. Not up to Belvoir caliber!

everyoneShouldKnow: The Belvoir really wants your business and does a lot to make you feel comfortable.
title: This hotel has great service.
comment: Friendly, courteous, helpful staff. They bent over backwards to make us feel welcome. It seemed like there wasn't anything that they wouldn't do to make our stay more enjoyable!

title: Very nice
comment: The room was very updated and modern; comfy. The lights went out in the bathroom early one morning, and they were repaired within 20 minutes of calling. Housekeeping neglected to leave towels one morning and when we asked one of the cleaning ladies in the hall for two towels, she was rude and basically accused us of stealing the towels out of the room. One of the cleaning people also left a snickers wrapper and crumbs on the night stand, and it wasn't our snickers bar.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Food at your restaurant and bar
title: Belvoir DFW
comment: Everything that was asked for was provided for the conference. Had problems with my TV and it was taken care of within minutes of arrival. Great hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is old and needs renovation.
title: This Hotel needs work
comment: I stayed on the 10 th for three different stays and 2 different rooms. Both rooms smelled old and like a locker room after the first day of each stay. The linens were clean but the room clean up was bad. One day they left all the breakfast stuff that I had clearly finished...empty yogurt container, empty cereal bowl, banana peel, and emplty coffee. Also, once I used the cleaning bag once it was never replaced. The gym had machines that didn't work and TV's on the machines that didn't work.

title: loud and cold
comment: I had to move to another room due to the noise of people talking in the next room. I do not recommend a room with an adjoining door. Also the heat did not come on all night, very cold.

title: Nice stay
comment: I was in town for a conference. The hotel is in a great location. The staff is friendly and the room was clean.

title: The elevator system is great
comment: The room was great. The only thing that I didn't like was checking in. I requested a certain type of room when I made my reservations. W hen I checked in my request had not been taken care of. They finally got it fixed but I shouldn't of had that issue. They also held a certain amount on your card which was not told to me in advance.

title: service manager
comment: If you are to walk around the Hotel and take note, 1. wall peeling in many areas, 2. lots of water damage to ceiling and walls, 3. Windows are very dirty. And one big thing is the sheets do not fit the beds as you sleep the sheets bunch up under you? Very uncomfortable, this was the case with several of other people I had spoken to in my meeting. I hope this helps

everyoneShouldKnow: the staff was very friendly room was clean
title: Our Great Experience
comment: My Husband and I had a great experience. The staff was very helpful. We plan to be back in November.We are sure that we will have the same treatment.

title: Shower's Disappointing
comment: Most of the room was great. However, for me one of the most important things is being able to take a nice shower after a day on the road. The shower heads were unsatisfactory and not up to the level of the rest of the hotel and room. There was also some issues in the Dog & Pony on Sunday night. A number of people came down to get dinner/drinks and watch football. There was only one member on staff and he was clearly overwhelmed. I also ordered the Skirt Steak Chimichurri off of the menu. I have been a chef and know cuts of meat and what I received was not skirt steak. The meal was disappointing from that aspect.

everyoneShouldKnow: vehicles are safe when left overnight
title: Just a great place to stay!
comment: Breakfeast in Great, rooms are well kept, clean, vehicles are safe when left overnight

title: Great Hotel
comment: Stayed here for night after a meeting. Great hotel and friendly staff!

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff was very pleasant and helpful!
title: Very Pleased
comment: The first night of my stay there were some problems. Management responded quickly and provided me with another room. Staff and facilities were great!

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice location during day; not as safe after dark
title: Conference Visit with Spouse
comment: Wife was staying here for a conference. I tagged alone to get some writing done. Stayed in room on Club Level. Room was average. Club lounge was staffed by some very attentive employees (the highlight of the stay) but did not have the level of amenities I expected. Also, It seemed that many people not staying at club level were accessing the lounge and carting away food. The hotel is a very good mid-level choice. The only caveat is that at night the location is quite unsafe. But, during the day, it is in an area near very fine restaurants and attractions, e.g., the Atlanta Aquarium.

title: Hotel made our vacation!!
comment: The staff, the scenery, the whole experience was above expectations.

title: Hotel has great staff
comment: This hotel is in need of updating. However, the staff far exceeded expectations in every department. This made the difference.

title: My Review
comment: The only comment I would make is regarding parking. I find it difficult to look and see an empty parking lot around the hotel that costs $12.00 per day to park in and parking a block away for free in another parking garage. Seems not quite right in my opinion.

title: Top sheets
comment: The top sheets were so noisy!! ( to much starch). Roommate and i were afraid to move in our beds, afraid we would wake each other up.

title: excelente
comment: this hotel is verry good location, the personal is excenten and all is good

title: bill9720
comment: Location on Sand Key is great. Pool a little small but this time of year plenty of room and the beach was great. Staff could not have been more accommodating and friendly. Almost everyone of them actually had conversations with us when approached and not simply answered questions. Food at Rusty's outstanding as was service

title: September 2012 Stay
comment: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and i would highly recommend it to anyone. The staff were great and friendly and very helpful. The rooms, including conference rooms were great. The food was also good. This hotel was also in a very good location right off the PA turnpike and near local shopping. It was very easy to get to.

title: Ms. KH
comment: The Belvoir Hotel is an awesome place to stay. I would recommend this hotel to any of my family * friends.

everyoneShouldKnow: Clean and well maintained exercise room
title: Pleasant Surprise
comment: Friendly staff and excellent location provided us with a most pleasant surprise during our business trip to downtown Dallas.

title: conference
comment: The hotel was very convenient for my needs.

title: Cleaning needs to be improved
comment: I stayed at this hotel for a trade show/conference.

title: Disappointed in Customer Service
comment: Hotel was nice, I did have a problem with the front desk. My luggage was lost by the airline. When the airline called me @ 11:30 PM and told me it was on the way, I called the front desk and asked them the PLEASE call my room when the luggage arrived. Of course they did not do that and I had a very restless night worrying about my luggage, all the time it was downstairs....not good customer service at all

title: What happened to "you belong?"
comment: Over the past 10 years, I've really enjoyed staying at this property. However, because the turnover is excessive, it is rare to see a familiar face at check-in or during my stay. Therefore, if there are issues that need attention, you are generally not treated as a loyal patron unless a certain customer service/front desk manager is on duty. For the most part, the newly hired front desk staff are friendly and courteous; however, if customer service/front desk managers are rude and uncompromising, the front desk staff will think it's okay to treat patrons that way. I realize that customers are not always right, but loyalty should always be considered.

title: Employees are the Key
comment: With the exception of one employee, all your employees are exception and very customer oriented. Your staff, especially those who drive the shuttle, have been very kind to me and have gone out of their way to excel in customer service.

everyoneShouldKnow: They charge you for parking but do not tell you beforehand!
title: Do not stay at this Belvoir
comment: This hotel charges you for parking but does not disclose the same behforehand. In addition, the hotel is VERY tired and clearly in need of "refreshment."

everyoneShouldKnow: Services was great, location great. Cost was good
title: FAN
comment: Come to town every year for Bear's game, but never stayed here before. Now that we Have will make this our hotel of choice. Location is great, service also great

title: Awesome Resort
comment: Stayed at this resort for 2 nights.. It's a beautiful resort.. the staff is friendly.. the amenities are nice.. overall its a beautiful resort to spend time with family & friends :)

everyoneShouldKnow: Friendly people, great facilities, reasonable cost.
title: Good service. Nice hotel.
comment: This was my second stay at the hotel. It's nicely appointed, clean, and the service was great!

everyoneShouldKnow: The service is terrible. If you like BPG properties dont stay here, it will sour you to the entire brand.
title: Nice hotel, Nice location, Terrible service.
comment: Shame on me but I thought we would give the Seattle Belvoir another try. It seems like every time we stay here its something. I generally have a good stay at Belvoirs, and I am a platinum Grandbourne member so obviously I stay at Grandbourne quite a bit. All that being said I will NEVER stay at this hotel again unless God forbid its the only option, then I will dread every moment leading to the stay. I booked a room at this hotel for 4 nights. At check in I was thanked for my platinum status but not offered a welcome gift, (points, etc.) and I was told we were in a room with a double bed. I was traveling with my wife, kids stayed home, so I asked for a king bed. The staff looked at the computer and said "I am sorry sir, but our king rooms are totally sold out for the entire length of your stay I found this hard to believe so I asked, are you sure? "Yes sir, totally booked so I pulled up my BPG mobile app and checked, there are all kinds of king rooms available. I show the gentleman what about all these king rooms, I can get online and book one right now that is available. Now I am pretty calm, but I was pretty irritated that I had been lied to. The desk person says "let me check" goes back behind the check in wall and comes back and says "we can put you in a king room Honestly? After all that? Most hotels make me feel like staying exclusively at Grandbourne properties is a good idea and take care of us; The Belvoir downtown Seattle always, Always makes me regret it. Do yourself a favor and book a different BPG property.

title: First timer =)
comment: First visit to Denver at this hotel, I loved it and would surely return. The room was enormous and cozy. The staff are very helpful and polite, especially with the extra coffee I requested. About the only downside is, I chose the option to go GREEN, opt for the Grandbourne points, but have yet to receive them. The meeting rooms are spread out, had a time locating them.

title: Trip To New Orleans
comment: Toilet in our room did not flush properly. Also was remodeling, but otherwise everything was very nice.

everyoneShouldKnow: Hard to find due to 1 way streets
title: Hotel in brooklyn
comment: Great area, safe, all accommodations and locale were excellent.

title: Always a great stay
comment: I was upgraded to theClub floor (rm 624); and though it was a very nice room, the desk space was limited and I had to use the bed as additional work space. On future visits, I will remember to ask specifically for a room with a large desk area.

title: pet policy
comment: found no info on pet except that your hotel was pet friendly was informed upon arrival that i was to be charged $150.00 non refundable deposit.asked to see policy agents could not find it on websight manager was called and showed me whare it was buried in websight however now when i look back i still cant find it. i do look for these things prior to booking and think they should be more prominate.

title: Great experience
comment: Execellent bar staff and hostesses.

everyoneShouldKnow: Hotel nice/ Food and banquet facilities not so good
title: Room was nice but restaurant and banquet facility disappointing!
comment: The room was nice and comfortable, however I was at a wedding on Saturday and they ran out of food. They then brought food out that was cold. I know they spent allot on the wedding and this was very disappointing. On Sunday morning we went to the breakfast brunch. There was 10 of us. When we arrived they tried seating us at a dirty table. Then when we went to the buffet it was a mess, 1/2 the food was gone, no butter or syrup. We tried to eat the food and couldn't, it was cold and horrible. The manager did offer us to order off the menu at no charge. Just a disappointing stay...Personally I think the kitchen needs a lot of work!

title: Wonderful and excellent
comment: This is a fantastic place to stay , the staff were most welcoming and helpful . A special thank you to the manager and staff for making our stay so wonderful .Keep up the lovely work wont hesitate to return or recommend this hotel for future visits.

everyoneShouldKnow: Welcoming, clean, wonderful hotel, and pet friendly too!
title: Great place to stay while at Disneyland
comment: We very much enjoyed our stay at the Belvoir Park Hotel. The hotel was welcoming and friendly, as well as clean and accessible with so many amenities. Our dogs also stayed with us, and we all enjoyed the wonderful patio area that the Hotel keeps just for guests with pets. Never seen anything like it before. Our wonderful stay at the Belvoir Park made our conference / disneyland trip a real dream come true! Thanks so much.

title: perfect staff
comment: upon arrival was greeted immediatly with a warm friendly smile and from there on everything was perfect. mark checked us in and mark took our bags to the room from that time on they all used our name whenever they saw us. we went to several Grandbourne properties on this trip but my wife and i decided next time to just stay at your hotel as it had everything especially the first rate service. thank you all

title: Pleasant Experience
comment: I enjoyed my stay at the Belvoir Augusta Hotel. The room was clean, spacious and modern. The bed was very comfortable and there were no nasty cracks or mold in the bathroom. The business center was convenient and the computers were fast and well maintained. It was easy to get onto a computer and get what I needed and printed. (Many business centers are run down and pointless). Great staff, friendly and efficient. I just wish they had free breakfast. I will definitely stay there next time I'm in the area.

everyoneShouldKnow: That it is very clean and has a great location.
title: Review of Stay
comment: I always enjoy staying at this Belvoir when visiting my daughter in college. This property is clean, has everything you need on property, the staff is friendly and welcoming. I enjoyed the Restaurant and breakfast, Carlin was very prompt, attentive and friendly. The guestrooms are very comfortable and clean. No Worries. Great location.

title: Consistently poor conference food
comment: Four days of business meetings and numerous meal opportunities to rule out any anomalies. Consistently poor quality food across all breakfast, lunch, and sadly, even snack options. Hotel is OK. Location is very good. Food,...not so much. If you are looking for an average hotel in a good area and do not plan on staying here to eat, and the price is right for aforementioned criteria, then this is your hotel.

title: On site food
comment: While staying in the hotel we decided to dine right on location. My fiance and I had been told the steaks were a good choice. Our medium and medium well steaks arrived at our table well over cooked with the side dishes cold. We would stay in the hotel again, but would definatly dine away from the hotel next time.

everyoneShouldKnow: The most scenic Hotel property on the Island.
title: KeauHou Bay Area
comment: Friendliest place we've been. The pool, the views, the property, the staff & with local historic sites on property and nearby.

everyoneShouldKnow: parking is horrible, and the house keeping should ensure that the room is clean.
title: Wedding night
comment: We arrived around 11:30pm and there was no one at the front desk. We had to wait several minutes for someone to come. and we were gioven a room that was not clean; the bathroom was very dirty.

title: Best in comfort
comment: Most comfortable mattress and pillows we have EVER had!

title: Comfortable
comment: Loved the beach location. Best mattress and pillows. Slept like babies with no morning stiffness.

title: Comfortable, but needs improvement.
comment: Hi,

everyoneShouldKnow: staff works very hard to meet all customer expectations
title: Quiet and comfortable!
comment: Every request was met with a positive response by staff! Best of all, the bed was extremely comfortable, the room very quiet and we both slept very well!

title: Bedding Comfort
comment: The hotel was an excellent place to be and the only thing I think could use improvement is the bedding comfort. Otherwise it is an excellent value.

everyoneShouldKnow: this is our fifth stay and it will not be our last - easy access to interstate to everywhere
title: Tulane, tourneys, the Quarter
comment: We often stay here wheither visiting one child at Tulane, attending sports events for another, or enjoying a couple's retreat including a quick run to the Quarter. This hotel is a stone's throw to everything without having to pay the maximum price or deal with the unpleasant aspects of being in the middle of downtown.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is like staying with Family, except in an exceptional room, location, wonderful Club Lounge, Restaurant in lobby, service available 24/7.... wait...it is 100% better than staying with Family!!!
title: PERFECT IN EVERY WAY!
comment: Besides location, Club Lounge, Lobby restaurant, and Front Desk.... the Mgrs & Employee's @ this Grandbourne hotel are what makes this Belvoir 5 + Stars! Each employee is excellent & will go above and beyond to accomodate your requests. Make you feel like family! I shall stay here every time I am in this area. Thank you each and everyone who I had the pleasure to come to know!

title: Good Disneyland location
comment: Good basic hotel. Club floor average.

title: Great hotel
comment: We were happy to stay at the Belvoir Resort. The Manta Ray Bar tops it all. Thank you, we are planning to come back soon.

title: Met Expectations
comment: This hotel is located closed to the heart of Mission Valley shopping mall surrounded by reputable restaurants and other establishments. Facilities and rooms are clean and their staffs are genuinely friendly and courteous. They recognized BPG members and offers perks without you asking for it. I wish they pay more attention to room details such as having adequate electrical outlets easily accessible for electronic gadgets and laptops. Sometimes, it requires more than 1 phone call for guest service to respond.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location within Times square for walking locally
title: Excellent
comment: The only thing to improved is the club lounge use to serve a more expanded breakfast as hot food and fruit are no longer offered. I felt the offer for breakfast was subpar and not to my expectations.

everyoneShouldKnow: This is the only BPG hotel at JFK. If you need to stay here, go there with enough time and before unpacking, check that everything works in the room.
title: Low class hotel
comment: I am a platinum member, here are the three issues I had:

title: Mr
comment: COnvenient hotel. I like the swimming pool but the locker room has become very small

everyoneShouldKnow: The location is perfect for visitng Disney theme parks
title: Second excellent stay here
comment: The Swan & Dolphin resort is lovely. Its location cannot be beaten for visiting Disney parks, with 2 within walking distance. The restaurants and bars are great & the resort staff are wonderfully friendly. We love it here & find it good value.

title: A Good Time; A Good Place
comment: We enjoyed our stay very much. Staff was friendly and helpful. We were there for a wedding reception. It was such a pleasure to be in the same place as the reception. We could come and go easily. Food at the reception was EXCELLENT! We had a chance to walk and shop in the outlets. People used the exercise room and the heated pool. When we called early to make the reservations, we asked about promotionals and were informed of one that saved us money . . . and that was good, too.

title: Great Weekend Stay
comment: It was my first time visiting Chicago and the location of the hotel is great. The concierge service is awesome and its very easy to get to everything.

everyoneShouldKnow: At least one room needs a better bathroom.
title: Belvoir Gateway Los Angeles
comment: The room I stayed in was adequate. My main beef is with the bathroom. The sink handles were broken. The shower did not drain properly. The bathroom needs to be overhauled. The rest of the room was great.

title: pay for room internet?
comment: Never had to do that before, disappointing to pay $12.95 a day for net access. It's free in the lobby, big deal.

title: Wonderful hotel
comment: We wanted to use our suite night upgrades, but since the hotel was sold out we could not redeem them. We had booked a traditional room using cash and points and we were upgraded to a deluxe room with a view of the city on one side and Lake Michigan on the other side. The staff was very attentive and our room was wonderfully unexpected.

everyoneShouldKnow: Located in the middle of everything about 3 blocks from the boardwalk.
title: Hotel near everything
comment: I have stayed here several times. My recent stay was for shopping at the outlets and to see a show at 1 of the casinos. The only 2 things that i would comment about would be: 1) Their was a dog staying on our floor which barked a lot. 2) The buffet was cold.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location for conference, but not for shopping.
title: Great Hotel for Conference
comment: My husband and I spent three nights at the Belvoir Downtown Raleigh, while I attended a conference there. Our room was nice and clean, although a little small. Everything worked fine, except the fan in the bathroom was a little noisy, and was not on a separate switch from the light. The conference facilities were wonderful. No problems finding the rooms for the workshops and sessions, and the food furnished by the hotel was really good. While there are many restaurants nearby, there are no "convenience" stores or drug stores open later in the day or after lunch on Saturday to get toiletries, sodas or snacks. Everything closes early, which is really strange.There is literally no shopping nearby. Lots of museums within walking distance, though. Three blocks from Amtrak, so it is very convenient for that type of travel. Overall, it was a good experience.

title: Less than Good!
comment: This hotel left a sour taste in my mouth regarding the Belvoir name. The rooms are small in general. I paid for a larger corner room but was put in a small room because my wasnt ready and wouldn't be until 4pm?!? Also, the air conditioner was not working so the room was hot. I asked for help regarding the AC to no avail. I will not stay here again which is unfortunate because it is the most convenient location to the mall. My company will be sending 1-6 people to the area weekly and now they will need to find an alternate location.

title: Room with a view
comment: We were so excited to be able to see the Charles River and a great view of the city for our stay at the Belvoir! The room was perfect in every way, from the guest recycling options to the beautiful linens. The Belvoir Boston takes care of every detail for a great stay.

title: Dolphin
comment: Generally this property is top notch, but this experience was a little below my expectations. The room (14100) was musty and damp. The tissue box had 1 tissue. The room service breakfast sheet was in japanese requiring I call the front desk to get one in english. We didn't have a refrigerator and I'd purchased food at Epcot. I called the front desk and requested one and they said they'd have one delivered; however, 30 minutes later and ready for bed, I called and canceled it. I requested extra cream on my room service order sheet for my coffee, which is usually provided; however, this time it wasn't requiring the attendant go get more, which took 30 minutes. Just not up to par.

title: TOP OF THE LINE.
comment: This trip to Atlanta was a pleasure. The Belvoir met my every need. When visiting downtown The Belvoir Atlanta is my choice.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, but not so friendly and parking is difficult.
title: Lots of confusion
comment: Parking situation is not good. Neither is check in. No one to aid in the garage vouchers when you pull up around the back makes traffic jams and a dangerous situation. Having to park, then go in, then go back out to car to get luggage is too much of a process when you can't leave your car in the roundabout. Staff was not friendly and quite dismissive. Cleaning staff was very nice, but our room had a funny smell. Also when I made the reservation I was not able to remove the deposit from the original credit card I used to place the hold even though I was told that I would.

everyoneShouldKnow: The suite is spacious and very clean.
title: Great location for my stay
comment: Before I called to reserve my stay, I was able to review the suite. It was all that I expected. I plunged myself on the luxurious bed and sunk into plushness. I came for busniess, but felt like a mini getaway.

title: Nice hotel
comment: Nice, clean hotel in great location. Attended hotel for a conference and it was very convenient. Only comment is that the hotel needs to put trash cans in all the meeting rooms. The only waste bins we could fine were in the restrooms, which were chronically out of paper.

title: So comfortable!
comment: This is the 5th time I've stayed at the Belvoir Suites. It is a wonderful place to stay. It is SO comfortable, feels very safe and is in a good location to get to many different parts of Dallas. While I did not eat in the restaurant or sit in the bar this trip, I have in the past and it was a fine value for the cost. The staff is very helpful, and eager to please.

title: Good Location
comment: This hotel is conveniently located to most 'must see' attractions including Fenway Park. Being attached to shopping is a big plus, as well as access to the Top of The Hub.

title: Elegant
comment: Lovely accommodations. Great shuttle service.

title: The Belvoir Gunter Hotel - Always Welcoming
comment: The Belvoir Gunter Hotel is an unique historic hotel. You feel like you are stepping back in time when you enter the hotel. Soon after arriving you will notice the staff's commitment to service. They see to it that you are well taken care of. On top of that the restaurant in the hotel is fantastic with excellent servers (never had to ask for a refill - they are on top of that). Their breakfast buffet was delicious!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great place with amenities to your needs and is center of downtown and close to eating and shopping location and to sports facilities
title: Recommendation for improvement
comment: was unabale to log on to internet even though I was told I had access.

title: A/C not working well and NO WATER on last day!!
comment: I stayed for 3 days. The hotel is nice, but the A/C in my room was less than sufficient. It ran constantly for 3 days, but never got down to a comfortable temp. Then, on the last day, the water was shut off throughout the entire hotel. We couldn't flush the toilet, take a shower, or even brush our teeth. The hotel's response to this was to provide each room with 2 bottles of water. No other compensation...made the last day of my trip very unsatisfactory.

title: Perfect location, fine service, excellent stay
comment: I just wrapped up an absolutely flawless stay. Granted, I'm a Grandbourne Gold Card holder and it's possible I got some extra-special treatment, but from check in to (painless) check out, I felt like a very, very special guest. I was upgraded to a high floor with a SPECTACULAR view of the river and skyscrapers... There were no "Club Level" rooms available, but I was given club access on my key, which was certainly just as good (Club access gets you complimentary breakfast, cocktail-hour snacks, and free beverages all day, in addition to access to a computer with printer -- perfect for checking in for your flight!). I was also given free Internet access in my room, and even two complimentary drink passes. (I was meant to be given one, but when I mentioned that I was there for a romantic weekend, the man the counter gave me two).

everyoneShouldKnow: It is located in an area accessible to a lot of food places, trolley, bus lines, as well as entertainment
title: C.M.E
comment: The meeting facilities for small and large groups are great features. The service of hotel staff all around is professional as well as friendly and willing to meet the needs of the guest.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's amazing and worth every penny you spend!
title: Best Hotel!
comment: My husband and I came to the Belvoir resort for our honeymoon. We were blown away by how helpful, professional and friendly all the staff was. We felt so welcome from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. I would recommend this resort to anyone staying in Kauai!

title: Not the greatest stay
comment: There are several issues that i had during my stay. my room had a bad smell so they had someone come up and spray air freshner, still not good, my key was never registered to my room, so i was charged out the nose for parking, and when i went to the front desk to bring to their attention, i was told there really wasnt anything that she could do, but fix the card now, as to which that was my last night, what a waste. The room was ok, but it needs improvements or updates. For this to be a Belvoir I expected a lot more.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you are not a Grandbourne Preferred Guest, make sure to sign up when you check in.
title: First stay at this facility
comment: I was in Chicago for a conference and the entire stay was excellent. My room was very comfortable (loved the plush comforters) and had a great view, food provided by hotel for conference attendees was delicious, hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, housekeeping staff was very attentive to needs and restaurants/cafes and coffee bar were outstanding. The overall experience made the conference even better.

title: Alright
comment: Enjoyed the hotel, my issue was housekeeping coming and and when they finished, or whenever would turn my Air Conditioner off, and open my blinds. I would leave the A/C on and blinds closed as I had a west facing room. Very warm out and my room was like an oven. Point leave my room settings alone.

title: Nicest Hotel in the Area
comment: I do business in the greater Brandon/Valrico metropolitan area and have yet to find a hotel that matches the customer service and overall fit and finish of the Belvoir Tampa East. Convenient location is quiet yet close to major highways. Check-in/check-out are a breeze. A delightful stay from start to finish.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you leave something in your room, don't count on ever seeing it again.
title: Mixed experience
comment: Check-in was cordial and efficient, and the room was comfortable. I would recommend this hotel simply because of its convenient location in my local airport, and the general comfort of the rooms. However, after a recent stay in which I left a personal item in the room, I had an experience of very bad customer service. First, I didn't receive even the courtesy of a return phone call after I left a detailed message for housekeeping a few hours after I checked out. When I gave up waiting and called again two days later and asked to speak to a "real person in housekeeping," I was promised that by the phone operator, but again put through somebody's voicemail. I drove 40 minutes back to the hotel, and when housekeeping looked for my item and couldn't find it, staff implied that I was mistaken that I'd left it there. When they finally located it, after my repeated insistance that they look in their lost and found "one more time," they came up with excuses instead of a simple apology. They were actually full of excuses, e.g. the reason I didn't get a call back in the first place was that the supervisor was off the day I left the message.

everyoneShouldKnow: the people make it a success
title: people
comment: the resort is beautiful however the people make it from jamie who checked us in to the greeter in your excellent resturant to the young lady who served us drinks that night and went the extra mile to help us get dinner right. thank you

title: Surprisingly unpleasent
comment: First, the valets ignored us. We unloaded our own bags and I finally hailed a valet and asked him for a ticket and to please park the car. No offer was made to carry our bags. When we left I called down for the car. When we arrived my wife and I had to load the car ourselves and go to the ticket window to pay and get our keys. The valets never did a thing. For this service we paid an exorbitant parking fee.

title: Business Travel
comment: I had problems at another hotel your on duty manager Ta handled everything beyond my expectations. thankyou

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Location to Fenway and Subway.
title: Lawandra-Front Desk
comment: Very professional and helpful. Allowed early check in and also rearranged the two rooms so they were close together. The bathrooms were a bit of a surprise for the room rate?

title: Check in
comment: The check in experience couldn't have been worse.

title: Early morning noise
comment: Our room was very nice. The view was awesome. But unfortunately the neighbors were terrible. I was awakened at 1:30 a.m. by slamming doors and loud yelling. I finally called "0" at around 1:47 a.m. and security came up to quiet them down. It worked; there was no more noise, but I couldn't get back to sleep until around 4! I was so disappointed. Other than that, everything was excellent as always.

title: Great service & amenities
comment: The hotel was very nice & the staff extremely helpful. Not thrilled with the quality of the food at the resturant.

everyoneShouldKnow: Not equivialnt to other BPG properties of the same grade
title: Overview
comment: Great hotel, could use a remodel on the rooms, not equivilant to BPG properties at equal ratings.

everyoneShouldKnow: The rooms is cozy and clean.
title: Wonderful stay
comment: If I have the chance to stay in roanoke again I will stay at the Belvoir. I love the area I can't wait to stay again

title: Air Conditioning System is Weird
comment: I was at the Belvoir for an event and only had about 20 minutes to change and get ready in my room. It was a very hot day and my room was very warm when went inside. I attempted to put the A/C on and found out by reading the manual in the room that it takes 15-20 minutes to kick in! So the room was very hot the whole time I was getting ready, which was a pain. Once I got back to the room later that night, it was a pleasant temperature b/c the A/C had been on. Some of these "green" measures are just plain silly and more of a nuisance than they were worth. Also the hallways of the hotel were very warm, which wasn't pleasant, and smelled like curry. The hotel is beautiful overall and well maintained. I would recommend changing the air conditioning system though. We ordered room service for breakfast the next morning and while everything was delicious, the portions were TINY. I got huevos rancheros and I think there were two tablespoons of black beans on the plate. If the hotel is going to charge room service prices, at least make the portions decent. Also, the hotel front desk staff wasn't very friendly and didn't seem anxious to get my room for me even though it was a VIP room.

title: This hotel has great service
comment: It was a great trip. First time we got to use the club. The workers were great and a great asset to your Hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: FOOD WAS GREAT, AND STAFF WAS VERY HELPFUL WITH ALL MY NEEDS.
title: BEST PLACE TO STAY IN ARLINGTON,TEXAS
comment: THE STAFF IS THE BEST...FROM THE VALET TO HOUSEKEEPING. ALSO, PLEASE GET ROOM SERVICE FOR HOT AND TASTY FOOD. THE FRONT DESK WAS THE MOST HELPFUL AND FRIENDLY I HAVE HAD IN YEARS. KEEP UP THE GREAT JOB.

title: BackAgainAussies
comment: Once again we return...

title: the staff are the finest
comment: the staff went above and beyond expectations of every need for us. Friendly and very effecient....they really made the stay!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Located a few blocks off Ocean Blvd. with great views and none of the beach traffic
title: Great ocean views
comment: Room on 10th floor had wonderfull ocean views. Cooling was not as effecive as we would like. Valet parking appeared tp be an issue for the staff on our three day stay., but all were friendly and helpfull

title: What a pleasant stay.
comment: I have stayed there several times. There is a tall manager and he remembers everyones name. Waves and addresses you by name, friendly greeting everytime. Its nice to have thar when you are missing home.

title: Needs improvement
comment: This hotel needs to clean its act up. The rooms badly need a refit and the staff at the hotel need to do a course in customer service. The towel staff around the pool are way to busy talking to each other than talking to customers. The check in staff could be a lot more friendly. Overall after staying at an BPG hotel, I expect a lot better service. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Not very clean
comment: I always choosse BPG hotels when I am travelling, and have stayed at this Belvoir twice. The first stay was average, nothing to rave about. The second stay was for this past Friday. I arrived late, around midnight and the check-in was very smooth, and the associate made sure to recognize my BPG status.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very nice to have the option of omitting housekeeping in order to accrue more BPG points.
title: convenient area, comfortable and safe
comment: Very comfortable, cozy room. It would have been nice to have a mini-fridge in the room as well as free internet. Other than these comments, everything else was super.

title: Ms.
comment: Hotel was centrally located. Staff at Bell desk and concierge was great and very helpful. Food was good in restaurant. Ballroom facilities were good and spacious. Front desk staff was not very welcoming..

everyoneShouldKnow: Right off the highway. Great little shops and restaurants right in walking distance.
title: Love the Belvoirs
comment: Have stayed at many Belvoirs. Portsmouth one of our favorites. Beds and pillows are soooo comfy. Pouring the night we were there so we ate in at the restaurant, Excellent meal and service. Free dessert with our check in. Can't wait to go back!

everyoneShouldKnow: Overall, this hotel needs a MAJOR renovation. Until then, avoid it.
title: 3 words to describe this hotel: What a dump!
comment: I am a travel industry professional and am responsible for managing corporate travel programs for Fortune 500 Companies. As a result, I am frequently on the road. Many years ago I stopped staying at Belvoir Hotels, as I saw a decline in the quality. I was booked into the Belvoir Los Angeles Downtown by a colleague, mainly due to the location and the discounted industry rate. I was quicky reminded why I vowed not to stay at Belvoir hotels. The Front Desk area was loud and I could barely hear the woman who checked me in, due to excessive noise. I was put in a room on the 3rd floor and attached to a meeting room. The bathroom was dingy, paint peeling by the ceiling, with no washcloths. There was a broken thermostat on the wall and the room was too hot. The bed was reasonably comfortable and the only worthwhile aspect of the room. The wi-fi was additional fee and slow. I could hear people in the hallway, as if they were inside my room. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and had I encouraged a client to use the hotel, I would be fired.

title: This hotel has great features
comment: My stay at the Belvoir was a wonderful experience. Maria from Housekeeping kept my room fresh and clean. Steven, Sandee, Sean, Chris, Denise and everyone in Guest Services are worth their weight in gold.They all go the extra mile to meet your needs. My dog loves all of them, and you know what they say about dogs being a good judge of character. Enjoy your stay at the Belvoir Europa Center in Chapel Hill!

title: Excellent Hotel
comment: This was my first visit to Hawaii so I wanted to stay at a well-known hotel. After reading several reviews online, I decided on the Belvoir mostly for it's location.

title: Fabulous Service
comment: I have stayed at the Belvoir Waikiki on two occasions... both times the front desk check in was great. courteous and I would recommend this place to anyone.

everyoneShouldKnow: its way too expensive for what you get! i dont care about paying big money for nice rooms but these were so small and ugly, i hated every nght i stayed there. i complained and nothing could be done apparently
title: stay somewhere else
comment: so very disapointed in this place, it spoilt my time in New York. i paid huge money to stay in the tiny, ugly dated old rooms. i proposed to my partner during my time in NYC and this place really impacted the time we had. woken every night by the noise in room and every morning early! put in the wrong room then had to complain twice to be moved to another below average room. nothing good to say about this place at all

everyoneShouldKnow: Beautiful room; very friendly staff & bartender
title: September Stay - Edison, NJ
comment: The stay was very comfortable with the exception that the pillows were too soft and the walls are "paper thin". There was a group of rowdy guests that woke up the 3rd floor at 2:30am while in the hallway. Once in their room, their little dog barked for apporximately 15 minutes.

title: Excellent
comment: Excellent location and excellent service and amenities.

title: Hotel has great staff
comment: I was surprised when the staff said hello to me by my name. It shows they are "on the ball"!

title: The Service was extraordinary
comment: This is one of the best hotels for service! The hotel people could not do enough to make your stay pleasant and memorable. The front desk was great and the housekeeping really do their job. The hotel is very clean and very inviting. I would suggest this hotel to anyone staying in downtown Atlanta.

title: great deal
comment: excellent hotel for the price

title: Nice Hotel
comment: When I had my first stay at this hotel about 3 years ago I decide I will never stay at another this was my hotel and stay here everytime I come to Dallas,Texas .

everyoneShouldKnow: Give yourself plenty of time to check in
title: Check in
comment: The check in was really a horrible experience. There were never more than two attendants checking people in. My husband waited in line over an hour to check in and when we checked in at 3:00, we were told our room was not ready and would not be ready until after 4. We got our room at 4:30. We had traveled over 6 hours and the wedding was to begin at 5 and there were 4 of us to get ready for a special occasion for our family. The line at 1 point we were told was backed up through the lobby and well over an hour long. We were told that there had been an accident on the top floor and that caused the issue, but somehow we felt perhaps you might have been better prepared with all of those people who had chosen your hotel for their stay. It kinda got us off to a bad start.

title: Belvoir Wilmington
comment: All staff were pleasant and helpful.

title: GREAT SERVICE
comment: THE HOTEL Belvoir IS A HOME AWAY FROM HOME! EXCELLENT SERVICE, THE FRONT DESK PERSONEL WAS FRIENDLY AND HELPFULL. THIS IS MY HOTEL OF CHOICE FOR NASHVILLE

title: A place to comeback
comment: We had and excellent stay, Food was excellent and the location can not be better.

title: Not happy
comment: My son and I went to the dining for dinner. It opened at 5:00 and we were a little after five along with a family of 4 and had to track done someone in order to be seated. Ordered a salad and sandwich and waited 30 minutes for our meal, while other walked up to hostess stand and ordered to go and got it before us. My son was also bit on the are numerous times by something making big welts and itching. Not happy.

everyoneShouldKnow: Do not pay full price for this hotel
title: Ok for a short discounted rate stay
comment: Even though there were many staffers who really tried, it wasn't enough to overcome the issues of a very moldy and musty room, the incomplete and seemingly lazy approach from housekeeping, and the absolutely rude and horrid staff at DRAFTS restaurant in the lobby, the 1980's outdated and worn decor.

title: Exceeded Expectations
comment: Great location, great room and very comfortable bed; recent renovations were noticeable. Better experience than expected.

title: Great Place
comment: The Hotel was great, the location was wonderful! AND so much more affordable than other hotels.

title: wonderful weekend
comment: Stayed 2 nights for our anniversary celebration. thought we wanted a room on the grnd floor facing the pool. The room had a view of only shrubs and smelled funky. Changed rooms - no problem. Got room 746 facing north east. Looked out on Sand Key park with the bridge to clearwater beach in the distance and a small section of gulf beaches to the northwest. No sunset view but we were at outdoor restaurants both nights for sunset so the west facing rooms were not worth the $40 upcharge.

title: wonderful staff
comment: from the moment you walk in front desk adrian loretta kim kate michael and gm tom just a pleasure to work with fast and complete

everyoneShouldKnow: The employees will work to make your stay enjoyable.
title: Enjoyed my stay
comment: I stayed at this hotel with my mother and 10 month old daughter. It was great because they were able to provide a refrigerator and crib, at no charge. Additionally, when i initially called to upgrade to a suite from the regular room reserved for my company's conference Tirsa Ortiz was very polite and professional. She provided me with alternatives for the suite size to accomodate me traveling with my infant daughter and care taker. The suite was great because there was plenty of room for my daughter to walk around and play with her toys.

title: Univ. of Connecticut Visit
comment: We loved this hotel. We flew in to the airport for a quick visit to see University of Connecticut. The rooms were very comfortable and clean and the food was great. Customer service was amazing.

everyoneShouldKnow: Stay in rooms higher tham Palm trees. They obstruct the beautiful view of the sunsets. Don't forget anything in your room when going to beach, very long walk.
title: Uncomfortable Beds
comment: The hotel needs some updating, great location, friendly staff but the beds are so uncomfortable. The pillows are also worn out, no support. I did not get a full night sleep the entire stay (4nights)

title: Very Nice Hotel
comment: The Belvoir met my expectations of a fine hotel. The room was clean and the staff was friendly and very responsive to our needs. My only complaint is that the hotel should supply parking for it's guests. Or not charge such a high rate. To stay for a week it will cost you $140.00, almost the price of a room for one night.

title: Needs improvement
comment: Fixtures are becoming dated. Toilet seats are faded.

title: Excellent Hotel
comment: Recently visited Duluth to take advantage of the Fall colors and ride the train to Two Harbors. The Staff and room at this location were above the standard. Very clean rooms, nice workout facility and convienent location. The hotel shuttle drivers were always on call which made getting around the city very easy. Had a great stay and would recomend this Belvoir to friends.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's comfortable and there are many amenities there
title: This hotel is great for the whole family
comment: I traveled to this location for a conference. I was alone, but I could have brought my wife, and kids or grandkids. There's plenty to do with the pool and fitness center, and lots to do nearby as well!

title: Boston Belvoir
comment: The hotel was clean and provided everything needed. The location was convenient and the staff was helpful and friendly. I would stay here again.

title: Hotel with great service.
comment: This hotel is right off the beach, was clean and well staffed, had a 24 hour convenience store inside, and was part of the local trolley system to get you around the area.

title: Expecting much more...
comment: The first day II had a bug in my bed.

title: Wilmington South Belvoir
comment: Wonderful hotel - absolutely recommend!

title: Needs work
comment: The staff was great but the value was less than expected.

title: Excellent Hotel
comment: Clean, convenient, affordable and a fantastic staff. The only criticism is with the restauraunt staffing. We had dinner on a busy Saturday night and it took two hours for dinner due to a lean staff. Morning breakfast also took too much time and the staff was just standing around although our waitress was very nice.

title: Very comfortable room!!
comment: We have stayed at this Belvoir several times before. As always our room was very comfortable. The location is perfect for a walk to the Circle. Next time in Indianapolis we will be back.

everyoneShouldKnow: Housekeeping staff was helpful in trying to get room reassigned, but management delayed process
title: Disappointing check-in
comment: Room assigned with keys at front desk was still occupied. Took over 45 minutes to reassign another room. Was late for a wedding due to delay. New keys assigned to new room did not work. Expectations not met at check-in and caused disappointment for remainder of stay

everyoneShouldKnow: right next to the ferry to NYC
title: close to NYC and outstanding
comment: the staff is helpful and friendly. the hotel is in great shape and very clean. right across the parking lot to the ferry to NYC. Great place to base your NYC trip from.

title: Vu & Tristan make this hotel
comment: I booked this hotel SOLELY based on the reviews I saw about Tristan. I knew I wanted to stay at a hotel that provided excellent customer service and this hotel seemed to fit the bill. Here is a breakdown of my experience.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location if you want to see and do in Dallas!
title: State Fair
comment: THe hotel is convenient to the state fair park, it is easy to check in/out, and the rooms are always comfortable and clean.

title: Less than expected
comment: 1. The room we were given had not been cleaned (bed unmade, dirty towels on the floor)

title: Great --- But
comment: We have stayed here a few times and everything has been great but this time was a bit different. I had a $100 gift card through a web booking site and when I used it I did not realize I forfeit my BPG status. I am not sure if that is why we were placed in a group of rooms where people had no respect for others or if it happened to be the clientele that weekend. But our one night stay consisted of only a few hours sleep.

everyoneShouldKnow: Accessible to all Albuquerque has to offer.
title: Boston on Tour
comment: We arrived from Boston with friends in tow. We've been with BPG since the 90's.

title: parking
comment: I have stayed in just about every brand of Hotel all over the US and abroad and have NEVER paid so much for parking! I was not told the price or options when I arrived or I would have self parked! Also the 2 times I tried to get my car it took over 20 -30 minutes because there was not anyone working! I will Never stay there again!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Very affordable for what the hotel offers
title: First Impression is Always a Great Memory !!!
comment: As usual, we were very satisfied with another Belvoir Hotel. From the minute we arrived to our departure, all our needs and requests we met. Front desk gentlemen were exceptionally friendly and accommodating. Look forward to coming back !!

everyoneShouldKnow: The room I stayed in featured old carpet, worn out grout in the baths and was not clean.
title: This hotel is a disaster
comment: I found the Belvoir in Boston to be way below expectation. The room was dirty, the bathroom was a mess, the elevators were not timely, the food at the convention was overcooked and poor in quality. It took numerous times to make sure my BPG rewards number was attached to my reservation and I am still not sure it is. The staff was not nelpful and not friendly. It basically was a disaster.

title: Disneyland Stay
comment: The room was great, the view not so much and we did not have a hair dryer in our room so we had to call down for one. The concierge upgrade food was marginal and very crowded. overall we had a good experience though. Dinner we had to wait 40 min and there were only two tables with people.

title: Great frontdesk team
comment: From the arrival to the check out on sunday the friendliness and attention of stuff was outstanding. Will gladly use again and recommend.

title: Access to Lounge
comment: Great feature and maybe i am spoiled

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel staff is cordial and accomodating.
title: This hotel was totally satisfying
comment: My stay was terrific from beginning to end. The staff was friendly and jovial.

everyoneShouldKnow: They try to accommodate your requests promptly.
title: Great Hotel...has Everything You Need
comment: My most recent stay at the Belvoir Atlantic City Convention Center Hotel....was wonderful. From the time you pull up in front and are met by staff....you are continually made to feel welcome and a valued customer!!! From the parking attendant, to the registration desk and on....everyone has a "can do" attitude. It is a pleasure to be in such a positive atomsphere!

everyoneShouldKnow: THE CLUB LEVEL IS WORTH THE EXTRA EXPENSE
title: GREAT DISNEYLAND VIEW
comment: WE COME TO THIS HOTEL BECASUE IT HAS THE BEST VIEW OF THE DISNEYLAND FIREWORKS SHOW

title: Great Place
comment: Great food , very clean room. pool was beautifull and grounds.

everyoneShouldKnow: park in S parking if there for convention
title: comfortable, large desk work space
comment: If you have lots of paperwork to keep separated, the double desk arrangement gives you lot's of space for it. Bed was comfortable & room arrangement with closet & drawers near the bathroom made getting ready fast.

everyoneShouldKnow: Exceptional staff and the city views are wonderful.
title: Very happy
comment: I needed a place to stay close to my husband's work in Studio City. I chose the Belvoir Universal. Immediately when I walked in, It was very clean and modern. We go to Las Vegas a lot and the lobby riveled any 5 star Las Vegas Hotel. The staff from valet, to the greeter in line who offered me wine, to the desk manager were extremely pleasant and professional. I asked for an upgrade and although I know this was unusual, she put me in a suite on the 16th floor! This had a entry, dining room, living room, two baths, a small butlers pantry and a separate bedroom with views all around! I appreciated the effort and WILL BE BACK. Thank you Belvoir for making our stay a memorable one.

title: Great experience!
comment: The hotel staff was extremely helpful, friendly and professional. The room was even better than we had expected. It was extremely spacious for 3 of us and everything was clean, comfortable and well above average. Everything about our stay was fantastic from beginning to end.

title: reservation
comment: the Grandbourne central reservation system and the hotels reservation system were not in sync and delayed my check in consdiderably as the hotel had no confirmed reservation for the 2 rooms I booked. However the staff was very helpful in resolving it and getting us the proper accommodations. the hotel facilties and the stay were otherwiise very good.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is walking distance to the promenade.
title: Great experience at Belvoir Delfina
comment: We stayed just 1 night. Were able to park in the hybrid spaces just at the entryway of the parking lot which was really convenient. The check-in process was extremely easy. We were able to stay in a double room with 2 beds (which hasn't always been the case at other Belvoir's I've stayed at. The reserved room type was a 'preference'). And the room was laid out nicely. With the hotel being on Pico which is a busy street the sliding doors do an amazing job of cutting out sound.

title: Amazing stay
comment: Staff was wonderful, bedding was luxurious, facilities were great. Great hopst for our hockey team!

everyoneShouldKnow: Superb location for visit to UPenn
title: Excellent staff, location
comment: The hotel staff was professional, welcoming, and helpful. We stayed in a very well-priced mini-suite with a King bed and large separate seating area with a pull-out sofa. The design of the room was exceptional and ideal for travel with either families or even an unrelated work associate. Only recommendation is to either replace the sleep-sofa mattress or provide a foam or air mattress topper. The location was terrific-- convenient to UPenn books store, an excellent variety of restaurants, medical center, UPenn sports facilities. Look forward to future stays.

title: Great Hotel
comment: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and quite enjoyed our visit. The location was wonderful, the conceirge was very helpful and the room was very clean. Loved the all white bedding and white bathroom. Proves that the room is clean. Would definetly stay here again.

title: Bad Stay
comment: I have stayed at this hotel 2 times now and will not be going back. The fist night I did not have any wash clothes in my bathroom, the second night, I came back to a dirty towel left on the floor inside the door and no bath mat. I did however get wash clothes. I called down stairs but they just sent me more towels. I found complimetary water the first night but guess you ownly get that for one night because there was no more the second night. The valet parking was a joke. They really need someone to direct traffic and lear what 5 minutes actually is instead of just saying it to say it.

title: Simply the best
comment: As a 10+ year Platinum member with over 400 nights on the road, I have sampled quite a few Grandbourne properties around the world. In all my travels, this is simply the best Belvoir I have ever visited when it comes to the overall family experience. Service is first rate, location (easy walk to private LegoLand entrance) is incredibly convenient, rooms are clean and comfortable, the fitness center is well stocked with the latest gear and the property is safe, attractive and inviting. Just returned from my first visit and we will be making this an annual tradition. HIGHLY recommended for families with young children.

title: Great hospitality
comment: Attentive staff

everyoneShouldKnow: Truly a beautiful location and facility on the backside of LegoLand. However the park closes early so there is no noise from the park at night.
title: Great Resort...Lousy Mattress...Long Coffee Line
comment: This is a beautiful location that provides fun for families or a romantic get a way. My wife and I were so happy with the staff and facility right up until we went to sleep.

title: Great hotel for everyone.
comment: Great hotel for everyone.

title: Great Beds!!
comment: I LOVE the mattresses in this Belvoir!! I felt like I was sinking into a cloud when I got in the bed. It was a great nights sleep!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Offers Many dining choices, Excellent Spa, However Pool Closes to Early
title: This hotel has many 5 Star Features
comment: This hotel has many great restaurants, walking distant to the, "Boardwalk" where one can find more dining / entertainment options. However after a long day outside of the hotel, I would have liked to enjoy the Pool / Spa area more. The closing time of 9pm of the pool appears to early for an exceptionally well rated hotel.

title: Yet another great trip
comment: Has to be my favorite place to stay. Really cannot think of anything else I could want or need in a hotel. Always expect and receive great service.

title: Very convenient and accommodating
comment: The front desk asked me which view I would like. That was the first time anyone had ever asked that. Her name was Anca and she was very accommodating.

everyoneShouldKnow: The views from the Club Lounge are spectacular.
title: The Belvoir Boston just gets better!
comment: I like this hotel better each time I stay. The location is great and the renovated rooms are wonderful.

title: Great Stay and Staff was very nice
comment: check in was very friendly and fast. room and hotel very clean. Easy to wrok with on last minute changes to my reservation.

everyoneShouldKnow: You have to pay to park unless you get your parking ticket validated at the front desk. Give yourself time to get out of the parking lot since not everyone knows this and it causes a huge line to get out of the lot.
title: Must Be Updated
comment: My room had chipped tiles in the bathroom, there were stains on the couch, and the wall paper was peeling off in the bedroom. Additionally, the refrigerator/freezer was turned off; therefore, resulting in the carpet in front of the refrigerator/freezer to be wet as well as the inside of the refrigerator/freezer. AND, the view was of scaffolding which was very unpleasant but I hope it was there because the hotel is getting updating. It was a bad staff as far as the facility/room goes but thankfully the staff was super nice.

everyoneShouldKnow: Feel comfortable with all needs met.
title: great food
comment: Bistro was excellent. Food was excellent and times to dine were convinient

title: Beautiful Rooms
comment: We really enjoyed our stay at the Belvoir in Avon. The room was wonderful and very comfortable.

title: Great Location
comment: The entire hotel was very nice. Location was great in a nice neighborhood within easy walking distance to many attractions. Room was clean and up to date.

title: Society Hill Weekend getaway
comment: Great, great location. Beautiful and safe neighborhood. Only issue was noise from a wedding under our room, but we were moved to a different room that was much quieter. Thanks! Hotel is very nice and valet parking was careful with car. Really could only suggest that you inquire about any events there before you book. Otherwise tops for looks and location. Thanks again Belvoir!

title: Great location and overall a good place
comment: The location is great right in the heart of Waikiki and across the street from the beach. The hotel needs a facelift and has been delayed because it was to be torn down a few years ago. The recession has shelved that plan. The rooms are very clean and the beds comfy.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't miss the s'mores at RumFire!
title: Amazing!
comment: Fantastic location, views, f&b, service...this place had it all!

title: Convenient
comment: Great location, close to freeways, DCA, Arlington Cementary, and Pentagon. Parking is pricey at hotel and everywhere in town, so getting to metro from hotel would be nice.

title: BEST NIGHT EVER!
comment: I took a chance booking this hotel for one evening while doing some shopping and socializing in Albuquerque. I have high hotel standards, and was expecting them to be met with this place. Wow, they certainly were! The staff were courteous, efficient, and helpful. The hotel gym was very nice and they even had refrigerated towels after my workout! The hotel bar was fun and comfortable, and the overall decor felt updated and worth the price of the hotel. I will definitely stay here again!

title: Great Stay
comment: My wife, grand daughter, and I had a great stay at your hotel. I would like to thank "ALI

title: Maybe not the best for a tired one night stop-over
comment: I stayed just one brief night between a long day of road travel and a long day of air travel. So I was tired and perhaps not very tolerant. Nevertheless, I was dismayed to find, after I had returned my rental car, that the hotel does not offer a shuttle service to and from the airport. The additional $45 for a taxi each way seemed like a significant extra expense I had not anticipated. Further, I found the room, though with ample space, to be poorly lit and with a fairly antiquated air conditioning system. There was someone else's hair on the bedroom vanity. The bathroom was small with only a standard residential bathtub (with a drain plug that would not stay open for the use of the shower). The decor of the room seemed outdated to me. When I called to report that I could not access my room because my key cards would not work, I was placed on hold, after which I was told someone would come to help me. When this person arrived, he tested my keycards himself (as if I was mistaken), then asked to see my identification before opening my door for me. He then said that I would have to take my keycards back down to the front desk to have them fixed. I agreed to the terms and fee to access the wireless internet but after returning from having the keycards fixed, the internet was no longer available. I called for help and was transferred to tech support where I was on hold for about 10 minutes. As soon as someone came on the line, the internet modem showed up and I was able to log back on. I made 4 calls from my room to toll-free numbers, yet I was charged $2.29 for each of these toll-free calls. Perhaps because I was there over a Saturday night, at some time of the early evening, music could be heard in my room, coming from the courtyard side. I do not know the source.

title: Would consider another place to stay
comment: We chose to stay at the Belvoir in Towson so we could redeem some of our points. This visit as well as our last stay at your facility was extremely dissapointing.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is close to the stadium; you need to take a train to go to New York City
title: Hotel with a view
comment: I like this hotel because it is cheaper than staying in New York city; complimentary breakfast, hors d'oeuvres and wifi depending on the rate that you paid; there is a shuttle to Penn Station and back; I was not impressed when I use the Link station and the printer was not working - I approached the front desk twice but no one came to find out why the printer is not working; when I went outside to catch the shuttle, I did not have a seat anymore when in fact I was outside 30 minutes before; the staff on the 21st floor should be more polite in toning down the noise when they are sorting out, doing or putting away the dishes - they are probably used to the noise, but I am not. The only thing that surprised me with this hotel is, it is offering some points in exchange of not making up the room. I want to be pampered when I travel so I want to see my bed made and clean towels are ready to be used and stock of amenities in the washroom. I appreciate when someone clean the bath tub and the toilet bowl for me. It is so tempting to accept the points but I would like to have the housekeepers keep their job. I would not trade the points for that. I AM EXTREMELY DISSAPOINTED THAT Belvoir LOWER THEIR STANDARDS PROBABLY TO PLEASE OTHER PEOPLE TO COLLECT POINTS FASTER, BUT I AM NOT PLEASED AT ALL.

everyoneShouldKnow: Pet frienly and great custome ervice
title: Great custome service
comment: I stay at this property several times a year and every time that he has been there, David has been spectacular! His customer service and friendliness are outstanding! I also love the Belvoir chain as a whole as they are truly pet friendly (not like some other chains that claim they are and then charge $150 or more for the pet)

title: Outstanding experience
comment: This hotel was a delight. the bed was so comfortable and the room was outstanding. i would stay here any time.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location -- clean -- neat -- friendly - Great Management
title: Excellent service, Great staff
comment: I reserved 2 rooms for 2 nights - both were very nice - rooms # 1063 & 1065.

title: Pleasantly surprised
comment: wonderful place with a great view and the staff was excellent

title: Great hotel!!
comment: Enjoyed my stay at this hotel this past weekend. Could not have asked for anything more. The hotel was close enough to Times Square but away from the noise. Also close to the subway lines.

title: Poor service
comment: We waited on the curb at the Airport for 35 minutes. Receptionist was not helpful on the phone or at check-in. Convenience of staying near airport was nullified. As Grandbourne platinum members we received NO benefit. Room key did not allow us to reach lounge level, room was small. Nothing special or appealing about this stay.

title: Location
comment: This hotel is in a great location. We walked everywhere we needed to go. The only negative thing I have to say is we had made reservations a few months in advance for one of the upper floors which had all access to breakfast,all day refreshments and night time hors devours . They did put us in another newly renovated room but we still received access to the amenities. I believe the other room had a few minor upgrades that our room did not have like bathrobes, makeup mirror, etc. Overall our stay was wonderful! Would definately recommend or stay again!

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent service and hotel. Beds so comfortable!
title: Atlanti City
comment: Really was impressed with my stay! The staff was all very helpful and nice, very clean rooms and comfortable bed! Will definitely book a stay again there! I really wish was on the boardwalk because its better than the boardwalk casino hotels! But it is close enough during this time of year!

everyoneShouldKnow: It's attached to another hotel, but you can access it from either entrance. Park in a downtown lot for free on weekends.
title: Convenient and Comfy
comment: We were able to catch a taxi for our ride to dinner and ride the free R-line back. Very convenient for those not wanting to drive. Comfortable room, although the hair dryer was odd. Felt very safe with the key-only elevator. Friendly staff in the bar.

title: Great staff and comfortable room
comment: This hotel is in a great location and has a hospitable staff that will go the extra mile to make your stay enjoyable. Especially liked the workout room and the extremely comfortable guest room.

title: Had a memorable stay at this hotel
comment: Everyone at this hotel was friendly and helpful.

title: Great location
comment: Stay here 3-4 times a month. Great service, very clean, and great price!

title: Great hotel
comment: Great location between Camden yards and inner harbor. Service, room was superb. Has nice lounge & fitness center. Great views of harbor!

everyoneShouldKnow: pay for parking and lot is very full.. no refrigerator... hot tub not in service....watch FREE water in room only 1 is free other you need to pay for.....
title: King Corner room was great...
comment: King corner room was huge compared to usual hotel rooms and although i spent hardly any time in it , was still nice not being crushed. Complaint only for room is No refrigerator.. I bought apple cider and water with me and cider went bad from being hot all day. most hotels now have refrigerators. also bottle water, 1 is free other cost $??$$ forget amount but glad we noticed card that said it cost to drink. That didnt make me happy as it is very easy to mistake it for being free. come on give 2 bottles of water for free. last complaint is the Hot Tub which we thought was in use but not ready yet. I had called a few weeks earlier to ask questions and was told the tub would be finished by end of august. otherwise this is a huge hotel and front desk staff very helpful and courteous, especially since my room wasnt ready and request for 4 rooms to be together and on same floor was never written down. not her fault .....i would consider coming back here again next year IF the price is right but will bring my icechest !!!

title: Excellent hotel
comment: Good location, clean room, good workout facility and morning Starbucks coffee in both room and lobby. A lot of restaurants right next door along with shopping and easy highway access.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very convenient to Univ. of Tampa and downtown
title: Mostly good place to glad with downtown conveniences
comment: The desk staff, restaurant and valet staff were all stand out, and consistently so. I had two quibbles with this property though. The first is that the room was in very good condition for the price and very clean, but the balcony was terrible. The sliding glass door has numerous spots where the sun reflector coating had torn off, and the outside balcony paint was filthy. Also, I found numerous take-out food menus under my door, which makes it obvious that people who aren't guests or employees are roaming the halls. Not very good for security and safety.

title: Career conference
comment: Hotel looks like it went through or is going through. I did not like the location of the room I was assigned. The carpet was dirty and had stains. I asked for a late check out due to,having training classes and the front desk guess service gentleman was rude and abrupt!!! I felt like a second class citizen. I did not get the ususal exceptional treatment I normally get as a BPG member!!

title: staff
comment: Staff not helpful or courtesy when aske for clarifcation of biling.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's beautiful and comfortable - very clean!
title: Belvoir Downtown Denver, CO
comment: Great stay - thank you! I would come back.

everyoneShouldKnow: Ground floor rooms dark food trays left in hallways all night. Staff will lie you out of a good room.
title: staff lies
comment: I booked for a work conference the lady recommended a tower room so I agreed. When I arrived to check in they stated they had no tower rooms available but had a room on the ground floor. I was also traveling with my 6 month old and had a stroller and extra items I asked if I it was easy access and was there good light being on the ground floor she stated yes. She lied twice actually three times. When I came back to the lobby 10 minutes later I heard another conference attendy told no tower room however this customer stated she wanted the room she booked which was a tower room and Wow the lady who told me there wasn't any found one just like that! The room at ground level was dark one window in the corner felt like a dungen, so another lie. Oh and it wasn't easily accessible I could not access the room through main elevators has to walk to other side of floor n use special elevator covering floor 1-3. Liars!!!!!!!!!

title: Weekend in Atlanta
comment: The staff was outstanding! The only draw back is the walk to the MARTA is up hill!

title: Great location
comment: This hotel being near the French Quarters was a great plus. I wish the food had been better but there were plenty of other great eating places in the vicinity,

title: This hotel had a bed
comment: Room was nice, it had a view of the water

title: thoroughly enjoyablevisit
