The WDW Dophin and its conference facilities were perfect for adults who still have a little kid inside. Location was perfect for Disney fun without being a Disney property. My only complaint is ground transportation Monopoly Mears is aweful and not worth the so called savings.

title: Beautiful Resort
comment: The Walt Disney World Dolphin Resort was simply beautiful! The grounds, the interior and the staff were all pleasant. I really liked how the other Disney resorts were just a short walk away.

title: Needs a renovation
comment: Hallway to rooms not well lite, very dirty and dingy hallway. My room's carpet had very large and noticable stains, needs to be replaced. The Column dining facility had the slowest wait staff. I sat at a table that needed to be cleaned off,server never cleaned it...I had to push the dirt dishes off to the side...very noticable the table was filfty. So disgusted by the cleaniness of the Column - will not stay at hotel again.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's like home. Safe and Secure
title: Sherton - Nashville
comment: Good place to stay. Close to many things. Appears to be safe and secure. Staff is always nice.

title: convienent
comment: attached to bradley airport. Clean and up to Grandbourne par.

everyoneShouldKnow: Best location on the beach! Hotel is beautiful and everyone makes you feel welcomed!!
title: Loved our stay
comment: We were upgraded to a beautiful room and treated as honored quests! We plan to come back next year!

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location for food, restaurants and shopping and friendly staff.
title: Jacksonville Univ. campus visit
comment: Was visiting our son attending Jacksonville University. Hotel was about 15 minutes from campus and had very nice shopping and restaurants in the area. We ate at the restaurant inside the hotel th first night and the food and service was wonderful. Staff was courteous and offered tips on where to visit while in town and were readily available to answer any questions we had as well as print out directions. Everyone working there was smiling so it seemed like they enjoyed it there. would highly recommend.

title: Best hotel in Stamford CT
comment: We were there for a convention and the staff made it a great experience

everyoneShouldKnow: GREAT LOCATION TO AIRPORT AND DOWNTOWN
title: THIS REVIEW
comment: GREAT PLACE TO STAY . THE VIEW ROOMS AMENITIES

everyoneShouldKnow: Shula's restaurant (within the hotel) has the best steak and crab macaroni and cheese that I have ever had!
title: On Mag Mile but costly
comment: The location is good as Mag Mile within walking distance. Small room and bathroom for price. Bedding plush & nice. Shula's restaurant (inside the hotel) is the best thing about this hotel. Pricey but very good! The best steaks and crab macaroni and cheese ever! Tough to get cabs at the hotel....try walking down the block if a long line. Took awhile for luggage and extra blanket to be brought up to room. Refrig avail - if you ask, no microwaves in entire hotel. Pay for internet if in room - inconvenient to go downstairs for free internet. Pool, sauna, fitness looked great but did not have time to use. Could do away with all the items in room to eat/drink and of course pay extra.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff were excellent and so attentative!
title: This hotel's staff are excellent!
comment: From the moment our taxi arrived to the moment our bellman obtained a taxi for our departure the staff were the most helpful and attentative than I have ever experienced at other hotels. The housekeeper(s) were definitely excellent as well. I drink decaf coffee at night and had written a note for the housekeeper requesting additional condiments for my coffee and he/she did and even for every night of my stay without any additional notes. Great stay experience.

title: Wonderful upgrades to property
comment: Unfortunately the food service is lacking-Quality has gone down. Service is slow due to overcrowding. Breakfast buffet was consistently out of food.

title: Great Stay
comment: Had a great stay, friendly staff. Accommodating. Nice facility.

title: Great Value
comment: This hotel is in a great location in the center of town near shopping, restaurants, theatres and the freeway. They have great service in the club lounge. This hotel is a good choice for business or family. I use it frequently.

title: Good time
comment: Everything was excellent except for our in room Wifi.

title: Only a few problems
comment: I stay at the sheriton at least a few times a year I always have a pretty good experience this time was no difference my only set back is I had to ask to be comped for parking or internet because there was no pool no club level nothing that I get for being a BPG member also I was on the tenth floor and had very little hot water and what I did get was only warm and didn't last long...I will be back in a few weeks and I will see if the problem is the same on a different level. Otherwise it was a great stay!

title: Perfect for LegoLand Trip!
comment: I'm a single Mom and I took my son to LegoLand for vacation not knowing anything about this hotel. When we arrived, I was impressed at how close it was to LegoLand, how clean it was and all of the activities that they had for kids and for adults. We stayed three days/nights and never left the hotel once, since there is a restaurant, store, gym, spa, pool, room service, etc. It was worth the money to not have to drive downtown for all of those things.

title: This hotel is excellent in every way!
comment: From the moment I walked into the lobby I could see this Belvoir was top notch. The lobby was inviting, tastefully decorated, and staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I love the Belvoir's beds and pillows...so soft and comfy giving you a restful night's sleep. A very clean hotel. This Belvoir by far is the best one I have stayed at. I will definitely make the Belvoir Bucks County my hotel when traveling in the area again. Thank you for the wonderful stay.

title: Great Hotel!
comment: I stayed at the Belvoir Suites for two weeks and enjoyed every minute of it. The staff were extremely friendly (Shuttle drivers Mr. Ed & Steve were outstanding!), the rooms were very large and had a pretty good layout, food was average, shuttle to and from Duval street was pretty good, and the hotel overall was just a great place. I would highly recommend this hotel, the level of service here compared to other Grandbourne properties is outstanding.

title: Visiting family
comment: This was an exceptional hotel, though parking was not available in their garage and we had to pay to park in overflow and walk in the rain.

title: Few issues
comment: 1. water pressure in the shower was poor

title: Analyst
comment: Your services were very good and I would recommend to others.

title: Sales Manager
comment: I only stay at Grandbourne properties due to the expectations I want to recieve.

title: Great location for Legoland - Relaxing feel
comment: The loacation was great for Legoland. The layout was nice and open. Good areas for relaxation outside of the pool. The spa staff were very helpful and provided excellent service. I was however disappointed when I arrived that I was not placed on the Grandbourne guest floor automatically. I am a gold level member and would expect this to be routine. I discovered there was a Grandbourne guest floor accidentally. After arriiving at my room I found that it smelled of pets. I asked to be moved to a room in which pets were not allowed. I was placed on the Grandbourne guest floor at that point. When travelers like myself committ to a loyalty program it is disheartening to find out that the expected perks are not automatically provided. It is disappointing.

title: Could have been better
comment: I have stayed here severel times & this was the worst by far. We had a stay park & fly pkg. The parking situation was very good, but the room's cleanliness was below par. There was a towel from a previous guest still hanging on the back of the door. The pull out sofa was not clean - food particles & a dental floss device were clearly evident when the cushions were removed. The chair in the room was also stained & dirty. The bathroom cleanliness was also sub-par for a Belvoir. We requested 2 queen beds, but were told that only double beds came with this pkg. We were very disappointed & would have requested to speak to a mgr., but our flight left quite early & we needed to sleep. We were not sure how quickly our problem would have been addressed. We seem to think that we had a sub par room because we were only staying overnight.

everyoneShouldKnow: The lobby and bar is beautiful
title: This hotel is a great rennovated property, but customer service fell short..
comment: As soon as I came into the lobby I was amazed by how beautiful it was. The front desk staff was very friendly. HOWEVER, not a single employee was memorable. In fact, the girls in the restaurant were not friendly at all. I felt like I was a burden. I simply asked for a piece of fruit to buy shortly after I checked in, and after she got it for me, she took care of other guests before taking my payment. I was just standing there awkwardly waiting for a good 5 minutes while they leisurely seated the people behind me and took their order......I would remind everyone that a smile can change everything.....

title: Dirty Carpets
comment: I would not stay at this hotel again, the carpet in my room was stained and the bathroom tiles had mold.

title: Disappointing
comment: The carpet in the hallways is wrinkled and needs replaced. My room smelled like mildew. Restaurant is extremely overpriced

title: great conference hotel and accomodations
comment: Meeting rooms, catering, and sleeping room accommodations were comfortable and good service.

title: Nothing was great.
comment: I will start out- side of my door.The carpet was just dirty. In- side the room there was three large carpet stains on the floor.

everyoneShouldKnow: Intimate Kauai location with great views
title: This hotel was a very pleasant surprise.
comment: We frequent Hawaii and have had wonderful stays at each island but this visit was different. The hotel was beautifully renovated. The ocean view rooms have extraordinary views of the Kauai coastline. The pool was a fun way to spend the day and be only a few footsteps away from the beach. A great service that the hotel offers is a shuttle service to local area restaurants or shopping centers- it was so helpful for those days we just did not want to drive. We will definitely visit again and look forward to staying at this hotel. Our only suggestions for improvement would be to expand the gym equipment.

everyoneShouldKnow: Beautiful landscaping in a very nice part of San Diego.
title: Hotel grounds
comment: The pools and grounds were very nicely kept and beautiful flowers all over. That was the best part of the hotel and the view of the marina.

title: Great, but boo to green...
comment: I appreciate a facilities movement towards going "green" and respecting the value of resources. However, when I placed my card on my door in the evening to not have towels replaced or bedding changes, etc., I did not understand that it also meant no soap/shampoo changes, not refilling of coffee condiments, cleaning of anything, etc. For the $5 voucher, sure you could bring one bar drink down from $12 to $15 dollars, but true customer service is missing, I believe. However in saying this, I loved my stay, the view, and everything. I just would not put that card out again

title: account rep
comment: Restaurant comment. First night service was great. Second night service was poor. Waited 15 minutes at a table and still no service. Had to ask for a menu and service. Also was interested in a post dinner beverage; after another lengthy wait I decided to ask for the check and leave. Certainly not the service I am acustomed to at this location.

title: Business seminar stay
comment: I was attending a seminar being held at the hotel and booked my room there as well. Front desk service was very friendly and helpful. I had to return my car at the airport and they picked me up very promptly. Service staff in the meeting rooms put fresh water frequently, staff was friendly and the burgers aren't too shabby ;)

title: Good location
comment: This hotel is in good location and convenient, surrounded by many great restaurants and close to some nice parks.

title: Great Customer Service
comment: Excellent service from all especially from: Sisi, Ernesto and Amanda.

title: Nice and clean
comment: The hotel looks very new and clean! The staff are very friendly! I would definitely come back

title: nickel and dime
comment: BPG members should not be charged for local calls and the Internet. It gives the place a nickel and dime reputation.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is not right on the beach
title: Great place to stay
comment: Our stay was very pleasant, the room was very clean and the staff was friendly. Room service was done in a timely manner. We enjoyed our stay and will return in the future

title: Wonderful Beds!
comment: I loved this hotel! Everything was great, from the bell staff, to the wonderful beds!

title: Work trip but a great hotel.
comment: The staff was amazing and very accomodating. The food in the hotel was well above average and worth every penny! I would highly recommend this hotel anyone.

title: Great Staff
comment: I am allergic to feathers and when I checked in they immediately had them removed and taken care of. Everyone was very considerate of my needs.

title: Met expectations
comment: My stay was quite comfortable.

title: Comfort and Location are Great!
comment: The Belvoir Suites on the Plaza is a great place to stay in a wonderful KC location-the Plaza! My suite was large, quiet, and everything I needed for my 4 days on the Plaza. Every staff member was pleasant, efficient, and helpful!

everyoneShouldKnow: The Dolphin is in a perfect location
title: Our Favorite place to stay in Orlando
comment: We have been coming to the WDW Dolphin for over 17 years now. We have stayed at other properties in Orlando but nothing compares to the Dolphin. It has all of the conveniences of a Disney property (location, extra magic hours, Character Breakfasts, Park Transportation). However, it feels like you are staying at a top hotel away from all of the Disney craziness. The location is fantastic (on the Boardwalk), the spa, restaurants, and rooms are like no other at Disney. We can't wait to go back and plan to return within the year. It is by far our favorite place to stay in Orlando.

title: DOLORES
comment: WE LIKED THE FACILITY BECAUSE IT WAS CLEAN AND LOCATED IN A QUIET AREA. THE STAFF WAS FRIENDLY AND HELPFUL.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location near numerous restaurants and the Columbia Mall.
title: This hotel has a beautiful waterfront setting.
comment: The waterfront setting is beautiful and the walking path is excellent for taking a liesurely stroll. Watching the Canada geese and ducks swimming around is very beautiful and peaceful. The rooms were nice and clean; the bed was very comfortable. Our conference room was set up well and the staff was very professional.

title: Restaurant
comment: Tony was an outstanding server in the restaurant. The food was really great

everyoneShouldKnow: Courtesy shuttle to the Disney parks
title: It was ok
comment: I was extremely excited to arrive at the Dolphin resort. The stores within the resort, location, and amenities were very attractive. The pool area was great and very relaxing. The room itself was nice and tidey. My family and I were there for a week so we purchased snacks, milk, and baby formula. The refrigerator in our room would not get cold. I contacted guest services and they said they would immediately send up a replacement fridge. We left the room and came back 6 hours later to find the fridge had not been replaced. I called guest services and was assured the fridge had been replaced. I informed guest services that we placed a sticker on the side of the original fridge and the sticker was still there. She immediately apoligized and said another fridge would be sent up. We heard nothing else from guest services that evening, but at 8:30am the next morning, room service showed up with a tub of ice saying there were no extra refrigerators and ours could not be replaced! I opened the cabinet to retrieve the cookies we'd purchased for the kids and the cookies, other snacks, and shelf were covered with ants.

title: Welcoming and Staff helpful
comment: Customer service was very gracious enough to send me wine and cheese. It was a welcome surprise and greatly appreciated for my stay at the hotel. I had trouble with opening the wine and a gentlemen in housekeeping was kind enough to open it for me.

everyoneShouldKnow: That one my pay for the fridge,parking and for umbrellas on the beach
title: Gloomy
comment: Room not up to the normal Belvoir standard.No fridge,no vanity kit,internet at a daily charge.Self parking at $20/day - should be FOC.

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel staff is very responsive to any questions/needs.
title: This is a beautiful historic hotel.
comment: This hotel is great. The rooms are clean and comfortable. It is close to the Riverwalk , Alamo, and many other sites and restaurants.

title: Facilities
comment: The room needs a microwave and refrigerator!!!!

title: NACAC conference stay
comment: The staff at the Belvoir consistently go above and beyond my expectations for conference accommodations. I've stayed here twice and will continue to because of the rooms, location, staff and especially the fitness center. I wish my own gym were as nice as the one at the Belvoir.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location. very convenient to NYC but the ferry does not run late enough.
title: Interop 2012
comment: Overall I was pleased with my stay at your hotel but there was a hole in the wall where someone punched it.

title: Good Not Great
comment: Convenient location, helpful staff. Good local restaraunt choices. Room clean although a slight musty smell. Could use some new towels and faster internet service. TV signal drops intermittently.

title: Excellent Hotel
comment: Hotel staff are always friendly and try to meet your needs. Rooms are spacious and clean. Every stay has been a very good experience!

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't worry that it's right off I-95. Inside you'll never know that, and the convenience is a plus.
title: Well Done
comment: Needed a hotel for one night in this location. This will be where I stay in this area from now on. A bullseye for a business traveler like myself, but would be a great hotel for anyone needing to be in the area. Comfortable, very tasteful, great room layout, quiet, spotless, great staff, surprisingly good food, all the amenities needed.

everyoneShouldKnow: Not to stay here until the room are updrated
title: Overall Stay
comment: My resent stay did not meet my expected standards for a Sharton Hotel. The room did not have any ready available outlets to plug in my cellphone charger or laptop. My stay was on a Monday evening and the ESPN channel did not display so I missed the MNF game that evening. Also the room was always hot and did not cool down even when I lowered the temp. Not an enjoyable stay. Also the iron did not heat up.

title: CAN'T BE BEAT!
comment: WE HAVE STAYED HERE NUMEROUS TIMES NOW AND THIS WAS BY FAR THE BEST, BUT IT IS HARD TO BEAT GOOD SERVICE, GOOD ROOMS, NICE FACILITY AND EXCELLENT STAFF WHEN THEY ARE THAT WAY ALL THE TIME. I WISH THE STARBUCKS RESTAURANT WOULD STAY OPEN LATER THOUGH.

title: Great Stay
comment: This was our (my husband & I) last days in Miami. The hotel was very relaxing and staff was wonderful. My only upset was there was a restaurant bill addded to my checkout bill. I kept telling the desk clerk I didn't eat at the restaurant, but she didnt seem to understand so I had to go put my stuff in the car and came back to another clerk to explain I Never ate at the restaurant. She then explain sometmes guest give the wrong room numbers. Other than that had a wonderful experience.

title: Better than expected
comment: Ideal location

everyoneShouldKnow: If you want to rest and spend +$200, look for another hotel
title: Needs a facelift!
comment: I stayed at the hotel after a transatlantic flight, wanted to rest, but the exterior noise is awful!

everyoneShouldKnow: Stay away until the reno's are completed.
title: How NOT to handle problems
comment: I understand that managing renovations is always problematic. But really ..?

title: Location
comment: This is a great hotel where is located between everything. We had access to everything as restaurants and shoppingmalls etx..

title: Great stay
comment: My wife and I were travelling across country with our dog. The hotel was the nicest one we visited during our trip across the southwest. Excellent. I highly recommend it.

everyoneShouldKnow: Exceptional Service, from General Manager straight on down.
title: Exceptional Staff
comment: I recently stayed at the Belvoir Suites in Key West with another couple celebrating my girlfriend's birthday. The hotel was just what we needed and the convenience of the shuttle to downtown was terrific. We thought we would utilize the beach, but we didn't utilize it at all and it didn't seem like anyone else was either. That was definitely unexpected, but not relevant to the hotel, the hotel was great.

title: Wonderful
comment: My wonderful experience started once I exited my cab. The friendliness, helpfulness from the bellmen, to the front desk clerks and management. I had breakfast and dinner in the restaurant, the service and food was second to none.

title: This hotel goes above and beyond your expectations.
comment: I enjoyed the Administrative Professionals Conference at the Dolphin Resort. Everything that was done for the conference seemed effortless - magical. Also, the staff at the resort was so warm, knowledgable and friendly.

title: This hotel was comfortable and conveniently located
comment: My room, and more specifically the bed, was very comfortable. I slept well every night. I was able to adjust the air temp inside the room to a constant and comfortable setting.

title: Wonderful
comment: Very nice. Will return. Had a great stay.

title: Room Expectations
comment: The bathtub had mold in all of the corners. The the water drain in the tub was entirely loose and the fixture that controlled the drain was half way out of the wall. The heating/airconditioning unit rattled incessantly.

title: Not Always the most helpful
comment: Loved the location...

everyoneShouldKnow: close to the city of Santa Monica
title: good stay
comment: Patrice was so nice as was the young man on Saturday morning.

guestFrom: Hartsfield Jackson Atlanta International Airport (ATL), 6000 N Terminal Pkwy, Atlanta, GA 30337, USA
everyoneShouldKnow: Not the ideal location if you are wanting to access other attractions outside of the hotel i.e. other eateries. The Staff in the 1900 Resturant could have been a little more polished in presentation, a bit rough around the edges, espeically the late night crew.
title: Think twice before checking in...
comment: If it were not for the conference that I was attending at this location, and the distance I would have to travel throughout the day, I would have preferred to stay at another location within the city.

title: Loved our stay
comment: We were impressed with Wild Horse

everyoneShouldKnow: It is in a good location for either work or vacation stays.
title: Starting to show wear...
comment: We have stayed at this hotel before, prefer to stay at Belvoir's as they provide a level of relaxation as soon as you hit the door and we usually stay for 5+ days. However, there were a few problems with this hotel we hadn't encountered before. The first, the parking area is being used as a parking lot for off of property events. The area was coned so you had to drive behind the hotel (past the trash, etc...) to get to the front. Also the parking behind the hotel was so hap-hazard, we had to weave around parked cars to get through. Upon entering the lobby, there was a water dispenser (as it was 108 degress that day.) At 3PM, the dispenser was empty. At check in, we informed the lobby staff and they said they would take care of it. As we left for dinner at 6PM, the dispenser was still empty, the sliced orange still stuck in the same place on the side of the glass container. We stayed on the 5th floor and as we walked to our room, we couldn't notice how dirty the carpets were, you could see the paths to each of the doorways. Also there were scuff marks almost the entire length of the walls from either the maid carts or baggage carts being dragged along them. Finally upon checkout, we were unable to exit the driveway due to the parking lot issue. The exit gate was closed and the attendant told use to use our room key. When we told him we had just checked out and showed him our parking pass, we were told we had to go back to the front desk and get a card so we could exit. Upon returning to the front desk, they told me I had the parking pass and the parking attendant should have let us out. We returned to the gate and waited until the attendant returned who then let us out without an apology. Even with these issues the hotel room was clean and comfortable which is most important. We did bring these issues to the attention of the staff who responded with an "ok." This is a new hotel that gives the look of a much older property...

title: GREAT STAY
comment: We stayed here for 3 nights in October 2012. The Belvoir City Center Staff was exceptional!! This is by far one of the best hotel staff we have experienced in any hotel! Not one stone went unturned and we could not be happier. We had a few problems with booking a large amount of rooms with the sales office. That end of our dealing with the Belvoir was horrible, but once we arrived we were thrilled to be there. And, any problems we had with the bookings were quickly taken care of by the hotel staff!! We would come back for sure!

everyoneShouldKnow: Certain members of the wait staff in the dining room gave exceedlingly poor service.
title: Restaurant Staff Ruined My Stay
comment: Due to the severe neglect of one of the wait staff, my entire stay at the hotel was ruined. I waited more than an hour and a half for my dinner order and ultimately walked out of the restaurant without getting my food since I had to be somewhere and couldn't wait any longer. I have never been so ill treated at any hotel restaurant in my life!

title: This hotel has great service
comment: I had a wonderful experience at this hotel.

title: This hotel had great features but on the 12th floor of the central wing had issues with loud elevator noise.
comment: My room was away from the elevator but when the elevator would move between floors a "roaring" sound would occur. It was only bothersome at bedtime. Besides the noise, the resort was top notch & there was always a friendly face from staff & willingness to answer your questions.

everyoneShouldKnow: Too expensive, our rate was $209.00 a night - not worth it, hotel in desperate need of a make-over, carpet replacement, etc.
title: This hotel is outdated for the price
comment: I stayed at the Dolphin for a conference; First off, this is clearly not the best place to hold a conference unless traveling with your children to take advantage of Disney. at first i was checked in and my room was way at the end of a long hallway, only 2 doors from a rear entrance, safety was on my mind; secondly there was a damp, musty smell as you entered a section to get to my room and in my room. when i called to request i be moved, they told me they were full yet they were still checking in folks. i had to use my cell phone to call as an external caller and ask to speak with the manager - i was then told they only had impared roomes available, so i took it, the AC was so cold, i spent most of my stay there with it off - the food was way to expensive for the quality, though i must say that room service staff (used only twice) was quite good but would not recommend without lowing the cost - i've stayed in better for the cost -- some of the attendees there were saying the same. the fitness center was located in the basement like area, so cold ou couldn't work out and for the location, the poor girl didn't seem to have any security in case of problems with customers.

title: Music City
comment: The grounds are spectacular the room was very nice the lobby was gorgeous.

title: Failed to Meet Expectations
comment: Overall this was a very disappointing experience. I was in the area on business and chose Belvoir due to past positive experiences with the hotel, however this facility was remarkably subpar. I stayed two nights and my room was not even cleaned between nights. When I called the front desk, I was asked to wait in the Club Lounge while this was being done, and after waiting an hour and a half, the room was still not cleaned. The Club Level did not have all days snacks as advertised and the nightly appetizers were mediocre at best. I was also unable to have breakfast either day as by the time I went to the Lounge, the buffet style set up was picked over and not refreshed or refilled at all. The room itself was nice enough but this experience quite simply was not what I paid for nor did it meet my expectations. I am very unlikely to stay at this hotel again in the future.

title: Great Location for Balloon Fiesta
comment: Nice size room and excellent for Balloon Fiesta as the Park-N-Ride was only a few blocks away and the hotel offered a shuttle to and from so no need to drive. The tub area was old and outdated. Quaint lobby bar with live music Friday night. Staff was most helpful about places to eat.

everyoneShouldKnow: It doesn't feel like a large convention hotel.
title: Always stay here
comment: Belvoir Phoenix is my hotel of choice in downtown Phoenix. It's a large hotel that consistently delivers warm personal service more indicative of a smaller hotel. Rooms are clean and well designed. Internet is super fast. District has great lunch values and the shrimp tacos are fantastic. The valet and door staff are also great,

title: San Diego Belvoir
comment: not a four star as advertised. water stains on ceiling, room was cramped, not well lit. Computer problem for entire week we were there made it difficult to enter and leave self parking lot.

title: Internet
comment: For the price I expected free in-room internet

everyoneShouldKnow: The family suites are on the older 'motel' side of the complex. Refurbished rooms but the AC made it seem damp, old.
title: Left with a feeling that service doesn't matter
comment: 1st night -no clean wash cloths, just two old wet ones from the previous guests. Next day, still no clean wash cloths, called guest services and asked for four. When we returned from a long day at the park -again no wash cloths. Grandbournes is usually spot on with service, but we left with the feeling that service and cleanliness was not a priority, at least on part of this property.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Hotel has a friendly atmosphere and it is very clean.
title: This Hotel has great employees.
comment: Your Hotel Staff made it a point to address and meet our needs.

title: Friendly Staff but Bathroom was lacking
comment: All of the staff i met on my stay were friendly and had a smile on. However the bathroom in my room was not very nice. Mildew on the very old floor and mildew under the soap holder in the tub. The bathroom could really use an update. I did find the rest of the room comfortable and I enjoyed my view. I would also like to mention that i had trouble finding my hotel room. It was very far away and the make matters worse the room number had fallen to the floor and i had to pick it up and stick it back on.

title: great location! great pool! very noisy!!
comment: The reasons I chose to stay at this hotel are simple: the location and the adult infinity pool. And while the room was clean and the bed very comfortable, it was incredibly noisy my entire 10-day stay. The walls are very thin, there is a large gap under the door so you can hear any and all noises in the hallway, I had to call security twice before they came up to address the kids running back & forth in the hallway, I could go on ....

title: Staff Barging In
comment: I booked this hotel for my wife and I to stay on the plaza for our 10th anniversary. We were very excited to get a break from the kids, and spend some alone time. We checked in, we put the do not disturb sign on the door, and were being intimate, when a housekeeping attendant barged into the room and got a good eyeful I am sure. They then sprinted off and I was unable to find them since I had to get dressed. I would think that the do not disturb sign should be a pretty clear sign that you should not enter a room. It was quite a disappointing event and made my wife and I quite uneasy for the rest of the night at our dinner reservation and back to at the hotel. I was not going to even report this and was just not going to return to your hotel, but my friend is a platinum organizer status with star woods and told me that I should fill out an online review. I don't really know what can be done at this point... Our 10th anniversary was ruined because of this.

title: Very nice hotel...
comment: I stay at this location every month. I like the rooms and I love the staff. The only thing that I find lacking is the food/menu. Everything else is great.

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel is in walking distance to anything one may want to do or to buy.
title: Joan & Brade's Wedding
comment: The facilities were in new condition and the services were wonderful. Thank you! The hospitality of the housekeeping services was also great.

title: Great Hotel
comment: The hotel is located in an area that has lots of things to do in your off time. Lots of eating places to enjoy, the Mint is nice to see also the Captial all in walking distance.

title: Nice but not super nice
comment: This is a nice hotel but not exceptional. I was in Birmingham on business and needed to get work done from my room. The outlets and computer connections were not very work-friendly - no wireless, and few outlets in the room, meaning that I needed to unplug things to plug in chargers and crawl under furniture.

title: Comfortable and Clean
comment: Comfortable and clean with a great location and lovely water view. Very good service at the desk.

everyoneShouldKnow: Whether the hotel pool is in season or not, make it look like a knock out place to swim
title: Much potential!
comment: The facilities have great potential. Continue to press the staff to make a service difference. Service was good, but if you want to make the five star level, it needs to be great.

title: Very Comfortable Stay
comment: Our stay with your hotel was very comfortable & cleanliness. Staff was very attentive & professional.

title: Hotel was under renovation
comment: The room was fine, due to construction many amenities were lacking. Price was high considering renovation. Good location.

title: Treated with Respect
comment: From the parking attendant to the front desk receptionist to the room preparers - all the staff were friendly, courteous, helpful and most of all respectful. And the hotel facility exuded the respect. Thank you so much for a restful stay.

title: excellent location!
comment: this hotel is right around the corner from the Galleria and excellent restaurants in Houston. great service, nice rooms!

everyoneShouldKnow: Clean and excellent service!!!! The artwork at the hotel is by local artists and for sale!!!
title: Belvoir Hotels are Awesome!!!
comment: The bed was so comfortable, I didn't want to leave!!! I ordered room service and it was excellent. I ordered the hamburger. I don't even like hamburgers but it was like nothing I've ever tasted!!! Your staff was friendly and helpful!!! Bravo Belvoir!!! I will be back!!!

title: Waaaaaay over priced for the quality lacking
comment: The heat wasn't working and took a while to be fixed, there was a nasty spider on the bed, they charged $15 for a pitcher of warm water!! The room service food was so-so and over priced.

title: Great area and very nice hotel
comment: This hotel was great. The staff was very welcoming and helpful- they helped me with understanding the parking and with the activities that could be done around the hotel considering the time of evening we checked in. I would have preferred for the pool to be open. The room was great- the bed was perfect- could have been firmer but i like them firm- the linens were very nice and crisp and the shower had a very nice pressure.

title: Nice Room but TV issues
comment: Room was good. Staff good not great. TV was missing about 1/3 of the channels. Staff member came to my room to fix, but unable. Front desk called shortly after to tell me it was a Lodgenet issue. They expected it to come on in about an hour. Never came on, even the next day. No comment from the staff, or explanation.

title: Ms Marilyn
comment: The Hotel itself was beautiful from arriving into the driveway, throughout the lobby and reception and into my room.

everyoneShouldKnow: Most of the staff members are very helpful and courteous and professional.
title: Some good and some not so good things about this hotel
comment: While the staff members in the club lounge were very friendly and helpful, the front desk agent apparently thought I was lying about breakfast! When I went to the front desk, taking a break from a day long conference at the hotel,to check out, I was told that my $35 breakfast in G's restaurant had been added to my bill. When I said I had not eaten in the restaurant, I was asked where I had eaten, what I had had for breakfast, and was asked that twice! When I told the agent that I was on the club level and breakfast is available in the lounge, I was asked again what I had eaten in the lounge! It was rather embarassing and insulting to be questioned about an item on the bill for which I was not responsible. I wanted to say to him -- why would I go all the way down to G's for a $35 breakfast when I can go across the hall and sit quietly in the lounge and enjoy a decent breakfast as part of my room rate? So...I'm not very happy with that part of my stay. The conference section was superb and all the staff there were extremely helpful and courteous and professional.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's a bit far from the tourist attractions so keep in mind you'll have to take cabs to some places if you don't rent a car.
title: Excellent stay
comment: My girlfriend and I stayed at the hotel for five nights total, one came after a week long cruise. Caesar who checked us in on our initial four night stay was exceptional. He was polite, professional, and we both felt that he really wanted us to have a wonderful stay. He even remembered us a week later when we checked back in. You're very lucky to have such an exemplary employee.

title: Good, convenient hotel with loud airconditioner
comment: I stayed at the Belvoir Bradley Airport Hotel because I arrived very late, and the hotel was very conveniently located. Plus, I've found that Belvoirs are usually quality hotels. This one is no exception. The hotel is very nice, the rooms are clean and pleasant, and the airport location is ideal for people arriving on very late flights. My only complaint was that the airconditioner in the room was extremely loud and kept cycling all night. Since it was too warm to turn the thing off, there was not much I could do about it except endure it and settle for a less than restful night's sleep. It always amazes me that otherwise quality hotels don't invest in quiet, central air conditioning systems.

title: Another Great Stay
comment: This was my second 1 night stay at the Petaluma Belvoir using my BPG points. I cannot complain about anything for either stay. This time the hotel was full, but we still got great service. There was not a room with a king size bed when I reserved but when I checked in, they found one. With a view at that. The evening wine tasting in the lobby was unexpected but enjoyable . I love this Belvoir.

title: Quiet and very comfortable
comment: After staying in two Shearton properties and two other properties on our recent three week adventure of the USA, I would have to make comment that with the Belvoir it is like going to Macdonalds you know what you are going to get. The rooms and beds are comfortable and spotless, the staff are very obliging, the facilities meet your expectations and in the Anaheim case the shuttle to Disneyland made it ever so easy to attend the theme park.

title: only there for a few hours to sleep
comment: only there for a few hours to sleep. Did not interact with any staff aside from the receptionist that checked me in. Did not receive any recognition for BPG, I am not sure what the above comment means.

title: kauai vacation
comment: My husband and I spent our honeymoon here 5 years ago. So when we were planning our anniversary vacation to Kauai, we thought of staying here. Overall, the stay was good and comfortable. I do wish the staff at the front desk were a bit more helpful, they assume you know where things are located. We were also not informed of the list of activities that are included in the $25 a day resort fee. Just "you know about the resort fee?" . I found the housekeeping staff to be more nicer, always saying aloha hand they see you in the hallway. The location is great. They changed their breakfast from buffet to sit-down "based on customer feedback" which is not that great because your options are so limited and if its not included in the packaged you chose, its can be very costly so you might as well eat somewhere else. Also the wait timr to be seating was crazy some days...up to 30 mins and them to get your food another 30 mins.

title: Weekend getaway
comment: Excellent location- our room had a grea view of the river and downtown buildings.

everyoneShouldKnow: Rooms are spacious, clean and staff once you pass front desk (some of them) are amazing.
title: My experience at Belvoir
comment: Nice hotel, staff was avg

title: Great location
comment: This hotel has a great location, walking distance to Epcot. The service is no up to par for the price and meeting Disney standards. This is the second time I have stayed here within 8 months of each other. Both times I was put in a room overlooking air handlers and right next to the elevators. You can hear people using the elevator all morning which is frustrating when your sleeping. I requested on our second stay to avoid these locations but they did not acknowledge my request. The valet service was horrible. We called again and they were to busy to take us, told us to come down and it would take 10 mins. It took over 30 minutes and our friends that came later got their vehicle before ours. The first time we stayed we had a cake and they told us they would pick it up and leave in housekeeping fridge and bring a cutting knife, neither ever happened. This visit we also ate breakfast at the resort, they took forever to seat our large party even though the room was not full, ran out of plates and service took to long. Conserving the money for the hotel, extra fees and the money we spent in the hotel I would have expected better service.

title: Good place to stay in San Francisco
comment: This hotel is really good place to stay in San Francisco, CA. It was my 3rd stay and I'm happy and I can recommend this place.

everyoneShouldKnow: Thay have every thing you need you won't have to leave the hotel for anything .
title: Staff were great
comment: My stay at the hotel went well the staff were great Juan and kattie went out of there way to help me thay really did there job well I felt very welcom .I had room service the food was surprisingly good .as you know any room service at any hotel there is a 50/50

title: The hotel has a great staff
comment: The Belvoir Tribeca is a beautiful hotel. The rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable. The front desk staff was extremely accomodating . They have a Starbucks I'm the lobby, and provided complimentary Starbucks in our room. The area was a fun neighborhood with lots of shops and restaurants to choose from.;

everyoneShouldKnow: Great staff, great food, great walking/rolling path
title: Not really wheelchair accessible
comment: Staff were totally helpful and sensitive -- EXCELLENT. To be fully wheelchair accessible;

everyoneShouldKnow: do not go until after construction
title: Construction
comment: The facility was clean and bed comfortable. The only problem was they were doing some construction and at 9AM the knock and drilling started, forcing us to get up and get out to get away from the noise. We are not morning people and like to sleep in until 11

title: AWESOME beds!
comment: I booked this hotel as I wanted to be close to Epcot for the Food and Wine festival. While I didnt get to spend much time on the grounds, the lobby is beautiful with comfortable chairs and the staff is very friendly. Beds are awesome and super comfy. The restaurants look like they have great food, but I was there for Food and Wine. Next stay I will have to try out the food. I wouldnt mind coming up for a weekend and just relaxing at this hotel and not go into the parks.

title: Excellent facilities. Nicest People
comment: The facility is nice but the best feature was the attitude of the staff. They were wonderfully friendly and so willing to please.

everyoneShouldKnow: The entire hotel staff is friendly & accomodating.
title: A "MUST STAY" when in St. Louis
comment: Rachel, the front desk mgr. was incredibly helpful. She got us a 20% Illinois resident discount when "reservations" couldn't even find it on their own website. The room was clean, well-appointed and the bed comfortable. At Bistro 14, Michelle, our server, helped us out with my wife's gluten intolerence. She personally checked with the chef about the allergens on the buffet. (And the breakfast was delicious!) We took the train to St. Louis and the hotel is a very short walk from the train station. When we return again, we will definitely stay here.

title: Hotel was great.
comment: Had a great time at the hotel. The staff was very accomodating.

title: elevators
comment: the elevators are in horrible condition and are 1 of the first things you see if you were to repair or upgrade these I'm sure the overall opinion of your hotels condition would go up .this is the only real downfall I noticed .

title: Stay at home getaway
comment: This hotel has everything you need!

everyoneShouldKnow: The Porter Steak House is Fabulous!!
title: Great Experience
comment: Will definitely be returning to the Reed House...loved the staff and suite. Lots of space...Starbucks inside. The Porter Steak House has amazing food and wonderful staff who catered to our needs!! The best Belvoir we have ever stayed at!!

title: Comfortable room. Great amenities.
comment: We really enjoyed our stay. Great views from balcony. Comfortable bed. Wonderful breakfast buffet. Nice shower.

title: Room was worn out and filthy
comment: The room was very worn out, and very dirty. There were chunks of something on the bathroom floor and door (I'd be willing to bet it was some sort of body excretion). The tile around the bathroom and in the bathroom was filthy, it looked like it had build up of staining from years of improper cleaning. The grout was filthy. There was hair in my bed. The a/c was inconsistent, it either didn't work at all, or made the room freezing. This was my first, and likely last stay at this property.

title: Great Stay
comment: We very much enjoyed our stay. The room was very clean and had a pleasant smell. The reception desk folks were very nice and answered all our questions. I would definitely stay here again when we are up that way. I hope next time to have time to check out the spa and pool.

everyoneShouldKnow: They don't say what they are going to do
title: Tried it one more Time
comment: This time when we checked in there was no water in the room. I called down and requested our two waters that came with the resort package. The lady on the phone said they would send some up, they never came.

title: wonderful staff
comment: Hotel was Clean and comfortable.

everyoneShouldKnow: There is no food in the evening and no outside food is allowed. Take the stairs.
title: Service/Elevators Lacking
comment: People were stuck in the elevator for 20 minutes (multiple times throughout our stay), there was a huge line to get into the elevator and then a staff member cut the line with a large cart that took up the whole elevator to deliver room service. We had to find stairs to go up to our room, but no one showed us where they were and when we found them they were outside.

title: Effortless
comment: Had not one issue or problem. Everything went very smoothly, with no effort on my part. That's the hallmark of a good stay for me.

title: Nice hotel
comment: Comfortable, pleasant, nice staff, good location

title: Great Hotel if you are visiting UD
comment: This hotel is close to the University of Delaware. It is well maintained, the gym and pool are are fine for a small hotel. The club area on the 5th floor is outstanding.

title: First Timer
comment: This was our first stay at a Suite hotel, and we liked it. Much more room than I envisioned. Microwave and refrigerator were great to have.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is walking distance to Epcot
title: Housekeeping items
comment: To be honest, this stay was a bit below average . My bathroom (commode) was not cleaned properly when I arrived to the suite (someone else's business was left behind). There was a razor left in the shower (not mine). I asked for housekeeping to replace or repair the alarm clock (the time was never correct the entire time I stayed). The printers in the business area did not function to print boarding passes and had to ask the conciere to do this task. The surroundings seemed a bit dated and carpets worn / dirty in some of the common areas. The room (ceiling) had dark stain. My bedding bolster had tear . I had always heard that Disney resorts went beyond your expectations. My expectations are higher! I will say the bed, pillows were comfortable. The meals were adequate but not superb.

title: Decent
comment: Nothing over the top but a decent hotel in a good location.

title: Great Hotel in Times Square
comment: The Belvoir NY is a well run professional hotel in a great location exploring midtown and Times Square. Hotel has recently been renovated so everything feels new and fresh. It is a large hotel with 1000 rooms but the staff does a great job managing the massive amounts of people coming through the hotel. Check in and out is great. Room was fresh and clean with a comfortable bed and nice big flat screen TV with alot of channels.However, the room is small and not really a place where one would relax and hang out. Best for tourists and businesspeople. Great security.

title: Unhappy Experience
comment: I had concerns about this hotel before my stay began. I was coming into town for a conference and a work meeting. My plans changed at the last minute and I was not going to be staying the full lenght of time. I called the hotel to change dates and was told they would bill the entire amount then reimburse. They billed the entire amount and gave 2 different invoices. When I called to inquire about the refund/credit I was told it would post after midnight due to a bank holiday. I was also told a manager would contact me. It's a day later. No credit has been issued and no manager has called. I am not happy. Will not be staying here again. Also during the course of the stay we had a fire alarm go off for no apparent reason (staff did not apologize for the inconvenience of trotting dow 28 flights at 9pm in 29 degree weather) and in a separate instance a colleague got stuck in the elevator. Rooms were ok, but the hassle of getting payment corrected means I will stay elsewhere in the future.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you are holding a meeting, Chelly does a wonderful job meeting all your needs.
title: Always a nice stay at the downtown Phoenix Belvoir
comment: As usual our stay at your hotel was perfect. Chelly met our every need for our scrapbooking weekend. The catering department did a bang-up job on the food. The rooms were very comfortable. Can't wait to come back in May.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is close to everything you need to enjoy Ft. Worth.
title: This hotel is close to everything
comment: This hotel was close to shopping, dining,and anything you would want to do and see in Ft. Worth. Excellent location. The room was very nice and comfortable. Only one draw back... the A/C was very loud and distracting trying to watch TV or sleep.

everyoneShouldKnow: you can bring pets and the staff provide very nice service
title: this hotel lets dogs stay there
comment: the site was conveniently located near 95 and other amenites.

title: This hotel's staff was outstanding
comment: The hotel's staff was very helpful and friendly, everyone I encountered was extremly friendly from the front desk staff to the security staff.

title: Great Stay
comment: This property has a great location, all suites and is pet friendly. I have stayed here before and will return again and again. The front desk check in staff was great.

title: Partly Satisfied Customer
comment: I thought the room rate was very pricey for the accommodations. The Club level upgrade was a rip off, since they overbooked and I was still charged that club fee and was not on that level. Then they charged me $15.00 for two glasses of wine in the club lounge that was not very inviting. However, the pool and hotel resturant was very nice.

title: Had a fireworks view
comment: I found my 4 night stay at the Dolphin to be very comfortable. Check-in was a breeze and I was in the room before noon! The only problem I had was the in-room safe was locked upon arrival but maintenance arrived to open it less than ten minutes after I called.

title: Great Hotel minus the in room bathroom
comment: The bathroom in the room was outdated and the paint was peeling from the tub, but everything else was great.

title: Expectations
comment: We were very aggravated. When we booked the reservation online, we booked a room with a king size bed. When we arrived at 4pm (which is an hour later than the time you can check in) we were told that there were no rooms with King Size beds clean and we would need to be put in a room with 2 queen beds. You shouldn't be allowed to book something that isn't going to be available! It's ridiculous. If you cannot have them ready, then don't promise them. Then, there was a disturbance on our floor about 1:30am and the hotel security staff, I guess, is walking the floor looking for the disturbance with their walkie talkies beeping LOUDLY and continuously while we tried to sleep...beautiful hotel, crappy service! I was disappointed!

everyoneShouldKnow: Generally very clean and the staff is very professional
title: Parking can be a problem
comment: I stay at this hotel quiet often. Every once in a while there will be no parking available because the hotel does not protect its parking when other activities are going on at the convention center

title: Not What I Expected
comment: We stayed at the Fairplex because of an event at the Fair Grounds. Thought it would be convenient considering there was a res truant and bar on site. However the service was horrible. You would think that the hotel and staff would be accustom to taking care of large groups. this was not the case. Took over an hour to get drinks at the bar, Dinner was an hour and a half to get a burger and fries for 2.

everyoneShouldKnow: Easy access to interstate and good location for most any activity in the Tidewater area. Nice property.
title: Great River views
comment: We used points for our stay. Hotel was very busy with reunions and weddings but noise level was fine and we were in a room right at the elevator. Did not eat. Valet $22 or self park for $13. They will validate ticket for $5 off self park. In case of bad weather you may want to valet as it is a little bit of a walk to garage.

title: Very Accomodating
comment: Very friendly staff, room was perfect and clean. Had a great time and will stay again next time in Orlando area.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff and Service is better than other hotels
title: Best Hotel Staff in Houston
comment: I got a great rate, which was the real reason I originally chose this hotel. The 290/610 location was perfect. From the moment I checked in Amanda and the other front desk staff made me feel at home. Needed to have a business meeting at the hotel on a Saturday and the equipment and Wi-Fi worked great. Forgot my iPhone charger but the front desk took care of it. The service and friendliness of the staff was truly outstanding.

everyoneShouldKnow: great location for UVM. Nice bar inside hotel for drink
title: Capacity crowd causes less than great stay
comment: We checked in about 10PM expecting our king size bed. After 7 hours of driving and 3 hours of walking around town we needed a good nights sleep. Our king room was given to someone else. Temp is room kept switching from hot to cold. Some mold in the shower tile grout. On the brightside, right next to UVM and the bar was good

title: wifi inadequate
comment: In the meeting area (Convertion Center" I could never get on wifi, always "too many people already on." This is below standard for 2012 facilities.

title: Very nice hotel
comment: I'd recommend this hotel , despite it not being on the boardwalk. Very nice room, friendly staff. My only complaint would be the breakfast we had. Other than that, the place is great.

title: Made for relaxation
comment: I love the sleeper beds they are wonderful. As soon as you lay on them you sink right in...like sleeping on a cloud. I must admit I was a little shocked at the pool. I loved that it was indoor and well maintained but it only goes up to 3 feet which was very disappointing. The room had a Nintendo 64 which is outdated. Besides that and the trouble we had with the arm to the entrance of the parking garage everything was excellent and very well-maintained.

title: Loved this hotel!
comment: Great pool, great service, great food, great views, great walking trails.....we will for sure be back!

title: Great Chicago Weekend Hotel
comment: Hotel is in a prime location. Nice Lobby. Club Lounge on top floor with Amazing Views of the City, River, and Lake. Easy access to Navy Pier, Magnificent Mile, Millieum Park etc. Would definitely stay again.

everyoneShouldKnow: The convention center is right outside - very convenient.
title: Good sleep, below average food
comment: When I was in my room, I was quite happy with this hotel. But when I was hungry - not so much. The restaurant had very limited choices for each meal. And when I ordered something simple for breakfast that wasn't on the menu (4 fried eggs with a croissant), it was not prepared properly. Four days in a row, I ordered a simple breakfast and when it came it wasn't right.

everyoneShouldKnow: Guests will be charged for any delivery of packages.
title: Great rooms and great service.
comment: I enjoyed my recent stay at the Belvoir Denver Downtown hotel. This is a great location on the mall and relatively close to the conference center. The rooms were spacious and well equipped. One major complaint was the charge for the handling of packages sent to the hotel. The hotel outsourced the receiving of packages and there was a extreme fee to collect the packages. My attempts to remove these fees only had the hotel push the blame on Pennington. Pennington blamed the hotel. My colleagu, was forced to pay the fee. We work for a university and ship to hotels across the country and have never been charged.

everyoneShouldKnow: Beautiful outside facilities and great food.
title: Pool in beautiful
comment: Pool area is very beautiful, but thought there could be a little better service

title: Dolphin Is The BEST
comment: The hotel staff was wonderful and very courteous. The room was a good size with great amenities, balcony, and wonderful view. The restaurants were pricey.

title: Great Mini Vacation
comment: Excellent service and rates-Pet friendly!

title: October weekend
comment: Room was well appointed and comfortable. There were a few issues which could have been improved upon, such as a very noisy air condtioning system in the room, poor elevator service to this area, and a non-functioning, untstaffed club room. The restaurant lunch was very good, and the staff extremely helpful.

title: Best Staff Ever
comment: I have to tell you, the staff was the best I have ever worked with in all my business travel.

title: got to work on the WIFI
comment: I had a comfortable room and the staff could not have been more helpful. I dined in the restaurant and the quality of the food was average and the service was poor. Most of all, though, it's absurd in this day and age to charge for WIFI. The front desk clerk said all the Denver hotels charged, but I know that is not true because a friend who stayed at another hotel did not get charged; so there you go. For this reason, I am not able to recommend you to anyone else nor will I plan to stay with you in the future. The accommodations are first rate and comfortable, but it's ridiculous to charge for WIFI. You need to work on that.

title: Nice & Close to PDX!
comment: ....not a lot to say as we were only on site about 5 hours in the wee hours before an early flight! Love, love, love the 24 hours lounge access as a Platinum Member. Rooms adequate, staff friendly, location proximity to PDX, perfect!!! Usually stay at the Aloft, however, it was full and I may have enjoyed this more because of the 24 hour lounge access!!!!

title: A pleasant stay with minor exceptions
comment: My only complaint was the electric outlet for the TV and coffee pot didn't work, so no TV. Also the tub didn't drain well and kept me awake as the water gurgled out. Other than that, the room was beautiful and very comfortable. Loved the pillows! Would have like a towel rack in the bathroom, still it was nice and roomy.

title: woodbury experience
comment: ecellent hotel, staff and food...

title: great weekend stay
comment: great location, every staff person helpful and friendly, great club level lounge. thank you

everyoneShouldKnow: The night staff has hardly any Idea what is going on
title: Hotel Staff Needs WORK!
comment: The hotel its self was not to bad, but when we got into the rooms the madness began. The living room floor was SOAKED and we didnt find out until after we unloaded ALL of our stuff. We got moved into another room with NO assistance only to have no sheets on the pull out bed and only one person on staff so no one could bring it up to us. The next day house keeping came in and literally only fixed one bed. The REMOVED THE TOWELS and DID NOT REPLACE THEM! So, as you can imagine we were towel-less and no trash was taken out. Even though things were not going great I still went and asked to extend my stay one night, the "night manager" said she cannot see my rate so I would have to pay the rate which is going for that night, I'm fine with that except she LIED because when I checked out my rate was printed on the receipt! Not to mention the hotel has leaking problems in the lobby and Flooding problems in the parking lot, UP TO YOUR KNEES! We could actually see the water bubbling up which means there was a drainage problem. I would NEVER go back, these conditions were way to unsanitary for me.

title: Great Stay!
comment: The room was clean and the bed comfortable.

everyoneShouldKnow: Horrible,the attitude of some at the front desk and the cleaning staff.
title: this hotel has zero
comment: our stay was one of the worst one's we have ever had at a Sherton. We got up to no hot water on Sat 10 6 2012, the responce that was given was unacceptable.

title: Great Place to Stay
comment: We were attending a concert at the Hollywood Bowl and this is the perfect location to stay. We jumped on the shuttle and didn't have to worry about parking or traffic it was great! We will stay there again for any upcoming concerts we attend!

title: Gone downhill
comment: I have stayed at this hotel every two years for a trade show held across the street, was always satisfied, but this time I was not , the hotel is in need of a cleaning, the place looks tired, also very noisy, almost impossible to get to sleep. Will not stay there again if I can help it. To bad as it is right next door to the convention center.

everyoneShouldKnow: Comfy and clean rooms, great bartender
title: Love this place
comment: Rooms are always clean and comfortable. We love the bartender!!!!

title: Fantastic Staff
comment: The staff at The Dolphin Resort are top notch. They went above and beyond for me during my stay there. Absolutely the best hotel/resort staff I've ever met.

title: Nice Hotel, but...
comment: Nice hotel, nice lobby, convenient to convention center, train and AC sights. Awesome water pressure in the shower.

everyoneShouldKnow: Deluxe Suite great value for the money.
title: Very satisfied
comment: We were exremely satisfied with our stay & the hotel. We used the pool and the gym while there and were very happy with those facilities as well. We will be staying there again next year!

title: Comfortable Stay near to Disney
comment: We stayed for three nights at Belvoir Buena Vista on our daughters birthday treat in Disney. The hotel is very close to Disney and lots of restaurant option nearby. The hotel seems to be newly renovated and it looks great. We really enjoyed the pool and the ambiance inside the hotel. They have hot breakfast with lots of options. The room was spacious with comfortable bed. Internet wifi was free and $10 parking per night was among the lowest I have seen as compare to some of the other hotels.

title: Room Problems
comment: The staff was excellent however, I would not recommend this hotel because the bed was average(very saggy), the sink was stopped up and fixed after I called (when I first called the person said "hasn't it been fixed") and the shower had mildew/mold in the corner.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff work very hard to accommodate their guest.
title: This hotel has is in a great location
comment: The staff go out of their way to meet the needs of their guest.

title: Bad experience
comment: Hi,

everyoneShouldKnow: Try the french toast from the resturant. Very very excellent.
title: This hotel was very nice
comment: I stayed at the Belvoir Columbia Town Center for four days last week. This is a very nice hotel. I was able to connect to the internet in my room and get some work done and the facilities for the conference I was attending were very nice and close to my room. Housekeeping did a very good job before noon. The lobby staff was very professional and allowed me to hang out in the lobby for two hours while waiting for my shuttle to the airport.

title: This hotel met my needs.
comment: This hotel is clean, great service, near to shopping centers and Qualcom stadium.

title: Great property, great value
comment: I've stayed at this property a number of times now, and always been please with the facilities and the service. It's a great location adjacent to shopping and amenities, with spotless, comfortable rooms, a lovely rooftop pool and workout facility. They were in the middle of a major program to renovate windows when I was there, so I was glad to see them continuing to invest in the property!

title: Wonderful hotel and staff
comment: Every year when I visit Dallas I choose to stay at the Belvoir Suites Market Center because it is very comfortable and a great hotel. The fridge and microwave in each room allows guests to dine in their room but they also have the option of dining in the restaurant or ordering from room service. I like the way this hotel allows the guest to make the choice. Additionally, the washer and dryer are much appreciated but guests can also opt to send out to a laundry service. This is a super hotel because it provides many choices for the guest. Deborah at front desk was especially helpful.

title: Room 175
comment: It took 3 calls to the desk to get somebody to fix 2 lamps in the room. I could not adjust the thermostat. No towels left when the room was cleaned. Minimal staff in restaurant on Friday night the 5th, The food served at our reunion function was very mediocre. Plastic cups in the room was very surprising. I would have thought Belvoir would supply glass.

everyoneShouldKnow: There is nothing welcoming about it.
title: I like nothing about this hotel
comment: I found the hotel empty and unattractive.

title: This hotel is beautiful!
comment: The bed is extremely comfortable! The room is cozy, and the hotel is located in a great location near the pier and shopping!

title: Great Staff is Key
comment: Great hotel with staff that goes above and beyond to be helpful

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff are very rushed and you really have to assert yourself to get what you need.
title: Staff seemed very rushed...
comment: There was a problem with my reservation on arrival: I had been promised a king bed and was initially given a room with two double beds in it. Went back down to registration and woman found me a more appropriate room. On my departure on Sunday, I asked to check on my previously booked Airport Shuttle. Woman initially said she had no record of it and was not very helpful or very polite. She snapped something to the effect of "You should have a receipt..." (How would I have a receipt given the transaction was conducted the day previously over the phone...)? Eventually, she called the Airport Shuttle and the situation was resolved, although they had no receipt for me (I had given my credit card number the pervious day over the phone). Not the most pleasant people... Also, I feel it a little unconscionable, given the high room rate, to charge extra for the use of the fitness center. This seems to be happening at more and more Belvoirs.

everyoneShouldKnow: The service you are given and friendliness of all the staff.
title: This hotel is well worth a vist!!!
comment: Friendliness of all the staff service is excellant and the resturant food is 1st class.

title: Great hotel
comment: The staff was quite friendly and helpful and the rooms were very comfortable! It could have been better if there was wireless internet in guest rooms. Also, would have thought there would be a courtesy shuttle service to the airport at a facility so large.

title: WEFTEC Visitor
comment: The service does not match the room rate.

title: We fell in love, The Cleanest Belvoir ever!!
comment: overall the Hotel is so clean from the lobby to our room. Staff was great, very convenient to stay at the door step of Universal Studios and right on the other side of freeway, stores, Ralphs, RiteAid, gas station and right on hwy 101/170. We loved our stay, can't stop talking about how squeecky clean it was and every time we walked in the lobby, we fell in love again.

title: Poor Service
comment: I took my daughter (ag 17) and 3 of her girlfriends to Seattle to shop. We booked two rooms. My room was fine but the room my daughter and her friends were in was a handicap room. This means there was no bathtub - only a shower that was industrial and grotty. The bathroom vanity was small and for ,again ,a person who is handicapped. NO ONE TOLD me that the room was not a regular room. I also thought the shower was quite dirty and not very nice for anyone to use. The phone in the girls room was broken. They were given a very sub-par room. The girls settled in with all their stuff before I could approve of the room and as they were17 we needed to have rooms that were connected by a door. When I asked for a discount (because we could not move) I was told "no". They did give me 1000 Grandbourne points - great points that don't get me anything and unlikely to use. I asked for a parking credit and again told no. If you are trying to call the operator/housekeeping or the concierge you will wait forever. No one answers the phone. On the one time I did get someone I inquired about take out/delivery options. The concierge was not able to give me any ideas...just said he could not help me.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is very dirty and there is no spa. It is boarded up.
title: Dirty Hotel
comment: We booked this hotel to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary and brought along our 2 children. When attempting to pull out the sofa for my daughter to sleep on, there were dead bugs all under/in the pull out bed. The sofa and chair in the room were stained. The bathroom was so small you couldn't get ready. There was no vanity area, unusual for a suite. Also, the carpet and bathroom tile and baseboards were filthy. I would never recommend this hotel and wish we had our money back so we could go somewhere else. Also, when we went to the indoor pool and hot tub to use, the hot tub was boarded up. It was horrible.

title: Nice room
comment: We stayed here to attend the Texas State Fair. The room itself was nice, clean and the bed was comfortable. However, there were no linens, blankets or pillows for the couch bed where my daughter would sleep and only two towels in the room. We tried to call guest services but the bedroom phone did not work and the living room phone would only beep after pressing the button. We ended up calling room service who contacted the front desk. Gust service showed up with sheets only, we asked for a blanket, pillow and an extra towel. She returned with a blanket and pillow but no towel. We politely reminded her we needed an extra towel, she returned with at least 6 each washcloths, hand towels and full size towels.

everyoneShouldKnow: don't go to this hotel... please pick another
title: I can never reccommend this hotel
comment: we stayed for the talladega weekend last week... Our Tub would not empty.. it is not nice to take a shower in your own dirty water... the ice machines did not work on the 6th and 7th floors... i had to travel up to the 8th floor to get ice... I have never stayed at a hotel where the did not take a credit card for incidentals... we were not able to rent a movie without coming down and paying for it first... very unprofessional... and the manager did very little to help the situation... although he was professional and kept himself in that manner throughout the transaction

title: Stay in October 2012
comment: It is nice hotel with a good location and fast connection to all major attractions. However - I would not recommend to stay at the rooms facing the front, because of the old design of the windows, it gets quite noisy from close by freeway. Also, higher floors are under direct lights from the reflectors in front of the hotel and you have to close the drapes, otherwise your room is like a theater stage. I don't understand, why they can't to turn those lights off - at least from midnight to 5 AM or so....

everyoneShouldKnow: Beware of closed amenities for children this time of year
title: Great for a short stay
comment: Positives: clean and nicely decorated room, a variety of spas and pools; well maintained fitness center, good internet connection, pleasant staff.

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel rooms are comfortable and clean and the hotel staff is great.
title: Very Nice Hotel
comment: I was very impressed with the hotel staff and the comfort of the hotel rooms. I had a beautiful view from my room window (snow top mountains on both sides). Not a too far to walk to shopping and museums. More transportation would have been great. If you really want to get around, rent a car.

title: Personal Rating
comment: Good Stay, nice hotel. my rating scale of 1-10

title: Loud and poor mattress
comment: The mattress was literally "broken." So busy with business just thought it was a bad mattress until finally had to to look... 5-6 inch "sink hole" in mattress. Wake up call for Friday morning didn't come at all, so glad I used the alarm clock as back up as I had important business meetings. The noise level was intolerable. Was in a small cove/hallway and every evening until 1am people were letting their room doors slam and it woke me up every time! I stay all over the world and never heard doors slam like that where the noise is horribly loud throughout the entire area.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent customer service from the front desk staff. Quiet relaxing place.
title: Comfortable
comment: Excellent relaxing environment.

title: Room not up to my standards
comment: We had three issues with our room the sink did not drain, the toilet did not flush completely and the television needed to be turned on multiple times to get a picture. The staff was very friendly.

title: Fantastic Amenities, Average Rooms
comment: My stay at the Dolphin was a great experience for myself, out to have fun. There are over a dozen places to eat and free shuttles to the Disney Parks, including some cool water taxi's to a couple of the parks via the hotel's own waterways. The Boardwalk is short distance away by foot, and multiple pools are enhanced with a cabana bar, waterfall slides, and miniature "beach". This is a hotel for the visitor that wants to be out and about, though had I left the vicinity of Disney, it would be quite a bit of a drive. The room size was completely satisfactory, just a little bit less "fantastic" than I thought the hotel would contain based on the amenities they offer. Cleaniness was a little off here and there...for instance, the first day/night, my floor was sticky in the entryway (not sure if it was from cleaning product or just dirty) and there was a cup/mug ring on the dresser. Morning came and I wanted to make myself a coffee, opened the machine to start the heating, and the stagnant water it began to boil filled my room with the smell of mildew for a day and a half or more; no idea how long the water had been in there prior to my arrival. I had housekeeping remove it, but I never got a replacement. This is the only 'bad' customer service I received in the hotel. Service and staff were impeccably friendly and more than helpful, going out of their way to make sure I was accomodated, even if I didn't know I wanted to be! This is definitely a place perfect for those that want to be out of their room in the Parks until bed time and enjoy good eats.

guestFrom: Belvoir Gateway Los Angeles Hotel, Los Angeles International Airport (LAX), Los Angeles, CA 90045, USA
everyoneShouldKnow: The beds, pillows and towels are of high quality and the entire staff is on top of your needs. They were so respectful and they showed us how much our service meant to them.
title: This hotel knows how to pamper you
comment: Their beds and pillows are the best quality that I have ever experienced at a hotel. You get four pillows on your queen size beds. We felt like queens. The food and staff were excellent and the men that parked our car when we arrived at the hotel were excellent too.

title: Has a great view of the Marina.
comment: The best thing about this hotel is the view of the marina during the day & the lights @ night. The " C " level ( restaurant ) which isn't far from the hotel is another additive to ur stay.

title: Best Oceanside Hotel in Waikiki!
comment: I have been here many times over the last 25 years and the new pool areas are awesome! The Edge Bar has great food & drinks too! All guest services were excellent.
