Bellmen were super-fast getting my bags and car. Guest Services upgraded my room since I am BPG Preferred Kama'aina. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. I will be back again in 2 months! Thanks!!

title: mrs
comment: good friendly staff i enjoyed my stay

title: Great time in Birmingham
comment: We have stayed several times at this Belvoir and our stay this time was wonderful.

title: Average HOtel, Bad GREEN Program
comment: Asked to participate in GREEN Program in exchange for 500 Guest Poiints per night stay, did Green Program for three days and received ZERO Points, front desk CSR could not credit my account upon check-out!

title: Beautiful Hotel with nice Pool
comment: We always choose the Belvoir for our weekend getaways. We enjoy the pool and the relaxing atmosphere. The staff treats us very well. We only have one complaint, the food is not as good as it used to be. I think the last Chef was better. We ordered the Boneless Korean Short Ribs, meat was tough, too much hoisin sauce and the coconut rice tasted gross. Bring back regular white rice and maybe the Chef you used to have.

title: Beautiful Hotel, Awesome Location
comment: Very well run hotel. Great location for SU parents.

title: We were a little disappointed
comment: We were disappointed in 2 things. First that there was not any kind of breakfast available for guests. We did order room service for breakfast on the day we checked out but it was WAY overpriced. For the amount of money spent on the room, you would think there would be some sort of continental breakfast. The second issue we had was that there was a lot of walking to get to the rooms. Several of our family members have health issues and it was a lot for them and even had trouble finding their room when getting on a different elevator. Overall the hotel was nice, but I expected it to be better.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, great fitness center, great staff!
title: Terrific Staff!
comment: For a hotel in this location and with this degree of competition on all sides, the Belvoir New York is a delightful safe harbor in a turbulent sea. It's rooms are quiet, and the staff is amazing - it has been two years since our last stay here, the hotel has been renovated beautifully, and Muhammad in the Club Lounge recognized us immediately and addressed us by name. How many times will you experience that degree of familiarity in a big-city hotel? Simply the best!

title: Overall Good 'Value' Hotel
comment: Great hotel in Waikiki with views of the Pacific ocean. This is one of my favorite hotels to stay at in Waikiki because it tends to be one of the more affordable hotels in the area and its also right in the middle of all the action. The beach is just across the street, and its very easy to access. I tend to stay at this property when Im in Honolulu for a longer stay because its more affordable.

title: Confort and extras that make it better
comment: The Club floor rooms are just perfect and with that little plus that makes your stay better for sure.

everyoneShouldKnow: Rooms are not as clean as one would expect from any hotel, much less a costly hotel
title: Nice swim area
comment: The fridge didn't work. there was mold in the showers, the counters were not washed and the floors were dirty. Other than that, ok, nothing special.

everyoneShouldKnow: Awesome view of the bay but not worth it with all of the issues we had during our stay.
title: What a disappointment!
comment: Expected so much more from a Belvoir Hotel. The staff was unfriendly from the moment we got out of our vehicle. They refused to allow us to put our luggage on a baggage cart ourselves. Stated only staff allowed to use them. The front desk was very nice and helpful though. Not impressed with rooms. Carpet was dirty and needed shampooing. Noted scuffs on walls and baseboards were very dusty. Our daughters room had the entry light into room flickering and would not come on at all upon entry. Did have an awesome view and that helped us overlook some of the flaws. But then the second night we had this awful noise coming from above. Called to front desk and stated would check on it. An hour went by and the noise continued. (sounded like a tennis shoe in dryer) Called again and then finally they responded within 5 minutes. (had running toilet above us for hours) The third night of our stay our daughter came back from a wedding off the property and was unable to park in the self park area and was told to drive around until someone left. REALLY!!! They charge $22 for self parking each day! We did get some compensation after speaking with the manager but we will NEVER recommend or stay at this Belvoir even with the awesome view we had. Oh yes, they started ripping out the pool the 2nd day into our stay.

title: Close to airport
comment: Very convenient for airport travelers. Close location to city. Pool unacceptably cold. Exit gate problematic.

title: Room
comment: Airconditioning did not work. Went to the front desk and they said they would take care of it but they didn't. Airconditioning did not work our whole stay.

title: Friendly, great location
comment: The staff at this hotel is exceptional. They went out of their way to help with maps and areas to visit. Location is perfect!

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff and accommodations were fantastic!
title: Staff and location are great
comment: The staff was fantastic and the location superb. Minutes from Falls of Ohio park, Megacavern zip lines and activities downtown Louisville.

title: Rough check in process
comment: Check in at the hotel is confusing and time consuming. We arrived by car and pulled up in front of the hotel and were ignored by the bellboys. We finally realized that we had to pull around to the side of the hotel for the parking.

everyoneShouldKnow: Are there balconies available? We saw some from the promenade after we were already settled in our room.
title: Exceptional Staff & Nice Hotel
comment: All staff were exceptional from the check in at the desk, the bartender in the lounge, to the valet at departure. Our room overlooking the harbor was wonderful. We enjoyed the club level and would like to commend the attendants that were on duty during our stay. Both the evening and the morning hostess' went out of their way to make sure our needs were met. The food was the best club level food yet! I misplaced my note w the name of the evening attendant who was great and for that I apologize.

title: Prudential hotel
comment: Too pricey , but the easiness to get to mall was great, especially with the bad weather.

everyoneShouldKnow: Use Renata if you are planning an event
title: Wedding venue
comment: The hotel was chosen for guests going to wedding. The front desk were nice but did not follow directions in giving out bags to the guests and needed to be reminded several times. They delivered a guest to the bride and groom to the wrong room and did not remedy the situation. We had brunch the following day and it was really good and the staff was helpful. All in all it was done well and Renata, who I worked with was terrific.

title: Location, location & ......location
comment: The location is ideal, with many subway lines to Manhattan and walking distance to the new Barclay Center. Unfortunately, its location is also a curse, as the electronic/dub step music from the rooftop bar permeates the pores of the hotel until 3 am, making it impossible to sleep. When we arrived (on Friday am), we discovered (as others have said) its next to impossible to secure a room upgrade (NB As a Platinum BPG member, this is the first time I have not been upgraded in 2 + years). The action in the bar also explains why the elevators are so slow (we waited for 10 minutes on two occasions on Saturday). Its because the hotel dedicates 2 of its elevators to the bar, including the service elevator, forcing its own staff to use the public lifts! Housekeeping was pretty iffy - we had to ask for everything! The staffing in the BPG lounge was spotty - they opened late & were inattentive when supplies ran out! The final straw came on Sunday, when after a night with zero sleep, there was no hot water to be had! We checked out early (a first!) and went to another hotel! (Mid-level management did not adequately respond to service concerns, another signal that all is not right @ the Belvoir Brooklyn).

title: Great Oceanfront Hotel!
comment: This was our 1st time @ The Belvoir Virginia Beach Oceanfront Hotel and it hopefully won't be the last! We were very pleased with our room,the hotel and the staff! We are BPG Gold Members and received an Oceanfront upgrade because a room was available and our family loved it! Pool and Oceanfront View was Great! Pool Fountain was a bit noisy but it didn't bother us because we could still enjoy the views of the ocean,beach and the dolphins swimming by! Great Location! Free Parking! Lot's to do on the boardwalk! Very Family Friendly! Our Room was 225 and was a Cabana Room! Great Hotel! Can't say enough great things! And you even get Extra BPG Points for Going Green and not using Housekeeping everyday!

title: Great Hotel
comment: The hotel was excellent. The bed, pillows etc...were SO comfortable! The breakfast was awesome. However, the male waiters' personalities could use a upgrade, but the waitress was VERY sweet!

title: Excellent service
comment: one of the smoothest stays ive ever had in a hotel checkin was quick and staff was friendly

everyoneShouldKnow: Best Beach is across the road.
title: Excellent
comment: Used this hotel after touring the east Coast US. Needed a Hotel to relax in and this fitted the bill perfectly. Staff were super, grounds well kept and clean. Would happily stay again. Shuttle service to town is great and being just out of town we felt was a bonus especially with the beach across the road. Only complaint would be the blinds in the room.

everyoneShouldKnow: Definitely a remote location, so just know it takes 15 minutes to travel off site for dining (if desired).
title: Great get away only 20 minutes from the airport
comment: This is the second time I have stayed at the Wild Horse property; both for work related travel.

title: Hotel Staff
comment: At check-in we were greeted with an outstanding staff member who was friendly, professional, helpful, positive, and a true pleasure to deal with. The Club Floor member's room had another outstanding staff member who was so helpful and polite. She worked very hard to make our stay special.

title: Enjoyed my stay
comment: The Belvoir Ridgedale did a wonderful job in support of the CMSA convention which I attended in early October. I especially liked the option to not have room service and in exchange receive a $5 voucher each day which I used in the restaurant -- this was a wonderful idea and I made use of this every day. The only complaint that I had about the hotel is that on 3 of the 5 days I was there at least one of the treadmills in the fitness room was out of order. I managed to get a workout every day, but I got to the fitness room extremely early so I would be sure to have a machine for my work out.

title: Great breakfast service
comment: The private breakfast service for our youth baseball team was fantastic and a fantastic value.

everyoneShouldKnow: Fantastic views! San Diego is so beautiful, it's unbelievable.
title: Great location, great hotel!
comment: Stayed here overnight after a wedding reception at the hotel. It was great overall. The only minor concern I had was the couch in our deluxe room seemed to have stains and discoloration of the striped fabric on it. It didn't smell or anything, but it just looked like it might either be dirty or the fabric was ruined by cleaning solvents.

title: The best hotel in San Diego!!
comment: Great service, excellent views and the staff was superb!

title: Great Hotel with Great Location
comment: My room was GREAT! I had a balcony that had a city view AND my bed faced the water - I had the best of both worlds! The hotel is right off of the highway and is river-front (I think it is the James River). The hotel literally sits in the midst of so much American History. You must walk the Board Walk and stop along the way to look at the bronzed letters (this will make sense once you get there). I loved the Owner's Club Lounge; had a nice variety and was open every time I needed a snack. The had drinks, fruit and yogurt available at all times; evening appetizers and a nice breakfast. The lounge overlooks the water, has plenty of seating, flat screen tv, computer AND printer. The gym is small but nice and clean with a temperature controlled "cooler" with small hand cloths. The outdoor pool was nice and it had lounge chairs which needed to be updated. I thought the pool areas was a little "dated". Check-in was a little longer than expected but it was well worth the wait. The staff is extremely accommodating and actually came from behind the desk and handed me my room keys (I cannot remember his name, but it had a very unique spelling). I opted to self-park in the garage ($8.00 with the Belvoir discount); the last time I stayed, parking was free (of course it has been at least 1 year). Norfolk has rich history and has done a nice job in preserving it. aI highly recommend the Belvoir in Norfolk.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location and convience to shopping and outside restaurants. Within walking distance!
title: Beautiful surroundings!
comment: We had a wonderful experience during our stay with the exception of the free breakfast. The first day the lines were long and some of the waitstaff gave us poor service. It was confusing ordering off the menu as to what was included for free. I do think it was better than the buffet that it replaced. By the 2nd day the service had improved greatly. The food was excellent!

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't get the buffet was cold and stale.
title: Excellent hotel
comment: I came to Orlando to visit Universal and Disney. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was nice like brand new and clean. The guy who checked me in was very accomadating, got a king bed and view of disney fireworks was awsome! Restaurant food was good, but breakfast buffet was old and cold. Get breakfast off their menu, excellent!

everyoneShouldKnow: It has a very friendly and helpful staff.
title: Great place to stay.
comment: The staff was very friendly and helpful. They went out of their way to help us with the Dog Show that we had at the Hotel. The room was very nice and comfortable. I highly recommend this Hotel.

title: Great location
comment: We love this hotel. We have been visiting this hotel for many years. The staff is wonderful.

title: Belvoir Duluth
comment: Excellent service by the front desk staff. The restaurant/bar was great with a fabulous bartender.

title: Nice Job!
comment: My wife and I stayed prior to the October 7th Giants game. Pleasantly surprised on a excellent stay. Room was great being clean and comfy. Great view! Only drawback was the elevator system was extremely slow and the ice machine on two floors did not work. The front desk was very helpful, informative, polite and professional.

everyoneShouldKnow: The lake beside the hotel is gorgeous, beautiful walking paths.
title: The bed was super comfortable
comment: This double was spacious and well equipped.

title: Rooms are spacious; well designed
comment: We appreciated the two-sink bathroom, excellent bed and how quiet it was. Staff was friendly and helpful.

title: Great staff, great service
comment: The staff were exceptional in every respect.

title: Stanford Reunions
comment: Book early. This is the best place to stay. Close to campus and bar that has indoor and outdoor areas.

title: The room was very big
comment: We loved the room.

title: Phily
comment: I would stay here again

everyoneShouldKnow: Beautiful Club Lounge overlooking Times Square, Central Park, and Hudson River sunets
title: I am always pleased with service and BPG Recognition
comment: I have been staying here on multiple occasions each year for quite some time, and am always pleased with the service. I often arrive early in the day, and was very impressed on my last visit by how quickly they found a great room for me at 9 AM after a sold out night.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is a awesome place to stay!!
title: Great place to stay
comment: Myself and my new husband stayed here for our honeymoon. The beds were very comfortable, the rooms were spacious and clean. They also had several computer in the lobby with free printing which was helpful since were both FT college students. We had our laptop with us, but the extra use of their computers and the free printing made doing our homework easier. The staff was nice and everything we needed from food to valet parking was at our finger tips.

title: A work in progress
comment: They were doing some renovation and luckily we had a renovated room. Things did not work throughout the hotel, the elevators were crazy slow and the staff not very responsive.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great resort property due to the pool and all the restaurant services.
title: it's a real resort!
comment: I loved the property as it was so all-inclusive for all my needs! There are walking trails, there are places to watch the ocean surf, great food, great service, cheerful staff, beautiful grounds and an awesome pool area! The workout room and other recreational areas looked good too! The concierge in the Flying Fish shop was very helpful and super-sweet! The restaurant staff were great morning, lunch and night! My only negative comment was that housekeeping didn't clean the room before I arrived and that the rooms were not sound-proofed very well. (I had hair in the bathroom and I could hear my neighbor's kids at night.) Housekeeping responded quickly and cleaned it all the next day and the the rooms/bedding were otherwise very good. I can't wait to return!

everyoneShouldKnow: Unbelievable location. Fresh new feeling rooms. (I know, that's 2 things)
title: Great location/staff in NYC
comment: Based on some reviews, I had some concerns about staying at this property for our family vacation. We are just back, and I felt it important to highlight that our stay was excellent. Daenous (sp?) pronounced Donnis, at check-in was really helpful and courteous as were both Concierge attendents who helped us book great meals.

title: The front office staff did not arrange the room type as we reqeuested before
comment: Once we checked in at hotel on Oct.4, the front office staff told us that no queen bed room available and only can arrange twin bed. But we booked queen bed room type through Grandbourne website, quite disappointed with this arrangement.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is a short walk from broadway st. which is where most of the nightlife is. Very convient.
title: Called for Bell Service at Checkout but no answer
comment: Everything was great except when I was checking out I called guest services but nobody ever answered so I had to carry all my luggage all the way down to my car, which was on the 5th floor of the garage. Would have been better if I would have gotten assistance.

title: rooms
comment: my room was not cleanded one night and the tub i had to clean the first night stay

title: great features
comment: staff very friendly

title: NOT WHAT I EXPECTED
comment: THIS HOTEL BEING WHERE IT IS SHOULD BE WAY BETTER AT SERVICE LEVEL THEN IT IS

everyoneShouldKnow: Do not eat at Il Molino
title: Do not eat at Il Molino
comment: We stayed 3 nights and 4 days; during all that time the room number plate for room East 7380 laid on the floor by its door and an empty food plate was against the wall and nobody picked either up.

title: The staff
comment: never been to a hotel that had such a friendly staff and always put the customer first. Thank you for all the help.

title: Comfy beds
comment: I had been looking forward to this mini vacation and was rewarded by a wonderful trip. Each morning I felt rested and relaxed and each evening I was welcomed into a cloud of comfort as I settled in for sleep. Centrally located, convientant to most everything. Staff was friendly and helpful. Only negative they did not remind me of my free full breakfasts I was to get each morning. I finally remembered the day I was leaving, I had plans most mornings but would have loved if they had reminded me so I had the knowledge to make the choice.

title: Room Cleanliness
comment: The staff at your hotel was fantastic. The associate who checked me in was very helpful and I would definately recommend this hotel.

title: Pool area
comment: The sauna was so hot you couldn't breath and Jecuzzi was out of order,

title: Room and Staff Excellent; Restaurant "Rain" needs improvement
comment: We stayed overnight at the Belvoir after attending a wedding reception held at the Belvoir. Check-In was excellent. The hotel room was well appointed, very clean, and the comfort of the bed was amazing. The wedding reception was beautiful. However, MUCH needed improvement is needed in the restaurant "Rain" - at least for breakfast service. We had to wait 15 minutes for a table. Perhaps this is due to being understaffed - I don't know - as there were many many empty tables waiting to be cleared. The staff was very apologetic. We chose the breakfast buffet for sake of time. Although the options offered appeared to be sufficient, the hot food was cold and most needed to be replenished. I would recommend the hotel but not the restaurant.

title: Decent resort hotel
comment: This hotel had an amazing location but the rooms and bathrooms were standard run of the mill Belvoir. I do not think it was a good value for the money. The staff at the pool and the pool bar seemed very surly and unwelcoming. For years I have stayed at Belvoirs (more than 50 nights a year each year) and this was definitely not one of my favorites.

title: Upscale & Convenient
comment: Great location and very comfortable - great staff - Jamie on desk & Mike on bar

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is so friendly and attentive.
title: Wonderful staff!
comment: We have stayed at this hotel twice now (the second time being for a week while waiting to move in to our new house). The staff - Amy, Sylvester, Corey, Lily, Sue, and Didi were all amazing! They were warm and friendly and we couldn't ask for a better staff. Oh, and the car attendants- Jason, Tim, and the others were all friendly and attentive. I truly hope you know what a great staff you have!

everyoneShouldKnow: Double check your ac unit for operation BEFORE unpacking.
title: AIR CONDITIONER PROBLEMS
comment: We had 2 rooms, on club level, one ac blows warm air-miserable night, and the other the ac was so noisy it kept you awake all night long. Not even an apology from the staff. I thought club level was "better" than the cheaper rooms.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient to train station. Very attractive. Great for business meetings or conferences. Outstanding food
title: Gracious staff. Fab food. Great rooms
comment: Food fantastic. Lots of fresh fruits and veggies. Room very attractive and clean, with comfy chairs, beds and desk. Staff very reliable and gracious

title: Renovation is superb!
comment: the renovation is great, esp the new beds and window blinds, but you need towel hooks or bars in the bathrooms to hang up wet towels! the tea at the bar is a little steep to swallow, $6.99! front desk reception was fast.

title: great stay for conference
comment: i attended the art is you retreat from october 4-8, 2012. this was my first stay at your hotel, though i stay at Belvoir's all the time. was surprised by how noisy my room was (from sirens of fire house outside), but other than that the stay was lovely. ordered room service several times and the staff was very courteous and professional. loved the buffet breakfasts + lunches - food was yummy! would like to see a full service starbucks in the lobby so that i can get a frappucinno in the am - or at least carry bottled starbucks products please! looking forward to my 2013 event.

title: Nice hotel
comment: Lobby was nice. Rooms were clean but fairly small. We were part of a group and had a $99 rate. For $99 was a great deal. For the $269 regular rack rate, would have been sorely disappointed.

title: Sharaton Burlington
comment: The staff was great, the facility is convenient. But, they need to update and renovate for everything is looking old, paint wall paper flooring furniture in rooms...

title: Great location
comment: This was my second stay at this hotel. It is close to good dining and shopping options and the bus shuttle service to the McCormick Place tradeshows is convenient.

title: Great place to stay.
comment: Our family spent the weekend here prior to going to Disney because my 4 year old wanted to go to the beach also. The staff was great, very helpful, and PROMPT!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff is very courteous, helpful and friendly!
title: Weekend Staycation
comment: Had a wonderful time. Staff was incredible and very friendly.

everyoneShouldKnow: Some of the best internet access that I have ever had from a hotel.
title: 10/7 Business Stay
comment: Hotel met or exceeded all my expectations.

title: Most everything was fine
comment: Everything was wonderful-service, room. However, I would like to make one suggestion, even though I opted for the green approach to my linens a couple of days, I would have appreciated that someone remove dirty glasses that were in the room. Otherwise I had no complaints. The staff was wonderful as well.

title: Needs some updating
comment: The hotel room was clean and neat, but needs some updating all around. The pool area was terrible. The cushions on the chairs were disgusting. We had to cover the whole chair with towels in order to sit down. The spa was dirty and the whole area looked abandoned. The slide was fun.

everyoneShouldKnow: The most comfortable beds in all of Disney.
title: Amazing
comment: As usual, the Dolphin does not disappoint. The staff is amazing, the check in process quick and efficient, the rooms beautiful and the grounds meticulously cared for. Thank you for another great stay.

title: Very conveniently located
comment: Not hard to drive in and out. Near our interests.

title: Rude front desk staff
comment: The black girl that checked me in had a bad attitude. She was really rude. I like the hotel a lot and stay at least twice a month but the way she acted kinda makes me want to go stay at another hotel.

title: Great Stay and value
comment: This was the second time I stay at the Belvoir PHL. Although the lobby and exterior are going through renovations, the nice rooms and great beds more than make up for that inconvenience.

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice facility with a great staff.
title: Great Staff
comment: Enjoyed my stay but have to say the staff is what really topped off my opinion. From the shuttle drivers, to front desk, to housekeeping and restaurant staff, everyone was extremely friendly and very helpful.

title: Clean, location, friendly staff
comment: My husband and I stayed there for a weekend get away. We loved our stay it was a very nice place, clean, no children and a very friendly and accomadating staff.

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel staff take great pride in assuring that you will have a good stay.
title: Great service
comment: I was at the Belvoir Inner Harbor Hotel for a three night stay for a conference. I was on the club floor and had a few problems with my room. I spoke to the manager the next morning and he was outstanding. It was obvious to me that he wants every guest's stay to be perfect. Everything was taken care of immediately. I travel extensively and this was the best service that I have ever recieved at a hotel.

title: Solid Option
comment: The hotel location worked out quite well. You are within walking distance of a great sports bar, a grocery store and a Trader Joe's. While you are several blocks from King Street and the main Alexandria strip of shops and restaurants, it is close enough to walk. The hotel staff were great. The only concern I had was room maintenance, however having the separate seating area from the bedroom helped reduce noise from the hallway.

title: Happy Guests
comment: Had a wonderful time staying at the Bucks Belvoir this past weekend. The staff went above and beyond expectations. We were welcomed with open arms as were our Scotties. Activities held at the hotel were great, rooms were perfect. We hope to enjoy many more years of celebrating the STCA's National Specialty using your wonderful Hotel as a base!!!! Thank you!!!

title: Nice hotel. Terrible parking.
comment: Stayed from Oct. 5-8 for a wedding and the hotel was beautiful. Parking was terrible though. When therd is an event at the convention center, everybody parks in the hotel parking lot. Got back from the wedding at 10pm and could not find a spot for 30 mins. Front desk didn't recognize us as BPG members either. Had to tell them in order to get our gift.

title: Surprising Lack of Service
comment: Room was not cleaned two out of four days. Club amenities not supported -- rarely was bottled water available.

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice place...love to two bit you though
title: Hotels likes to two bit you
comment: It's bad enough that you have to pay $11/night for internet in your room, which you can get for free in the public spaces (ie even hallways), but they even cheaped out on the use of their own coupons. I took the green options (no housekeeping) for environmental reasons as well as the $5 coupon. Was told it would be redeemed for any food or stores in the hotel...so I decided to enjoy those chocolate bars in the hotel; turns out they were NOT allowed use for the $5 coupon. Guess they don't make any profit on those $4 chocolate bars...

title: Beautiful historic hotel
comment: Some historic hotels are dowdy and cramped. This one is spacious and elegant. Its central location in Chattanooga's vibrant downtown is perfect. We very much enjoyed staying here.

title: Great location
comment: We stayed on the top floor in the tower. We had large windows and a great city view. The room was very clean, quiet and comfortable. The hotel is dog friendly, we had our small dog with us. There are plenty of restaurants and stores within walking distance. There is a shuttle service as well. We enjoyed the club benefits as well. Overall we were very impressed. The conference space was nice and easy to get around.

everyoneShouldKnow: great service and try to go to the club lounge
title: Great hotel with great location
comment: Great BPG Platinum regconition. I booked two nights durjing a holiday weekend, the rooms were sold out but the hotel managed to upgrade me to a suite. It was so beautiful and elegant that I did not want to leave the room and hotel. Very nice service. One of my best experience with hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: recheck your entire bill for hidden charges.
title: Read your bill and track expenses closely
comment: I had ordered room service, with the price clearly printed on the menu. It was not delivered until I called, it was delivered and the charge was $4.00 more than the menu. I had requested laundry services, i did not get an itemized bill by the charges on my laundry ticket were $40.00 less than I was charged at check out. Even the desk staff could not explain it as they had no itemized bill. After investigation they told me I was overcharged by $29 and it was removed. Upon check in I asked and was told internet service was included in my room rate, on check out I was charged $13.95 each day for internet. Again I had to ask this to be removed. I can understand one bill error, I am concerned when there are 3.

title: Hotel is conveniently located
comment: It is near good restaurants, broadway shows and access to different place in the city.

title: Comfortable hotel near Disneyland
comment: We decided to stay at this Belvoir at the last minute Disneyland trip. It was clean, convenient and very comfortable. It is walking distance from the parks and I would highly recommend it.

everyoneShouldKnow: cal train has a stop within 10 steps!
title: easy as pie
comment: So simple, easy and comfortable.

title: What a beautiful site and location!
comment: I love this place! My only recommendation is quiet mellow music (live). This is not a party hotel nor party island (thankfully). But quiet guitar or light jazz listening ambiance would be a nice touch to a beautiful stay. Beds and linens were HEAVENLY. Concierges, although VERY helpful, were tough to access, with daily waiting lines.

everyoneShouldKnow: The view from the top is great.
title: much needed quickie vacation!
comment: My husband and I booked this vacation the day before we left. The hotel was exactly what we needed, soft beds and all, and the view of the beach was perfect.

title: Great staff!
comment: From the lounge bartender to the bellman, they had a genuine outwardly friendly demeanor and were extremely helpful.

title: Not sure we'll stay here next year!
comment: Had prepaid for two rooms for two nights. The 1st night one of the rooms no one had stayed in and the hotel was actually going to charge us $50.00 more for the 2nd night because one of the rooms was vacant. Keep in mind that the rooms were prepaid in full!!! Then the hotel misplaced our credit card. They had told us that credit cards left in bar go to the front desk for security reasons yet our card was nowhere to be found. Called card issuer and reported card lost/stolen. So have now wasted 20-30 minutes already. Having breakfast and guess what they bring to our table. Yep the credit card that was just cancelled. Talk about lack of communication amongst hotel employees. Hotel is very nice but did not feel like we were very well taken care of at all!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: beds are really nice but a little too soft for someone with back problems.
title: Nice hotel with great service
comment: From the outside the hotel looked old fashioned (dated) but the interior was delightful, except for the carpet in the hall ways which was dingy and unappealing.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Quality of service by the hotel personnel is OUTSTANDING. If you have a question - ask, a concern, make it known. They will make it right!
title: EXCEPTIONAL SERVICE AND AMENITIES
comment: Having been a long time user of the Belvoir LaGuardia I have come to appreciate the GREAT SERVICE provided by the bellmen, front desk staff, maids, Lounge attendants and even the Parking attendants! To be remembered and greeted by name -- AMAZING!!! THAT is consumate customer service!!! Great Job, folks!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: There is no free wi-fi or internet service in this hotel. Be prepared to spend $10 per day for a convience that a hotel of this stature typically offers free of charge.
title: Very nice hotel except for -
comment: There are no in room refrigerators. There is no free anything that other hotels offer guests such as internet / wi-fi service, morning coffee in the lobby, continental breakfast and complementary newspapers.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location is convenient to many points of interest. The staff provides excellent service and the renovations are wonderful.
title: Better than I expected
comment: Given that I knew beforehand the hotel was undergoing major renovation, my experience far exceeded expectations. There was the usual construction related activity, but the staff addroitly adapted to daily operational changes and managed guest services very well. The renovation had no negative impact on the hotel and staff operational performance. The renovation interface with hotel management was well orchestrated.

title: Great Location!
comment: Great location for an extended business stay. The room was comfortable and clean. Wish that you didn't have to go down an elevator/escalator to reach the tower rooms. Great having the Yard House right there too. Can't wait to come back and visit.

title: This is a beautiful hotel
comment: The staff were wonderful from the time we checked in. The room was perfect and the view was fantastic.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel is extremely relaxing even while working.
title: Outstanding Resort
comment: This resort was one of the most comfortable facilities I've ever stayed at. The rooms were spacious. The food was exquisite. The staff are accommodating. The spa is out of this world. The only glitch I had was not receiving packages that had been sent to the resort for me in a timely fashion.

everyoneShouldKnow: It needs a lot of attention to detail.
title: Disappointed
comment: I found this hotel to have a lack of attention to detail. Hotel lobby was full of leaves that have blown in from outside during our entire stay. Our room had a sink that backed up so bad I can not believe that a house keeper cleaning the sink would not have seen this. In addition our toilet backed up and we had to have maintenance work on the toilet 3 different times. I don't believe this is reflective of the majority of Shearton properties I have stayed at over the years but of a reflection of poor attention to detail and a definite lack of accountability. I believe your management needs to pay attention to visible details and hold staffs accountable. In addition I found the dining room menue to be very poor in terms of options. As a result we only had one meal on property in five days. Lastly each morning the maids meet at there supply room to gather their things for the day. However the amount of noise and commotion taking place in this room and in the immediate hallway needs to be stopped. At times it was like a mini convention holding a political rally, noisy and conjusted. I suggest more time be spent cleaning hall ways, doors and walls with finger prints on them and picking up room service dishes that are left in the hallways for a day or more. Bottom line I was very disappointed in our stay at your property.

everyoneShouldKnow: The front desk staff are ok, not great.
title: Swimming Pool
comment: Few hotels have pools where one can actually swim. This Belvoir does. However, it was closed on the morning I went to the pool at about 7:30/8am. Apparently the lifeguard did not show. A sign on the door would have been helpful. At 9am I was told the staff was looking for someone. Thanks, but annoying for those who have to work out early.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient and very clean. Staff is very professional and friendly.
title: This hotel is in great location
comment: Our stay in Orlando at the Belvoir was a very pleasant experience. The staff are very friendly and professional.

everyoneShouldKnow: The club lounge was a fun perk!! The staff were friendly and helpful!
title: Warm, friendly staff!
comment: Beautiful hotel! Great staff!

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff are the most courteous and gracious...always a pleasure to interact with them.
title: Feels like Home...
comment: This hotel always make me feel like home! The staff are overly friendly and they always make the effort to make sure my stay is comfortable.

title: Very relaxing
comment: I just started staying at this hotel. Wonderful staff, clean hotel, awesome gym. Now my preferred hotel in Orlando.

everyoneShouldKnow: Lobby renovations...though not a big deal
title: new and clean
comment: We stayed in a newly refurbished club room and it was tasteful and comfortable.

title: Hotel Visit Boston
comment: One item that we noticed was that the Club Room could not cater for the amount of people that had access to it.

title: Service well below par
comment: Good location, but with renovation the front desk was out of the way and insufficiently staffed. In addition, there was a failure to service my room. When checking out was charged for movie/video game that I did not purchase. Took multiple efforts to remove from bill. As Gold member was only given late checkout to 1 pm.

title: A perfect oasis within DisneyWorld!
comment: I had a wonderful and relaxing stay at the Dolphin Hotel! From a most gracious staff, to the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in! The location is perfect for visiting Epcot and Hollywood Studios. However, when at the hotel, you have a serene home away from the madness of the parks! I would definitely stay at this property again!

title: Great Hotel!
comment: This hotel was great from the very beginning. Upon check in we were upgraded to Jr. suites and still were able to use the concierge level. The staff was so nice and helpful. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. The staff in the bar were also exceptional, as were the people in the breakfast room. The location is perfect.

title: Great location.
comment: No better place to stay for the price in lower Manhattan. Close to all the best shopping and dining.

everyoneShouldKnow: Other than the perfect location, the beds!
title: Well done!
comment: Visiting this Belvoir location for the first time on business. All-day meetings really take it out of you, so I'm looking for a restful retreat at the end of the day. With that in mind, here's my review:

title: Great Location
comment: Hotel is located really close to the Crystal City Metro station. Price is great and you can spend your day in the tourist area and take a quick train ride back to hotel. Close to a great Kabob place also.

everyoneShouldKnow: There are not a lot of food choices in the immediate area-however, there is a fabulous mall with everything rather nearby.
title: Great stay
comment: Our room was superb! Unfortunately, we had little time to enjoy the amenities. Most helpful to us was the extremely accomodating staff.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is so-o-o convenient to the Pasadena Convention Center
title: Wonderful Guestr Service
comment: I had reason to contact your Guest Serices person, Mike and he was wonderful. More than made me happy.

title: This hotel is in the perfect location
comment: My family enjoyed their stay at the hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you don't mind being a little further from the parks, then this hotel is the perfect choice for clenlinessand comfort.
title: Clean, Comfortable, great
comment: We enjoyed our stay here. The rooms were very well kept and clean. We liked having lots of pillows, the complimentary water was a fabulous unexpected amenity and the staff was very helpful. Our first night we realized we had a leak in the bathroom causing a small puddle. We are pretty easy so we just called the front desk to alert them and said it was fine to us as long as it didn't get worse but just wanted them to know. They sent maintenance right away. He brought us extra towels for the floor and told us he would have it fixed first thing in the morning, which he did. The front desk was always pleasant as were the valets and porters. My son ended up with a collection of stuffed animals from Disneyland and the housekeepers would always arrange them nicely on his bed for him. He enjoyed that. Overall, it was a great hotel and experience. We chose to walk to Disneyland every day which was about 10-15 minutes depending on crowd and crosswalk lights. We could also walk to Garden Walk for dinner. We never used the ART but the hotel hasa nice sitting area for it to stop at right out front. The laundry room was great to have, although, it took us almost 3 hours to do a load because we had to run the dryer twice to get clothes fully dry. That was a bummer to have to sit there that long with nothing to do. Finally, the snack shop was a great option although pricey. We wish Molly's Kitchen was open for dinner because Overland seemed very dead and the food wasn't that great. We would definitely stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: the close proximity to beach.The fantastic service
title: this hotel has great staff
comment: We had a great time... The staff in the bar areas were fantastic... The variety of food was a little limited resulting in us dining elsewhere quite often

title: Great Amenities
comment: An older property, but location and amenities are worth it. Convenience store and deli are great amenities for families visiting local attractions. Game room, pool and gardens are perfect for kids!

everyoneShouldKnow: Small Casino off Lobby if you want to do something different.
title: Very nice Club Lounge
comment: The Club Lounge at this hotel is beautiful and spacious. It has a nice outdoor seating area with a nice view of the bay. Service was very good and lounger personnel were friendly. Pool area is also spacious and has a bar next to it.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff was wonderful - friendly and helpful.
title: We loved staying here!
comment: As we pulled up I was impressed with the beautiful landscaping. After a long drive, we were welcomed by your friendly staff, who provided us with directions to the various nearby attractions. Our room was ready, spacious and very comfortable. We also enjoyed the dining facilities and appreciated the breakfast coupons. I've already recommended this hotel to my brother and a co-worker!

title: great hotel but...
comment: i had confimed late checkout and had 'do not distrub' on the door but housekeeping kept knocking to check when i will be out of the room. other than that, it is a great hotel to stay in waikiki area.

title: Hidden Oasis
comment: This Belvoir is in a great location but is semi hidden away. The grounds are beautiful and remind me of a hidden Oasis. Nice club lounge and Executive club rooms with mini kitchenettes.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you have a problem, I wouldn't count on them to do anything about it. They may know how to woo guests, but they sure don't know how to solve a problem.
title: Can "woo" a guest, but cannot solve a problem!
comment: Hotel policies are published in an obscure link titled "announcements" on the website homepage--not on the reservations page where they take your money. It is not even a tab, just a link. A simple box asking "Are you at least 21 years old" on the reservation page would be very helpful and would have avoided this entire debacle!! Had it not been for another guest in her party, my eighteen year old daughter would have been left without a room in a unfamiliar city despite the fact she had a confirmed reservation in her name with her credit card. She has been to Europe and back, yet she was not permitted to check into this upscale, personal-service minded hotel. She was there for a wedding party and this debacle made it memorable, but for all the wrong reasons. Sure wish the staff had reacted to my daughter as they did to some the other people who left reviews here. I spoke to the manager during this event to see what could be done and she was rude--tough luck was her attitude!

title: On the Beach
comment: Stayed at this location during a business trip and brought the wife along. Front desk staff was the BEST and friendliest I have ever meet. They are the model for Customer Service!

everyoneShouldKnow: No airport shuttle, shuttle will only go within one mile of the hotel. No restaurant.
title: Rooms and Bar
comment: Missed the refrigerator in the room. As there is no mini bar really missed having this. When you went down to Starbucks later in the morning nothing was left to eat. Would have preferred to have my own food to eat. Coffee was good. With respect to the bar, not enough coverage, was hard to get someone to wait on you at your table and were forced to wait in line every time you wanted another drink. Would sell a lot more with better service.

title: stay at Shearton
comment: It took a lomg time to check in eve n though there was olnly one person in front of me. A trainee was there and the supervisor left. In thre middle of checking me in they started to talk to another guest.One room key did not work

everyoneShouldKnow: It's very friendly and comfortable. They take good care of you!
title: I recommend this hotel
comment: We needed to change rooms and there was no problem whatsoever. The staff was always professional and helpful, the room was very comfortable, and we would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to others. We look forward to staying there again!

title: I Love it except ......
comment: I love everything about this hotel - location most importantly - the size of the room - cleanliness of the room - and customer service is superb! Only downside is the elevator problem and also the bathroom - i thought the tub had a stain but its cracked in small spot also the wallpaper is peeling off . If you have access to the LOUNGE is a Big Plus - They have delicious food there and very cozy - so for those who wish to stay - I highly recommend an upgrade for lounge access - it's worth IT :)

title: Room was a little small
comment: We stayed in a queen bed room. It could have been a little bigger but met our needs. Disappointed their was no refrigerator.

everyoneShouldKnow: Pet friendly and very high standards
title: Very Comfortable, Welcoming hotel
comment: What a welcoming pleasure, to have valet parking and our luggage taken care of to our room and as well as our departure. The staff was more than commendating . The room was very clean and beds were very comfortable.

title: Friendly staff
comment: The staff at the hotel were very friendly and kind. Everything was clean which is important to me. It would have been nice to have a club room for BPG members, but other than that it was a very nice stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Centrally superb location and best for walking down the beach towards Diamond Head! Nobody has an INFINITY Pool like this hotel!
title: This Hotel Gets My 4 Mai Tais UP Award!
comment: I normally rent a home in Lanikai for my annual trek to Oahu. Purchased 3 nights stay at a great Charity Auction and bought 2 more nights for my stay. Checked in, got the "Guest of the Day Award and abundant perks", that was awesome but more awesome was the Staff who always remembered me by name, & knew I was there for my birthday celebration. Staff is amazing - kudos to Management & thank you Lynn in KAI restaurant for making my morning breakfasts memorable! I'm no longer renting a home on Windward shore & always going to be spending my October birthday at Belvoir Waikiki! PS - might we see some more "tropical events in evening" instead of the disco? And more fish dishes on EDGE menu - some of us just don't do "Fried" when we're fried from the great sun:) AND next door to Halekulani's "House Without A Key" which is fab for 5pm Mai Tais with setting sun and no problem getting back home to Belvoir!

title: Large hotel with poor service.
comment: Front desk insufficiently staffed for volume of rooms / visitors. The large TV in the lobby area was broken, did not work. There was no TV channel guide in the room. No coffee is available other than sit-down in the restaurant. No newspapers were available in the hotel, complimentary or otherwise. When I checked out they charged me $745 for 2 nights, my confirmed rate was $526 total. They corrected it, but only after I complained.

title: This hotel is very comfortable.
comment: My family and I thoroughly enjoyed an extended weekend at the Belvoir Anaheim. The hotel is beautifully kept, with large comfortable rooms. Access to the Disney Parks is great with frequent and dependable shuttle service. My only complaint concerns the shuttle service. During the hottest days, the shuttle did not have functioning air conditioning, which was nearly unbearable. Please be cognizant of this.

everyoneShouldKnow: business style hotel, 15 minutes from malibu.
title: this is a business style hotel
comment: this is a regular Belvoir hotel. do not expect to feel welcome and receive special treatment for being BPG member. i have gold status and they gave us a regular room, nothing special just a bed and bathroom, small sized room, the bed is on a particularly high bedframe. we asked for complimentary drinks and breakfast from elite club lounge and they did not want to accomodate saying if they gave me the free can of coke or water bottle i wouldnt work on becoming a platinum status. i mean seriously i check in with my BPG credit card obviously i like the BPG program. the hotel was full of business people and there was a meeting going on there. I used 7,000 points for the 1 night stay and in the morning the bill they slipped under the door had a room charge on there i had to go to the front desk to have it resolved and the lady in the morning was curtious and said she will update to a 0 balance.

title: the hotel has patios
comment: i wrote this at the hotel. we were not shown the patio and the next day i discovered our door that led to the patio was not locked. i suggest bellmen open and close the drapes and check the door to see if it is locked. there was no indication if we could use the coffee etc without charge.lastly yours is the only one with no refrigerator in room.

title: Great hotel!
comment: Clean, comfortable, and very friendly staff. It was very cozy and felt right at home during our short stay.

title: Airport Belvoir
comment: The only problem I have with this hotel is the fact that the bathtub looked filthy. It would be nice if they figured out a way to keep the tub surface looking white and not grey. Other than that, the staff was nice, very accommodating and the rooms were quiet.

title: Location is ideal.
comment: With respect to the Convention Center...the Belvoir provides the ideal location.

everyoneShouldKnow: Close to many things to do.
title: A great family hotel
comment: We have stayed here for the past 6 years at 10 days at a time. It is just like home.

title: Great night's rest!
comment: The bed was the most comfortable I have been in! The place was very clean and new feeling.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, respectable initial pricing, avoid buying anything on site.
title: Wonderful experience, except food pricing
comment: The hotel was wonderful overall. They were extra friendly and provided a little cake for my daughter's birthday (no charge). Everyone gave me the impression they really cared at all times.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff is very friendly and made my stay more comfortable
title: Friendly Staff !!
comment: Great Place to stay and staff is the most important asset of this hotel

everyoneShouldKnow: They charge exorbitant fees for a dog.
title: Do not go here if you have a dog...
comment: I stayed two nights and was charged $150.00 for my dog to stay. (Small Dog) That is on top of the nightly rate for me to stay. And the $12.00 for parking in an already full lot. And $10.00 for a slow Internet.

title: Customer Service lacking
comment: Stay October 4-9. Arrived at 11pm, no one at the front door to help with bags. Found a roach in the room. All 3 pools were to cold to use. Response form the front desk was" we turn the heaters on next week" One Hot tub to hot, the other to cold. Told the boat to wild horse starts at noon on sunday. 4 calls and 45min later told by hotel employee they made a mistake. Manager refused to provide dinner for two because of mistake

title: great location, spacious room
comment: perfect location as you can walk to numerous restaurants and the mall. Spacious rooms were very comfortable. Accept dogs which was wonderful.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is in a most convenient location for all downtown Raleigh activities.
title: Plush and comfy, not business friendly
comment: The Belvoir is luxuriously comfortable, and beautifully appointed. If, however, you are a working guest, it is not at all well-suited to your needs. I stayed three days, along with few hundred friends at a conference. In the meeting spaces we had wireless (though weak signal) access to the Internet. In our rooms, the only place with peace and quiet, we were assessed a $10 per day charge. Does this matter to everyone? maybe not, but to an online college communication instructor, it is a deal breaker. Also, there is no affordable coffee and quick food available early morning (6 a.m.) range.

everyoneShouldKnow: No risk in staying here. Highly recommend
title: BPG Recognition-doing the right thing!
comment: Always enjoy staying at this hotel. The staff is great and focused to customer service.

title: Nice stay, but
comment: Everything about our stay was good, except the check-in process. The front desk was understaffed and the wait to check in was around 20-25 minutes.

title: Family trip
comment: This is a great place to stay. My family loved the pool and beach. Great location. Everything you need is at this hotel.

title: Excellent facilities for my conference
comment: My business had a conference at this hotel and everythig worked out great! The room was fantastic and the conference meeting rooms met our needs and the catering staff was excellent!

title: Facilities issues and poor cleanliness
comment: I have to say I would rate this as a below average BPG property. In addition to the hot water not working in my room and the wake up call being late the room was dirty and smelled as if there was a pet in it before. I was also surprised to discover that the ceiling fan inoperative. I will not be staying at this property again.

title: Okay
comment: There was mold in the bathroom. Top of wall near ceiling. I reported this to the clerk at the time of check out.

title: Great location
comment: Good location for going to game at MetLife stadium. Shuttle service was great. Room was nice. Staff was very accomodating. VERY disappointed that whirlpool was not operating and pool was very dirty. These were the two things I had personally called about prior and were assured would be usable.

title: Perfect Hotel & location
comment: The hotel was walking distance from major attractions and the subway. The staff was very helpful & friendly. The newly renovated room was update with the most modern features to include decor. I would definitely recommend to a friend and stay again in the future.

everyoneShouldKnow: This is the way service should be
title: Great location, great staff,great amenities
comment: This hotel personifies the Aloha spirit--laid-back and seamless service. The restaurant was particularly exceptional--oceanside dining at its best.

title: Very nice stay at the Belvoir
comment: Room was nice, but would be small for two people. Room service was excellent...good food and great service. Was not able to connect to the internet although I was told I could. Would definitely stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is very clean and comfortable
title: great stay
comment: Hotel was great. Clean, comfy and great location. Ocean and beach right across street. Felt like home (almost)!! Staff was great from check-in to check-out.

title: Overall good
comment: I like the newly renovated rooms. Nice job and big improvement over the old rooms.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's Really a Beautiful Facility and is central enough for your activity needs.
title: Great Family Vaca Facility
comment: We absolutely LOVED staying at this facility. As an BPG member I got a good rate and location was convenient to activities. We barely wanted to leave...lol. Only 2 small flaws (which is good in my book) Need a bigger fitness center, had a little bit of a line forming to get on machines and DEFINITELY get a better Internet Network. Took almost 3-5 minutes for sites to pop up. End up using 3G on my phone for faster service. Overall, it was great and we'll definitely be back.

everyoneShouldKnow: The rooms are very small and plain. This is not the Belvoir on Maui.
title: Don't expect luxury
comment: I read this hotel was renovated. I had high expectations given my experience at the Belvoir on Maui. This is not and will never be that hotel. I did not see where the dollars were spent. The lobby was new but nothing else seemed refreshed. Our first room was very small. The bathroom was very small and very much like a motel bathroom. It was a Garden Room on the 4th floor. The big problem was the A/C unit, which sounded like a jet engine. We complained on night #1, they said they would have engineering look at it. Problem was not fixed. We complained again. The front desk informed us that this was a "new" A/C unit and are much louder. So, they knew about this problem but yet did not move us when we originally complained. This front desk clerk, immediately changed our room to one with a quieter A/C unit and credited our resort fee for our entire stay. That was much appreciated.

everyoneShouldKnow: you're right on Highway 95 - great location, but not views!
title: Very nice people!
comment: We always stay at Grandbourne's, since the time they were Belvoir Club many years ago. Sometimes in the smaller towns the hotels are fine, but not exceptional. This one exceeded our expectations, and, Abha, at the front desk. was one of the nicest of your Grandbourne (or any hotel!) personnel we've ever encountered.

title: Excellent
comment: The staff was very friendly. Right on the beach and a great pool. Rooms were a liitle old but very clean .Only complaint rooms need fans in the washrooms

everyoneShouldKnow: Plan dining or entertainment options off property.
title: limited dining options
comment: The resort it self was in a beautiful setting. The pool was wonderful and the building beautiful., But there are extremely limited dining and social options for being so far removed from the general area. Especially given the conference facility. It was difficult to find ways to "entertain" clients for more than an evening or so on property. The TVs in the only "bar" area were fuzzy and barely worked for sporting events. And the menu after 9 was basically nonexistent.

everyoneShouldKnow: Old and tired, but convenient to Cobb Galleria
title: Great Staff; Tired, Old Facility
comment: I want to like this hotel because the staff genuinely tries to provide excellent service, but at the end of the day, the hotel is in serious need of a major renovation. From toilets that barely flush to sinks that barely drain to a garage posted with flood warning signs, the hotel needs serious work. The rooms are relatively spacious, but the furniture, walls, carpeting, etc. show their age all too well. On the positive, the air conditioning was effective. The location is fine, with close proximity to I-285, and you can walk to the Cobb Galleria Centre. Parking is relatively inexpensive as well.

title: house keeping or lost and found
comment: I checked out the 9th and on the road remembered I left my sons black dress jacket in front closet, ive contacted several times these two and NEVER got a response from them. It was left in closet!!! They just give me the run around

title: comfortable and nice welcoming staff
comment: The rooms are big and spacious , even though hotel is further away from Duval st, it has a shuttle that was a plus. You dont have spend money on cabs to get to downtown. You can sign up for shuttles, and I advise that you.do but even when you dont the staff is very accommodating.

everyoneShouldKnow: close to airport and is set nicely in the harbor island.
title: Customer service needs improvement
comment: I have booked package directly with the Belvoir call center. But it appears that the hotel staff is not aware of the package. so i have to constantly show them the confirmation paper work to prove that i have some free service with the room charge. Otherwise they charge for those inclusive services.

title: Thie property has some problems
comment: From check in to the rooms itself this hotel has some problems I called the day of check in and requested connecting rooms as I was traveling with 4 children told my request would be filled. Got to the hotel that night only to find out they gave one of the rooms away so not only not connecting but far away from each other. They did finally find two room close to each other but when we got to the room the bedding on the one bed had several yellow stains on both the sheets and the blanket .

title: Slightly disappointed
comment: I really expected so much more from the Belvoir! Outlets didn't work properly, we blew a fuse running a blow dryer, had to pay extra for a fridge. Just a lot of little things, but overall it was disappointing. Staff was great though!

title: hollywood
comment: i found the hotels location wonderful for our needs everyone was friendly and show was great !!!!

title: Great response to service needs
comment: Our air conditioner did not work properly. Maintenance tried to repair but moved us promptly when the part needed was not available.

title: Great Experience!
comment: The Sheration Kauai Resort & Spa has a great location and wonderful employees!

title: Disappointed
comment: Was on a waiting list for the hotel, as I was in town for a convention...which close to the event I got a reservation. The pros: the room was clean, bed comfortable, and hotel floor super quiet (never heard other guests, or noises). Cons: No refrigator, no complementary breakfast, and when I checked out a day early they informed me it would be a fee (half the price of the rate). I asked to speak to the manager and explained this was not mentioned when I reserved the room. Also when we checked in we used one card but I didn't want that card used so I switched cards. I had to wait over 40 minutes for the staff to figure it out. They keep complaining I wasn't being charged enough. Well I looked at my statement and I was charged more than if I hadn't cancelled my last night. I was originally staying for 4 nights and stayed only 3, but I was charged for 4 and after my stay I see a small charge from them! What is that from? The staff made no effort to apologize for the long wait and mistakes they made.

everyoneShouldKnow: you will not be disappointed over the top service
title: this hotel is fabulous
comment: Beds are wonderful, rooms sqeaky clean/best restaurant fabulous food, wonderful food. Nolan and Erica very nice and cordial Desk associates professional and know how to respond to tired people in a positive manneriterd i was very impressed.The sales team so nice and willing to work with you

everyoneShouldKnow: take a chair to check in you will need it.....
title: Reserve at own risk
comment: Reservation was screwed up, waited in line for 45 mins to check in....

title: big room, great location
comment: the room is larger than many in Manhattan.

title: Niccceee!
comment: For night it was cool. Love the staffs hospitality.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff make you feel welcome and accommodate you
title: Excellent Lodging
comment: Friendly staff, good service, very clean room and public areas. Free parking and convenient. Overall excellent experience. BPG members and Grandbourne Vacation owners should stay here rather than other expensive Grandbourne properties where they nickel and dime you for everything and make you feel like they are doing you a favor.

everyoneShouldKnow: The dessert is worth going for...
title: Excellent Hotel
comment: The staff were great & helpful. Especially Elise, who provided excellent recommendations on the food. I definetly recommend for dessert the banana's foster in a mason jar. Very peacefull location, clean & comfortable.

title: Horrible Bathrooms
comment: Bathrooms were disgusting.

title: Beautiful Hotel
comment: Beautiful hotel and friendly staff

everyoneShouldKnow: Beautiful setting, nice amenities, and friendly staff
title: Beautiful Hotel
comment: Friendly staff and beautiful setting

title: Anne From Stl
comment: Arrived at 11:30 at night and after checking in I returned to the parking lot to park my car and get my bag from the car. I was approached by a man 6'4" who was insistent that I drive him some where and was backing me up to my car. It was beyond scary and not what I expected at a hotel for $200 a night. When another came out to his car across the lot to go home for the night it scared him off and he ran towards a McDonald's. I was terrified and returned to the lobby where security was at the front desk just talking away in a social conversation. Then a couple minutes later he walked casually outside and said he did not see anything and dismissed the situation! I asked for the manager the next morning who showed more empathy. I was on a trip that was going to be demanding and I spent the extra money because I wanted to relax and that is far from what I did at your hotel!!!

title: Beautiful Hotel
comment: We enjoyed our stay and found the location to be convenient for travel in the area. The restaurant menu offered several good choices for dinner and our selections were delicious! The staff was very friendly and helpful.

title: Great night in Portsmouth
comment: The Belvoir in Portsmouth is a great place to stay. The staff is particularly friendly and always willing to help. We found our room to be clean and comfortable.

title: Stay Here Often
comment: I stay here often on business and have always had good experiences. Rooms are clean and comfy, never an issue at check-in, and as a Platinum Member, I am just about always on the club floor and receive suite upgrades when available. The club lounge is good as well with decent hours and a mix of snacks. Overall, a good hotel for business travel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Restaurant and room service food awful.
title: Not again soon
comment: The food was terrible

title: This is a Belvoir !
comment: Arrived, ceiling falling down in parking structure. Checked in, assigned room on 19th floor. Ceiling falling down from leaks, room smells and is dirty. Hotel was full. Elevators effectively non-functional. Had to walk down 19 flights of stairs after 20 minute elevator wait. Wife needed to use scissors. Went to front desk ... was advised no scissors available. Water lukewarm in shower. Called for service Was advised sorry, hotel full and best they can do as water system cant keep up. Just a dump.

title: Expected better treatment as BPG member
comment: We were put in a non-BPG floor. Because of that, they told us we do not get some of the benefits,specifically complimentary water. Other Belvoirs, even though we were not put in a BPG room, gave us complimentary water.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is fresh, clean and inviting.
title: Very nice property!
comment: This is an extremely nice property. The room was great, the food was fine and the staff was very welcoming. The hotel was a little far away from downtown but overall I would highly recommend.

everyoneShouldKnow: Friendly staff especially at the restaurant
title: Billing Issues
comment: The hotel staff is great when checking in. The problem is the constant calling follow ups with billing errors. Unacceptable still have not received the correct bill

title: Best Location
comment: Perfect location. Close to theater, museums, shopping, people watching. Quiet rooms. Staff is very accommodating. Definitely recommend and stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Ms. Marie Kupfer and the entire staff are beyond outstanding and feel like family right away!! they are so sincere and caring!
title: WOW!!!
comment: THIS PLACE ROCKS!!!!..WAS TREATED BEYOND ROYALTY...THE STAFF IS THE ABSOLUTE BEST I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED AND Ms. KUPFER WAS OUTSTANDING TO ME AND MY WIFE!! WE WILL DEFINATELY STAY THERE AGAIN AND AGAIN !!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Not fancy or high end but good staff
title: Great location made up for shortcomings
comment: Great location with a great staff, problem was hotel needs a bit of face lift. Thought staff was MORE than friendly which made the stay great. Could use a few later hours at the bar! Food was good and overall the stay was GOOD!

everyoneShouldKnow: Easy to get to Valet parking is the way to go...
title: Surprisingly Nice Stay
comment: I rarely do reviews online since I travel so often, but I was pleasantly surprised with this stay... I visit Atlanta often and never stayer here till this week, some of the reviews said rundown rooms, but they must have reviewed them before renovation... Hotel was clean and looks new and renovated, on top of it, was easy to get in and out from Freeway...

title: pilot
comment: this is a good place to stay for the surrounding area.. great for airport travel needs.

everyoneShouldKnow: Close to restaurants within walking distance
title: Enjoyed the stay immensely
comment: We were pleased to find that all our requests were met, early checking, close to the elevator and tournament area.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very convient to Disney World attractions.
title: Needs work in housekeeping
comment: Mold on shower and bathroom tile. Not what we would have expected of Grandbourne facilities.

title: Great locatin
comment: Location of hotel was across the street from conference I was attending. Also, within walking distance to downtown attractions.

title: So So
comment: Convenient location. Staff friendly and efficient, quick check in/out. Facilities and rooms are worn and in need of renovation. Wallpaper peeling off walls, anchors from old fixtures unrepaired on the walls. Carpet threadbare. Room and bathroom were clean, bed comfortable,

everyoneShouldKnow: They add extra fees without telling you.
title: Don't like surprises
comment: The hotel was wonderful! The Staff was great while we were at the hotel! Everything was Great! When I got home and looked at my receipt I discovered a Resort Fee which I was not made aware of along with a Parking fee again which I was not made aware of. Being in the hospitality business I find these fees as a "money grab" and am highly put off by extra fees. If you want to raise your rates do so, but don't keep adding unknown fees. What did I get for the Resort Fee? NOTHING that I know of. Valet Parking - yes my car was parked and I got two bottles of ice cold water when we checked out. Neither of which I think is worth $15 when the parking lot was within steps of the front door. Had I known this I would have parked my car myself. I loved the hotel and the renovation is superb, but I may have to think twice about staying myself and putting my groups at the hotel. I am a tour operator and was looking for some new hotels in the Orlando area. I had met one of your sales people in Jacksonville the week before and thought I'd try out the hotel on her recommendations. It is easy to add extra charges when customers pay with a credit card and then they are in a hurry in the morning and don't take the time to look at the bill at the time.

everyoneShouldKnow: Old world Charm inside and with the staff.
title: Southern Hospitality is here!
comment: We only stayed one night before flying home, but everyone was just so helpful from where to eat, getting a taxi in the early morning, etc. Incredbily kind hearted people!

title: Hotel met my needs
comment: Very clean. Superb location. Staff was outstanding. Room was perfect. High floor...very quiet. Just what I needed. No complaints. Way to go.

title: Wonderful old hotel in down town San Antone
comment: This is a beautifully restored hotel built in the early 1900's. Great location for access to the river walk and excellent down town restaurants.

title: Great stop over
comment: Great priced stop over hotel when flying into Miami, free hotel shuttle to hotel, quick, easy, efficient check in. Room was fine if a bit dated but overall met our needs fully. Club lounge great for a light snack and drink after a long flight, Continental breakfast in lounge also met our needs. Staff in lounge excellent. Ideal location to stroll across to pick up hire car at the Miami Airport car rental centre.

title: Club Suite
comment: The Club Suite and Ms. Monique's service in particular were very good and made the stay much better. When we arrived, the hallways smelled bad, the a/c in the room was broken, and the Plaza view wasn't very good because it was the last room in the hall (1701). The Club Suite is the reason I came away with a positive experience.

title: First time stay
comment: Check in staff very friendly. Shuttle to the airport very efficient and driver very friendly. Will stay here again when in Albuquerque.

title: Comfort, Clean and well staffed
comment: We will be staying here for all our trips to Chapel Hill. The comfort of the rooms are exceptional. The staff helpful. The restaurant was very good and convenient. Atmosphere was quiet and we slept well.

everyoneShouldKnow: Beautiful view of Lake Superior and the Canal Lift Bridge.
title: Disappointed
comment: We have stayed at this hotel previously and have even recommended to others that they stay here. This time, however, we were quite disappointed. We made a reservation on the Club floor with a lake view, and when we arrived we were told no such rooms were available. Furthermore, we were told that was not the room we had reserved. Fortunately, I had a copy of my reservation showing we had in fact reserved a Club floor room with a lake view. Instead we had to settle for another floor. We were offered additional BPG points, however I have not seen the additional BPG points on my account. Otherwise, we enjoy the location, the fitness room, and the restaurant. Next time, we won't trust the online reservation.

title: On the Road Again...
comment: Professional Customer Service from Beginning to End,

everyoneShouldKnow: Walking distance to UVM. Very convenient free shuttle service.
title: Could use improvement
comment: I had 2 consecutive reservations for a 3 night stay. Very convenient location to UVM & the free shuttle is a plus. Lobby staff & shuttle drivers very efficient, helpful & friendly. However, I checked in on Thurs. morning & did not get housecleaning services until Saturday. The rooms definitely could use some updating - and maybe a little bit of color, for instance colorful bedding instead of plain white.

title: good for travelers
comment: Well situated in terms of distance from airport and public transport.

title: This hotel has a very courteous and friendly staff.
comment: The entire staff was very friendly, courteous, and ready to please from the front desk to the bartender to the club floor lounge.

title: Excellent Service, Excellent Staff
comment: This hotel has accommodated us for me and my girlfriend's past 3 visits to Disneyland. Always a warm welcoming staff. The check in was speedy and prompt, the rooms were well kept and clean on arrival, and the room service was on point! We have had a few mix ups (nothing to severe) but the hotel was quick to make things right! A definite hotel we will always keep coming back to! Thank you!

title: We love the Dolphin / Swan
comment: This hotel is one of our favorite places to stay in the Disney area. We love the location and quality of the hotel. On this trip, there were a few amenities missing in the room when we arrived (glasses, for example), but the very responsive staff took care of this right away.

title: Lobby
comment: The lobby and bar area needs an face lift.

title: A pleasant home away from home.
comment: I have stayed here many times and will always come back when I am in the area. The facility is welcoming and the staff friendly. There are many areas of the hotel arranged as you would your home with chairs arranged for private conversations and small nooks where you can work privately without being stuck in your room. The bar and restaurant are outstanding.

title: My Stay
comment: Excellent rate for the comfort received.

title: Picture perfect
comment: Arriving to the hotel we were met by friendly warm staff that made us feel immediately welcomed. They provided a complementary bottle of bubbly for our anniversary. A perfect way to start our vacation. Enjoyed the bubbly from our expansive balcony watching a picture perfect sunset. Thanks, kona

everyoneShouldKnow: perfect place to stay if you like the outlets or need to get to the convention center
title: great place to stay in AC
