comment: i'm not a gambler, but i do go to AC for conferences, or just a short getaway. the Belvoir is perfect for me. quiet, comfortable, exceptional customer service at check-in, and only steps away from the convention center.

everyoneShouldKnow: I've been coming to this hotel for about 22 years because of its employees.
title: My Home Away from Home
comment: Every employee I encounter -- from the valet, to the front desk to the concierge attendant to my housekeeper -- not only remembers my name, but asks me how I am doing and hopes that I am having a great day. Then each and every one doesn't let me leave until he or she asks, "Anything I can do for you, Miss Anderson?" I love this hotel because of its people whose hearts beat loud and clear for every guest they serve.

title: Your standard Belvoir ruined by its staff
comment: Been staying here for weeks and unfortunately will keep doing so because its convenience trumps the negatives for me. Some if the staff are great, but when you have a front desk manager that has no concept of guest service, the experience is ruined.

title: Great location; great place to stay.
comment: Location is great because we love walking to Studios and Epcot. Our room was clean; maid service was timely. I had asked for a very quiet room and received it (always a plus). Had a problem with the key cards, but it was pleasantly and promptly corrected. The only minus was that some of the pillows weren't what I remembered and seemed to be a bit flat.

everyoneShouldKnow: A good place for all occasions.
title: Great Hotel
comment: Terrific in every way. Our business conference room was great and the service personnel moved in and out with a disruption to our meeting.

everyoneShouldKnow: Looks like a hotel, will feel like home
title: Right Place - Right Price
comment: Centrally located near restaurants, historical military displays - including the U.S.S. Wisconsin docked three blocks away, the Belvoir Waterside is a bargain gem. Friendly, helpful staff greet you at every turn. Their 'breakfast included' rate is a bargain and unique for its quality. It's my new home away from home in Norfolk.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is ideal. Nice nature/walking trail adjacent to hotel through bird sanctuary.
title: Great location
comment: Very quiet location, and scenic. Convenient to freeway if traveling.

title: this hotel is awsome
comment: WOW, what a great time. We were there for a wedding oct 5 & 6 everything was great.Thank you very much.

everyoneShouldKnow: Beautiful facility with great ambience and
title: great place for business or pleasure
comment: Being on the club level has great benefits. The complimentary breakfast, all day access and evening wine and hors d'oeuvres is a lovely aspect. The staff in the morning and evening are

everyoneShouldKnow: How great the staff are and how greatly located it is.
title: This hotel was great
comment: This hotel was convient for our trip. The room was spacious. The bed was comfortable. The location of the hotel was not far from places to eat.

everyoneShouldKnow: Clean, excellent staff, super clean pool
title: more then expected
comment: Have stayed in many hotels/motels from traveling since retired. This was not the most I ever paid for a few nights stay. What surprised me was the staff and room for the price. I have paid alot more for alot less. If I come back to this area I know where I will be staying.

title: room cleanleness
comment: went to pour water in coffee maker and a 1" bug came out .also went to adjust a/c and a bug came out from behind the control !!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Older hotel but maintained at cutting edge level.
title: very comfortable hotel
comment: This was my first stay at the Belvoir Commander, and nothing disappointed. Location is great, and the room was wonderful. Services were also at high level.

title: Small rooms but great Staff !
comment: I found the staff to be very friendly,..always said hi in passing, & were eager to help.

everyoneShouldKnow: Avoid it - there aren't that many hotels in the area but do try to find another one.
title: One of the worst hotel experiences I have ever had
comment: The room was OK and they kept it clean, but overall, this is one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in, in relation to the price. Maybe *the* worst.

title: Good Hotel at Good Price
comment: Hotel was nice and clean. I expected more from the restaurant order the Mahi Mahi which turned out poor. The breakfast was nice and so were the benefits for BPG in the lounge floor. Overall a decent stay a few updates to the rooms as far as details would bring the location to a 5.

everyoneShouldKnow: Eat here. Great food and awesome bar staff.
title: Great place but please get new valets
comment: After a very long day of sales calls between LA and San Diego I was looking forward to checking in and relaxing. The first impression was not so good as the extremely rude valet asked to hold my keys while I checked in. He was a slightly over weight asian man that had a real attitude. My experience at check-in was perfect, very nice lady. However, then I had to park and it was not clear where. I went by mistake to the valet lot and was yelled at by another valet. At this point I yelled back at him much to his surprise. Finally parked, went to room and to the bar to eat. The bartender was amazing. One of the best I have ever had at a hotel. A super guy and very knowledgable about the food and beers at the hotel. The room was very nice, clean and slept great in the comfortable bed. 5 stars if it wasn't for the two "tough guy" valets. Thanks!

title: Club lounge was a zoo.
comment: We stayed four nights . The location was convenient to subway lines into Manhattan and Brooklyn Heights. The Club Lounge only had one overworked and distressed lady to do the work of at least two. Last Monday, there was a shortage of food and drink due to 45 people who swarmed the room though not having appropriate lounge pprivileges. This is the busiest Belvoir club lounge I have visited. It needs more staff to handle the morning surge of guests. Also, it needs a better screening system, to keep out people who walk through the door with legitimate club lounge guests. No newspapers in this lounge too!

everyoneShouldKnow: Normally a very nice place to stay!
title: Disappointed on this visit.
comment: Although this hotel has normally received excellent reviews from me, my last visit was a disappointment. Because I have been a Platinum member for quite some time, and a rather frequent visitor to this hotel, I am always upgraded to a lovely suite. This time, however, not only did I not get a suite (which would have been OK on it's own), I was placed in a wheelchair accessible room, which was very awkward, (which also would have been OK, had I been advised as to why and beforehand at the front desk) and a first floor room- when I specifically ask for a higher floor room in my profile. I went back to the front desk to request an upgrade but was quickly told that none were available. It was as if I was lucky to get any room at all (even though I made the reservation over a month prior), but was offered no explanation. Access to the very nice Club Lounge was included. However, my one glass of wine was not. The computer in the lounge was down and after standing and waiting to be charged, the attendant finally gave up and said he would call me later to verify the exact amount, which he did. Good grief- a free glass of wine for the sub par room and inconvenience would have been nice, but it was not to be. I will return, as I'm almost positive that this was just a one off experience.

title: room
comment: We needed repairman 2 times in the evening. Toilet would not flush, TV not functioning properly, lights and radio not on correct outlets. Expected more concern from front desk when at checkout.

title: Overall a Nice Stay
comment: Overall, we had a nice stay at this Belvoir. They were able to offer us our early check-in that we requested, which was nice after a long drive. We were provided a room with a fridge but no bathtub. I figured this was what was available for early check-in...no complaints really even though a tub would have been nice after a long day at Disneyland. I feel as though we were recognized for being Gold BPG by getting the early check-in and room on the 6th floor w/ fridge.

title: Great staff, great location, great room
comment: Honestly, the title says it all. Everyone was very nice. Very helpful with directions and friendly all around. Beautiful view from the room and lobby of the hills. Very clean room with a comfortable bed.

everyoneShouldKnow: be prepare that front desk staff is not too friendly, at least it appears.
title: customer service needs improvement
comment: I found that the front desk staff needs some training on how to make guest stay a joyful experience, starting from simple smile when talking to guest to going distance to resolve guest issues.

title: This hotel has great customer service!
comment: Marie helped us with all of our reservation and exceeded our expectations!

everyoneShouldKnow: The service that always does everything in its power to exceeds one's expectattions.
title: Have Never Felt More Appreciated And Valued In A Hotel
comment: The Belvoir At The Falls has an excellent reputation over five other previous stays of valuing and appreciating repeat guests better than any other hotel that I have ever been to. Its Grandbourne Preferred Guest Level has beautifully furnished King Executive Suites with two television sets, microwave, rerigerator, a large walk-in closet, sofa, large desk robe, slippers, a vanity area, and so much more. Its BPG Lounge with Rick and Angelo provides the finest possible service and outstanding wines and cheese, crackers, nuts, friuits, and so much more. The Guest Services Staff anticipates one's needs from having a copy of the Buffalo News reserved for you, to simply taking the time to listen to the guest no matter how busy the hotel is. Thanks to Kate, Melissa, Diane, Eamon, and the entire team. The Jade Room at Breakfast has very nice food,but servers like Laura, Wendi, Alanna, and Michelle anticipate my needs and are ready to serve me at 6 a.m. TGI Friday's also features many wonderful servers like Debbie, Jennifer, Amy, and great managers like Dan and Sue. Geoffrey and Monica are Sales/Marketing leaders of excellence that have done so much to enhance my stays. Stephanie, Natalie, and Pamela support the managers very well and are always available to help the guests. Belvoir At The Falls is a most special hotel with a staff and management that does everything in its power for one to have a memorable stay. Please come to Belvoir At The Falls and see how much a hotel staff can care and exceed one's expectations. It is my opinion that one will not find a more dedicated staff, even in the Housekeeping and Engineering areas, than this one. It truly is a joy to stay at Belvoir At The Falls!

title: Excelente hotel
comment: Estivemos no Hotel de 02/10/2012 at頱1/10/2012, adoramos o local, o conforto, muito pr󸩭o da disney e dos outlets. Muito seguro, limpo e bonito. Ficamos em um apto de um quarto, eu, meu marido e meu filho, tinha um sof᭣ama bem razoᶥl para meu filho. A cozinha completa facilitou o caf頤a manh㠥 a janta ap󳠵m dia cansativo nos parques. Muito bom, recomendo.

title: Dallas stay
comment: Great hotel and accomodations.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is excellent. The location just right.
title: Wonderful facility
comment: Each time we stay is better than the last.

guestFrom: Woodland Hills, Los Angeles, CA, USA
title: Unexpected Gem
comment: I was pleasantly surprised by the rooms and pools. Resort is south of Kona and you need a car to explore the island. Good value for the money.

title: Good location
comment: The only issue I had was a miscommunication in regards to our late check out as a BPG member.Housekeeping wanted us out to clean the room and even had a supervisor tell us it was time to check out. The 3:00 check out was in the computer.

title: Great Stay!
comment: Smoke Free, Pet Friendly are must haves for us! We really enjoyed this Belvoir's location. Staff members Ashley and Eric were so helpful, pleasant, and knowledgeable. The food in Moniker's restaurant was excellent. However, I would have preferred not eating dinner in the bar area with televisions etc. I was told the dining room was for breakfast. I think a small portion of the dining area could be open for dinner if a guest preferred it. As always the Belvoir beds, bedding, and pillows were super comfy. Marco Polo appreciated the ample grassy area around the hotel for his comfort ^^-/ The room was clean and well stocked. Thanks all!

everyoneShouldKnow: It is just enough of everything. location is perfect and if you want to just stay in, that is great also.
title: Belvoir Stamford, CT.
comment: The staff was great and patient and I am probably considered not an easy guest.

title: Close to airport
comment: Good hotel if you need to be close to the airport. My room was on the 14th floor. The hotel has two elevators. Only one was working so there was a long wait to get from my floor to the lobby and vise versa. There was also a noise coming from the AC vent. The front desk clerk sent someone from engineering to assess the situation. The guy told me it's a water circulation issue he made an adjustment in the bathroom and the noise stopped.

title: Strange...
comment: My husband and I are frequent guests at Belvoir Hotels, so we had certain expectations for this one. We were shocked to see that the price for valet parking was $22 per night, especially since they would park your car in the very same parking deck where we ended up parking for free. The room was adorable, as was the whole hotel. After being away all day we came back to our room to find that it had been cleaned, but we had no towels. We had to call the front desk twice to get all the towels and washcloths we needed. We went to the Main Street restaurant expecting some kind of Southern Comfort menu, since that was advertised in their elevators. We were not expecting to find the crazy, loud bar or a 30-minute wait for an appetizer (that wasn't very good). The food overall was a disappointment. The next morning we went to the club level to eat the breakfast for Gold Members (which is routine at all Belvoir's and the front desk had specifically told us was going to happen) only to find the room empty and no food in sight. When we asked about it, all we were told was that we were not the first to complain about it that day. We had to get home, so we couldn't stick around to find out if breakfast ever happened that day.

title: Belvoir Experience Was Wonderful!!
comment: The Belvoir staff was outstanding!! A special recognition to Ms Hannah in the restaurant! She went over and beyond to made sure we were satisfied with our service and meal.

title: Very Nice Hotel
comment: We stayed 4 nights in October of 2011. Our room was clean, quiet, nicely decorated, and the bed was SUPER comfortable! The staff was friendly and very willing to help in any way needed. Not the fanciest part of town, but it is easy to get to and is pretty convenient to the airport. Close to several good places to eat, also. We will stay again when we come back to Phoenix.

title: Wonderful trip
comment: Stayed for two nights, hotel was great. Staff were all very helpful and pleasant.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel does not have a spa. Also, upgrade to rooms in buildings near beach and pool.
title: A bit deceiving from online site...however, great location
comment: They advertise recently renovated, however, they fail to mention that there are many buildings within the Belvoir Kauai and not all have been renovated and if they have, I'm sure they spent more money on the main building which houses the pool, restaurants/bar. If your in the other buildings it's as if you're an outcast with your own pool that has no food or beverage options. They also advertise the Rainforest Spa. The spa doesn't exist. I found this out after the front desk sent me looking for the "spa" in my building and after searching around I asked the Salon staff and found out the spa was actually in a hotel room - the one below my room. The pillows were flat and uncomfortable and the bathroom was extremely dim. The shower also had no water pressure (an issue I heard among many guests). We also were put in a room that had no towels and were told it would be a few hours to get them (another issue shared among guests) In the rooms we had no cell service and terrible wifi. Most of the time you loose connection. As far as food - in the book of guest services it states that breakfast is from 7:30-10:30am (pretty early considering the times of all other hotels) - found out the hard way that they changed their hours to 7:30am-9:30am - even worse and we missed breakfast. When we finally made it to Rum Fire for breakfast the next day it was a good 15 minutes before we were asked what we would like to drink...another 15 minutes before we got our coffee and juice. And, much later before we got our food. Needless to say, we did not go there for dinner due to terrible service. Luckily, we found The Shops at Kukui ula and stumbled upon amazing food places for a quarter of the prices at the Belvoir. The location of the actual main pool on the beach was beautiful. Due to the lack of amenities (spa, room service -which doesn't serve breakfast fyi) I would not stay there again. We were on our honeymoon and expected to relax in a spa, not have to rush out for breakfast and were very disappointed.

title: Great location
comment: Fantastic location, but it was still under construction....

everyoneShouldKnow: Be assertive in converting $5 cards for green program to BPG points.
title: This hotel is comfortable.
comment: The room was clean and nice overall. Bed comfortable, nice gym, great complimentary breakfast. Refrigerator nice but no microwave in rooms. Not enought plug ins in rooms and no fan in bathroom which was weird. The green program was not explained very well as far as turning in the $5back cards for points. You have to remind them to give you points. We forgot to turn in some cards at check out as we stayed 6 nights. Also some confusion with having two reservations combined because of using points one of the nights.

title: Nickeled and dimed
comment: A very nice hotel experience. Nice staff, nice room, clean.

title: this hotel is in a wonderful location
comment: aside from this property being in a gorgeous location, the facility is beautiful and well maintained. The staff was one of the friendliest i have ever encountered.

everyoneShouldKnow: Manta Ray viewing from the hotel's free, safe, and attractive manta ray viewing platform
title: Hotel is "Plat-friendly
comment: We enjoyed our stay and feel that the hotel appreciated and recognized our BPG Platinum status. Nice room upgrade. Staff were great. Manta Ray viewing platform a real plus. Pools were warm and large with a nice water slide. Good food at Ray's on the Bay, the Holua poolside restaurant, and the Kai breakfast buffet.. Beautiful grounds and quiet location. Much closer to the Volcano than Waikoloa resorts. No beach at the hotel but we do not require one.

title: Nice hotel that was Plat-Friendly
comment: Though not in Old San Juan, you can easily get there for cheap by taking the bus that stops right in front of the hotel, though can be infrequent. Food at Choices restaurant was good. Food in Club Lounge was good. Staff were attentive, friendly, and helpful. It seemed everyone we met in San Juan wanted to help the tourists, from airport staff to hotel staff to public transportation staff to tourist office staff. Pool was warm and has nice view of Old San Juan. Location is a bit remote but with a car or using the bus you are OK. Received upgrade to a suite. Casino is non-smoking which is a huge plus.

everyoneShouldKnow: lovely Hawaiian experience with plush amenities.
title: the Belvoir was a luxurious experience...
comment: as kama'aina of kauai, it was our first experience staying in this amazing resort.

title: Sharaton Brooklyn
comment: No hot water. Food was not good quality. Stafff was pleasent, but not well trained. Overall, the worst BPG experience I have ever had. This property is not up to BPG standards.

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel is very beautiful situatet and offers a superior standard of comfort.
title: This hotel has great features
comment: Beautiful and clean romms.

title: Loud and Bad parking experience
comment: I stayed in a third floor room over the A/C units for the lower part of the building, the room was very loud at all times. Each time I left the parking garage I would pull up to the card reader to re-enter, only to back out, return to the front a request another room key to open the gate to ender the garage. I had to do this several times along with waiting in long lines to re-enter the garage due to the same issues with many other room keys.

title: Could be so much better than average
comment: Overall, I rate this an average Belvoir.

everyoneShouldKnow: Check to see whats offered when making Res
title: Not enough info
comment: I was not totaly info by the front desk on what my Wife and I had expected for the 10 Floor until the morning we where checking out. It was disapointing to find out these things were available after or on about checkout time. Would Recommend but info He/She on the Goodys

everyoneShouldKnow: Quiet and clean. Great common room for BPG members and decent food offerings.
title: Nice and quiet hotel
comment: Hotel service was very good especially for BPG members. Room was clean and quiet. We found the Cost of a room was a little high given that the room was basic and the hotel is is next to the highway.New windows needed. But otherwise we found this to be a good hotel and did not have one negative experience. The breakfast room for BPG members is a great idea. Very comfortable room and good selection of food items.

everyoneShouldKnow: It needs a lot of updating and cleaning.
title: Dated and in need of many repairs
comment: The lobby made a good impression. Unfortunately, good impressions ended there. The restaurant decor was cheap, old, and the chairs were all covered with stains. The food, however, was ok. Although the hotel is now all non-smoking, my room smelled so bad I had to request a different one. Carpets in the halls, elevators, etc were very worn and the elevators were not all working. This was a budget hotel, but with a premium price!

title: Good Choice
comment: Clean and comfortable. The kitchen needs to work on the menu

title: Nice stay
comment: The staff was great, the room was clean, the food in the lounge was good. It was very quiet.

title: Inadequate room.
comment: The room I stayed in was very clean, the bathroom was adequate and the facilities were good, but the elevator noise (beeping) was loud in my room everytime the elevator came tot he floor I was on. The other thing was the room was too small for a king bed with the desk at the foot of the bed. I could hardly walk between the bed and the desk and when I used the chair in the desk everytime I turned the chair was bumping the bed and kept pinching my hands on the arm rest when i stood up because the chair was still under the table. Kinda dissappointing.

title: great location
comment: Recently was in Phoenix for a conference and the hotel is located just a block and a half walk from the convention. The bed was so comfortable I didnt want to get up. The staff was very helpful .

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel is a good hotel but it is definitely showing its age.
title: Good hotel but showing its age
comment: The accommodations were good; however, the hotel in general is beginning to show its age--specifically the room hallways had carpeting with multiple ripples from high use and some corners were damaged from luggage traffic. Additionally, food prices were a bit exorbitant even by Disney's standards when compared to the quality of product.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location and views of the city.
title: Aside from the great location and view, just OK
comment: BPG.COM messed up our reservation and it took over 30 minutes and a second reservation to get in our room. The staff was as friendly and helpful as they could be, especially Elizabeth and Joseph, but we had an engagement we were late for due to the reservation problem. The room itself had beautiful furnishings, but the bathroom and front door showed signs of wear and tear and age and lack of proper maintenance.

everyoneShouldKnow: Extremely friendly and devoted to guest comfort.
title: Above and beyond
comment: The managment and staff were wonderful. Always cheerful, helpful and informative. Although we were a large group, I felt I received individual attention form every person at this hotel. Truely an enjoyable stay. Thank you all so very much!

title: Picabu
comment: needs to have someone to assist with gluten free food

title: Nice place to stay in NYC
comment: Quick car valet and fast check in. Efficient and friendly staff to meet your needs. Elevators very fast and never a wait. Very comfortable bed and pillows. Great location for walking to theater, Lincoln Center, Moma and 5th ave. Enjoyed our stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great food. The Club lounge was excellent!
title: Great service, location
comment: We really enjoyed our stay. We only planned on staying one night but after we checked into the "other" hotel we started missing the accomodations. One phone call to BPG allowed us to check out of the "other" hotel and return to the Pentagon City Belvoir. Once the rennovations are complete, this hotel will be the place to be when you visit DC!! We are already looking forward to our next visit to the DC area! Also, the front desk staff was excellent. One young lady in particular (Venus, I think) was just wonderful!

everyoneShouldKnow: Availability is a sore point, even for loyal guests.
title: Great, but reservations are a sore point
comment: This hotel is really a great hotel. No issues there. Rooms are well appointed, club level and club room are as good as can be. The staff are very courteous.

title: Average
comment: Need a microwave and fridge in the rooms. Also, easy to hear loud noises from the outside. WiFi should be free with the rate we're paying. Liked the $5 voucher for not having room service. Furniture, bed and bathrooms were very nice quality. Fitness center was very nice too.

title: Heart O' the City
comment: I found that the Belvoir was a very good hotel with a great location. The main reason why I chose to stay there was the location. Natalie, the Concierge, was excellent in recommending restaurants or places to go and visit, helping with the logistical end of the trip. Yasim, the Valet, was very helpful when I parked the car in the garage. We valeted the car but the car was not parked in the garage. I asked him why not, he said I was a VIP. But I would like my car garaged, that is what I paid for. I asked him to take it off my bill, since it wasn't being garaged. And he did. It meant a lot to me for him to do that.

everyoneShouldKnow: the hotel staff was very accomodating
title: Great with one exception
comment: My only problem was the shower did not really sustain the hot water and the water pressure was low.

title: Stayed week of 10/8/2012
comment: The bed was super comfortable! The Hot Tub/Spa was boarded up probably never to be fixed. No sanatizer in the workout room for wiping down the machines. The heat/ac control has no control over room temp. Didn't matter if it was set to 60 or 85- same air came out. A grand old hotel though. I'd still stay again. No free breakfast. No fridge in the rooms. Starbucks was good though.

title: Huge Cancellation Fee for Duplicate Reservation!!
comment: I can understand charging a cancellation fee if you decide not to stay at a hotel and leave the room unreserved, but when I cancelled a duplicate reservation because after I initially called and was able to get only conference rate, our secretary called and got a lower government rate for the same room, I was charged almost $300.00 for a cancellation fee! This even though I still had a reservation and stayed not one, but 6 nights! I've never been treated like that at this hotel in all the years I've stayed there, and you can be sure that not only will I never stay again, but I will recommend the conference be held at another hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: its worth the money but the rooms are small
title: Cool Place
comment: The hotel really maximizes it sapce to give you the best overall quality hotel experience. The room was clean, comfortable, and well furnished. Its also well within walking distance from everything that you need.

title: Soooo Clean!!!!
comment: The room was beautiful....so cery clean...I was in 419 for 4 days and was very pleased. During the conference...the food was really great. The staff were very friendly and accomodating.....so very nice.

title: Wonderful place to stay
comment: The staff was very helpful and I was provided with a beautiful view of the ocean. I could not have have asked for better customer service.

title: People make the difference
comment: After a difficult conversation with IT rep via phone, I found hotel staff - especially JAIME, to be especially helpful and a wonderful problem solver in getting my issues resolved. She saved the day! And hats off to Thomas too, who figured out why my bill was incorrect and made the adjustments. Much appreciated!!

title: Elevators
comment: I was disappointed with the elevator situation. Many under repair which caused undue delays in handling the crowd attending the convention. Extremely inconvenient!

everyoneShouldKnow: not really a Belvoir level hotel
title: Getting long in the tooth
comment: Hotel is nice but mostly for location. The decor is getting long in the tooth -- carpet is old, bathrooms motelish (tub liners, poor lighting, white tiles), bar is ok but loud, restaurant food tastes premade. Gym was disappointing. service is good but overshadowed by the need to update the hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: how nice and accomdoating the staff is
title: staff
comment: My recent stay at your hotel was with an elderly man who I was accompanying. He had an unfortuante accident in the bathroom which required more than the usual cleaning of the bathroom. Your staff was absolutely understanding and wonderful in accomodating us with cleaning and disinfecting the bathrooms. Thank you. The way this was handled with this older gentleman was so respectful and full of dignity that he even commented to me about their presentation. thank you.

title: Great stay!
comment: We stayed at the Dolphin during a conference that was held in the Dolphin. The room was a wonderful sanctuary to go back to after a long day. I loved that we received free water bottles every day. The beds were always clean, made, and comfortable. Plus, the hotel is so close to all of the wonderful Disney attractions.

everyoneShouldKnow: Spa and Pool was world class. Restaurant and bars were above average.
title: Belvoir Dallas World Class
comment: Great place for ameeting or vacation. Rates were very competitive

everyoneShouldKnow: The renovations are tremendous very well thought out
title: Great Property
comment: The new renovations were well thought out and very comfortable to to stay at the property

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location and white sandy beaches
title: Great Stay At Sand Key Resort
comment: Hotel was exceptional with great service.

title: two week stay at hotel
comment: I had several issues that I called the front desk about including the fact that one of the dresser drawers didn't close properly and that I couldn't put anything in that drawer because then it wouldn't stay shut. The staff addressed everything but that issue. I probably should have kept complaining and asked for a different room, but was too tired to pack all my stuff up and move.

title: Room Cleanliness
comment: There were spider webs in my room, the room was dusty. The maintenance people did not clean my bathroom, they only put out new towels.

title: Nothing Special
comment: There was nothing special about this hotel.

title: The bar area
comment: The bar was full of people. Totally understaffed. Tired, thirsty and waited and waited. My second beer was comped.

title: Great staff
comment: Staff was very helpful at the front desk. hotel met my needs for a quick one-night stay.

title: This resort has great features but is overpriced
comment: There is no need for a lunch to cost $15 per person, when individuals are traveling on business and our conference is taking place in your resort. To avail a reasonably priced meal, one has to take the shuttle bus and travel to downtown Disney, which is absurd!

title: No hot water!
comment: Major fail. no hot water.

title: Pricey
comment: Overall my stay was satisfactory, however, the rates of the room did not meet my expectations of complimentary services. The room service menu was outrageoously pricey and without much selection. Overall, I expected more for my money.

everyoneShouldKnow: USe the Shuttle-Drivers are knowlegable and quick; Very convenient
title: Staff is OUTSTANDING
comment: Everyone welcomed me and my family, and were able to mention some of the features of the hotel. Staff was prompt and super freindly with our reqeusts.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff should not come into a room without knocking first.
title: poor experience
comment: When I got to my room, housekeeping came in WITHOUT knocking. I was in the bathroom and yelled..."who is there". She said, "you got in the room too quick". I expressed my concern that she came in without knocking. I also told the front desk about it and asked for a manager to follow up with me and I was never contaced. Also the bathroom was not clean and the hallway carpets were nasty. Looked like they had not been cleaned in days.

title: Nice hotel
comment: Stayed for 2 nights in town for NFL game...great location, clean and tidy rooms, great staff and service. Do be prepared for the parking fees either valet or self which are not included in the room rates. I used BPG points for our stay and would highly recommend this hotel for anyone wanting to stay in downtown Nashville for any reason.

title: Very helpful staff.
comment: From the time I checked in until the time I checked out, the staff could not have been more professional, accommodating and helpful. Checking in and out was very easy and fast. I appreciate that my time was important to the staff and that they made sure that I had what I needed and was satisfied with the services and accommodations.

title: Conference Stay
comment: It was a great place to stay while at a conference. The location was great. The rate that was given was a good rate. And, the hotel's use for the conference meetings was exceptional.

title: always enjoy my stay!
comment: I have stayed here several times on business and have always found this Belvoir, clean, comfortable and very accommodating. The decor is tasteful and the restaurant is great!

everyoneShouldKnow: Do Not Expect Prompt service in the lounge.
title: Cocktail Lounge a Disaster !
comment: You shouldn't have to wait 20 minutes for a server to take your drink order , particularly while sitting AT THE BAR. But when the Bartender is working the room taking food orders & delivering food, there just isn't time to fool with customers at the bar. Guess a waitress could do that stuff, if only the had ONE ! And this situation wasn't just one evening, but three in-a-row during my stay. Complaints to the GM, caused "Food Service Mgr." to wake-up long enough to get me a drink. Pathetic !

title: bed
comment: the bed was very comfortable

everyoneShouldKnow: It is very clean and convenient to Barclay's Center.
title: Convenient and Clean
comment: The hotel was fine, but there was a problem in having no hot water the entire time we were there. This has happened before so this is an ongoing problem. They did not attempt to adjust our bill, nor offer an apology upon check out. Hotel is very clean and convenient to the Barclay's Center. The staff is good but the lack of hot water is not fun!

everyoneShouldKnow: About a 10 min walk to ocean
title: Nice rooms, well maintained
comment: Good hotel fairly central in Santa Monica. Rooms were nice with OK views. Great, friendly staff. Good bar/lounge area. Only negative is wish it were a few blocks closer to the beach, it's a little bit of a walk to the Pier or other areas, not bad, but wish it was a bit closer.

everyoneShouldKnow: They beds are great and the staff is nice and friendly.
title: Enjoyed the upgrade
comment: Just wanted to say thank you for the upgrade since you didn't have a king room available I was able to be placed on the 5th floor with club status. It was the first time I have ever recieved this type of upgrade and it was greatly appreciated.....

title: Excellent stay
comment: I stayed in a king suite while in Orlando on business, and it was a great experience. The staff was very helpful, the rooms were very spacious, and the location was accessible to the airport.

title: This Hotel has great features
comment: Have returned to this hotel many times and it has always met my expectations.

title: Great Staff
comment: I've stayed here a couple times and stayed at comparable Grandbourne hotels in NYC and the Tribeca Belvoir does a great job with service. They just seem genuine about treating you like a person/guest rather than a number. It's also a bit smaller so you feel a bit of relief from the swarms of people at larger hotels or certain areas of the city. I think this also makes a difference in the perceived stress level of the staff. They seem to be less annoyed and more welcoming than other hotels. The rooms are comfortable and serviceable. The showers are walk-in - which I prefer rather than stepping over a bath tub and they are a little bit roomier. I will definitely stay here again and would recommend it to others.

everyoneShouldKnow: There is so much to do on the grounds of the hotel.
title: Great amenities.
comment: You could spend days just enjoying the what the hotel offers without leaving the grounds.

everyoneShouldKnow: Your rooms are very clean and your staff is always warm and friendly. That is really important to me.
title: Great staff, comfortable rooms
comment: All around good experience. Staff was friendly, including room service and restaurant staff. A very pleasant experience, comfortable beds, quiet rooms. Would definitely stay here again.

title: This Hotel has great features
comment: A swarm of termites interrupted on night of my stay. Very annoying. Otherwise "Perfecto"!

title: Horror Before The Wedding
comment: Well this started off as a great place to entertain friends and family, but as the title says The Horror Before The Wedding.

title: Great Stay
comment: They stay was great, however, on my last day, while using my towel and hand towel I noticed, some unappealing yellow stains on my towels.

title: Overwhelmed hotel
comment: Arrived on a Friday night for a weekend stay using points. First assigned room smelled like cleaned up vomit. Apparently that was the last room with a queen/king bed. Switched to a room with two beds (and offered 1K BPG points as compensation). However, was not satisfied with the quality of the room and the amount of noise. Through BPG customer service, asked to be released from our reservation the following morning and moved to another BPG property in the area. To their credit, the property granted our request.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't tell anyone how convenient it is to everything or there won't be a room for us next year!
title: # days at Belvoir AC Convention Ctr
comment: Being a BPG has its perks, but we miss the massage chair on the top floor. Rooms are excellent (but we could use more coffee packets to stay awake during the conference). Comforters are getting lumpy and heavy but love the beds and pillows. Lighting is good and mirrors are good. We come back every year. One more suggestion: could you vary the breakfast fare on the 16th floor? Thank you.

title: Great Augusta hotel with superb staff
comment: Stayed a couple of times recently & could not fault at all. Quiet location & rooms but excellent staff throughout. We were working late so ate in the hotel & loved it all. Worth having a meal just to meet the great people serving!

title: Great hotel, but room noise is unbearable
comment: Really impressed by the large gym, customer service, and overall facilities. However, it looks like the hotel didn't upgrade the plumbing during their recent upgrades...I could not sleep in the morning since whenever the person upstairs or next to my room turned on the shower there was a LOUD noise in my room.

title: Disappointed
comment: I have stayed at the Belvoir in AC prior to this visit. I was in town for a convention and despite being able to get a room for a cheaper rate at one of the casino's I chose the Belvoir because of the good experiences I have had there before. I checked in without a problem. I went up to my room and as soon as I opened the door I saw that the 2nd double bed had not been made. It actually looked as if that part of the room was ransacked. The fitted sheet was half off the bed and the pillows were all ove r the floor and chair.That was phone call #1 to guest servics. Phone call #2 came after realizing that the sink was clogged. There is no way housekeeping could have cleaned it and left it that way. Very disappointed. I also noticed that there was visible dirt on the floor and it did not appear to have been vacuumed. I didn't even bother to call about the floor . It was late and I wanted to get dinner and go to bed. I just made sure to kep my feet covered. The issues were addressed but Overall I was very surprised with all of these negatives. Questioning whether or not I would ever stay here again.

title: ACL Weekend
comment: I went to Austin for ACL weekend. When I checked in Thursday night, the concierge didn't recognize my BPG status of being Platnium. It was almost like I felt it was a bother to even speak to the gentlemen at the front desk. He didn't offer me the Plat. welcome gift or offer to participate in the make it green choice (as the other BPG hotels do). The one thing that I dislike about BPG is how some hotels 'claim' to be a franchise and do NOT participate in most promotions.

title: Still nice, but club level not what it used to be
comment: I've been staying in this hotel once or twice a year for about 8 years. It's clean, comfortable, and convenient to where I need to be.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's beautiful, clean and has a wonderful feel to it.
title: Great Experience
comment: Great location, wonderful staff and a very nice hotel. Clean, spacious and convenient.

title: AUB Pageant Stay
comment: We love this hotel but there were some problems at check in as well as when we checked out we got charged twice for the room. We also asked for a room near they elevator because I had surgery and cannot walk far but the only connecting rooms they had were at the very end of the hall. We probably come to this hotel once every month or two and stay for 1-3 nights. This was the first time we had this problem and I'm hoping it doesnt happen again.

title: Great hotel
comment: The Belvoir in downtown Dallas is better than home away from home. Superb facility!

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice location and close to Epcot.
title: Vegetarian Food
comment: My only issue is that the hotel lacks a decent vegetarian restaurant. The one restaurant does not have enough vegetarian dishes.

title: Overnight stay
comment: The hotel is well located. The room was very comfortable. I used the fitness center and was amazed at the number of different machines that were in the room.

title: Thank you to the staff
comment: I wanted to write this review specifically because of the assistance I received from our waitress Amanda who was working in the Lobby Lounge the evening of October the 10th, 2012. My business partner and I were looking for a great steakhouse to eat at. We asked for her opinion, as both of us have never visited Philadelphia before. She not only gave us recommendations but also made reservations for us and told us that transportation was available right outside at the bell hop stand. She went above and beyond her call of duty. Thanks very much.

title: Beautiful hotel
comment: Was a beautiful resort and a great way to start our vacation

title: roome setup was great, convenient location
comment: I enjoyed having the "living room" area and the frig/microwave. I also really liked being able to use the "green" method for housekeeping - declining fresh towels, etc as I wanted. Very close to the hospital - reason for my visit.

title: NIEHS
comment: meet all my needs, keeep up the good work

title: The hotel has great features
comment: The hotel had great features and the staff were very polite and helpful. The only problem I saw was the bathroom area. There were some rust stains in the bathtub area that did not look appealing so I didn't feel comfortable taking a shower there.

title: Great location
comment: Hotel is located very well, and you can get transportation to any park within Walt Disney World, no need to bring a car and if you do, no need to move it around, just leave it there.

title: NO HOT WATER!
comment: We were only there one night for the Barbra Streisand concert. Would have loved to shower before concert but had no hot water. Then had driver pick us up at 6:30 A.M. next morning to head back to airport to catch flight and still no hot water. Could not shower or wash hair, good thing I was there for recreation. It would have been a nightmare if we were there for business!

everyoneShouldKnow: Take time to tour the grounds in the morning and at night- It is so peaceful and relaxing!
title: Beautiful Property -The Perfect Escape
comment: I was so excited to arrive on the Big Island. I have stayed at many properties and this one i at the Top of my list. It is great family fun and quiet and peaceful all in one. The pools are beautiful and the location is perfect. The room and decor was stunning it was a true Island experience!!!!!!! The staff at all outlet were so kind and gracious from the moment of arrival valet, bellman front office and the restaurants! Thank you for making my anniversary so memorable!

title: Great Hotel
comment: The location of the hotel was excellent for the conference I was at. The rooms were not far from the conference rooms and it was close to fun things for the evenings. I will say the Dolphin seemed more "Adult" which was not bad for me as I had no children or family to worry about but just to note... however I was there during the week which may have made the difference. The one thing that was a little bit of a bummer was between the Swan and Dolphin they only had a total of 3 or 4 resturants open for lunch. Could be different on weekends. Overall though good experience.

title: This hotel is modern but needs improvements
comment: Modern, bit needs improvements.

title: excellent hotel
comment: i loved how close this was to everyhting. our stay was excellent!!!!

title: Clean, enjoyable, best for weekday business travel
comment: I actually attempted to pay more to avoid staying here because the negative reviews posted here, but could find no availability. So my wife & I celebrated our first anniversary here, and thoroughly enjoyed our experience. The facilities are nice, our room was clean & had a decent view, the staff was friendly & helpful, and the bed was PHENOMENAL!

everyoneShouldKnow: Most of the booklets, instructions, menus are in Japanese. On several occasions we asked for items in the English version.
title: Worst Grandbourne Hotel
comment: This is undeniably the worst Belvoir we've ever stayed at. It did not meet our expectations. The service was poor, the staff was unfriendly and not accommodating in any way. We have been Grandbourne members for 9 years and the overall experience at this location does not meet the Grandbourne standard. There was construction on our floor at 1:00am and delivery trucks at 4:00am with very loud alarms. Our children (8 and 5) required to wear water wings on waterslide because they could not touch the bottom (4'10") even though they both swim competitively and they charged our room for the wings. Our elderly parents traveled with us and we requested a room close to elevators, luggage, and other things. When we asked for some assistance, we were told staff was too busy to help us. We spend a great of time traveling all around and are not difficult people to please, but the cost of the hotel does not match what you receive in terms of service! We will not return to this hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Negative: $22 daily self parking rate on dirt road (unacceptable).
title: Not that bad
comment: Received a decent upgrade as a BPG platinum member. The studio suite was ok, but the layout could of been a bit better. The club lounge was decent with excellent view on both sides. I just wish that the parking situation would be a lot better. Paid $22 to park on dirt road. And the standard policy of placing two set of towels should be adjusted. No bottle water in the "suite" which was a surprise.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is friendly and helpful. Room was very clean and well-furnished. After having visited the Mayo Clinic, it was a relaxing and comfortable place to be before beginning a homeward-bound journey via automobile.
title: Wonderful Experience
comment: All aspects of our stay were exceptional. Definitely recommend this hotel for service, accomodations, and dining.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't get double charged for parking.
title: Everything was great except parking.
comment: Everything was very nice about the hotel. The problem I ran into is they double charged me for parking, it was only 15$ so not that big of a deal. I just figured it would be nice to inform them and get the money back. I called left a message for the accountant, and never received a call back. I called again finally after 20 minutes I got a hold of her and she said it would be no problem, so i figured the case was closed. The money never got refunded onto my card and I'm still trying to call them back and unable to get a hold of them. Everything else was great though.

everyoneShouldKnow: Clean rooms, friendly staff, great location
title: Amazing Hotel!
comment: This hotel is excellent. I completely recommend staying here to anyone traveling in the Des Moines area for business or pleasure. Sara and Moe that work in the lounge upstairs are absolutely phenomal employees who care about the folks staying in the hotel. I will be back!

everyoneShouldKnow: Location and units are quite good but customer service can be improved to Grandbourne levels.
title: Customer Service Needs Improvement
comment: We agree completely with a previous reviewer who concluded this property's staff needs to run more like a Grandbourne Hotel for customer service and less like a time-share. We are BPG gold members and owners at Maui but chose to pay cash for a 5 night stay at Belvoir Broadway Plantation in Myrtle Beach. We booked an AARP nightly rate which included a $75 resort credit with a stay of four nights or more. At check in, we were given no paperwork...no confirmation of nightly rate, no mention of the resort credit and were required to get our parking pass from vacation services (aka timeshare sales appointments) before our room keys would be issued. We returned to the front desk after unloading our luggage (about an hour later )to confirm our nightly rate and inquire about the resort credit. We were informed there are no resort amenties toward which a resort credit could be used and offered a $50 gift card to a local restaurant. I opted to call BPG customer serice and was eventually contacted by the front desk manager who confirmed there were no resort amenities to use for a resort credit but again offered a $50 gift card to a local restaurant. Front desk manager finally agreed to provide us with a $75 gift card (we think to get rid of us) but did not seem particularly concerned that nightly rates, including a resort credit, continue to be posted on BPG.com.

everyoneShouldKnow: Parking may be challenging, but hotel is worth the effort.
title: In the City
comment: This hotel was a surprise as I've not traveled to this area before. Although it is an older hotel, it is pretty much updated and rooms were nice. Views were great of the city.

title: Beautiful view
comment: We spent two nights at the Belvoir National and enjoyed the experience. Beautiful view of the momuments from our window, timely and courteous van access, clean and crisp linens and delicious breakfast buffet with large variety.

everyoneShouldKnow: Ideal location if you plan on taking the Metro and walking around DC. Very poor WiFi connection. Parking is extra.
title: This location is ideal
comment: The hotel was located one block from the Crystal Springs MetroRail, ideal since I did not know we would be taking the rail over driving. Parking was not a hassel but the front of the hotel is not ideal for several people checking in with private vehicles. The Grandbourne member's room was less than expected. I was expecting more options for breakfast but the appetizers at dinner were quite nice. The room was average and I was expecting a larger bathroom but it was operable. WiFi was very poor for this hotel. Especially in such a connected city.

title: Wonderful staff!
comment: The staff here is very friendly. The facility is great for beach goers.

title: Wonderful
comment: The only problem had was with check in. Company we came for didn't tell 3pm was check in no earlier. Can back at 3pm. One customer service lady having problems and other one helping they found room wasn't clean another lady stepped in which is the on seen earlier that morning took care of the problem and bump the room up to unexcpected level.. Wished had her name but we didn't. Great Wonderful stay. THANKS SHERTON

everyoneShouldKnow: Competitively priced, quite clean and comfortable.
title: A Positive Experience
comment: My husband decided that he wanted us to have a weekend staycation and chose the Belvoir Suites Galleria-Atlanta ---it was a spectacular experience. The staff was welcoming and the location was ideal for the weekend. It is convientently located to the Cobb Energy Center, mall and restaurants.

title: This hotel has comfortable room.
comment: Very nice interior and the balcony is very big. I love the spacious atmosphere. Goes great with the surroundings. Excellent time!

everyoneShouldKnow: Their Customer Service is above and beyond.
title: They know how to make your day
comment: Above and beyond is all I can say. When they heard that our wedding anniversary was the weekend we were staying we recieved a very nice card and gift. It was very sweet of them.

title: Great stay
comment: Accommodated me & my dogs. We had a great stay!

title: Convenient
comment: Room was a nice size and staff was friendly but the linens needed replacement. Raised it to management and they said it will be addressed.

everyoneShouldKnow: Make sure you ask a lot of questions regarding fees and amenities before booking a room.
title: I was disappointed in the details
comment: I ordered a fridge ahead of time. It was not there upon arrival. The desk told me it would be delivered immediately. When I left for the day and returned it was still not in the room several hour later. I had to request it again

everyoneShouldKnow: It is definately worth staying at.
title: Great Stay
comment: I loved the fact that this hotel had an indoor/outdoor pool. It has a nice resturant, well worth the prices. I was a bit confused in not being able to find the "free" breakfast.

title: Slow checkin
comment: Hi. The location of this hotel is nice, and the rooms are comfortable. However, the check-in was extremely slow even for an Elite member.

title: So-So
comment: The staff were always polite; however, no BPG recognition given, nobody to explain parking (across the street after you drive two blocks and enter from the back and then have to pay). Breakfast starts at 7:30, which is unacceptable for business travelers. Billing was screwed up and took calling the Platiinum line to get it fixed after zero help from a direct call to the hotel.

title: Our 25th
comment: My wife and I spent our wedding night at your hotel and I booked our 25th anniversary night there to relive our original stay. I shared this information when I made the reservation. I never expected the "extra" special treatment we received. We were presented with a lovely gift of champagne (My wife's favorite brand, to boot) and a cheese and cracker tray from Kelly soon after we checked in. Our room was very nice and the staff was more than accommodating. Thank you very much for helping make our night memorable.

title: Good hotel near airport
comment: Reservation Manager I. Garcia was excellent. Everything was right on my reservation.

everyoneShouldKnow: very convient has everything a traveler needs, would suggest you could have food available after 12 midnight
title: Reunion stay
comment: I had my high school reunion at your hotel. The room was very comfortable, it had everything that I needed, Iron, in room coffee, (I need it as soon as I wake up) non intrusive staff. I went to 2 events put on by hotel staff and all were done very well. The restaurant had healthy food too boot. I used the pool and fitness center and again it had everything I needed including towels and showers.

everyoneShouldKnow: Large working space on main lobby level with a variety of small and large tables, couches, etc. - perfect for business travelers
title: Quiet, Comfortable - And Good Food!
comment: Stayed at this hotel one night for a meeting the following day. Was impressed by the large working space on the lower level - bar, comfy couches, tables, etc. - obviously designed with the business traveler in mind. Room was quiet (well insulated from external noise - which is a must as I'm a light sleeper). I ordered room service for dinner, which was surprisingly delicious, and had the breakfast buffet the following morning. (Try the omelet bar - very good!) All in all, a very good stay and I will stay again for my next business trip.

title: Great Customer Service
comment: I stayed there and I got married on the Aolani which is docked behind the Belvoir. I had a suite and it met all our expectations and after we married there was chocolate covered Strawberries and a bottle of Martinelli's as we don't drink alcohol and it was on ice. There was no problems checking in or out. The experience overall was excellent and I would recommend for anyone to stay ther. They have great views. I will deffinetly stay there again.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's conveniently located right off the highway and directly in front of the airport, but it's surprisingly quiet and relaxing within.
title: Not Bad but Not Great for Club Level Prefered Guests
comment: The car parking area was nearly full when we arrived but there did not appear to be that many guests checked into the hotel (not sure, everyone may have been hiding), which led us to believe the parking was also used for airport travelers not necessarily staying at the hotel. As for the actual stay, the hotel was clean except for a big spot on the ceiling that looked like water damage. The toilet was also loose at the base so it would move a little when using it; no leaks, thank goodness. We didn't hang around the hotel much but everything else seemed good to go. I guess I was just expecting a little more for the cost.

everyoneShouldKnow: getting to your room the first time can be a little confusing but if you have any sense of direction you'll be fine.
title: awesome views, great location
comment: I stayed on the club level floor. My room was huge and the view was amazing. The club lounge was also very nice, totally worth the upgrade. Had free drinks and snacks all day and night as well as hors 'derves and drinks in the evening and breakfast in the morning. The only thing I didn't like was the double beds in my room, they were just too small. Overall we had a great time here and would definitely come back.

title: Outstanding Hotel, Outstanding Service
comment: I just want to say it was a complete pleasure to stay in your hotel. The location was beautiful, the room very comfortable and staff was extremely helpful and informative.

title: Great Stay!
comment: Excellent hidden gem. Clean comfortable rooms, accomodating and friendly staff and great pool, courtyard and facilities.

title: Nice and Clean Hotel
comment: Our hotel stay was very nice. The room was clean and new. The staff was friendly. I was impressed with everything on our stay except for the parking issues and having to pay for wireless internet!

title: Great staff, great club lounge.
comment: Overall we had a great experience.

everyoneShouldKnow: Resort fee is applicable and the facilities are often over crowded
title: Belvoir Waikiki
comment: We were disappointed that when we arrived -it was late at night- the King size room on the Club floor we had been relegated to a twin bed room. The clerk was not helpful- no room at the inn etc, you can try tomorrow but dont waste your time etc was the response we received.

everyoneShouldKnow: The views are over the top!
title: Awesome!
comment: Taking the Guest Experience to a new level....nice work...staff were on task and always helpfuf!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Housekeeping did an awesome job at keeping the room clean and left us with extra coffee and creamers that we asked for.
title: Disappointed
comment: We had reservations to stay at the Bay View Tower but was told when we got there that they didnt have a room available for us. Transferred us over to the other hotel which I really wasn't happy with. It took them over 3 hours to get us a refrigerator and on our last night there we were woken up at 3:00 am by housekeeping bringing us another refrigerator 4 days later...People in the room below us were out on the balcony smoking pot all the time and we couldnt even go outside or keep the slider door open because of the smell.

title: Great staff
comment: Staff was wonderful...helpful, knowledgeable and friendly. Thank you so much.

title: Great location, but lots of room for improvement
comment: I reserved a king bed, but only two doubles were available when I checked in. I had a partial ocean view room, one of the older rooms apparently which was mediocre at best. The rooms are in need up updating, especially more electrical outlets.

title: This hotel is very convenient for my travel needs
comment: The facilities are sufficient for my business needs, staff are friendly and helpful, and room pricing is reasonable.

title: BEST TIME EVER
comment: We had the best 10 nights ever. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to a Kai Suite. 2 balconies, huge lounge room and loads of seating.

everyoneShouldKnow: You can walk to Epcot, but you are far enough away from the crowds!
title: Swan-Dolphin Food & Wine Fest
comment: My friend & I stayed @ the Hotel to attend the 3rd Annual Food & Wine Fest on the property. As in the past it was fantastic! The Hotel & grounds are always lovely & the Fest is so well organized & relaxing!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location if you're attending an event at Merriweather Post Pavilion.
title: Perfect location for attending nearby events
comment: I was able to book this room the night before an event at Merriweather Post Pavilion, having struck out previously and booking a hotel more than five miles farther away. Due to a last-minute cancellation, I was surprised and delighted that a room became available within a manageable walk from the venue. Aside from a one-legged (dead) cricket in the bathroom, the room was clean and well appointed. I've stayed there before and would stay there again!

title: Leisure
comment: I enjoyed my leisure stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Talk to the staff. They are some of the friendliest and helpful people you will ever meet!
title: Better than expected...
comment: Our stay at the Walt Disney World Dolphin Resort was better than we could have planned for. The staff was exemplarary, the entire facility was clean and well-maintained. Our needs were met immediately and, I have to say it again... the staff was amazing. They made certain we had everything we needed to make our stay as relaxing as possible.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Sherton staff made our wedding party feel very special during this wonderful celebration for our childrens wedding weekend!
title: Above and beyond service for our wedding weekend!
comment: Our daughter and her wedding party were treated like royality on their special weekend! The hotel was within walking distance of the venue's... and in the hub of the city for our out of town guest to enjoy everything our fair city has to offer!

title: owner daycare
comment: staff and hotel clerk wonderfull

title: Great location
comment: this hotel is conveniently located and has a great location for exploring Napa and Sonoma.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff is very friendly and eager to serve
title: This hotel has great staff
comment: I came in at the last minute. The staff worked with me and gave me group discounted rate even though I missed the reservation deadline.

everyoneShouldKnow: A very restful sleep at an easy to get to location with ample parking and fast, efficient staff service.
title: Overnighter in transit
comment: Excellent comfortable and clean bed linen made for a very restful overnight stay. Bathrooms are looking a little tired and would benefit from a modernisation programme but they were clean and functioned well.

title: Belvoir Clayton
comment: Exemplary service from all staff, from arrival to departure. Room was clean, well appointed, very comfortable (great pillows!!). Dinner at Alexander's, food was good, plentiful, reasonably priced, but service not quite up to par.

title: Great Stay!
comment: In town for a conference and hotel was in the perfect location, convenient to everything, great service, an excellent bar and staff downstairs and wonderfully attentive houskeeping. Awesome pool and views. Made my 4 nights very enjoyable.

title: a good night's sleep
comment: Traveling for kids sports requires flexibility, including late arrivals and early exits. The hotel was very accomodating to several teams and allowed the team to enjoy their few 'down' hours and still get a good night's sleep.

title: Not this one
comment: dried blood on pillow, broken metal doorstop on floor that I stepped on, called before booking room about ballon festival and was told to go to site and book and information, cost much more that if I had booked thru you.

everyoneShouldKnow: Fantastic hotel and service but outside of downtown.
title: One of the best experiences ever at Belvoir
comment: From the moment i walked through the door I was treated as a valued BPG Gold member. The staff greeted me by name, offered me my welcome drink, and provided access to the Club lounge. One of the best customer service experiences in a long time.

everyoneShouldKnow: GREAT VIEW AND LOACTION IS FABULOUS
title: HOTEL HAS A FABULOUS VIEW
comment: i GREATLY ENJOYED MY STAY. THE STAFF ARE VERY COURTEOUS AND PROFESSIONAL. THE FITNESS ROOM WAS VERY GOOD AND POOL IS EXCELLENT ALTHOUGH I HAD A LIMITED TIME TO USE IT.

title: Kid friendly
comment: Although the hotel is a conference center and appropriate for business travelers, my grandchildren were welcomed. They loved the pool, and we felt comfortable in the facility.

title: First room assignment was horrible!
comment: The first room we were assigned to was horrible. They called it a "suite" but it looked like a large room half filled with old and worn out furniture - and worst of all the bed was on the floor!!! We requested to be moved and they relocated us to a "normal" room. Was very disappointed that they originally tried to stick us in a very subpar room, especially since other much nicer rooms were readily available.

title: Belvoir Sioux Falls
comment: Was the first time I had stayed there - was great except we could hear the bar noise until well into the night. Was disappointed in that. Otherwise great place to stay!

title: Very Comfortable
comment: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Denver Downtown Belvoir - very comfortable & great staff!

title: Service-Bar Tender
comment: On Friday evening (10/12), we had the most terrible experience with a bar tender (male hispanic?). He was rude and never checked on us (even though he walked past us and made drinks right in front of us several times while we were seated at the bar). His attitude made us quickly finish our drink so that we could be on our way. He was very bad for business

title: Beautiful Location
comment: This hotel offers beautiful views from many rooms.

title: Staff
comment: The staff was extremely helpful and always alert to see if they could be of help. The hotel was beautiful and the restaurant was excellent.

title: Facilities
comment: I had a great time at the Belvoir Long Island Hotel. Rooms were clean. Staff was courteous. I would like to comment on the exercise room. It would be nice if most hotels would commit to a work out /exercise facility as the Belvoir has. The only thing I would add is that it could use a Pull Up Bar and the machine was broke the whole week I was there. Maintenance would be nice. Also, the exercise room could have been cleaner. Otherwise a great hotel.

title: great location; bad amenities
comment: I can't believe the hotel charges $10.00 a day for Internet -- that seems ridiculous when much cheaper hotels inthe area provide free wireless. Also, we were there for a convention,a nd the food served was terrible -- tasteless and dry. I expect more from a Belvoir.

title: great hotel, near everything
comment: We thought the hotel staff was great, very attentive and friendly. The hotel was near to everything, so we really liked that. The only thing we had a problem with if at all, was the pool could have been alittle cleaner, it was kinda of "foggy" at times. But the pool was nice as far as privacy goes, with not worrying about people from the street looking in. It was in a private setting. The room was clean and beds were very comfortable. I would stay again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great hotel for a great value
title: Grat Stay
comment: Stayed for a Conference. Staff was excellent. Joe helped us out finding a place to eat and providing walking/driving directions. Smile was a welcomed surprise for a big city hotel.

title: Rooms
comment: Rooms were nice and confortable

title: Excellent Overall Experience
comment: From check in through check out, the customer service was superb. Friendly and attentive staff who were always helpful and willing to accomodate. The Pool and Beach were nice and the area was within walking distance to many restaurants and shops. Overall, our experience was excellent.

title: 5 star hotel for 3 star price
comment: the staff is superb, everyone of them.

everyoneShouldKnow: Be prepared to be treated in the best possible manor by the entire staff
title: this hotel offers great features
comment: My recent stay at the Belvoir Fort Lauderdal hotel will be remembered for a very long time. I was given the greatest treatment that a hotel can offer. Fast, friendly, heartfelt service from the entire staff. I would highly recommend this property to one and all for a memorable experience.

title: Loved my stay!
comment: Had a great time at a conference, such a beautiful town, and great guest service!

everyoneShouldKnow: No free wifi at your room. Only at the business area which sometimes are crowded.
title: Comfort bed and good staffs
comment: We stayed four nights at this hotel. If you have a car to drive around Chicago and don't care what around the hotel. This hotel is probably good for you. Otherwise, they provide a standard Belvoir bed and services. Korean airline staff also stay at this hotel from time to time.

title: Nice rooms!
comment: Very comfortable beds/pillows.

everyoneShouldKnow: If You Are Wearing Sweats When You Check In...Except Bum Treatment
title: Great Rooms, Unhelpful Front Desk
comment: My wife worked in Grandbourne's corporate office for years. Lucky for all she did not pick up the phone and call folks who are still there. Except for one person who was great (Narjah?), the front desk staff needs help. Not problem-solvers at all. I could go into details, but I'd get a head-ache (again). Let's just say their first impulse was always to say "no", even when I needed help getting on to the computer right after having turned in my key. Duh! Sadly, many other examples exist.

title: Only location?
comment: Excellent location, wonderful Food and Wine Classic.

title: framingham Belvoir
comment: Room was very clean and comfortable. Overall hotel looked like it needed some refurbishing as carpets in some areas were frayed and worn. Restaurant had a musty smell and did not appear that attention was being paid to cleanliness. REstaurant was overpriced and food very average.

everyoneShouldKnow: Request a room on the parking lot side or on higher floors
title: Great location, but...
comment: If you want quiet and uninterrupted sleep, request a room on the parking lot side or upper floors. This hotel is poorly designed and my room overlooked the lobby. Aside from missing sunlight and a view to the outside world, the bigger problem was the constant noise from chatter, or at times yelling (football), and music from the bar in the lobby. I had to call the front desk on two occasions, once at 12:30am. They should be aware of the volume of the lobby music - especially at that time of the night. The other nights I just dealt with it - I only called the nights where the noise kept me awake. Other than that, everything was fine. I choose Belvoir so I can count on a good night's sleep. This was an anomaly and if I return to this location, I will know what to ask for next time!

title: Hotel Staff
comment: I find the club level and staff very nice. It is nice to come back to this hotel and see fimilar faces. Sepical thanks to Emma and Jordan.

title: Always a great experience!
comment: This property really is the best choice for the NY metropolitan area. From their GM, Kevin to front desk personnel and housekeeping. Great club room, awesome restaurant and close proximity to the city. This property will not disappoint you.

everyoneShouldKnow: Attention to detail needs to be improved for such a newer hotel. will go downhill fast
title: Cleanliness went downhill
comment: We stayed in the Spring and it was great. 4 months later we stayed again. Carpets in the halls and rooms were very dirty. We did not take our shoes off it was so bad. The bathroom floor needed to be cleaned.

everyoneShouldKnow: Be prepared to go somewhere cleaner
title: Dirtiest Hotel Ever
comment: After our cruise, we stayed one night for our flight out. The exterior of the hotel was shabby, stained, missing logo letters, heavily rusted metal doors and an exterior light hanging by its wires. The room itself was very dirty with heavy dust on the dresser around the TV, lower body hairs were on the tub and bathroom floor, two huge stains in the carpet which was very dirty overall, the fabric pillows were dirty. The internet area in the lobby looks like it had not been vacuumed in weeks and the furniture was too dirty and dusty to sit in. I will not recommend this hotel nor will I stay there again,

title: Stay at Belvoir
comment: It was a nice Hotel. Staff was friendly, rooms were large and clean. Would return to stay again. Parking garage is very small and the the fee is $16 per night. They never seem to tell you that when you register online. That should be information provided.

everyoneShouldKnow: Book club lounge, beware of parking fee.
title: Enjoyed the club lounge
comment: Our check in process was not good. We arrived at 3pm, check in time, but had to wait over an hour until our room was ready. Even then it was not the room they were supposed to put us in but we were headed to a wedding and needed a room to get ready. They did waive the parking fee due to this, which was only fair. They should not be charging a parking fee anyway. We really enjoyed the club lounge for snacks and sodas in the evening and breakfast in the am. The gal who ran it in the am was the best. So helpful and friendly, she really made us feel welcome. Beside the check in process, we enjoyed our stay.

title: good location
comment: Hotel is convienant to many northside Atlanta areas. I have been staying here for 25 years periodically and always liked the location and rooms. The hotel is looking a little tired, could use new furniture and updated paint/pictures, etc.

everyoneShouldKnow: do the classes they are fun and explore as much of the island as you can!
title: Tail end of the perfect Honeymoon
comment: We loved this place very friendly staff and the perfect location! We had a seal show up every day that we were there, just hanging out on the beach!

everyoneShouldKnow: Beware of hidden fees not in the rate.
title: Hidden charges
comment: $14.00 per day resort fee for internet, 2 bottles of water (not chilled), and fitness center. Since its not an option, it should be in the daily room rate. $15.00 per day self parking is outrageous since no Disney hotel charges for parking. Bought wristbands for Food & Wine Classic. Lines way too long. Not enough food stands.

title: Great hotel, but a little noisy
comment: We only stayed for a night but I think we would stay again if the opportunity presents itself. This time we will ask for a room away from the elevator as that is all we heard all night. It's a bit noisy with kids but its next to Legoland so what else would you expect? Also, would have been nice to not have had to throw away the previously used soap... Tht shoud be the maids job...

title: HAPPILY SURPRISED
comment: not only was he room great but the food was most reasonable and delicious.

title: This hotel has excellent staff
comment: I was traveling with my granddaughter who has food allergies. I needed to have items microwaved. The restaurant manager was most accomodating. We were on the club floor and the hostess, Nancy actually took the food items to the kitchen. In addition she knocked on our door to let us know the fireworks were beginning and in the morning enquired about my granddaughter. Now that is service and personal attention!

everyoneShouldKnow: What ever you want, the Belvoir will have it.
title: A comfortable stay
comment: Our two short visits to the Belvoir were very enjoyable. The rooms were comfortable with all the usual amenities provided, tea/coffee, tv, internet etc.

title: Excellent Stay
comment: Recommended this hotel to a co-worker and he really enjoyed his stay. He said it was a great location and excellent room!! Also, front desk staff Janet and Lorena were great in assisting with reservations. Thanks !!

title: Ice Machine
comment: The only real problem that we had with the room is that there was no ice available to us for about 2 days. There was a boil alert that shut down the water for the ice machines and had to go to the CVS a couple blocks down to get ice which was inconvenient. Otherwise, everything else was great.

title: Great stay as usual
comment: I syat here 2 - 3 times a year. As expected it was a great stay

everyoneShouldKnow: tons of foreign visitors and pool chairs are lousy.
