title: hotel stay
comment: Hotel was nice, too crowded.

title: Enjoyed Stay
comment: Hotel ws comfortable and wonderful location/views. Would recommend eating outside hotel. Food was consistently poor.

everyoneShouldKnow: Pure rooms mean extra air purification system in room.
title: Very nice property that tries hard
comment: Quick overnight stay that had lots of little errors...though all were corrected when brought to the management attention. Definetly would stay again as it is a very nice property. Did NOT feel like an airport hotel.

title: I couldn't have been happier!!
comment: Clean, comfortable beds, excellent and professional staff. I left behind all my valuable jewelry (gold,diamonds,etc) on the nightstand when I checked out. When I got home 9 hours later, I realized I left it behind. Talk about honesty, the maid returned all my jewelry to the head of housekeeping, who then was able to return it to me. Outstanding service,.....just outstanding!!!!

title: Birthday Celebration
comment: We stayed here because of its location to a nearby restaurant where we were celebrating my fianc駳 birthday. Once guest services knew it was his birthday they brought us fresh cookies and a homemade card. They also stored our bike without a problem. A wonderfully relaxing stay with a celebratory twist.

title: Great Mattress
comment: I slept for nine hours straight. I haven't done that in my own bed in a year.

title: Beautifiul location,many ammenities
comment: Beatuiful hotel , lots of friendly service, great location.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location is excellent, the Hotel itself is very clean and the staff are great.
title: Really Great Hotel
comment: We have enjoyed staying at this hotel since 2003 & 2010 and again this year. We will definitely stay again in future trips. The Hotel Staff we very friendly and helpful and could not do enough for us. The Maid Service is outstanding and tried to very hard make our stay enjoyable. We would recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Great place to stay
comment: We loved staying here- we were with a large group of people and it was great to all be on the same floor.The only downside was that we were in the last room at the end of the hall.We heard the door slam amd vibrate every time someone went in or out.I would say that the door needs some sort of mechanism that would let it close slowly instead of slammimg shut.It was quite annoying.

title: Great meeting space
comment: I enjoyed my stay at Belvoir Stamford. I stayed at the hotel for business and had meetings in the hotel meeting rooms. The space was functional and met our needs.

everyoneShouldKnow: Stay in a room above the lobby floor! Hopefully won't have the drainage or bed issues.
title: This visit to the Dolphin was way below previous experience!
comment: The room didn't have a fridge, but was immediately provided one. However, the fridge did not work well at all. The beds were not the heavenly bed we had on our last visit. Very uncomfortable beds. The drainage of the sink and tub were horrible. Don't stay on the lobby floor. The view out our window was awesome for the lobby floor. Cleaning of the room was not the greatest. It appeared someone had gone through some of our things while we were out. Our 1st visit a few years back was extraordinary, but this visit with the hotel left a lot to be desired for the price we paid!!

title: What's with the towels??
comment: a great location. my wife and 2 kids enjoyed the 3 nights prior to our cruise and the 4 nights when we returned after, however there are a couple of points i feel i need to mention in the interest of providing service feedback. on 2 occasions we needed to call housekeeping to get an additional towel brought the the room even though there were 4 guests - only 3 towels were left. we also returned to our pool lounges one day to find that our pool towels had been removed from on top of our backpaks and we had to return to our rooms dripping wet through the hotel. pool staff told us it was time to 'clean up'.? when checking in for our 1st stay we were offerred a bigger room however when we checked in for our second stay we also requested a similar room and told that we had been given 'a bigger one' however when arriving at our room it was clearly much smaller than the room we had been promised and we felt like we were told it was a bigger room just to get us away from reception. our room was not ready by the promised 3pm check in time as well. finally, as an BPG member i have received my September statement and the stay is not showing although i gave my BPG member number when checking in. not all bad, the view from the 30th watching the sunset was amazing and one of the best locations in Waikiki.

title: Excellent choice in Kona
comment: We stayed in 2 hotels in Kona and this was by far the best one. Lovely facilities, grounds and rooms. Seeing the Manta Rays from the viewing area was a highlight

title: Unfortunate Stay
comment: My husband and I decided to book a last minute stay, being a long time BPG member I used cash and points. Booking was easy, as it usually is.

title: Staff was OUTSTANDING
comment: Love the hotel and the location.

title: Excellent hotel and restaurants
comment: Restaurant was oustanding

title: Poor HOtel - Needs Improvement
comment: Had to wait 55 minutes for the airport shuttle and needed to call 4 times before they got there. restaurant was next to ballroom in which there was a large party going on and very noisy. Got to be so bad I decided to take my food to my room. By the time I got it (took almost 40 minutes) and got it upstairs it was ice cold. Just very poor all around!

everyoneShouldKnow: You will definitely know your near the airport with all the plane noises
title: Solid hotel for a good price
comment: The hotel is fairly nice for the price your paying. The rooms were fairly clean and the parking is nice and accessible. My only issue is that we booked a room with Bay view and they said there were no more available, which I don't understand how we were able to book a room with Bay view to begin with. They didn't try to make it right, all that was said was "sorry, you booked a Bay View bit we only have a handicap accessible room".

title: Great Getaway Stay
comment: We wanted to get away for the weekend. This was our first time at this Belvoir. From the very beginning we knew we had picked the right hotel. The desk person let us know that we could access the club lounge. This was very nice and having 24 hr access was great. The breakfast there was convenient as well since it was on our same floor. We also made use of the free shuttle to and from the city part of Annapolis. We also were alerted to the free trolley that toured the city. Our hotel shuttle driver told us about this service. Everyone we came in contact with at the hotel was pleasant and polite.

everyoneShouldKnow: Really great service, much better than you'd expect from an area chalk-full of tourists. Very convenient location, usual Belvoir first-rate accommodations at a very reasonable price.
title: Nice convenient way to see a show at the Old Globe Theatre
comment: This hotel was very convenient for a San diego weekend that consisted of the Miramar Air Show during the day and seeing Allegiance at the Old Globe Theatre that same evening. The 10 minute drive to the theatre was a discriminator along with the usual Belvoir amenities. We had enough time after the air show to check-in, shower-up, relax and enjoy a quickie dinner in the hotel restaurant before heading to the theatre. The restaurant food was good, not great, but was served very quickly and with great service which is what we needed before heading to the Old Globe. After arriving back at the hotel post-show we enjoyed a nice glass of wine which was served by the same server we'd had earlier for dinner. The overall summary for our 1 day stay:

title: just for sleeping
comment: very good beds and excellent location.

everyoneShouldKnow: Close to I495 and business park.
title: Not good air conditioning but nice hotel
comment: The staff greeted me as a Preferred Guest, and were pleasant. The room was a reward stay, so I didn't mind that the window was not a full length one, with a view of pipes and air ducts. I did mind putting the air conditioning on the lowest temperature to cool the room, but it stayed warm. When I complained to the front desk they told me to shut it off, as it was colder outside and it would cool the room. That did not work. I was only there for the one, warm, night.

title: Exceptional Staff !!
comment: The staff was exceptional !! They work like such a great TEAM! Everyone was on the page of putting the guest first with a smile and a warm greeting. The room needed to be updated; very old TV, dresser, and bathroom.

title: Working stay
comment: Working stay and when I needed rest the room was perfect.

title: Great Stay
comment: Second visit as my son relocated to the area. Plan to stay again!

title: Comfortable & Clean
comment: Stay in the Hotel approx. 10 times per year.

title: Belvoir needs help!
comment: I recently stayed overnight at the Belvoir and attended a family wedding there. I was disappointed in the restaurant food and service while having lunch at the main bar area off the lobby.The food was unappetizing and we had to wait an hour to receive any food. At the wedding the bartenders did not have the martini glasses and they ran out of cranberry juice in during the meal. When you are hosting a wedding for 200 people your staff should be equipped with the proper proportions of glasses and juice.

title: where are amenities
comment: Nice hotel but the rooms my family stayed in did not have microwaves and no refrigerators. Which made it no so enjoyable when you go out to eat and you can't bring back leftovers to enjoy in your room later. Also very difficult to access lobby wi-fi to connect with laptops or tablets.

title: A bit run down
comment: The bathroom toilet was cracked, shower tiles broken and the desk chair had a whole in the seat.

title: the hotel staff
comment: staff was very helpful and accomedations were great

title: amaizing place.... great hoel
comment: Got my expectation....I enjoyed my stay... pretty... confortable..... nice staff..... BPG member has some privilege

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location if you are going to Syracuse University or any of the hospitals.
title: Wonderful Staff
comment: I stay at Belvoir's because you know you will have good facilities. This one has all that and a wonderful staff to boot. Everyone, from the Front Desk folks, to the Rachel's restaurant staff, to the housekeeping staff, are friendly, and go out of their way to make you feel at home.

title: Wedding Stay Overnight
comment: We stayed overnight after attending a wedding reception,which we had booked in advance and everything was great.The food was great the staff was very helpful and our room was very comfortable and clean.We would definitely stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Perfect location when visiting the IBM Sterling Forest site.
title: 4-Night Business Trip
comment: No major issues. Enjoyed the stay, room, food and service. Room was very clean and the bed very comfortable. The hotel was hosting two weddings and a reunion. There were no noise issues.

title: great staff and friendly
comment: Had a great experience at the Belvoir this week. Staff went out of their way to ensure my complete satisfaction. Everyone from front desk, room service, bartender, housekeeping was top notch. Definitely say here again when in the area.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location and the Food and Wine Classic is a great event.
title: Great location and Event
comment: We stayed at the resort for the 3rd Annual Food and Wine Classic. The event was excellent and very well organized. Rather than go to the parks we enjoyed the resort pool, fitness center and surrounding area. It was a fun and relaxing weekend. Only negative would be all the fees that are tacked on at checkout. A bit excessive.

title: Clean hotel marginal shuttle service
comment: This Belvoir is clean and comfortable. The pool, spa and fitness facilities are in great shape. If considering this hotel for your stay while visiting Disneyland, be aware that the shuttle service is marginal. The shuttle service serves two hotels (and sometimes 3) and we experienced times when the shuttle would show up with a near full bus and couldn't take us all to the park. They were not prepared to quickly order a back-up bus.

title: Disappointed in service
comment: Our stay was not what we had expected. There was no valet parking. We could not drop off our the other passengers and our bags until we had driven across the street parked our car and checked into the hotel. When we got to our room there was one towel for two guests. We called for more and none arrived the first night. Second night we had two because I caught the cleanning lady outside my door and ask her to leave two towels. There were people screaming and yelling all night outside our room, and then you could here them throwing up all morining. The cross walk to the garage was closed. So the only access you had to your car was out the front entrance of the hotel and across the street. I could go on and on but have said enough.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's in a very convenient area with good restaurants and shopping within walking distance.
title: Odd room
comment: We had a room which was bigger than the standard room but had only two tiny drawers. We would have liked to unpack our bag a bit but were unable to. We would also would have liked a safe in the room to avoid the inconvenience of using the front desk's security facilities.

title: great place to stay
comment: nice location, friendly staff, clean and convenient

title: Exceptional Place
comment: The Sherton South Hotel is and excellent choice for your lodging needs if you are visiting the first state on business, pleasure our just time to revive. There is nothing the staff will not do to accommodate you and maker your time worth each moment you have and more. The food is awesome and always very fulfilling. Whenever I stay here I am always sadi that I never have the time to extend...but I will be back!

title: Starbucks!
comment: Unbelieable stay at the Belvoir! Our room was extremely clean and the bed was so comfortable! Only 1 complaint; our room had 2 decaf packets of coffee and only 1 regular blend and the maid left only 1 packet of condiments which had been previously opened and used and half empty. Very disappointed since we love our coffee in the morning and there was only enough regular blend for 1 of us to have a cup. Decaf is a no-no in the morning! We know there was a Starbucks's near the lobby but that defeated the point of wanting to savor a good cup of coffee before you get dressed.

title: Belvoir Tower Chicago
comment: large and well managed, large volume of conference attendees and everything was smooth and the attendees were were well cared for. Bathrooms were clean and well maintained. Great Conference destination. Easy to walk to area locations of interest for shopping, and transportation easy to navigate.

title: You need a car!
comment: The hotel is lovely with wonderful views of the water from the rooms. However. it is not within walking distance of anything! Cab fares are outrageous in San Diego ($50 to zoo and back). No restaurants within walking distance (except those in the hotel). Paying $22 a day to park a car seems excessive to me. Food in the hotel is expensive and just okay. No vending machines (just ice) on our floor and gift shop has limited hours. Free shuttle to/from the airport was very nice and appreciated. Next trip to San Diego, we will stay downtown where we don't need a car but can walk to restaurants, shopping. etc.

title: Good location, but some issues
comment: We were in town for the Steeler game and then for a Pampered Chef weekend trip. We got in around 2:00 and our room wasn't ready, which was expected because check-in time isn't until 3:00. We left our phone number and walked downtown to see the sights. We returned to the hotel around 3:15 and our room was still not ready. After sitting in the lobby until 4:30, we finally checked at the desk only to be told our room was ready at 3:19 and we were never called. Not a very good start. We got a free breakfast out of it, but the late check-in basically ruined our evening dinner plans before the game.

title: Wish I could have stayed longer
comment: Right from the start, the hotel staff were helpful and friendly, the amenities were more than I anticipated, the room was lovely and comfortable, and the location was perfect. The catered food was excellent. The cafe and other 2nd floor restaturant were excellent. My only disappointment was in the Java bar. The bartender was talking with the table waitress, saw me and didn't mention that I was there, waiting. I had to ask "is there table service" for her to tell the waitress I was there. I ordered the shrimp, and got 5 skinny shrimp for $14. Way overpriced.

title: this hotel is perfect
comment: this was just perfect - everything from the room with a river view to the side bar dining, to the lobby - just perfect

title: I enjoyed my stay
comment: The rooms are comfortable. The restaurant is good and the creek and falls view were beautiful

title: DOC D
comment: it was great, room was very nice and clean.

title: Most comfortable beds!
comment: My wife and I both thought that the Belvoir was one of the most comfortable hotels we've stayed in. The staff was accommodating and the extras like cookies upon return from the Fiesta made the stay much more memorable.

everyoneShouldKnow: We have also stayed at different times such as September, February, August, etc. We always stay on the 2nd floor by the pool because of the table and chairs and the patio that overlooks below.
title: Location to college.
comment: This was about our 10th stay at your hotel in Iowa City due to grandchildren attending University of Iowa. We have never had a bad experience only great ones. We would definitely recommend your hotel.

title: The location is excellent
comment: Great hotel right in the heart of the city. Close to just about everything and my office.

title: Service & Cleanliness
comment: Brian front desk supervisor did an excellant job. Resturant was poorly staffed and slow needs a good manager. Room was very clean except for carpeting. Bar area fountain was discusting but service there was excellent. All and all a good experience that could be made better by management.

title: Wonderful stay
comment: We booked the park and cruise package so we could leave our car here while we were on a 7 day cruise. It was WELL worth the money. We had a club level room and enjoyed the free drinks and snacks. The room was very nice and the staff were friendly. The only negative that I can say is we asked the night before we left about a shuttle and the girl at the front desk called for us. She then called me and told me for my family of 4 it would be $40 each way. I told her to cancel and I would get a taxi. They were $35 each way. The next morning the taxi AND the shuttle was there. She had not called to cancel, and worse... it was $40 round trip. My return taxi was $30 so this could have saved me money. That was frustrating but we still enjoyed our stay and would not hesitate to stay again.

title: International mason
comment: Every thing was very good.

title: Room conditions
comment: We stayed at the hotel from Fri. 10/12/12 to Sun. 10/14/12. The bath drain was slow our first night and I notified the desk the next day. No one responded, and bythe time we left on Sun.the water was left standing in the tub.

everyoneShouldKnow: Double check your bill before checking out.
title: No AAA discount
comment: I booked a AAA discounted rate which included breakfast and later was told that they didn't offer that special there. The reservation rep i spoke to told me they did but they never agreed on it and I was stuck paying for the 45. dollar breakfast bill.

everyoneShouldKnow: They are pet friendly and upscale. It's not a dump that allow you to bring your pet and then charge a fee. I think signing a waiver is sufficient. I'm sure bad experiences caused other hotels to charge a fee. But, you do have pet owners that are clean, and clean up after their pet.
title: Love the fact that its pet friendly
comment: Our stay was fantastic! I never seen so many pets in a hotel. The hotel was very clean, and upscale. The customer service was outstanding. Plus they didn't charge an extra fee for your family (pet). I can't wait to go back.

title: This hotel great locatation
comment: Hotel is a great location for visiting Penn and Drexel.

title: Conference Center
comment: Came here for a conference. Great location. Close to all the restaurants, navy pier, in Downtown. Courteous staff.

title: Best in town
comment: My third stay here... terrific tiled retro-modern bath and comfiest bed. Very consistent service. Great location close to things, and away from the riff-raff. Veiws of the harbor and a short walk to Canal Park. Nicely-equipped Club lounge.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, excellent services and courteous staff
title: Excellent hotel
comment: The front desk staff are prompt, courteous and helpful. They offered me options of upgrades, and anytime I have a request they accomplished it in a timely manner. This is my 2nd stay in that hotel within a 40 days period, and I am going back

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent location, clean and comfortable rooms, quality service
title: Fitness Center limitations
comment: The Fitness Center is great and popular for vigorous physical exercise, but is a single room and very noisy. I was not aware of any accommodation or optimal location for yoga or meditative, relaxing exercise.

title: Unaccomodating
comment: I went for a conference as a funded guest. I had a video chat meeting requirement for one hour in the morning (9-10) and I couldn't be in the lobby of the hotel, and the rest of the entire day (until midnight that night) I would be at the convention center. I have over 27,000 BPG points and am 10 stays away from gold membership (of 25). I feel like an hour of complementary internet is not a huge request. However, that is not what I am venting about, it was that the manager said it was not possible to apply complementary service in the room. As a computer scientist, as a guest in other Belvoirs, I know that it IS possible. The inaccurate information given by the manager was frustrating. I did change hotel rooms the next day. And I would advise you to look around just a little bit more to find a more suitable hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't stay in the back side of this hotel!
title: Disappointed
comment: First time in Kauai. Stayed at the Belvoir for the first time. The front part of the hotel is nice and remodeled but....the back part of the hotel was a different story!

title: Furniture
comment: The hotel grounds were nice. Staff very friendly. The furniture in the room was uncomfortable. The cushions on the sofa were ripped and zippers were broken

title: Great Stay!
comment: We had a great stay at the Tech Center Belvoir! They have a brand new Starbucks! Easy access to Tran Tech Center.

title: Good Value in Downtown Austin
comment: This is a great hotel located right in the middle of all the action in downtown Austin. The property is updated and has a great lobby with a cool, popular bar that gives a good vibe to this hotel right when you walk through the front doors. Youre within walking distance to nightlife (6th Street is about 5 blocks away), and youre also close enough to walk to the University if youre in town for a game or to visit friends and family that are going to UT.

title: So Friendly
comment: What a great Hotel. The staff was the best I've seen right from the beginning. From the valet to the front desk to the service man who came to fix my TV. This was my first time visiting Boston and won't stay anyplace else when visiting again.

title: great pool
comment: the pool temperature was perfect, each morning at pool we were greeted by a nice gentleman from enginneering in charge of pool. always made it perfect for us.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff, from top to bottom, not seeming to care or take pride in property and guests.
title: Needs Good Leadership
comment: There seems to be an systemic issue starting at the top in this location. The attitiude, attentiveness, and overall pride is lacking.

title: Fun in Denver
comment: Whether sunny summer or frigid winter, the staff at the Belvoir denver downtown will warm your heart with excellent service and a great drink in Mix by Kim. My first gustroom had a broken heater, so I was promptly moved to another room, which was wonderful! The staff was very helpful and the hotel is in a great location for the 16th street mall and green space.

everyoneShouldKnow: DON'T EXPECT SATISFACTION IF YOU HAVE A PROBLEM
title: IT WAS BAD ALL AROUND
comment: ROOMS GIVEN AWAY EVEN AFTER CREDIT CARD GIVEN AND CHECKED IN BY LOUIS. MOVED TO NEW ROOM 12:30 AT NIGHT. BREAKFAST OFFERED BUT NOT ENOUGH FOR EVERYONE. SHOWER DRAIN DID NOT WORK SHOWERED IN WATER TO ANKLES. GIVEN 3000 POINTS TO MAKE UP FOR ALL PROBLEMS WHEN A FREE ROOM IS 7000 POINTS

title: the little things
comment: We loved how the room provided complimentary bottles of water.

everyoneShouldKnow: Huge but very comfortable - like being outside but you are indoors!
title: Fantastic Stay!
comment: I reserved 2 rooms on the Club Level, we were celebrating my 40th high school reunion, my daughter's 32nd birthday and my 2 grandaughters 1st trip to Vermont. The rooms were outstanding - connecting rooms (king bed for me, 2 double beds for the girls). Most comfortable beds and bedding. The maids kept us supplied with towels galore!

title: Mixed review
comment: My husband and I stayed at the hotel so we would not have to drive home after the food and wine festival. The hotel had a very nice pool area and lobby. I thought the rooms were a little dirty and very outdated. The staff was very nice and helpful. I would only stay here again if they renovated the rooms and improved on house keeping.

title: Accommodated well, but no follow thru with security
comment: Our stay for my stepson's wedding was quite an experience. The hotel was beautiful and the accommodations were finally met after sometime for waiting for a room after requesting early check-in. I wouldn't have cared so much about this if we didn't have the wedding to worry about. Not having a room until after 2:00 with the wedding at 4:30 was a huge issue for my husband and my family. But our stay ended up being very comfortable and wonderful in the end... until I called security the next day to ask about my 12 yr. old's missing ring that was acidentally left in the room, and they were very nice about it and said they would look into it immediately...never heard back from them!!! That part makes me mad. I was hoping for someone to follow through with that and I received no call back even.

title: Nice stay
comment: This hotel was nice, met my needs and was clean.

everyoneShouldKnow: Rooms were spacious, clean and modern. Staff was wonderful
title: Wonderful hotel!
comment: We had to make last minute reservations as this hotel due to a family illness and the rooms and the hotel was surprisingly warm and welcome despite a hot air ballon fiesta and the hotel seemed full. Will definitely stay at this hotel again--all areas were flawless in their service!

everyoneShouldKnow: Very convenient to beach and shopping.
title: Hawaii trip
comment: The air conditioning in the room needs major improvement. Low setting hardly works; and high setting is more like low. Bathroom fixtures could use some updating. All in all, it wad adequate as all we really needed to do was sleep & shower. The property in general, could use some updating. James in Security was a huge help to me when I had my ID and debit card stolen from the beach. He was great to work with and you should be proud to have someone on staff who genuinely cares unlike the police department. I only ate one meal at the hotel - continental breakfast and it was ok. My biggest complaint with that experience was the language barrier with the waitress. English needs to improve drastically.

title: Hotel has great location and amenities
comment: Superior food and beverage product

title: Repeat visitor
comment: Several times a year I find it necessary to spend a night or more, often with family, when visiting from my Whidbey Island home. Staff is always friendly and professional and I feel like an honored guest. Parking, restaurat, and a shuttle to nearby shopping are all just outside the door!

title: Beautiful Lobby
comment: We traveled during a big race weekend to Charlotte. We always have trouble finding decent rooms with low rates, but were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. Will definitely use again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very comfortable hotel, but inconvenient shuttle service to parks
title: Wonderful room, unsatisfactory Disney shuttle
comment: Everything about this hotel was wonderful except for the shuttle service to the Disney parks. The shuttle had inconvenient, erratic pick-up and drop-off times and sometimes the last pick-up at the parks was well before they even closed. The buses were dirty and extremely overcrowded (many times there was standing room only). If Belvoir could get the official Disney shuttle service or another service that is more frequent and better quality, I would have no reservations recommending this hotel.

title: Great Customer Service!
comment: We love staying at the Belvoir Albuquerque Airport Hotel! During this stay, we were upgraded to receive access to the club floor even though there were no more rooms available on that floor. This means we were able to enjoy the evening tapas as well as the hot specialty breakfast. We are always taken care of by Nancy in the club floor lounge. She does a super job keeping the food well stocked and everything looking clean and tidy! Thanks John L. for the upgrade!

title: The "Other" Star in the Roanoke Valley!
comment: My wife and I have stayed at the Belvoir Roanoke several times now, and each time we were delighted with the accommodations, the service and the beauty of the hotel's surrounding campus. As BPG members, we always look forward to coming back to spend a special night in Roanoke's "other" Star!

title: Great weekend
comment: My wife and I stayed for the weekend. The room was excellent and had a great view of the river and lake. The staff and general manager gave us great service and made us feel very welcome. I will stay here again because of the fantastic service.

title: Outstanding Historic Hotel Near Alamo
comment: This is currently my favorite hotel in Texas for a number of reasonsbut primarily because of the superb job the Belvoir has done in honoring the history of this century-old building and retaining the old world charm. I was upgraded to the Governors Suite, which Ill admit was very kind of the hotel, but the other rooms are equally as nice. The Governors Suite was large and spacious. I especially liked the heavy wooden shutters that you could open in the mornings and close in the evenings. While sitting in the lobby, it felt like you were in the early 1900swith all the hard wood, marble floors and antique chandeliers. The Alamo is only about a 5 minute walk from the hotel, and the River Walk is equally as close.

title: Great hotel! Helpful staff.
comment: Staff was helpful and friendly. Rooms were spacious and clean.

title: am i the only one
comment: I must be the only person that would never stay here again if I could help it. If it weren't for the mandatory stay at the property because of business, I would not have come back after the last stay in 2009. I don't think the food is good, you can hear every sound through the walls and windows, the staff aren't particularly friendly. When I tried to check in hours after the posted check-in time and no room was ready, the response was lackluster. But at 11:20am on check-out day, I'm darn near being escorted out of my room. I hope that means someone was able to check-in to the room I was staying in on time.

title: Perfect Place To Stay
comment: This hotel is the perfect place to stay. Convenient location and very professional staff. You won't go wrong staying at this hotel.

title: Nice weekend
comment: Great location for shows and restaurants

everyoneShouldKnow: It is truly right at the marina!
title: Great Views
comment: I love, love, love this hotel. I was a bit anxious before arriving as I had read a couple of reviews that were not very nice. I did take on person's advice and book a room in the marina tower. From the parking lot to lobby to the lounge to the views when exiting the elevator--BEAUTIFUL!!!! I was inspired!

everyoneShouldKnow: The beds are comfy and if you have any issues, contact Ginger at the front desk.
title: Cozy room and the bed was comfy..
comment: I would first like to say that the Ginger at the front desk was awesome! I had to call several times before I got to town and Ginger accommodated all our needs and was extra helpful and courteous. She went above and beyond to assist us with our needs. However, the morning of our check-out, housekeeping came knocking at our door at 9:45am, before we could answer the door, the male housekeeper had the door open and was standing there looking at us. Just out of the shower and not fully dressed. Check out time is at 12:00 noon and I dont think housekeeping should be knocking on doors and intruding on guests before then. Prior to this we could hear them knocking on other guests doors and talking loudly in the hall, as we were trying to sleep. We finally decided that sleeping in was not an option. We were on the 6th floor, club level and you think they would have been more courteous. We felt like the whole floor was being kicked out as they were knocking on all the doors and opening them, hours before check out. Other than that, our stay was great and the room was very cozy. The front desk staff was great!

title: Weekend in downtown Denver
comment: Could not be a more perfect location for a visit to downtown Denver. Hotel rooms are extremely clean and comfortable for such a massive hotel. Staff are pleasant, and the facilities are very good. Minor disappointment was the broken tv in my room and the failure to deliver on bonus Grandbourne points. Overall excellent choice if you are visiting Denver.

title: Very disappointed
comment: I have to say I was disappointed at my first stay with one of the BPG properties, Belvoir Birmingham AL (10/15).

everyoneShouldKnow: expensive but resort style, clean and very accommodating staff
title: Friendly Staff
comment: I found the staff very friendly and the accommodations very clean, neat nice and well appointed. If anything was not perfect I would have to say the value of the food /price. I had a grouper sandwich that I did not enjoy at all and it was $17.

title: Excellent check-in hospitality
comment: Was approached while waiting for check-in and provided information as to dinner establishments, direction to the stadium and all done in a very friendly and professional manner. MG is to be commended for her efforts.

title: Excellent Hotel
comment: The accomodations were great, the staff was one of the nicest, most helpful staff we've ever come across. Everyone was exceptional.

title: Needs better organization
comment: 1)Registration man (Bellman) disorganized,confused and lacked information. It took half hour to register

title: Great Value
comment: If you compare this hotel to many others in this area or Miami, you could not get nearly the value of such a clean and friendly staffed place. It may not be the "fanciest" appearance in comparison to some others, but the food, drink and rooms are stellar and the staff are some of the most dedicated and friendliest we've met!

title: Not recommended.
comment: The room rate is for 3 or 4 stars hotel, but the facility is old, and service was bad.

everyoneShouldKnow: Parking is not included and rather pricey.
title: Good Stay
comment: Overall my stay was great. Staff was friendly. Room was very nice. Great location. The only small issue was that the staff was a bit unclear about payment and checkout. Most hotels I have stayed in have room checkout whether on the TV, phone or internet. I had no clue what to do about checkout. Then at checkout at the front desk the girl was still unclear on what was happening-whether they were charging my card on file or I could give a different one. Then she didnt even offer a receipt.

everyoneShouldKnow: we ate the second shift, every time we went for a meal, the food was gone, we had to tell the waitresses to fill the food. The food / beverage was terrible this time.
title: hotel review
comment: I booked 2 king size rooms, i received 2 queen rooms. I checked in at 3:00. I asked the clerk to give me someone else's king that haven't checked in yet and he said there were no more kings available in the hotel.The clerk said he couldn't do anything to compensate me. I know of at least 2 people that booked their reservation and checked in after me that received king beds, so the clerk lied to me. Our scrapbook leader said I should go back and complain and I should be compensated, so I did go back and complain to a woman clerk, and she compensated me with wine and cheese and crackers and strawberries. But before she compensated me she went to my scrapbook leader and asked her if she should compensate me.I was not happy to hear that from my scrapbook leader.

title: Great service, and wonderful view.
comment: This hotel is in a perfect location. The service is incredible. We had a problem with the heat, and right away someone came to fix our problem.

title: great stay after our cruise
comment: the hotel was well maintained, clean and in a good location (car still needed). bed was extremely comfortable and the room very spacious. beaches within 10-45 min (depending on which one you want to visit). restaurants are plentiful. would definately stay again. only rated good overall because pool was inside (nice size but would rather have some sun). in all fairness though i came for the beaches.

everyoneShouldKnow: It has everything that any family could ask for while on vacation in the Orlando area.
title: This hotel has everything we were looking for.
comment: Wonderful water works (pools, hot tubs, water falls, beach) and kids playground area. Food and drinks are excellent. Service is the best.

title: Dropping Par
comment: Overall, the Dolphin is showing its age. The room is beginning to look dated, and things are going without maintenance (hook gone on back of bathroom door, cabinets falling apart, etc.).

title: The Staff was great!
comment: This hotel was had a historical feel. The location was nice. The rooms were large and clean. I didn't get to swim or use the fitness center.

title: Great Spot to Stay for DC Trip
comment: This hotel was a great spot to stay for our recent trip to DC.

title: Great for DC Weekends
comment: Recently stayed here for a 1 night stay although I have stayed here many times before.

title: Great location, very nice room
comment: This hotel has a great location - close to Times Square but not so close that it is super-noisy. Room was spacious for NYC and very clean. The hotel has obviously gone through a recent renovation and the room is very tasteful.

title: Staff was the icing
comment: I enjoy staying the Belvoir line of hotels. The hospitality of the staff at this location was exceptional. They had a smile for everything and made sure I got my questions answered, was directed to the correct location, and tried to anticipate just about everything. The room was comfortable and quiet.

title: Very happy!
comment: This hotel exceded my expertations. I thought being near the airport it would be noisy, during our time there I forgot that we were near the airport. Meals were served at our conference. The food was delicious and the wait staff were efficient and friendly. Thank you for everything.

title: Excellent staff and service
comment: My stay was wonderful as was the staff, beginning with check in! I was allowed to check in early which was awesome. It fast and effecient. Jose took care of my luggage and needs in my room right down to filling my ice tub!! I asked for him again at check out!.Thank you for a most excellent stay at your hotel. I will return..

everyoneShouldKnow: Newly refurbished, quiet rooms with fantastic views and easy access to the airport.
title: Very comfortable hotel with wonderful city and harbor views .
comment: This newly refurbished hotel is relaxed and quiet with fantastic views of the city and harbor. Right across the street from the airport with free shuttle is convenient. Even though it is close tithe airport, it was much more quiet than the hotels I've stayed at downtown and near the Convention Center.

everyoneShouldKnow: The one thing that stood out for me, was the magnificent lobby and entrance doors, once the scaffolding and the work on the outside reach completion, this Hotel will rate outstandingly high..also location, location, location...
title: "Great Stay"!!
comment: This hotel met our every need, the beds were so comfy, that we almost forgot to wake up in the morning to go sightseeing.Our room was big enough to accommodate the four of us, very clean and pleasant. The staff behind the counter were first class in accommodating me and my family's needs. The Concierge downstairs were very helpful and nice . This Hotel is in the best possible location, we walked everywhere with no difficulty at all. The Cleaning staff were very friendly and considerate. There was one issue with the bar fridge, but that was quickly resolved with no problems thanks to the very understanding staff..Our stay was very very pleasant and I would definitely stay here again and I will certainly be recommending this classy hotel to my friends and other family members also. Thank you to you all...

title: Excellent views and location
comment: Great convenient location, great water views

title: check-in staffer
comment: She was professional, very friendly, and was determined to find a room that met our desires, which was made more difficult since we were checking in early on a very busy weekend.

title: NIce Location
comment: Nice hotel, restaurant is only average; rooms are comfortable and spacious. not always given recognition for Gold BPG status. Staff is courteous throughout the property.

title: Parking concern
comment: I stayed one night, arriving about 5:00 p.m. on 10/14. Attended the CAR convention that evening and taught a class the next day. I checked out at noon and explained that my class would be over at 5:10 and would I still be able to use my card to get out of the parking garage. The front desk person said I may have to pay $8.00. That was OK with me - although I was also paying $12.00 for parking as a room charge. When I finished my class and left the parking garage at about 5:30, I was charged $48.00 - plus the $12.00 parking charge attached to my room. $60 parking for 24 hours is unreasonable to stay in your hotel in my opinion.

title: Best stay ever in San Diego!!!
comment: Just wanted to thank all the staff and GM for a wonderful and romantic stay. Was celebrating a special anniversary with my Teresa and we were pleasantly surprised & pleased by the Junior Suite upgrade in recognition of my Grandbourne Gold & Ownership status. We loved the comfort, view and quality of the room, plus it really made our stay that more enjoyable. We will definately be back!!! Love Belvoir San Diego & Grandbourne!!!

title: great location
comment: Only a block away from the inner harbor. Front desk associates were polite and responsive.

everyoneShouldKnow: The $22 dollars an day self parking was crazy and even though it is done at other hotels, it is still crazy.
title: The staff was the most friendly ever...
comment: From check in to check out, this was the most amazing stay, at a hotel, I have ever had. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable, and very competent. My husband and I were there for a conference, but for our job we stay in hotels 5 days a week on average. And from the cleaning staff , the dining staff, front desk, and valets to bell hops , I have never had such a comfortable stay even on the 21st floor, we had hot water with great pressure. Thank you

title: Location, location, location!
comment: Great location, great, comfortable beds. Disappointed that wifi was not included as this an expected amenity.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is really nice--everyone is accommodating
title: Great hotel -- a couple of issues
comment: Shower did not have strong pressure which was a negative and not enough plugs near a mirror outside of the bathroom. Room was lovely--great breakfast buffet.

title: This hotel has great features
comment: This hotel was very accommodating to our every need. The bed was especially comfortable and we enjoyed our stay thoroughly! Thank you for a great visit to Vermont!

title: Great stay
comment: Wonderful stay and very clean

everyoneShouldKnow: It is very nice and the rooms are a great size
title: had better visits
comment: Let me start out by saying, i have stayed here several times in the past and it was awesome. this time not so much. 1st off when we got to our room the toilet was clogged and not by us.The showere was not working properly and the tub would fill up with the dirty water.The room was not as clean as expected. Part of our stay, we didnt get hand towel or toiletries.One day they came to clean our room so we left for an 11/2hr, when we got back it wasnt touched. I called front dest they said they would send someone up ASAP. They called back and said they were all out to lnuch and that it would be a half hour. I said ok but it has to be soon cause my child needs a nap. They showed up over a hour later!! this put us out for the day and my daughter never got her nap, so if you have children you know what the rest of the day and night was like! There were other miner issues but i can over look them

everyoneShouldKnow: Very helpful staff. Close to campus.
title: Cozy hotel with great staff
comment: Facilities were ok, but the people who work there are top notch! From the maids to the desk clerks, I felt like everyone there wanted to help. Some wear and tear on the hotel, however, with staff that can help with restaurant suggestions, directions to my meetings on campus, and the attractions in Philly; I was definitely satisfied!

everyoneShouldKnow: If you are having a Convention, it is perfect
title: Had a Great Stay
comment: We were attending a convention held in the hotel. We stayed for four nights and had an enjoyable stay. The rooms were clean and had adequate space. The staff was exceptionally friendly. We also attended a couple of banquets and the food was much better than expected. We will be back next October.

title: One satisfied customer
comment: This was my first stay with this establishment and I absolutely enjoyed my stay. The services that I received were outstanding and I will continue to use this establishment as long as it is meeting my needs.

everyoneShouldKnow: Worth paying a little extra here for easy access to Iowa City restaurants, campus etc.
title: Nice Stay, great location
comment: Only stayed one night to visit niece at UI. Very pleasant, no issues. Brought my own hotspot so I didn't pay for internet. This was NOT a footbal weekend, but hotel seemed busy, parking was included, plentiful and easy.

title: Wouldn't recommend
comment: Stayed at this hotel in October of 2012, and it wasn't one of my more enjoyable stays at a Grandbourne property. Bathroom needs repair no water pressure, all of the fixtures where coming away fro the wall. Housekeeping didn't replenish soaps, etc on a daily basis. Elevator is horribly slow. Would often take 10+ minutes to get up/down from 20th floor. Hotel also refused my request for a late check out. Called guest services and they told me that the hotel was sold out so that they can't provide late check out even though i'm a gold memeber. I was told that I could go downstairs and speak to a manager to see if they could provide me with late check out. When I checked the website to see if rooms were available I was still available to book online. This wasn't one of our better Belvoir stays.

title: Beautiful Hotel
comment: The hotel is beautiful, the property is wonderful. We stayed to take the kids to Rawhide (which is not part of the Belvoir) however that night it was clased due to a private party. The hotel comp'd us a movie and we went out for a wonderful dinner. I feel that is something that the front desk and BPG needs to beaware of, at least recommend that guest call before making reservations, we would have gone another night. Also charging guest for use of the fitness center Really????? Don't we pay enough for the BPG or the room as it is

title: Great staff
comment: The registration staff were great-- fast, efficient and very helpful with directions and advice.

title: Comfortable
comment: Excellent hotel with highest level of comfort for guests.

everyoneShouldKnow: Print your email to reference, apparently they can't be trusted
title: WAS our very favorite hotel, now, not so much :o(
comment: Have stayed at Swan/Dolphin many times before and have always been more than satisfied. We have recommended them to family and friends (even strangers). This time was a much different experience. We made reservations in July for our trip last weekend to attend the hotel's 3rd annual Food and Wine Classic. A bunch of our friends also booked packages for the weekend, we were all so excited!

everyoneShouldKnow: Best place to stay if visiting Epcot, Boardwalk, and Hollywood Studios
title: Best stay for Epcot & DHS visits
comment: We are members of DVC and usually stay at the Beach Club Villas as we spend most of our Disney time at Epcot, but we actually like the Dolphin better. The only complaints we've heard from others that seems valid is self parking, so we always use valet parking and highly recomend it!

title: Mom and Daughter Weekend
comment: It was nice to stay once again at the Belvoir Suites Cobb- Galleria. We utilized the room, restaurant, and parking facility.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Pool area and gives a feeling of relaxation
title: Relax!
comment: Very relaxing,, great pool area.

everyoneShouldKnow: good location, but run-down, not fancy
title: Ok, but in need of upgrade
comment: the hotel is dated and not one of the nicer Belvoir's i've stayed at. i used points so i stayed for free..but i don't think this hotel is worth more than $125/night. our room was run-down, the shower had problems and the furnishings were outdated and clearly old and worn.

everyoneShouldKnow: Shuttle will take you to nearby locations. Try to reserve in advance, as there could be a waiting list.
title: Minor technological improvements needed
comment: Stayed one night for business.

title: This hotel was great
comment: The staff are super friendly and the food was delicious. My one recommendation is to add a refrigerator to the guest rooms.

everyoneShouldKnow: make sure folio and all are correct before you leave property. otherwise, forget it.
title: have stayed here before, but probably the worst expereince this time.
comment: Poorly trained staff at front desk. Not very friendly or helpful. Did not follow through on my request to get final folio in paper or electronic format until 36 hours after checkout. phone servcie poor. held on phone for over 20 minutes. Operator stated she thought she could help but was useless. very bad exerperience for a Platinum customer. Restaurant issues with waitress not getting order correct.

everyoneShouldKnow: Too far to walk to the Gaslamp district.
title: Great Club Lounge and Restaurant
comment: Club lounge has excellent views of the bay, marina and San Diego town. Excellent service on our first night. Breakfast in the main restaurant was superb with great choice and quality, along with views of the marina.

title: This hotel had great staff
comment: Everything in my stay was fantastic. I would recommend this hotel to.everone I know.

everyoneShouldKnow: Slightly out from the centre of the town and many of the rooms in noisy location with poor view.
title: Disappointing stay
comment: I had been looking forward to my stay at the Belvoir in Santa Monica as part of my Highway 1 trip but was left extremely disappointed with the location of the hotel and in particular the room (having paid for an upgrade to club). The club lounge was also poor value for the extra money paid. Finally, the pool was very small for the size of the hotel.

title: Great Stay Despite Reviews
comment: We were looking for a hotel to stay at using our points near a conference we were attending. Despite the reviews, we decided to stay at the Belvoir because it was close to the conference site and we could just use our points.

title: Great Disneyland hotel
comment: Excellent place to stay for Disneyland trips. Shuttle stops at the hotel. Staff is very helpful. Eat at Molly's Kitchen for breakfast; great food, good prices and not crowded. Avoid the cost/lines at the park. Hotel is showing some signs of its age, but still an excellent value. Did not use the pool, but it looks fine.

title: Good location, good staff tired hotel
comment: Hotel is in good location and staff were all very helpful. Special mention for the concierges who were great.

everyoneShouldKnow: Clean hotel - staff is extremely friendly and helpful
title: Very attentive staff
comment: From check in to check out the staff were extremely professional, friendly, helpful and attentive. No need to be concerned about noise being near the airport - not an issue at all. Very conveniently located to major roads Really appreciated the pre-typed directions the front desk had to local restaurants and stores.

everyoneShouldKnow: The reooms are very nice as is the layout and entrance area
title: CONFERENCE ATTENDEE
comment: MY ROOM WAS TOO NEAR THE COKE AND ICE MACHINES AND TO THE STAIRS...TOO NOISY

title: here for business
comment: comfortable bed and amenities

everyoneShouldKnow: Shuttle drivers go over and beyond and are very familiar with area.
title: Tampa Airport Hotel Stay
comment: This hotel was absolutely wonderful with the exception of the hotel room temperature.

everyoneShouldKnow: throws a great food and wine festival
title: great room - long walk to elevators
comment: rm 5172 nice location great view but a crazy long walk to elevators

everyoneShouldKnow: Great staff! Awesome suites! Great pools with lots of activities for everyone.
title: We'll be there Friday, October 26, 2012
comment: We own at this resort and love it. We stay at least once a year. We will be staying a week this time.

everyoneShouldKnow: Best rest I have gotten in a hotel bed!
title: Excellent
comment: Easy check-in/check-out process. Very friendly staff. Great room. Had a wonderful stay.

title: Nice hotel in great area.
comment: We enjoyed our stay at this property. The shuttle to Ybor city (or anywhere really) is a great feature. We were able to have a nice dinner and cocktails without having to drive afterward. The location on the water is nice, too, especially when sitting at the pool. The one draw back is that their is not any waitstaff assigned to the pool to take drink/food orders while catching some rays..

title: Perfect hotel
comment: This is a great hotel. It is close to everything. The bed was fabulous, the room very clean and the District restaurant was great - definitely recommend the hamburger!

title: Fabulous view!!
comment: Gorgeous view from our room was unexpected. Loved it!!

title: Wonderful place to stay
comment: We did wish that there was a bar or gathering place open after dark, other than the bar inside the fancy restaurant.

everyoneShouldKnow: Martin - the guy who helped me with my bags. He was great. I was so glad he was there when I checked out also!
title: As comfortable and nice as I could ever want
comment: Loved my room and loved the service. Y'all do a great job. My only complaint is that there is a charge for internet in the rooms. I know this is common among hotels of this caliber, but it just seems unreasonable.

title: Belvoir TriBeCa
comment: Great hotel, the staff was awesome, from the doorman to the front desk to the maid. Very pleasant, professional and caring. The staff's attitude was the best of all the Grandbourne properties this year. Will definitely stay here again

title: Great for Ironman triathletes
comment: I stayed at the Belvoir Keauhou when I raced the Ironman Triathlon. It was conveniently located away from the craziness in Kona and I could relax before and after the race.

everyoneShouldKnow: Clean and friendly. Even the guests were great.
title: Awesome
comment: If you're looking for a great hotel, this is it. My brother and I drove in from New York to catch homecoming at Michigan Stadium. When we pulled into the lot, we parked in front, walked up to the counter, we were there for less than 5 minutes and went up to the room. One of the cleanest places I was ever at. The staff was great and the location was perfect. Whatever you need, you can walk to. We walked down to Chili's on Friday night and to Dicks Sporting Goods and Best Buy. Everybody was nice to us. The Toledo football team was there when we were. Those kids were very nice too. I am definitely booking this place next year!!!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: The manager knows nothing about customer service.
title: Poor Service
comment: I've been staying at this hotel for over a year including 16 stays this year alone. The way the manager and the new staff treated me today made me feel like I'm nobody. I'm now a lifetime Gold Grandbourne member and will NEVER stay at this hotel again and will pass this review to my corporate colleagues.

everyoneShouldKnow: Their own food and wine event looks like a blast.
title: Can't be beat for Food and Wine
comment: Reserved two rooms for my wife and I, our 5-month old, and my in-laws. Last time at Dolphin was three years prior. First pair of rooms were far from the elevator, so requested closer rooms. Lost the balconies, but was moved to a fantastic room (more like junior suite) right next to the elevators that adjoined to the in-laws room. There was an A/C problem, but the staff fixed it in no time. We stayed for two nights. Friday night, the Swan and Dolphin had their own Food and Wine event with live music and lots of good food and wine. We had to navigate through to get to the boardwalk, but it looked like fun had we not had our 5-month old with us. On Sat, took the ferry to Epcot, spent 6 great hours eating and drinking through the park, and took the ferry back. Super convenient. Ate a snack on site and breakfast on Sunday. The prices were high, but to be expected. I must give the hotel credit for allowing Grandbourne members to waive the resort fee in lieu of bonus points, and providing free wifi. I always hated those extra expenses. Booked the room with points too, so only expenses at the hotel were parking and dining. Didn't get to use the pool or fitness center, but they looked amazing. Not waiting three more years to come back! We all had a great time and I forgot what a nice property it was.

everyoneShouldKnow: Complimentary bus services to the theme parks are a huge bonus
title: Excellent facilities
comment: We stayed at this hotel for 7 nights and upgraded to an executive suite as we were travelling with children. We found the staff very friendly and the facilities were amazing. So many food and beverage options which catered to all budgets.

everyoneShouldKnow: The two males at the desk could have cared less about my information. They don't seem to listen very well.
title: Not Sure
comment: Stayed 4 nights. Upon check-in was asked if

everyoneShouldKnow: They needed more help in the bar area-- and it's deafeningly noisy there.
title: Love your beds!
comment: I always sleep poorly on my first night of a business trip so imagine my surprise when I awoke to my alarm refreshed and cozy. The room was nicely cool (I did re-orient the fins on the vents so as not to blow directly on the bed) and the pillow-top mattress and comforter just delightful. Thanks for a good night's sleep! And oh-- I LOVED that orange-aroma shampoo and soaps! You should sell it in a gift shop.

title: this hotel has grreat customer service
comment: this hotel has the best front desk staff that I have ever encountered. You night front desk female, curly hair, may be african american is the most wonderful person in the world her can do attitude and the way she treats us is exceptional and I am sure we are not the only ones. And my apologies I forgot her name but not her face nor her kindness.

title: good location
comment: very quiet sorroundings good staff

title: Awesome place!
comment: We were so cozy and happy to stay here after a long day and evening in Boston. Everything was comfy and perfect, and our breakfast the next morning was superb. We were all rested and ready for our next adventure through Six Flags!

title: Hotel has pluses and minuses
comment: Hotel has excellent location - convenient to concert center, museum, catholic cathedral, interstates for access to excellent shopping.

title: Wonderful experience
comment: This hotel proved to be an excellent choice. It is convientlylocated near the Convention Center, the Arizona Center, and sports and performing arts venues. I thought that both the room and the restaurant will outstanding, as was the service from all of the staff.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel is a big disappointment
title: Would not stay here again
comment: This is the worst Belvoir I have ever stayed at and would not recommend anyone to stay here. The service is horrible, there are no basic amenities in the room (toothbrush, shower cap, fridge, safe). The "free" wifi they offered in the room is terrible. I could hardly get a good signal. Housekeeping didn't even clean our room and the front desk receptionist tried to blame us by saying we had left the do not disturb sign on our door.

everyoneShouldKnow: Near RDU airport and between Durham and Raleigh.
title: Nice property and good service
comment: I stayed at this hotel for a small conference / weekend meeting. A visiting ACC football team, band, and boosters were in the hotel for two nights of my four night stay. I was pleased that the staff were able to accommodate all of the varied needs, and everyone was very friendly.

title: The staff was amazing
comment: We had a week of events at the Belvoir Wilmington and everyone on staff was incredible to deal with. They bent over backwards to make sure that our stay went well and all of our travelers were taken care of. The food and catering was great and enjoyed by all. Catering staff was attentive and flexible. The front desk staff did everything they could to make sure our needs were met quickly and efficiently. Our Sales and Reservations contacts were all amazing and worked overtime to get everything done.

title: Excellent place to stay in Dallas
comment: I stayed here in October on 2 separate weeks and each time the staff were friendly, curteous and extremely helpful. The beds were comfortable and rooms clean. I throughly enjoyed my stay.

title: This is a good hotel
comment: I luv this Belvoir. They've finally improved their parking situation. There were never enough spaces to park. We stay here every year..& this yr we noticed more spaces. Their bathrms are always very clean & they have the coffee makers "outside" the bathrms! Its disgusting 2 see hotels have them in bathrms! Tlk about unsanitary! I did notice the elevators were dirty inside..doors & floor. And the carpet in hallways & room could use a good cleaning..but no bed bugs! A HUGE factor! Very nice & great job Belvoir!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Convienient to Galleria, Restaurants, Attractions for families
title: Surprising Galleria Charmer
comment: Tucked away among office buildings in downtown Houston is where you'll find this "Galleria Charmer" of a Belvoir Suites. The staff is extremely attentive and they go out of there way to assist you. If you're in a hurry in the morning--check out the buffet breakfast.

title: Belvoir 4p tribeca,ny
comment: did not get on gold preferred floor. as a result very noisy parties all night. prior stays however, were very good. j.h.

everyoneShouldKnow: Rooms are clean, comfortable, and well furnished. .
title: Well maintained accomodations
comment: Room was comfortable, clean and pleasantly decorated and furnished. Negatives: Burned out entry light upon arrival. Although a non-smoking facility, encountered heavy smoke in hallway and near the elevator. When reported, staff acted promptly to correct both situations.

title: Service is good dining options are poor
comment: The lounge takes a very long time to provide orders, food options are limited

everyoneShouldKnow: The Hotel's central location makes this a great choice in Tucson. Good restaurants, sights to visit and shopping are within reasonable distance
title: Very Good, But Could Improve
comment: Front desk was unattended for approx. 5-10 minutes Friday 10/05/2012 at about 9 AM. My attempt to extend my stay due to patient discharge delays at TMC was made more difficult.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is noisy and over priced. The interiors are ugly and the furnishings are of a poor quality.
title: Never Again
comment: The water for showers and baths was tepid at best. food was overpriced and poorly prepared. the beds were old and lumpy. My room was entered the do not disturb notice was on the door. The room had an odor of deodorizer used to mask uncleanliness. No wifi was included with the room and 2.00 fee for a local phone call is usury . The halls are noisy and the building could use both insulation and nicer furniture. The music in the bar and dining area was very loud and inappropriate for relaxation, When I called for the bellman to pick up my luggage in over to check out, he was just standing by the front door doing nothing with a big smile on his face. Meanwhile,, after waiting 20 minutes for him to arrive, I took out my own luggage to the car while this idiot stood around like he was being "useful"..

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't expect the pool to be open on time
title: Pool opening times
comment: The current system does not work! Very disappointing

title: Great Location
comment: This hotel is in a great location in Atlanta. It is close to everything. The staff really know how to cater to the business traveler.

title: Love the Suite Set Up
comment: Enjoyed the Suite set up. Pull out Queen Sofa Bed with room separator allowed privacy for early risers.

title: Good location for my needs
comment: The staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms are average but the bath area is very small for 2 people attempting to get ready in the morning.

title: Wonderful facility, staff, and location
comment: The room was great. The restarant and bar areas were terrific and our conference group really enjoyed the facilities and meals during our time at Belvoir Uptown. The hotel is located within an area with many opportunities for dining and shopping. Overall; an excellent place to stay!

title: very nice
comment: need to open dining room at night. need to have a gift and supply store. hot tub closed. pool dirty. very nice place just these things need to address,why not have dining room open instead of eating at the bar?

everyoneShouldKnow: One of the best hotels I have encountered in my travels
title: Wonderful experience
comment: Excellent service, clean, comfortable and pet friendly. I stayed on the club floor and really enjoyed the ammenities. I realized after I returned home that I had left some personal items behind. All it took was a call to the hotel and they fedx'd items to me at no charge. Did not realize the hotel was pet friendly but will definitely return with my dogs the next time I am in town.

everyoneShouldKnow: Request a room in a quiet area.
title: Needs updating and higher quality
comment: Have stayed at this location numerous time, it needs a face lift. Service at check-in poor, food in restaurant below average, lumpy bed, poor ventilation.

title: Buffet Breakfast
comment: I love staying here but frankly the over-priced breakfast buffet was a disappointment. For the cost it is limited and the eggs were cold and the bacon had been out a long time. Would have been best to go outside hotel for a fresh meal.

title: Problems with Room
comment: When I arrived in the room, two lights were not working and one phone was not working. The clock was not set properly and there was no way for me to set it myself. Eventually, after a one hour wait, a maintenance person came and fixed the lights and the clock. Setting the clock was a major operation requiring taking it apart and SLOWLY turning a dial inside. The maintenance person, while very pleasant, was dyslexic and I had to correct him on the proper time. I never even bothered with the phone although it was a great inconvenience to get to the further phone on the side of the bed. In addition, there was no hair dryer and when I called down for one, I had to wait quite a while late at night to receive one. These experiences certainly gave me a more negative opinion about Belvoir hotels.

title: Mr
comment: everyone with the hotel were most helpful. The shuttle to and from the airport were great.

title: Very tired
comment: The room was worn down and very tired. the carpet was gross and the walls and bathroom were very beat up.

title: We always feel at home
comment: Thank you - The staff is great and always takes good care of us. We feel at home once we get there.

everyoneShouldKnow: The elevators are split for the floors and you have to have your room keys to ride the elevator to your floor. :)
title: Very friendly and helpful, great atmosphere
comment: The Belvoir Downtown Phoenix was a beautiful hotel with many great features. The rooms were very nice and every one of staff was very friendly. I loved the proximity to the Convention Center, Arizona Center, stadiums, etc. They even brought in a big screen in the bar area for us sports fans. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Great Location
comment: I return yearly for a conference and find it to be a very good experience. Staff and facilities are very nice and ready to serve you.

title: Noisy
comment: Freeway on each side of hotel just resonates within. Behind is where they park the garbage trucks -- smell is quite bad.

everyoneShouldKnow: Registration at arrival not appropriately handled in timely manner
title: Inability to handle large no.
comment: Upon arrival at hotel for 4 day conference, hotel was not able to handle multiple registrants waiting in long lines to have access to rooms. After a 4 day stay, hotel did not have information of multiple guests staying in one room and therefore billing was only able to be delivered to one person doing the reservation.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is a great place to stay in Myrtle Beach - It is close to everything and is a beautiful hotel with great staff!
title: Great Experience!
comment: I stayed for a conference & brought my family along. We felt at home - I have been an operations manager in hotels for over 15 yrs & know what to expect & where to look :) The management of this hotel does a great job & it shows through the care taken at their property & by the staff's willingness to ensure a perfect stay - Melissa/HSKP and Hermann/Bellman are the BEST!

everyoneShouldKnow: food is weak and over priced not enough value for the cost.
title: food
comment: the italian food on the ground level was over rated, both meals were too salty. the wine was over priced.

everyoneShouldKnow: I got more than my money's worth staying here. My bed was extra comfortable and all the staff were extra friendly.
title: Comfort
comment: I was in town for my nephew's wedding. I was really exhausted from traveling. I had a great night's sleep in my hotel bed.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location - off of I-95 and is pet friendly.
title: Great hotel
comment: Experience overall was positive. room service breakfast eggs were cold. Love that hotel was pet friendly.

title: Great Customer Service
comment: Belvoir Anchorage is a great hotel. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the customer service was exemplary.

title: Quiet
comment: My room was very quiet; hallway noise was almost non-existent. Not much you could do about the ASU Marching Band playing in front of the TV studio nearby :-)

everyoneShouldKnow: Delightful facility, location, and staff - very nice.
title: Great Weekend
comment: The hotel is welcoming in every respect - room, food and service. Fantastic location on Sand Key Beach, next to a lovely park that lets one really enjoy a relaxing vacation. The dinner at Rusty's was well presented and very tasty. Very nice stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Adequate room with great staff to off-set
title: Great staff
comment: I was there for an extended stay 6+ ( minus family & for 2 days biz associates) during that time there was never a time when the staff was not .... Terrific! they made my stay tolerable and very much enjoyable.

title: Mr.
comment: Restaurant and facility was excellent.

title: Best Disney Shuttle Staff Ever!!!
comment: Whenever I need to go to Disneyland, my very first choice is Belvoir Anaheim. The reason? I come back because the wonderful service that we receive, especially from the bellmen/shuttle bus drivers. They are EVER so courteous, wonderfully pleasant, and full of humor. They make you feel like family!! Thanks Pavel, Bill, and Manuel, and the rest! I always want to come back to see them, they make my stay an enjoyable one! Hotel is conveniently close to Disney.

everyoneShouldKnow: The rooms are clean and the beds are very comfortable.
title: Belvoir Roanoke Hotel
comment: This hotel has a great location, and the bedding is so comfortable and clean!

title: Under Construction
comment: Folks considering this hotel should be aware it is under construction, although we were not told in advance. This the type of construction that will definitely affect your stay and your comfort.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff was great and overall experience good
title: BAthroom
comment: Bathroom fixtures need updating . Shower was hard to turn on and off. The sink drain stopper wasn't functioning and the "towels" were a little worn---not plush and a little too aged for this type of hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: staff is great..Alex, Jameel, Stephanie, alyce
title: another week
comment: Good visit as always..new guy Jameel at the front desk has really caught on quick..very personable and overall good guy..always calls me by name and very attentive..

title: Would go back again
comment: The Big Kahuna Service by the pool staff was the best!!!! Loved going to the beach with our chairs and towels. But the best service was the water and fruits they delivered to us at the beach. I always looked forward to it.

everyoneShouldKnow: Well trained staff--welcoming and professional and fun!!
title: tell all your friends!!
comment: Welcoming professional and attentive staff. I shall return!! I love the parking service!!!

title: Plumbing Room 918
comment: Imagine sleeping in a room where the water did not turn off in the tub? One of the staff members removed the drain plug.

everyoneShouldKnow: Manny at the front door was THE BEST!!!!!
title: Interesting
comment: The hotel was very nice. The room was somewhat small, but the amenities were satisfactory. The staff was cordial, and very accommodating! Drop-off/pick-up was quite difficult due to location, but the staff was responsive to all my needs.

title: Excellent three day stay
comment: The food was consistantly excellant. I was amazed that several hundred people at the conference could be served three meals a day so fast and yet be so good.

everyoneShouldKnow: For being so close to a major attraction - disneyland, there is a lot of room to strech out.
title: great time
comment: we liked being close to disneyland. my granddaughter loved the pool. I'll definitely return.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you want a view, be sure to request a lakeside room
title: hotel excellent - club level a disappointment
comment: I recently traveled with a colleague who had mobility issues, and so booked the club floor to allow easy access for breakfast. The food offerings in the club were minimal, with limited offerings and really below par pastry choices. The attendant seemed not to have been trained and was invisible most of the time we were there for breakfast. The second morning we opted to eat in the hotel's main floor restaurant, which is well run and serves above average food. The dinner there the night before was truly excellent, and the service was as well. The whole hotel facility was very attractive and well-maintained. The views on the city-side rooms, however, are not city views but rather look out on the hotel parking facility. I attend a meeting in Duluty every year, and next fall will request a lake view room not on the club level.

everyoneShouldKnow: The service is aweful and the building is not ready for guests.
title: Hotel is not ready
comment: This Belvoir does not meet up to the promise that Belvoir typically does. The staff are shared between multiple properties and were not knowledgeable about the Belvoir location. There is no club room and no wireless internet available in the rooms. The rooms are small and were quite dirty. Do not eat at the restaurant, it is not worth it.

title: This hotel has a great location
comment: Due to its close proximity to the Disney parks, I frequent this hotel often. I love the overall look of the hotel. The lobby area and grounds are beautifully kept, however the bathrooms are in need of updating and housekeeping is never great. Overall I would recommend this hotel to adults traveling to Disney whether it be for business or pleasure.

title: Great Location, Nice Facilities and Friendly Staffs
comment: This hotel is located just within 5mins walking distance from Pier 39 Fisherman's Wharf ! I like the young vibrant color themes of the rooms and the full coffee maker set with quality coffee bags available inside the room. Internet connection in room chargeable as well as parking for guests - I guess this should be reviewed and considered as waiver for guests. With BPG recognition.

title: roxylola
comment: just need more free weights!

title: Great service
comment: Helped us a lot about tourism information

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff went out of their way to help make our stay outstanding.
title: Where in the World is Joe Bonamassa - Why, Waikiki of course!
comment: Followed Joe to Honolulu as he played the Hawaii Theater and stayed at the Belvoir Waikiki. E-V-E-R-Y-O-N-E of the staff went out of their way to make our stay fantastic. From the moment checked in - to 5 days later when we checked out: perfect service. Poolside: waiters/waitresses gave us anything we wanted, even if it was just a glass of water; Surf rentals: Big shot out to Jeff who took excellent care of us; finally all of the staff at the Kai were simply the best. Concierge helped us with a rental car - and recommended spots to stop at around the island. Truly a top-notch hotel.

title: Awesome Stay
