comment: Hotel exceeded my expectations. The staff was awesome. They were friendly and thoughful. The housekeeper saw that I had used all of the coffee in the room - she left me additional without my asking for it. That is service! She exceeded my expectations.

title: Great Experience
comment: The hotel was very comfortable and the staff was really nice starting with the shuttle ride from the airport to the property.

title: A Great Place to Stay
comment: This recently renovated hotel is a wise choice for anyone staying in the D.C. area. Cleanliness is evident everywhere and the staff is attentive and friendly. Their is some road work going on nearby which makes getting in and out tricky, but I would not fault the hotel for this. Overall it was a great stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Really nice people and a very clean
title: favorite tampa hotel
comment: We enjoyed our stay in quiet rooms of this hotel, restaurant service was good with a clean atmosphere. Nice lobby, reservations where in order as planned.

title: Great location & nice hotel
comment: My only two complaints would be the small elevator and the hotel was a little overpriced. I did however love the location in reference to Harvard.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is very large, though the staff I dealt with mitigated this through their friendly demeanor and caring efforts.
title: A great business location in Chicago River North
comment: A superb location and excellent service mark this large and very comfortable establishment, in Chicago's River North neighborhood. Staff is engaged and friendly; and appear to be truly concerned about the welfare of guests. Rooms on the club level are well appointed and relatively large. The only off note was the quality and preparation of the evening "snacks" offered in the Club Lounge in the evening; though the continental breakfast in the morning was fine.

title: nEVER LET DOWN
comment: NEVER FELT AT ONE TIME ANY ISSUE OR CONCERN WOULDNT BE ADDRESSED

title: Close and Comfy
comment: Great area, comfy beds. I would really like to purchase one.

title: Good Location
comment: Nice hotel in heart of Philly.

title: Rates
comment: They charged us for the resort service package, Which included the workout room. The guy checking us in never told us that it was mandatory. It was an extra charge on top of the room rate. I am very angry about this, since there are so many other fees already that go along with the room rate.

title: Love this hotel
comment: This time was the best of all, others were good but the one was exceptional

everyoneShouldKnow: This property is due for a renovation!!!!
title: spa tub not working
comment: stayed for 2 nights. oct 6. Received postcard promising a call back before our visit, never got a call. Room was average condition, the in room spa tub was broken and I was not informed of this condition. This spa has obvious evidence of long term neglect. The knobs are frozen with rust and the buttons stuck in the depressed position. As an SVO, this is not what I expect from Grandbourne properties. This is unit 3057, to save you sometime in researching.

title: Great stay! 'Looking forward to our return visit.
comment: From check-in to check-out, the staff and management did all they could to ensure a comfortable, no-hassle stay. The choice of pools and their locations were excellent, and were well-supported by towel and cabana services, and a variety of restaurants and fast-food services within easy walking distance. Combined with clean, comfortable rooms, as well as an excellent downtown location, this hotel is a winner!

title: Loved the Club Lounge
comment: The upgrade to Club floors more than paid for itself with the daily breakfast and evening snacks

title: Convenient location
comment: Comfortable, convenient and friendly

title: Tiny and untidy
comment: The bathroom was tiny and not practical for a women to get ready in. My wife had to do her hair and make up in the room because of the lack of counter space and fan to unfog the mirrors. My biggest complaint was the first impression of seeing stains on the toilet seat and sheets, and the grimey bathtub drain. The staff did act promptly to address them, but after scrubbing the toilet informed us that the stains could not be removed because the age of the facilities. My thought was that it is a reasonable expectation that your toilet seat be stain-free. It is not very expensive to buy a new toilet seat.

title: Great stay!
comment: What a nice hotel, full of friendly staff members! Loved Phyllis on the concierge level. She was a fabulous hostess! I was lucky enough to be in the hotel for the managers reception. What a nice touch! I wish I could have stayed longer.

everyoneShouldKnow: You need to stay the night to really appreciate the rooms, but ultimately they're as nice as the common areas and the staff.
title: A slowly growing pleasant surprise
comment: First impression of the room wasn't great - carpet, sheets, bathroom fixtures, entry lighting.

title: Great staff
comment: The staff are always ready to help in any way they can. My only complaint was that it took the shuttle too long to pick us up at the airport.

title: !st Trip to Atlantic City
comment: The location was a bit farther from the Boardwalk than we anticipated, but the weather was great so we enjoyed the extra walking. It would be helpful to have a back entrance so you don't have to keep walking around the block to get to the heart of Atlantic City's Boardwalk area.

title: Great service
comment: Always your staff received me with a smile!!!!!

title: Dated, Noisy and far below expectations
comment: I stay in NYC almost every week. This time my wife wanted to come along so I thought booking into the Belvoir would be a nice upgrade from many of the slightly lower rated hotels I normally stay at near Chelsea. The Belvoir was allegedly recently remodeled. I found the room to have a dated feel, very poor fit-n-finish and worst of all it was incredibly noisy. We could hear entire conversations from guests on both sides of our room (and they certainly were not shouting). This was even on a club level floor. In summary, for the money and the other reviews, I expected so much more. I would not recommend this hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is friendly, professional and helpful
title: The hotel is a great place to stay
comment: The hotel is clean and the room was very comfortable. The front desk staff was very helpful, informative, professional and nice.

title: Great Location for Long Island
comment: The hotel is located well and easy to get to. The staff is very helpful, but I found that many of the rooms (even on a preferred floor) are in need of repair (torn and stained carpets) and refurbishing. Overall it is a good value.

title: very nice
comment: Very nice, my new favorite hotel

title: Poorly maintained and managed hotel
comment: The room keys didn't work reliably. I had to have mine replaced three times during my 5-day stay. There were cockroaches in my 42nd floor room. The elevators broke and were unoperational for about two hours. There was construction noise in the room during the day. The WiFi which should have been free to those of us on the Club floor didn't work reliably and when trying to log on it kept prompting us to pay for it. The overall impression is that of a poorly managed hotel. Just not a very pleasant stay.

title: What a location !
comment: Having the hotel literally at the airport was extremely convenient and eliminated many hassles. Was also very handy due to late night arrival - I could just go to the hotel and did not have to worry about getting a rental car and driving to a hotel after midnight. Concierge staff was very helpful - drove me to rental car pick up and delivered luggage to my airline departure lounge. Hotel needs to be marked better inside the airport.

everyoneShouldKnow: Be patient the staff has plenty of keys
title: How many room keys does it take
comment: We've been locked out of the building parking lot and are room multiple times each and every day. A 4 night stay has given us more time at the front desk than Disneyland and are room we are very frustrated. We had to get new keys this before going to breakfast the over and under is how many keys today. Overall the hotel is clean, convenient, and offers a lot.

title: Review of hotel
comment: We have stayed at your hotel many times and will do so when we are in the area again.

everyoneShouldKnow: PLAN TO WAIT FOR A ROOM WHEN YO ARRIVE
title: CHECK IN
comment: WAITED ALMOST 3 HOURS TO GET A ROOM. FRONT DESK PERSON SAID THEY WOULD CALL MY CELL WHEN IT WAS READY, BUT THEY NEVER DID.

title: Good location, dining and room service options
comment: good location, i.e. proximity to Riverwalk, very comfortable beds, nice TV/cable/movies on demand options, variety of room service food options, nice dining options, nice decor

everyoneShouldKnow: Don''t trust the staff's knowledge of the hotel
title: Great hotel but staff stupid
comment: The hotel was very clean and upscale. But, when we checked in we were told breakfast buffet closed at 10:00AM but you could order from the menu until 11:00AM. The next morning I went for coffee at 10:15 and the waiter confirmed the above. When we went to breakfast at 10:30 , a different waiter told us the dining room closed at 10:00AM. When complaining at the reception desk the young lady told us that was wrong that breakfast was served until 11:00AM but was surprized to check and find the resturant was closed. Anyone in charge?

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice hotel with terrible front desk staff.
title: Front desk staff
comment: Your front desk staff is slow, unprofessional, and rude. In addtion, as a Platinum member I expect to be able to get a little bit of a late checkout instead of being told that I have to leave as early as possible because a convention is coming in and rooms are needed.

title: A lot of families stay here; hotel oversells parking
comment: I stayed here this week and was on the club floor, room 757. It was at the end of the hall, so it was quiet except the times when children would run up and down the hall screaming and playing.

everyoneShouldKnow: The access from freeway is great.
title: Appreciated Upgrade
comment: We were upgraded to a suite which showed its wear. Room was clean and spacious. The big problem for us was this Suite is close to the elevator shaft, so we listened to the elevator come go and the whole time we were there.

title: comfort and quiet
comment: .We were celebrating our 25th anniversary and we were pleased with the room. It was clean and comfortable. There was only two small negatives and one was the toilet ran all the time so we had to make sure we kept the bathroom door shut. We paid extra to have the extra amenities that we didn't really use but did enjoy the cont breakfast and appetizers in the evening. We ate in the restaurant the first night, we felt rushed and it was not that great so we ate out after that.

title: Great Stay
comment: Wonderful staff quiet floor and quiet room. Clean. Enjoyed our four nights.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location is amazing, its a really resort
title: A dream....
comment: I this month, me, my wife and my son could fulfill a dream of a long time. Thanks to everyone in Dolphin who contributed much of it to happen.

title: The location is amazing!
comment: The hotel is wonderful, but the location is to write home about!

everyoneShouldKnow: It's in prime location in the heart of Philadelphia and is easily accessible to restaurants and city hall.
title: Great location
comment: The Belvoir is in a great location, but the rooms need to be upgraded. The carpet looked very worn. The bed and bathroom were clean.

title: Nice facility-Front Desk Staff NOT
comment: This hotel was great overall but for some reason my guest key was demagnitized from club level access which is great. I proceeded to the front desk where I found three agents standing there doing nothing as thier was no guests in line. They saw me and just kept talking among themselves virtually ignoring me. Finally one of the agents said "yes" I explained the situation, no smile, no apology, just "give me your id" I complied and she said "next time try not to demagnitize the key". Now I'm not an idiot and I even told her as such. What a waste of an employee. Attitude all the way.

title: Simply the BEST!
comment: Another fabulous stay. This hotel is truly a gem. I cannot thank the staff enough. I am tending to spend my weekends here. Its home away from home.

title: Amazing
comment: This hotel went above and beyond for me and my wife's anniversary. They made our time there feel magical.

title: Over priced and old
comment: The hotel was old and the bathrooms were gross. The bedding was nice but overall it was overpriced for the quality.

everyoneShouldKnow: fitness room equipment was a nice surprise
title: Needs Improving
comment: Room had scratched furniture, the ironing board was almost unusable, desk chair was broken, low water pressure in shower

title: Excellent employess
comment: Hello

title: Nice place
comment: . . .if you don't mind being a bit away from the centre of things. Clean and quiet. I wanted to have a "late" check-out (only 2 hours!) and they wouldn't/couldn't accommodate my request, which was inconvenient for me.

title: location is great
comment: Poipu location can't be beat. However the facilities are lacking in many ways. Only one pool with service and drinks, garden rooms are far away, parking is far, only one restaurant with breakfast and dinner as option, rumfire seriously lacking in service while staff servers cranking complain about no buffet. Gym is horrible.

title: conservation
comment: water conserving shower fictures a positive but air condjiioning discharge to shower stall leeds to a cold shower

title: Great location
comment: Belvoir Society Hill is a great hotel in a great location. Staff are attentive, helpful. Food was very good.

title: Old, Creaky Belvoir - needs total makeover
comment: It started at checkin - 10 pm, 5 people in line, and every checkin seemed to take 5 minutes. How can checking into a hotel be so hard? The check in staff were clearly not happy being there.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Service is great and the staff is so helpful and friendly
title: Perfect location
comment: I have been staying at this hotel since it opened over a year ago. I am a guest here at least once a month and love the location, the staff and the comfort. However over the last couple of months the hotel seems to be not as clean as it was and the rooms are looking worn.

everyoneShouldKnow: the King rooms do not have a bath tub only stall showers
title: major problems but staff fixed them
comment: Anytime I am inthe area i stay in this hotel - this trip I incurred many problems -

title: Avergage level of room for premium price
comment: the room was average for the quality of the hotel. the amenities were limited. the tv did not work well. there was no hotel guide - electronic or printed for the services available. the rooms were noisy with sounds very clearly coming from the room vents., Very limited dining options at the hotel if you are not attending an event on site or want to eat off site. The front desk was always understafffed and service was delayed due to this.

everyoneShouldKnow: Far from downtown. Middle of nowhere.
title: Average Stay
comment: I'm a huge BPG fan, however, this Belvoir didn't meet the standards I'm used to. As a Gold member, I was put in a ground floor room across two meeting rooms. That's not welcoming for a Gold member. The ventilation system is quite loud, and The location is far, not walking distance, to downtown Burlington. There are other hotels right near the water with updated accommodations. BPG should consider opening a hotel closer to downtown. I only stayed here because I'm an BPG Gold member, but if I weren't, I would have easily chosen another hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very convenient to the convention center
title: Growing pains
comment: I'm not sure how old this hotel is, but it has a few improvements to make in order for me to ever consider coming back. While here for a conference, I was constantly surprised by the lack of preparedness from the hotel staff. We pretty much took over the hotel and it was obvious that there would be peak times when more staff was needed but this was not thought through at all. While the staff (for the most part) was friendly, the complete lack of manpower meant that a simple sandwich and soup lunch took me almost two hours or finding a package took 47 minutes (yes, I timed them).

title: Hotel staff not customer friendly.
comment: The hotel staff is not at all friendly. Being a platinum member and frequent visitor, everytime I check in, I need to approach the front desk to correct my corporate ID and room rate. Never were given upgrades with reason that we are sold out. Room quality, especially bathroom, shower are below average and do not command the price they ask for. Folio is not sent promptly upon check out and need to call requesting the folio. Charges appear on credit card only after two weeks post stay which makes it increasingly difficult to settle with weekly expense report. Staff needs to learn a lot about courtesy and customer service. A simple smile sometimes does the magic rather than showing emotionless faces everytime

title: Good Location
comment: PRO:

title: GOOD,CLEAN COMFORTABLE
comment: Stayed 4 nights perfect for just needing a place to sleep. Courtious staff. Good location.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Location and Old World Charm!
title: Perfect Accomidations for Boston Vaca!
comment: This hotel met all of my family's needs and more for our Boston vacation. Great location to enjoy Cambridge and connect to the rail. This Grandbourne property had all of the luxuries plus the old world charm!!

title: I would not recommend this hotel
comment: I have stayed at this hotel once before for business and this was my second time. This time I was expecting it to be better than my first because I was the highest customer loyalty platinum rating. The room was dirty, there was female long hair in the sink and the tub when I checked in, I was put next to the ice machine (as a platinum member I should receive an upgrade), and the walls are paper thin. I was not able to sleep at all in this hotel.

title: Priced too high
comment: Loud noise in the room, some of the plugs didn't work, carpet frayed, bathroom tile chipped, ironing board cover looked like it was about 20 years old, etc.. I travel a lot for work and enjoy being a Grandbourne member but this hotel needs a major face lift.

everyoneShouldKnow: The view of the falls in the back is breathtaking!
title: Overall great experience
comment: This is a beautiful hotel with very friendly staff. My one complaint was the television reception. The satellite/cable signal was poor.

title: Excllent hotel, close enough to NYC
comment: I stayed in this Belvoir for 5 nights during October 2012. It's a great hotel with very good amenities and I would definitely recommend it to anyone!

title: SD Belvoir Bay View
comment: Excellent hotel, comfortable bed, wonderful view over the marina. However, the dining area was closed (Tuesday night) and the bar food mediocre. A real annoyance was the charge for wifi in the room.

everyoneShouldKnow: lovely location with many restaurant choices within hotel or within walking distance
title: 2012_10_SMTAI Stay
comment: very comfortable room. Non-carpeted floor in room was a bit sticky. Room was comfortable and otherwise clean. Robe and slippers would have been nice

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel is like a huge Central Station and they have no control over what's going on in there.
title: Incredulity!!!
comment: The first room we were put in, smelled of vomit and the air conditioning wasn't working. We were told there were no other rooms available to move.

title: Great property
comment: Really nice hotel. We got upgraded to one of the nicest suites we have seen.

title: Parking
comment: The property as a whole is wonderful. The employees are friendly and provide excellent service. I especially like Laslo in the club, and Tomasa and Laverne in the breakfast buffet. Front Desk staff are also very accommodating, friendly, and professional.

title: Citytrip New York City
comment: During our city trip to NYC we had a very pleasant stay in this Belvoir Hotel. I would certainly recommend this Hotel for a trip to New York City. Especially to escape the hustle and bustle of Manhattan after a day in the Big Apple. Friendly personnel. Good service. Clean rooms. Fresh towels every day. Shuttle-service to Secaucus railway station was good. Total trip time from hotel to NY Penn-station was +/- 40 min.

title: Hybridguy
comment: Overall good hotel experience.

title: Convenience at a good price
comment: Very convenient location at a good price

title: Goo location but need to focus on room cleaning service
comment: The location and over all service was good. however the quality of the rooms were just average. The bed that I had was making too much metal / spring noise and during my 4 days of stay the cleaning staffs didn't refill the lotion or soap. I had to call the room service and get them everyday. This happened 2 weeks in a row. Also the bathroom was not cleaned properly, tub and the shower curtains had strains from day 1. MUST improve on cleanliness.

title: Hotel has beautiful views.
comment: Hotel staff is great[ Our first room had defective room cooling and we were transferred to another room which was excellent. Restaurants are minimal with little choice unless you leave the hotel and then it's a drive. View is very good and would recommend.

title: Restaurant does not match hotel quality
comment: Our party of 5 ate dinner at the Grubsteak Restaurant, and although the server was very nice, and the manager solicitous, the experience was a C-. There was loud techno-rock music playing in the half empty room, which was a huge disconnect from the tablecloth, roses, silver setting (although our tablecloth had a noticeable red wine stain from a previous occupant.) We asked the manager twice if he could turn down the awful music and he said he would 'see what he could do.' Huh? The music stayed the same volume throughout. The service was very very slow (15 minutes to get our drinks, 30 minutes to get our first course) even though the place was not nearly full. I think our waitress, kind but unschooled, might have been serving the whole room. The manager mostly chatted up the customers, without actually doing something constructive and helpful.

title: really nice
comment: The hotel and room was beautiful and I would recommend it for anyone visiting Birmingham

title: Great experience for pre/post cruisers
comment: The Belvoir is in a great location. You can walk to everything around Old San Juan, including the pier for your cruise. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was great and so was the Chicago Burger place.

title: Upgrades Taken Away
comment: Evidently, the hotel takes away upgrades after giving them away if you check in late. Make sure to arrive early to accept your upgrade. With certain BPG hotels, they will upgrade your reservation which shows in the BPG app and then upon check in, the upgrade goes away.

title: Hidden Restrictions
comment: I was there with a large conference and we were told that we got a percentage discount on restaurants/bars at the hotel. But apparently that discount (along with the $5 green coupons) only works on things OWNED by the hotel. No matter that nowhere is it posted on these other establishments IN the hotel that they aren't part of that. Also, everywhere you turned the restaurants/bars were all listed together with no distinguishing notes. In the books in the rooms, in the envelope for your key card, everywhere all of the eateries in the hotel were listed together. It wasn't until one unfortunate night at one of the non-included restaurants that we got our bills and learned that we couldn't use discounts or vouchers. Ouch. My wallet is still hurting.

title: Excellent hotel
comment: When I booked the hotel, I did not know what to expect, since I had never been to New Orleans. When we arrived I was impressed by the whole place. Even though there was construction the place still had very little issues. The best part was how close it is to Bourbon Street without being near the noise. Next time I come to New Orleans, this would be the hotel I will stay at.

title: Nice hotel, but...
comment: The hotel is definitely nice, rooms are clean and spacious (in the tower). However, my major issue was the unfair practice of charging parking fees. The website states that the hotel charges overnight rate (ridiculously overpriced, given the availability of parking spaces around the hotel), which lead me to naively assume parking during the day is not charged. Alas, it is, and the price is still high. Very, very, very unfair. What is the point of paying so much for room, and having to pay high parking and internet fees in addition? Also, the air in the rooms (in the tower at least) is extremely dry, which creates difficulties for anyone not used to desert conditions. On the plus side, there's no need for the hair dryer.

title: Disappointing Stay at Belvoir
comment: I was extremely disappointed with my last stay at this hotel last week. While I have stayed in this hotel 12 times in 2012 - this past stay was very disappointing. In the morning, I noticed the ceiling in my bathroom was leaking - I notified both the front desk and the service desk to address immediately. As a result of the leak, I had to wrap up and check out very quickly and the staff did not do anything to address the inconvenience for the leaking occurance. While I know nothing could be done to prevent the event, the staff reaction for the inconvenience was extremely disappointing, especially given that I have stayed at this hotel 12 times this year and am a premium member with Grandbourne. Very disappointing stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel is friendly and the staff goes above and beyond to make you feel like family.
title: Our home away from home for 10 years
comment: Perfect in every way. We have stayed at this hotel every October with the exception of a couple. It is our favorite place to vacation and the Belvoir Sandkey is the best place to stay. The staff treats us like family. They address us by name and every need we have is met immediately! Love the coffee bar in the room! Thanks for taking such good care of us!

title: Belvoir Waikiki October 2012
comment: xx02 suite is very nice. Bedroom view is of Diamond Head and evening bar music is easily heard and enjoyed. Sitting area view is of ocean. Both rooms have lanais which are great for sitting, viewing, snacking and just plain relaxing. Wi-Fi is spotty around the property. Wi-Fi is included in the daily extra charge but it is a 24 hour period. One must go through the sign-up hassle every day when the connection drops out. The connection should remain for the duration of the stay.

title: Disappointed
comment: We had previously had a great experience with Belvoir the week before in Philadelphia, but this hotel was very disappointing. We couldn't check in when we arrived, and were told to come back a few hours later; the bag check room was full; when we were finally able to check in at 5.30 our room had not been cleaned from the previous occupants - and it took over an hour to get it ready. Parking was highway robbery and not clear at all that the charge is per 24 hours - and as we were 2 hours over is was $100 not $50. Room service charges turned a $12 kids meal into a $27 expense - before tip! Location is great but with hundreds of hotel within yards, not worth the $400+ charge we incurred ($500+ with parking).

title: sbaprada
comment: Loved the hotel, the staff were very friendly and attentive. Room was very clean and beds were comfortable. Only one complaint I could hear the people in the next room clearly when they came in at 3:00 in the morning. I had an adjoining room so maybe they are not as sound proof.

everyoneShouldKnow: Only good thing was it was close to airport. Nothing else was good.
title: Not worth $$
comment: First of all, we were 8 couples "deep" in the check in line, and only one desk person was working. Secondly, once we got to the room finally, tried to contact guest assistance, and took 4 seperate tries calling to finally reach someone. Thirdly, with the amount of $$ we spent on our room, you would think it came with FREE Wi-FI... not the case, have to pay 14.00 a day ! Never staying again

everyoneShouldKnow: Rooms are small but nicely furnished. Construction next door blocked our view of the area.
title: No Hot Water!
comment: Hotel informed us after checkin that hot water was unavailable - a situation that lasted for two days. As our stay was for three days, our first time in New York, and we were very disappointed. On checkout, we asked for some adjustment in the charges, which were made after some negotiation with the staff on duty.

everyoneShouldKnow: Book early - it may be sold out!
title: Great features
comment: The Belvoir Music City hotel is a great location on the East side of Nashville. Convenient to the airport, the facilities are immaculate, and the fitness center is open 24 hours - including pool and jacuzzi.

title: Hotel In remodel and Disorganized
comment: I had previously reserved a room through my company's travel site. Upon arrival no rooms were available. The staff gave me assigned me a room. Once I reached the room and opened the door I found that the room was under construction (part of the wall between rooms was missing) since the hotel is being renovated. I understand that mistakes can be made. So when I went back to the front desk to ask for a different room, I was told that there were no rooms available and that I would be sent to a another nearby. The sherton hotel paid for the hotel room and my taxi to the hotel and back the next moring. I still did not have a room until almost noon the next day. If the hotel new that they had an oversold situation that they would give preferance to BPG members or at least contact to us that rooms are not available. I would certainly not recommend this hotel until they finish their renovation and maybe their service will improve

title: Great stay...every time!
comment: When in Sioux Falls, this is the place!

title: Great hotel, great price, great location
comment: I have stayed in LA before, paid more money and wasnt that great of a spot. This is close to the airport, with a great shuttle service. Also easy to get around from there with the red trolley service coming past for $5. large room nice pool and gym and great help from staff

everyoneShouldKnow: It is not what it appears from the outside
title: Too many things went wrong
comment: I wanted (and expected) to like this hotel, and the lobby looks great, but after that, it is disappointing. We stay 60+ nights a year in hotels, and this one came up short of expectations.

title: The treat I needed
comment: The treat I needed to compensate for a heavy load from work.

title: Great location downtown and great service
comment: Friendly staff. Good location. Very clean. Nice fitness center with a view on top floor.

title: Overall, OK
comment: Overall, my stay was OK. The location is great; the staff for the most part friendly, and the fitness center was one of the nicest I have ever experienced in a hotel. The valet service was below par. When I checked in, I was promised 5-7 minute retrieval service. The average was 15 minutes with some being much longer than that. What I found very upsetting was I was promised a comp for my long wait one day, a very nice offer, but when I returned home to see my bill, I found it was only lip service as I was charged. Not enough of a problem for me to not recommend this hotel, but one that soured my experience.

title: food wine festival
comment: great beds , great location, overall helpful staff. apart from on the friday when i purchased wrist band for the food wine festival , i was misinformed that the wrist band was for 2 days , when i tried to use it on the sat i was told i couldn't . i spoke to a member staff and he he was adamant that no member of his team would of told me it lasted for 2 days , why should i lie? yes he did give me a half price meal. but still annoyed that i was made out to be a lier

title: Recent Stay
comment: Visit was very good. From the first moment, being greated by the bell hop taking my bags straight to my room, parking my car and his follow up on questions was outstanding. Evening bar area entertainment was (piano man) was very good. My only suggestion is bring your own pillow. Pillows are very soft, very soft. Might seem silly to some.

title: Excellent customer service
comment: I travel to the New York and New Jersey area every couple of weeks and I always choose the Belvoir in the Meadowlands because of the great customer service I receive each and every time. The staff makes me feel welcome and always greats me with a smile.

title: Needs new carpeting
comment: Carpeting in the room was filthy dirty (gross). Either new carpeting or a thorough cleaning is needed.

title: Location is wonderful
comment: The location was very convenient to restaurants and the Bourbon Street.

title: Good stay
comment: The hotel met all my needs, and I would stay there again.

title: Great hotel
comment: This hotel is a lovely gem in the Belvoir chain. The location was perfect for our needs--easy access to Hoboken and NYC, Our room was well-appointed and thoughtfully configured, with an amazing view. The staff members we met are a true asset to the company--courteous and professional, but warm, gracious and accomodating as well. We plan to stay here whenever we are in the area.

everyoneShouldKnow: no hot water in the morning
title: no hot water
comment: on both 10-17-12 and 10-18-12 there was no hot water in the morning and barely any water pressure at all.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location--near to nice restaurants, which is a good thing because the hotel restaurant is not anything to write about.
title: Pleasant stay
comment: The beds, carpeting, furniture, security, gym, and TV were very nice.

title: Postive Experience
comment: I travel fairly often for both business and pleasure, and I was very pleased with your hotel. The bed was incredibly comfortable, and the staff was very accommodating. The food was excellent. I would highly recommend this facility.

everyoneShouldKnow: Clean and quiet hotel with friendly staff.
title: Productive and Restful Stay
comment: It has been a few years since I stayed at this hotel. It was lovely to see the facility was even nicer than the last time. My room was super clean. I really appreciated the facility-wide wireless. I had a nice glass of wine compliments of BPG points in the bar and the bartender was very courteous. The woman working in the club lounge was friendly and very nice to visit with. She knew other regular guests by name and they were all happy to see her. The buffet luncheon provided for our meeting was very good. This hotel was so quiet and pleasant. I really enjoyed my stay.

title: Nice place, expensive steak
comment: Everything I would expect to have at a hotel except a $20 steak was there for my enjoyment. The $35 steak was great but would have been better with a little rosemary. :)

everyoneShouldKnow: On the same side of the higway as the airport saving you transfer time. A great little hotel
title: An Airport Hotel Gem
comment: The Belvoir JFK actually exceeds all of my expectation for an airport hotel, especially in NY at JFK. This is the first time I have stayed a hotel at JFK airport. Granted my stay was for only one night and I was expecting a mediocre, 2 star stay. The hotel is a great little gem.

title: Just Average
comment: My stay here was satisfactory. There is a lot of construction around the area and traffic can be a challenge. The check-in process went well and the staff was great in assisting. There was a constant line at the check-in desk and no more than two people at a time were available to check guests in. I was surprised to find that there was not a concierge desk or someone available to assist with area information or restaurant recommendations. I finally found someone who was able to assist. Overall, the stay was average.

title: The hotel needs some upgrades
comment: There were several issues with the hotel which was brought to the attention of the operations manager, sales manager and convention services - such as linens were put on tables that looked like someone slept in them - a guest room was left open all day by the maid - I had a jr suite which was not considered "club" level - seems like when you book a suite the amenities should be club level. The table in the room likes like it should have been in a camp. I stayed in a club level room the first two nights and the chair in the rooms had frayed fabric. Just not what I expected from the Belvoir in Burlington.

title: Great Location with updated rooms
comment: Clean, safe, perfect for business or pleasure.

everyoneShouldKnow: Proximity to parks and dining is above average.Plenty of dining options.
title: Great for Vacation - Not the best for business travel
comment: This hotel has great features if you are on vacation ( proximity and transportation to parks, access to Disney Boardwalk area, restaurant and dining options, etc), but lacks some of the common features per price point for buisness travel. The rooms were clean and updated, but simple things were missed in maintenance related issues ( running toilet and clogged shower drain ). In fairness, the service and response to these issues was quick and the front desk staff was accomodating. As a final, but important comment, wifi access, even for basic low bandwidth tasks such as email with VPN, was terrible.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you have a post 5 PM arrival, Belvoir overbooks, so make sure you call ahead to ensure that you have a room.
title: Reservation not honored
comment: Bumped to another hotel on first night after arriving around 9:30 PM. Belvoir overbooks so make sure that you call ahead, even if you paid in advance.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great place for banquet and meetings.
title: Clean and Comfy
comment: The hotel was clean and comfy. The staff was not very friendly or helpful and the price of a pot of coffee was $22.00. I don't recommend the room service. However the room was beautiful and clean. The complimentary appetizers and the staff on the 42nd floor was very good. The food and service in the banquet room was very good.

everyoneShouldKnow: Not in easy walking distance to Old San Juan, but very close to the convention center
title: Amazing staff
comment: I travel fairly often and have never encountered such a helpful staff. They helped me track down a bag left in a taxi (it took a couple of hours to locate!) and were very attentive and quick to respond to a maintenance problem in my room (turned out to be one of my electronics making the noise, not anything wrong with the room - embarrassing for me, but the staff was very nice about it).

title: Nice stay
comment: Nice fitness room & pool. Comfy bed. Quiet. Surprised there was no mouthwash or shower cap, but other than that a good stay.

title: Belvoir Chicago Airport
comment: Everything was 100 %

everyoneShouldKnow: The bay side view is amazing!
title: Hotel Staff Exceed Expectations
comment: Every staff member (at the front desk, in the dining room, in the lounge, and in the restaurant seemed to take personal interest in making my stay a great experience. Your hotel is beautiful but your people are your best asset!

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel has impeccable staff service and great in-room dining food.
title: Exceeded my expectations
comment: I had a fantastic experience at the Belvoir Puerto Rico on Convention Boulevard. The location and facility were beautiful with views of the Atlantic, Old San Juan, the bay, and, of course, the convention center. The in-room dining was top notch, and the staff provided consistent, prompt, and friendly service. I would be very happy to return.

title: Overall one of my favorite places to stay in New York City
comment: Whenever I stay here I reserve a Club Level room. This time I was disappointed in the food they offered in the lounge. In the past there was a nicer assortment of snacks. Same with the continental breakfast. Need to step that up to what it was in the past.

everyoneShouldKnow: If your attending an event at the convention center its convienient.
title: A little below expectation
comment: Wasn't impressed by check in person. Bearly smiled, not engaging, didnt seem genuine. Didint seem to want to go the extra mile. Maybe I've stayed here too often. Check in mediocre tone set stage for rest of stay.

title: Very Nice
comment: Overall the hotel was very nice. The pool area is very relaxing and it helps that it's located on the 4th floor so you are not getting any road noise.

title: Great Stay @ Belvoir Great Valley
comment: I stay in a hotel probably around 100 nights per year. This is one that I continue to stay at due to the excellent service provided.

title: Comfortable/clean hotel
comment: This hotel is always comfortable and clean and staff is very friendly and accomodating.

everyoneShouldKnow: They will do all they can to make your stay memorable! Staff is wonderful!
title: A simlpy beautiful resort for all occasions!
comment: We stay at this resort when our family visits Kauai. Wonderful location. Staff is very helpful and friendly, making us feel welcome. We love this resort. Enjoyed breakfast at Rumfire, not impressed with dinner. Felt it was not a good value for what we ordered, although the food was good. Overpriced!

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel doesn't meet my expectations as a Grandbourne Preferred guest.
title: Misleading appearance
comment: Walking into the Belvoir it looked lovely. The lobby was nicely decorated, clean and comfortable. My room initially looked ok, but closer inspection proved me wrong. The carpets were caked with dust, the comforter was torn, and the bathroom was filthy. There were holes in the walls where pictures had been. I was assigned a different room that obviously not been cleaned. Beds had been stripped and dirty towels were on the floor. The third room was fine, but this stay does not make me want to return.

title: bathroom and hallway
comment: bathroom ceiling was falling down in room 822. also access door in ceiling would not stay closed. there were several black marks on the walls in the hallway. i know it's a new hotel and i would expect better from a Belvoir.

title: Nice hotel, but....
comment: Everything about this hotel shows a major upgrade. I ordered room service many times, and it was always impeccable. The maid service and cleanliness of the hotel is unmatched. And the beds and general feel of the hotel are excellent quality. On the negative side, however, these rooms desperately need an upgrade to their air conditioning system. The system would flip on about every three minutes for a minute or two and then kick off...which wouldn't be a problem if the system wasn't so damn loud. The first night or two, sleep was hard to get for this reason.

title: Hotel has friendly staff
comment: I stayed at your hotel for a week and was

everyoneShouldKnow: good location for downtown and suburbs
title: Nice place to stay
comment: Great location! Friendly staff and very comfortable beds....bathrooms need some updating but overall a nice place to stay.

title: Great hotel
comment: lucked into staying at this hotel and would stay at it again when in San Diego next.

title: Overall it was Good
comment: My stay at the Belvoir was overall a good stay. The only thing that I'd like to point out is that my very first stay at the Belvoir Tampa Airport was 10/7 -11/2012, and the phones did not work properly. I called down to have maintenance fix it, but I explained to him that it still was not fixed. That was not huge issue, but it was not resolved. Secondly, my next stay was 10/14 - 18/2012, and I noticed that the stay well/eat well booklet is out of date. The channel listing is out of date and the room service menu is also out of date. I called down after a long day at work to order room service, and nothing from the late menu was available in the hotel. The Room Service agent explained to me that the menu's in the room are out-dated and that the hotel no longer serves those items. Overall, I really like this hotel, there are just some upgrades that need to happen, or remove the booklets and re-print a temporary menu and channel listing or anything else in the booklet that may now be out-of-date.

title: Great Location
comment: Comfortable room - great location

title: Disappointed
comment: For $300 a night I expected more than I received.

everyoneShouldKnow: location for the price is a very good value
title: shabby and low level staffing
comment: I was a bit disappointed in this hotel, one of two TVs did not work, carpet soiled, front desk did not answer the phone. Although a BPG preferred guest I was initially not booked on the preferred floor. When I moved rooms, because of the not working TV, I was given a room on the preferred floor and the room was in better condition. I don't understand why sheets and mattress pads don't fit the mattress - I had to remake the bed because of wrinkles in the mattress pad which were lumpy. No water, rare for a Belvoir, and the vending machines are not ideal. Location of the property is great, wish the hotel was nicer so I could confidently recommend.

title: comfortable hotel - poor connectivity
comment: Hi,

title: Excellent
comment: Excellent location and extremely nice ammenities

title: Amanda
comment: Hotel was beautiful and great location. In walking distance to some great restaurants and shopping. Had cocktails in the lounge and used the fitness center and bother were great. If I had any complaints it would be that the hotel was so big and my room was so far from the elavator but lucky I have no problems walking.

title: Courteous and Friendly Staffing
comment: This was my fourth trip to the Shearton Plaza. All members of the staff were courteous and friendly. Having spent 3 prior weeks at the Belvoir Plaza over the course of the previous 6 months, most members of the front desk and concierge staff were familiar with me as well as remembering many on my idiosyncracies.

title: Exceptional staff & Customer service
comment: The front desk staff was very helpful. I want to be sure they are recognized as I think they provided exceptional customer service.

title: Amazing staff
comment: This hotel staff was the most pleasant and helpful . From the moment we arrived at the front door through check out. Great job!

title: Belvoir OKC
comment: Hotel needs updating. Walls very thin - noise from next door and hallway quite loud.

title: Excellent service!
comment: This well situated gem of a hotel was quite a surprise. I was re-directed here when my hotel of choice was booked. What i found was a great location, fantastic restaurant and non-stop customer service. I wish I could remember the names of all the staff who helped meet my needs. Faisal at the front desk set the scene with an offer to call if I needed any thing. When I asked about the area, I was even offered two options for jogging trails, one of which went past Arlington National Cemetery for quite a moving experience as I walked between it and the Naval Monument.

title: This hotel is a great value for the money.,
comment: My experience at the Sheration Novi was very nice. Room was sizable and the bed extremely comfortable. The morning breakfast was outstanding as were the fitness facilities.

title: review
comment: the wireless internet service in room 402 was inadequate - spotty and slow

title: Great Room!
comment: Appreciated the upgraded room (1553, 10/15-19 )with great views to get me away from the noisy elevator and busy hallway.

title: Conference
comment: I really enjoyed my stay. The room was larger than I expected and included wired internet access. I've stayed in hotels where the wireless internet was poor quality and it was nice having solid wired internet. The waiters in the restaurant were very friendly even when I came in for dinner ten minute before closing time. The cable TV channels were very good.

title: A pleasant surprise
comment: Everything about this hotel was first class. Staff was helpful from first contact through checkout, the room was large and comfortable, temperature controls actually worked. Bonus surprises - the best hotel bed we have experienced, and free shuttle service to the local area.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Ocean Front View, dirty floors
title: Great Ocean Front View
comment: Our view from the first floor ocean front was remarkable. We sat on the patio and watched a great sunset with our complimentary maitai. The room was very spacious. That being said, the flooring, both tile and carpeting needed cleaning. They looked like they hadn't been really cleaned in a very long time. The tub was also a little crudy. We only stayed the one night but let a manager know about the needed cleaning the next day when checking out.

title: great staff
comment: Staff was very nice and helpful. The hotel guess printer was broken, but staff allowed us to print off at their printers.

title: Club Level Rocks
comment: My wife and I had a great stay on the 18th floor which is club level. The room was nice but the service and food was spectacular in the club room. If we have the opportunity again we would love to go back.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is great at all levels.
title: Staff is amazing
comment: The staff was like none we have ever experienced. They were all happy, friendly and interacted with each other as if they were very good friends. They went out of their way to make sure that the guests were well taken care of. The shuttle from the rental car area was a blessing for us. This location should be used as an example of excellent leadership, team building and customer service.

title: Excellent stay
comment: An excellent location, great service and staff. Which is why I choose a return stay

everyoneShouldKnow: stayed 8 nights bed sheets not changed - bed done only twice making me believe that bed sheets were changed when in fact where NOT all that time although no sign at the door for your green program - I to sleep in the 2nd bed and sheets not changed - just bed tied up - making me think that if I have not used that bed again the next customer would have slept in sheets I have used- also strange vibrating noise in the night - Also no practical except for soft light in foyer has no switch for table or bedside lamps have to go in the dark to table to turn the light on-and I was in the renovated room!!!! upon arrival no door man to be found to bring my baggages in the room had to carry them myself
title: lousy and deceiving cleaning service
comment: stayed 8 nights bed sheets not changed - bed done only twice make me believe that bed sheets were changed when in fact where NOT all that time althought no sign at the door for your green program - I to sleep in the 2nd bed and sheets not changed - just bed tied up - making me think that if I have not used that bed again the next customer would have slept in sheets I have used- also strange vibrating noise in the night - Also no practical except for soft light in foyer has no switch for table or bedside lamps have to go in the dark to table to turn the light on-and I was in the renovated room!!!! upon arrival no door man to be found to bring my baggages in the room had to carry them myself

title: Great hotel but.....
comment: Club Lounge was only item that was below expectations. At breakfast time everything was excellent, however, not enough room for all guests to sit and enjoy the meal. Otherwise it was excellent.

title: The hotel staff was great
comment: The staff at this hotel was amazing. My expectations were met way above what I needed. I loved this hotel and would stay here again.

title: surprise upgrade
comment: Had a great room . Was given a surprise upgrade with jacuzzi tub that was a hit with my girl . Nice Lobby Bar to unwind in and start the evening .

everyoneShouldKnow: There are fees for your pet to stay in your room.
title: the hotel has a great location
comment: At check-in, we were not informed of the $75 fee for pets.

title: Great Hotel in a Great Location
comment: Staff is friendly and helpful. Good location with easy access to Old Town.

everyoneShouldKnow: Terrible wireless if that's important to you.
title: Good Hotel With Worst Wireless on the West Coast
comment: Pros:

everyoneShouldKnow: You could live there, as it has everything you most likely have at home.
title: Fitness Center
comment: Your fitness center was spectacular. Available when I went to work out, which was about 6:00am. Great equipment and the room was neat and clean, and well maintained.

title: Fun In The Sun
comment: The Disney World Dolphin was everything I had hoped it would be. Outstanding service, exceptional dining, very comfortable accommodations and ideally located to combine business with lots of family fun.

title: our room was right above partyville
comment: We got a room right above the hot tub and pool. Very noisy and busy all day, but it did have a ocean view ( which we payed extra for ). Would be great scenery for a young bachelor man. Our friends got a ocean view but in the quiet secluded part of the hotel. It was very nice and made us jealous.

title: Adequate
comment: This hotel is perfectly adequate. They still charge for water. Elevators are slow and the stairwell is filthy.

title: Great, central location!
comment: The hotel is conveniently located in the middle of downtown Seattle. It is close to bars, coffee shops, shopping and the Convention Center. The rooms are pretty nice and clean with most of the standard amenities. I was somewhat puzzled by the fact that the mini bar refrigerator seemed to be locked and disabled and had been replaced with a basket of non-perishable goodies sitting on top of the dresser. Maybe this is part of the hotel's attempt to conserve energy, and if so, it would be a good thing. I appreciated the fact that you can trade one day of room service for 500 BPG points or a $5 food/beverage voucher as part of the hotel's "Green Choice" program. This is a great way to go!

title: Great Upgrade!
comment: I rarely write reviews because I stay in so many hotels it would be exhausting to write each time. However, I genuinely appreciate all of my past experiences at the Belvoir Nashville Downtown. I particularly enjoyed the upgrade to the presidential suite this past Thursday - one night only, but a great experience. More importantly, the staff is very warm and welcoming, from the front desk to the concierge lounge and the valet. Thank you!

title: Aging
comment: Check in room 515 and it had a musky smoke smell. Checked intyo another room. I had rooms 514 and 527. Couch ripped and torn, lamp shades coming off not screwed on.. Screw holding hot water knob together on sink. Electricity went out on Thursday night. Had to request shower drain plug in 514. Toilet wouldn't stop running, had to adjust myself to make it quit.

title: 3rd floor- 3 nites
comment: Everything was great.....view is weird, but that is the nature of the structure. Lobby is lovely.

title: Great hotel
comment: This Belvoir was a pleasure to stay in: friendly, efficient staff, a large, comfortable room with very comfy bed, and dining facilities with good food for breakfast and dinner. I received a corporate rate and could not have gotten a better value for the money. Very impressed.

title: Staff was quite helpful
comment: Rooms wre not really that clean. There was a pill on the bath floor in our one room and arounf the edges of the room and bath alittle dirty.

title: Never fails to impress
comment: Every time I go to Key West I always stay here. From the manager Fotis who sent me my cell charger after I left it in my room to the front staff Jonthan and Tameka were great and even Taylor G are amazing. These individuals are amazing which I have to give Fotis extra recognition for hiring these people for seeing that they will go above and beyond to treat there guests great. Cant wait to stay there again soon.

title: 1st time to Nashville
comment: This was my first time to Nashville and I enjoyed my stay. The maid did a great job cleaning my room and laid all my personal items neatly.

title: Excellent Service
comment: I stayed for a business conference and greatly appreciated the staff's assistance when I needed copies of a document. Service was always with a smile and positive attitude. All facilities were excellent...including the shuttle service that took our group to a downtown restaurant for dinner and back. I appreciated the ease of parking in an underground lot. Our group received first-class service all the way.

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice hotel but the rooms are getting old. Need to be remodeled soon.
title: Good location
comment: Rooms needs to be remodeled. Great internet access in the common areas.

everyoneShouldKnow: Have a great location, excelent service, a beautiful pool, You need to visit this hotel.
title: Great experience!
comment: I love everything! love everything in the hotel, the room comfort, the location, the staff hospitality, the pool is amazing. Everything was fenomenal... Congrats! I want to come back!

title: Great stay
comment: I had a top shelf experience.

title: Needs remodeled...desperately
comment: This hotel is in severe need of a remodel. The odor in my room was horrible, the carpet is stained throughout, the sheets weren't pressed.

title: Hotel is extremely nice
comment: Hotel Lobby is beautiful. Rooms were very nice.

title: Hotel staff was awesome
comment: Friendly helpful staff!!!

title: Temperature of the meeting rooms in the basement
comment: It was way too cold and the only way to warm the room was to leave the door open which was far from ideal. Otherwise the accommodation was fine although somewhere to sit and have a drink would have been nice rather than having to transport stuff from the bar to the lobby.

title: Hotel has an acommodating staff
comment: Everyone we asked for help went over and above what they needed to do. Wish I could remember names. If you have an event at the hotel ask for Ali or Christine. They were both great!

title: Great
comment: Wonderful location and great service

title: One Night To Many
comment: Hotel was beautiful to look at but stay wasn't up to expectations.TV wouldn't turn on. Smoke detector over the bed had a red light flashing the entire night which may not bother other people but drove me a bit crazy.One woman working the bar and there was about 30 people there.Flew in to SFO, drove almost an hour to hotel, and the ride was shorter than the length of time it took to order chicken fingers and receive them. At least she was really really nice!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't plan on shopping for souveniers at the hotel
title: If you're ever in Jacksonville
comment: It is a nice property and very comfortable. My only suggestions for improvement would be a broader menu in the restaurant or room service and a "bigger" gift shop.

everyoneShouldKnow: great location, great staff, can be a GREAT deal
title: A good rate turns into a great stay!!
comment: For the rate - really great hotel. We got a discounted deal that made the value ratio scream. Overall a 3.5 to 4.0 facility. Parts are dated, others updated. The 4" tile in bath really should be obsolete from a Belvoir brand hotel for example..... really old and it shows. Other bathrm updates are apparent. The staff was really great. The doorman on Friday morning was so pleasant (young kid), really quite energetic, engaged, informed, and interesting. Front desk was helpful and did the little things that made the stay a little more special.

title: Belvoir burlington
comment: The room door (242) looked like it had been broken down and not properly repainted, their was an obvious large stain on the coffee table that looked like blood spatter (unnerving); room service was unreachable (waited 15 minutes then decided to leave the hotel for dinner), check out receptionist was not competent (she couldn't print receipt and also emailed the wrong receipt)

title: This hotel is 5 star plus
comment: Overall, the hotel was exceptionally customer friendly. My every expectation was met.

title: This hotel needs remodeling
comment: The room I got was very spacious but street noise was very annoying.

title: Business Traverler features
comment: Business Traveler minded!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Toilets may be a little weak.
title: What a treat!
comment: Although the toilet overflowed at 11:53 pm we were quickly moved to another room. This room was not as nice as the first-- we requested another room for the next 2 nights. The check-in clerk was most accommodating and our new room was clean, quiet and comfortable.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you don't have a phone charger, you can go to concierge to rent one. When you return it you get the rental fee back off your bill. DOUBLE CHECK TO MAKE SURE IT WAS REMOVED FROM YOUR BILL.
title: Conference stay
comment: The accommodations at this hotel were good. The hot and cold water were reversed in our bathroom area so that was quite annoying. The food in the Picabu Buffeteria was average in taste, expensive in price and then an added service charge on top of that. Convenient for the Boardwalk. If wanting to go to Downtown Disney, you will have a long wait for the shuttle during peak times and make SEVERAL stops before you get there. Long wait for the shuttle on the ride back to the hotel as well. Visit was for a conference and the conference facilities outstanding as was the food. The staff who served our meals at the conference excellent.

guestFrom: Denver Tech Center, Greenwood Village, CO, USA
everyoneShouldKnow: Superior rooms, with nice beds and comforters. Staff works hard to make guests comfortable and at home. Lounge and attendant did not seem important in choosing this hotel, but is the reason I stay now. Emma is awesome.
title: Great Hotel In Denver Tech Area
comment: I've been at this hotel over 60 nights as of right now. Always a great room, and they make an effort to upgrade platinum members. Emma in the club lounge keeps the lounge in top top shape and gives the hotel the feeling of home, where you have somebody to hang out with before heading back to you room. Staff and "home feel" of the hotel is what I value most.

everyoneShouldKnow: Some of the machines weren't working in the fitness center, prices too high in the restaurant.
title: Way too expensive for our company, but I liked it
comment: Restaurants--Shulers is way too expensive--company rejects the dollar values for regular employees who are dinning in this restaurant. Better to take a plane to central Africa than to eat here. But I liked the hotel and its location.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't pack a bathing suit, unless you want to go in the hot tub. But the hot tub packed out with kids because they didn't like the cold pool.
title: Disappointed
comment: Stayed here on 10/20 with my son. We stay twice a year for the pool in a poolside room. My son is Autistic and loves to swim. However, the pool was way too cold. I complained three times. Was close to checking out and going elsewhere because it was pitiful to see my son stuck in the room after I paid $143 for the pool. I was assured after complaining the third time that they were bumping up the temp but it would take a while. Went out to dinner and when we gave it another try it did seem a little better. My son even went in. However, in the morning, I thought it would be even warmer, and it was just as cold as when we first arrived. Got in and got out immediately. Been staying here for a few years now and the pool used to be so warm. I don't know what happened. I had a problem last time also, but figured I would give it another try. I will definitely be finding another hotel on Long Island with a warmer pool in the future.

everyoneShouldKnow: it has potential but they cannot rest on their laurels - their lack of care for their clients will become known
title: great potential w/average accommodations
comment: i was so excited to stay at the Belvoir Downtown in Dallas and was thrilled with the view and the city. the room barely had enough towels not enough soap, cups, and no amenities other than shampoo and conditioner. Not only that but i asked for a late check out and the operator begrudging ly gave it to me - however my key was turned off prior to the time of my check out and i had to high tail it down to the registration desk - cut in front of other guests and asked the person at the registratioin desk to correct this as i had people waiting for me to transport me to the airport - that was inexcusable! i was only waiting for transport and didn't want to wait in the lobby that was totally rude!

everyoneShouldKnow: Fine, full-service hotel near Sonoma wine country
title: Great hotel, lousy Cisco room phone
comment: I was very happy with my stay at the Belvoir Sonoma County, with one annoyance: the Cisco IP phone in the room was just awful:

title: great stay
comment: Extremely comfortable bed and pillows.I stayed one night and wished i could've stayed longer.

title: Time Square was great
comment: Loved being there. My room had pretty thin walls as I could hear the neighbors on there phones, talking in their room or in the hallway late in the evening. That would be the only place of improvement. Staff was great. Breakfast was great. Really enjoyed my stay

everyoneShouldKnow: The commute options from this hotel are excellent for being in the NYC area.
title: Nice hotel, but a little lacking
comment: I was very pleased with the location of this hotel and the view, but I was let down by my treatment as an BPG Platinum member. I was "upgraded" from a King room to a Double room without my consent.

title: Honorable hotel
comment: The manager and staff made my latest stay a very comfortable stay even with my busy business schedule while staying at the hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Hotel has dirty carpet and the front desk workers are not very helpful. They do not honor reservations. The hotel is in desperate need of a remodel.
title: Lousy Hotel
comment: My husband and I stayed at this location over the past weekend.

title: poor parking set up
comment: I found the three small parking spots before the gate near the entrance to be very frustrating and terribly inconvenient. On top of that, I had to pay for parking!

everyoneShouldKnow: The side of the hotel facing I-90 (Mass. Turnpike) and Rt. 9 is extremely noisy.
title: Avoid if possible
comment: - Staff generally disinterested and unresponsive.

title: Disappointing
comment: This is he third time this year we have stayed here and it is the fifth year we have come to this hotel. So far this year the tv has not worked properly the last 3 visits. The refrigerator in the room was not working. Our reservation was lost although they did find s a room.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Yard House has remarkable food and beverage.
title: Most spot on service ever!
comment: I travel. I work in the hospitality industry as an event planner. I am incredibly critical of hotels, restaurants, service etc. This hotel was by far the most spot on Belvoir I have ever had the pleasure to stay in. Service was impeccable. They exceeded all expectations in every area. i was impressed!

title: Best Staff Ever
comment: I have stayed in many Grandbourne properties & this was by far the friendliest, most attentive staff I have ever encountered.

title: Need local flavor
comment: The hotel and room were very good. Given that it was Hawaii, it would have been awesome if there were some local flavor to the room - like the decor, drinks/snacks, soaps/shampoo etc. They were all good, but they were probably what I'd find at any Belvoir anywhere.

title: Great staff!
comment: The staff here are very helpful. You can count on them for sure.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location right by the ocean
title: Great comforting ocean view
comment: I could just sit in the lanai, watching the waves come and go with gentle breeze on my face and do not need to go anywhere ordo anything else. I also enjoy the Yoga class very much.

title: excelente location,good rooms, gym
comment: The hotel has a good value for the price

title: Check In and Lelevators
comment: Excellent hotel, great food, nice location, rooms are very nice (balcony!), very good service and food in the Club Lounge on the Club floor. Would have been nice as a Gold member to have a room ready on the Club Floor when we arrived at 12:30. Also two of the elevators were not working properly (doors failed to open on the first floor). I reported that to the front desk.

title: Promotion for members
comment: I was lucky for having chances for booking the Hotel. At first there was no room available for that time. So my friend let me know the availability. Why don't you accept alarming system to the guests for the availability of setting time especially promoted rate.

title: Great hotel for meetings & Conferences
comment: With the exception of rather high prices for everyrhing (eg:valet parking is $46/day) this is an excellent hotel.The staff provided sterling service and the facilities met the needs of the convention I attended. My suite, which was used for business meetings and entertainment of customers and vendor-partners, was on the small side and my attached bedroom could only be entered thru the suite itself as there was no seperate entrance from the hallway. Also, only one bathroom for both my sleeping area and the "meeting room". In spite of these shortcomings I'd reccomend this place for meetings and as a place to stay in downtown Boston.

title: Restrain your expectations
comment: Beds were uncomfortable.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff go above and beyond to assist your needs
title: this hotel helped with me needs
comment: When there was something missing they were there quick to assist me. And when I had a question they answered it clearly.

title: Another Great Stay
comment: I do work with QVC and have had the pleasure of staying at this hotel several times this year. Each stay gets better and better. The highlight of each stay is most definitely the staff. I'm always greeted with a big smile at the front desk - and the van drivers are excellent. Because of our around-the-clock shows on QVC, the team at The Belvoir are so accommodating with cleaning the room and all of my other needs. Thanks so much to the team!

title: Solid location
comment: If you have need to be in the Towson area, this is the only real choice. That said, I've been staying at this property since the 90s, and it hasn't changed much. A few things:

everyoneShouldKnow: Do not book a banquet here due to below expectations in food and beverage.
title: Only one opportunity to look at before booking a banquet
comment: The restaurant food was excellent; however, banquet food was below average for lunch (two occasions) and dinner (two occasions). Meat was dry and the marinade left much to be desired. The bread was hard and dry at every meal. The sandwich contents was okay, but paired with a thick dry hard bread. The coffee had sat in the pot so long that it was thick enough to cut with a knife. The room, service, and staff was excellent.

title: relaxing and enjoyable
comment: The hotel far exceeded my expectations in every aspect. Thequality of the food at the restaurant was a great surprise.

title: hotel
comment: Everything was very pleasant. Staff was very nice. it was a nice arrangement since the event we attended was being held there.

title: Hotel has great features
comment: With the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in, to the spacious room and bath, made this a wonderful stay.

title: Amazing sunsets!!
comment: Good things

title: Wonderful conference hotel in Alexandria, VA
comment: This hotel was a wonderful location for our conference. It is located within a good walking distance to local restaurants and old town shops along with some nice neighborhood places too. The beds in the hotel are some the most comfortable Ive ever experienced.

title: Amazing!
comment: I traveled with my two kids (5 & 3), my husband, father, and mother-in-law. We spent 8 nights at the Dolphin and couldn't have asked for a better experieince. The hotel is extremely well-maintained. The rooms are beauitful and remarkably clean given the number of (messy) small children who pass through. The staff was super attentive and warm, from the check-in, bell services, housekeeping, pool staff, valets, etc. The pool area was like a mini waterpark and my kids couldnt get enough of the water slide. They also provided free life jackets for my beginner swimmers. The location was unbeatable. We used the free boat service to Epcot and Hollywood Studios, and were albe to walk to the Boardwalk in minutes. We also booked the basic, least expensive rooms ("resort view"), but still had a decent view of the Epcot fireworks. I would highly recommend the Dolphin!

everyoneShouldKnow: It is far from any attractions (pubs, restaurants)
title: The hotel was okay
comment: For a short business stay, this hotel was nice. It had attractive grounds and room was comfortable. it was far from attractions so not recommended for tourists.

title: Downgraded My Room Without Telling Me
comment: I checked into the hotel around 11 PM. When I opened the door to my room I discovered two full beds rather than the king bed I reserved. I'm 6'2", so a king bed makes a difference, which is why I reserved it.

title: Excellent Stay
comment: This is a well maintained property with an excellent staff and great accommodations. We stopped here on our way south and liked it so much that we decided to stay again when we return north. Thanks to everyone who made our short stay so enjoyable.

everyoneShouldKnow: The location is great and it has potential, but the hallways smell intensely musty and the rooms are not especially clean.
title: Needs an overhaul
comment: This place is showing its age. The hallways smell musty and the carpets are dirty. Even the lobby looks rundown, even though it was once nice. My room was not clean when I checked in. There were candy wrappers in the room and dirt in the drawers. The bathroom hadn't been cleaned.

title: Very Good Stay
comment: The staff could not have been more accommodating. I had but to walk in the lobby (not even near the front desk) for someone to ask if I needed anything. Everyone was so attentive, and I appreciated the fact that they often responded with tellling me it was their pleasure to answer my question.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is directly next to landing runway at airport.
title: Overall experience
comment: The room was nice and hotel was too. The fitness center was very nice and had plenty of treadmills. The room service (dinners) were over priced. There was no statement or checkout procedure other than waiting in line forever to get a statement. The hotel is in a nice location if you have no desire to walk downtown as it is several miles away and located directly next to the landing strip at the airport. So, airplane noise was horribly loud!

everyoneShouldKnow: Good hospitality and very good room comfort with excellent ocean and city view.
title: Love this hotel
comment: I like the room comfort and staff of this hotel. They addressed all my needs and even waived my parking fee.

everyoneShouldKnow: I was surprised to find out it was located right in the mall!
title: plesant stay
comment: The staff is friendly and helpful. The hotel is clean and easy to navigate. It's very conveniently located

everyoneShouldKnow: Very clean and friendly. My room smelled fresh and was very comfortable.
title: Almost Perfect Stay
comment: The hotel and room were clean and comfortable. The staff were very respectful and welcoming. I was counting on using the shuttle bus as transport to the Making Strides Against Breast Cancer event. I, along with several other guests, ended up waiting about 1 hour. Some of the ladies had to go inside to ask where the bus was. It would have been better if the staff had come out and notified us of the delay due to a traffic jam at the event. After the event, I ended up walking 5 blocks back to the hotel because the shuttle bus was nowhere to be seen. Communication regarding the shuttle was poor.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location great for shopping, Newbury Street, more.
title: Fix the bathroom please
comment: Hi, overall the room was fine, but the bathroom, beyond being really small, needs some repair work. Looks like the room above it had a big flood and the damage to the wall above the toilet is very obvious. Ceiling's a mess as is the wall paper where it meets the ceiling. Really unnecessary for a major hotel chain.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very close to Nova South East University, clean and well decorated.
title: Very clean hotel and nicely decorated.
comment: Very nice and clean hotel and the staff was very helpful with directions we needed. The chicken sandwiches were the best I ever had.

title: Refurbished; great location; pet friendly
comment: I travel to Tampa often and have stayed in this hotel several times over the past 8 years. It was challenging staying during the renovations, but well worth the wait. The refurbished rooms are great. Upper floors (BPG?) are hardwood. I usually travel alone (except for my dogs) for business, but the 2 room suite would be excellent for multiple people or a family. The rooms have all the amenities you could ask for: fridge. microwave, lounge area, large workspace, 2 TVs. The bar is decent. Breakfast is so-so (it's a hot breakfast buffet, but overpriced for the quality of the food). Front desk staff and housekeeping is very friendly. I would recommend this hotel and stay again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great place to watch your favorite game in the Draft Sports Bar!
title: State Fair was fun, your hotel made out visit great!
comment: We were staying in Dallas to go to the state fair. We really enjoyed the hotel and the Draft Sports Bar. Very nice place to watch a game. We visited the pool and fitness area, and the Breakfast buffet was wonderful. Thanks for a great visit.

everyoneShouldKnow: Level of service, comfort, restaurant, accessibility and parking are excellent.
title: Excellent Hotel
comment: The service at this hotel was exceptional. The staff was friendly, helpful, knowledgeable and friendly. The setting is lovely with a great view of the Louisville city skyline. The restaurant has great ambiance a wonderful outdoor dining patio; the food is delicious! The lobby and business center are modern and functional and the rooms are super comfortable. The parking is easy and downtown is accessible via a five minute free shuttle ride. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's a great location - within walking distance to all of the great shops & restaurant on the Plaza in Kansas City.
title: Great Hotel on the Plaza in Kansas City
comment: A great hotel in a great location. Fun staff!

title: Great Hotel with a better staff
