comment: This is our 6th trip to this Hotel. We love staying here since they have one of the best hotel staffs that I have ever met. They also remember who we are and are great with my kids. Its great to have a BPG Hotel like this so close to Disneyland.

title: renovations
comment: I would have appreciated being told that the pool was under rennovation.

title: Customer Service Excellence
comment: The night of our stay, a college football team was also staying at the hotel. Several times, our neighbors woke us up with rambunctious behavior. The next morning, the Manager, Nikki(?), resolved everything by listening attentively and taking action. We will definitely be staying here again if we are ever in the area.

title: Very nice
comment: The staff was eager to help with anything that you needed.Room was clean and comfortable and the food was good and reasonably priced.I would stay here again.

title: Conveinent Location
comment: Nice location but I did not get the room I reserved then they put me in a room that the air conditioning did not work

title: LOCATION- PEOPLE-
comment: I HAD A GREAT TIME AT TE HOTEL AND EVERYONE WAS NICE.

everyoneShouldKnow: They have the best staff and the recent remodeling is fabulous!!
title: Best Staff Ever!
comment: This hotel has the best staff that I have ever experienced in a hotel. From the drivers to the front desk to the restaurant staff to the maintenance staff, they are all outstanding!

everyoneShouldKnow: Easy access to Walt Disney World!
title: DolphinReview
comment: Overall, great experience. Cleaning staff seemed to do minimum cleaning - perhaps this is the new 'green'. Room was adequately cleaned, but noticed small things such as a coffee spill stain left on the tile, etc.

guestFrom: Fishermans Wharf, Pier 39 Concourse #2, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
title: needs improvement with housekeeping
comment: housekeeping removed all clean glassware from the room the first day, during the day. We had to request our glassware returned and then they only brought wine glasses. WE had a 4p check-out and housekeeping knocked twice within 10 minutes at 8a to clean. We had to call front desk to get them to stop.

title: Just OK
comment: Everything was wonderful during my stay. A major disappointment was that I requested easy access to elevators due to my mobility issues and this was not done. The walk to my room was dreadful!

everyoneShouldKnow: It's a great location to enjoy Disneyland fireworks, park there and use the hotel's shuttle for guests to Disneyland which is much more convenient than using Disneyland parking.
title: Great Place to Stay
comment: Our room was very spacious, but it would have been nice to have more "turnaround" space in the bathroom! For convenience, cleanliness, location and staff service, you can't beat it!

everyoneShouldKnow: It is convenient to the highway and within minutes of downtown for meetings, etc.
title: Great Location to Highway & Beach
comment: The room was spacious and bright. Although the linen was clean, the room smelled of cigarette smoke. Parking was convenient, however, the self parking lot was filled so I had to valet. I observed non-guests parking in garage and walking up the block. Breakfast was delicious, and convenient. I would stay again.

everyoneShouldKnow: The people and the service are wonderful
title: What a great hotel
comment: We loved the hotel. the service, food and attention to deatil was spot on.

title: Needs some improvement
comment: My overall stay was fine, but who sleeps in Full-size beds anymore? Most people have Queen-size or larger. Full-size is basically big enough for one person, not two! Also you should have a small refrigerator in the room. You shouldn't be charging $2.00 for a bottle of water; I can buy a case for $3.00! Also, charging $20.00/day to park in your garage when you are staying at the hotel is crazy. You should only charge guests a one-time fee. Breakfast in Dos Cominos was a little-pricey. Breakfast food should not be so expensive; I could have had a steak dinner with all the trimmings and wine for what I paid for pancakes, waffles, and an omelet.

title: Must Stay
comment: Excellent Customer Service, Great Room Service, Staff Exceeded My Expectations, A+++!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Stay for longer than 1 day and get pampered
title: Great feature + Superb Staff + Food = Will come back from California!
comment: What a wonderful experience ......we only stayed for one night from California.

guestFrom: Hartsfield Jackson Atlanta International Airport (ATL), 6000 N Terminal Pkwy, Atlanta, GA 30337, USA
everyoneShouldKnow: Only stay if you have your own transportation. Taxi from airport to the hotel also cost $25.
title: Hotel was fine but beware of transportation
comment: I stayed at the hotel on a layover from the airport. We got in late and my wife, who was pregnant and naseaus, needed something to eat and was not up for walking. The closest place was a restaurant directly accross the street from the hotel. (Although the next day I noticed a cafe sign in the hotel so they may have had food. Not sure, I wasnt told about it when asking the front desk.) The desk told us the hotel shuttle might not take us down their driveway so I had to use his friend at the cab company. $8!!!! to go to the end of the driveway! Horrible taxi partner that preys on tourists. Be carefull!

everyoneShouldKnow: It smells like sewage most of the time.
title: Escalating Disappointment
comment: Over the course of this year I have accumulated 12 stays and 17 nights at this hotel for business travel. Each stay my impression of this hotel continues to decline. Upon my most recent trip the hotel continues to battle a sewage smell that permeates the property, even to my floor on the 10th floor. Elite status is often overlooked by all staff and you have to ask repeatedly for your amenities, like free wifi. When dealing with the front desk you would think the lines for all BPG properties ring there and the staff at the front desk prioritizes phone calls over dealing with guests. On top of this, my most recent trip to the property was on business and there was a reduced room rate. However, I was traveling with colleagues and knew we would be working on some projects and requested a larger room via the phone a few days prior. They said I would have a larger room on the club level. When I arrived the room was no different than those I was traveling with and yet I was paying an extra $90/night for the Club Level. When I inquired at the front desk (after waiting for the phone calls to end) I was told they would check with the manager and contact me. Never heard a word from them. I believe in the BPG brand but when I travel to Des Moines for business in the future I will seek a different property.

everyoneShouldKnow: All hotels should try to replicate the customer service skills of the Belvoir Parsippany.
title: What sets this hotel at the top of my list is the service.
comment: The hotel itself is nice enough - newly renovated, comfortable beds, nice workout area. But this hotel has something very special that no other hotel in the area has - the best customer service. I stayed at this hotel originally because my previous favorite hotel was booked. I have been coming back ever since - even though it's a longer commute to my worksite - because of the way the pesonnel treat their guests. Derick at the front desk has never had a issue that he couldn't resolve. Mary in the club lounge is thoughtful and caring (I didn't make it breakfast one day because I was not feeling weland she sent ginger ale with a coworker for me). Even the housekeeping staff is on the top of their game - one stopped vaccuuming so she could find a plastic bag for my coworker who tried to carry more than she could. The people at Belvoir Parsippany make this hotel feel almost like coming home. See you all very soon!

title: Wonderful experience!!
comment: We picked this hotel,because we had a wedding to go to and this one offered shuttle service! I must say that all the service we received was great! From the checking in with Tariq, to the shuttle drivers our experience was a good one! The beds are most comfortable too!! We will stay here again for sure!!! Thanks!!

title: Pretty standard conference hotel
comment: This hotel is a typical large conference hotel. The facilities are generally nice. Unlike most other Grandbourne hotels, network access is free -- but like other Grandbourne hotels, it's not great. The low-flow shower heads have such low flow that it's tough to take a shower. Location is nice, with several interesting dining options in the plaza immediately behind the hotel and nice areas for an evening walk.

everyoneShouldKnow: Walking distance to the French Quarter
title: Very tough on business traveller
comment: I am a platinum member so I have stayed at many Belvoirs. There are no plugs available for any equipment- had to unplug phone to connect laptop - had to use wallplugs to connect phone and earpiece. Coffee maker is not plugged in - had to take it to bathroom to make a cup. TV is high-def but signal looks awful - screen does not fill so you have to reset each time you start. When TV comes on you have to maneuver to regular TV - very annoying. Last of all - no suitcase stand- so suitcase is on the floor - am used to 2 stands. Once again very annoying. Staff friendly, rooms very nice otherwise. Hope they fix these problems then I would give an excellent review.

title: The hotel has great features however needs to be upgraded.
comment: The hotel is a bit dated and needs much updating. There are several large stains and bleach spots throughout the capet in the halls on atleast 5 floors. The bathrooms need a better ventalation system, after showering the condensation builds up on the ceiling. The tub drains increadibly slow as well. I would say the staff is very pleasant and accomodating and the food is excellent.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is not clean and the service is very marginal.
title: I was VERY disappointed with my stay.
comment: I travel a lot all over the world and in the US. I have never stayed at your hotel. I was shocked the unhelpfulness of the staff, the unprofessionalism of some of the staff in meeting my needs in a timely manner, and most importantly, the lack of cleanliness in the hotel itself. The carpets were so filthy, I left my conference to purchase slippers so that my feet would not touch the floors. The hall way carpets were equally filthy with stain everywhere. I was very disappointed with your hotel and decided to start a blog on the subject of where to stay or not stay, customer service, good and bad, etc. I will never stay at a Belvoir again and will not recommend you to anyone. I went home and immediately took a hot shower. Lastly, there was an old water bottle that stayed under the desk in my room for two days. the housekeeper did not bother to throw it away. Who knows how long it had been there.

title: Way too expensive
comment: A $25 breakfast buffet is outrageous and the "green" spin is a great way to reduce labor cost.

everyoneShouldKnow: There is not a club lounge on this hotel
title: Great
comment: Great location and service

everyoneShouldKnow: It is located close to many restaurants and the convention center.
title: This hotel is perfectly located
comment: I was surprised at how stained and dirty the carpets and bedcovers were. The meals were mediocre and of the two ordered, one was 40 minutes late and cold. They did reimburse me for the meal. Their green program was a joke, because they promised a reward card, which never came and they still didn't clean the room. I usually stay at Belvoirs. This was the worse.

everyoneShouldKnow: Parking can be tricky if you arrive late
title: Great Location
comment: This was a nice place to stay, close to everything and shopping on 3rd St and close to the Santa Monica Pier

everyoneShouldKnow: The food is fantastic and endless!
title: Corporate Meeting Success!
comment: Starting with Aileen - I knew this would be the place. Then on to Amanda and Sissi who pulled it all together, dealt with every detail and bent over backwards to make anything I wanted happen- This was definately the best location I could have chosen. Ernesto was always there to make sure I had everything I needed. The wait staff was fantastic! The location was simple, the comfort of the meeting space was superior and the food was outstanding. I highly recommend them!!!

title: GREAT LOCATION
comment: The bathroom sink drain has a foul odor whenever you turn the tap on and the water goes down the drain, the smell comes back up at you. Two years ago we complained to the Guest services, and the put something down the sink, but it really didn't stop the smell. This year it is worse.

title: Helpful!
comment: I arrived without a confirmation number for the reservation I had made online for a room paid with BPG points. Desk clerk was very helpful, as was the person she called for assistance in clarifying the situation. A new reservation was made expeditiously. When I got home I could find no confirmation email for the original reservation, which may indicate that i never completed the original transaction or that it had been deleted. In any event, staff resolved the issue promptly, for which I send my thanks.

title: quick stay
comment: flew into miami around 9pm. shuttle was timely and plenty of staff to check in and help with bags.

title: Great location
comment: We came in from the desert to attend some parties. Some were at your hotel so staying there was very convenient for us. Rooms were very quiet and the staff was excellent and very helpful.

title: Excellent accomadations
comment: We really enjoyed our stay. The accomations are excellent and the staff was superb in their assistance.

title: convenient location
comment: We had girls weekend out. Beds very comfortable. On second day insufficient towels and toilet paper were left for us and had to call to get replenished. Service was quick upon request. Parking rates a bit high. At desk, needed better local knowledge of comedy clubs and prices/terms. Not very soundproof within building but soundproof to outside noise. Staff overall friendly.

title: Great Accomodations
comment: I had to be in the Suffern, NY area and found this hotel to be close and very comfortable. The staff was friendly and the accomodations were much better than expected, especially for the price. The food was better than average!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location; beautiful building; on the Electric Bus route.
title: Was dissappointed in the happy hour offerings at the Club Level.
comment: Appetizers were undercooked and not of the quality that I had anticipated.

title: Wish List
comment: The Hotel was beautiful! Score 10!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location for seeing downtown Chicago.
title: Club Lounge Staff
comment: During my one week stay I was treated like family by Connie and Alex in the club lounge on the 33rd floor. They recognized me from day to day and learned my preferences and saw to them being consistently met. But the best thing was the warmth of their smile and the genuine concern for my well being.

everyoneShouldKnow: customer service was exceptional, Jennifer at the front desk and Monique in the restaurant stood out as well as the rest of staff as very professional and attentive
title: Hotel with excellent customer service
comment: The location was the first reason this hotel was chosen, next time it will be because of the excellent service and professionalism of the staff. The staff was always available and very helpful in any way possible. Cleanliness is also important to me and felt the hotel was one of the best, both in service and attention to details.

title: Service!
comment: I checked in to the Belvoir on my birthday and was immediately greeted with "Happy Birthday". Verlilah checked me in, carried flowers which had arrived from a family member to the elevator, and found me a bellman (which I needed because of floral bouquet) to assist me to my outstanding corner suite.

title: Service was the plus
comment: I found the service at the hotel to be quality. Staff was friendly and responsive.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is one of the nicest in the area and has a staff like no other. Everyone was polite, smiled all the time and even asked as you were walking down the hall if everything was okay and would even tell you to just let them know if you needed anything.
title: This hotel was beautiful and the front desk clerks were friendly and very helpful when needed
comment: The hotel was clean and the staff was very friendly.

everyoneShouldKnow: the rooms are clean and staff is great
title: the staff
comment: the hotel was great however the staff was also great just loved the place

title: Excellent location
comment: the location, friendliness of staff and amenities were excellent. The breakfast was an excellent value.

title: perfect for epcot food & wine festival
comment: had a great time. Enjoyed getting away with my wife ....and no kids weekend. thanks mom & dad.

title: park and fly
comment: Excellent program for returning customer. Shuttle efficient and helpful.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Staff is approachable when needing help and questions answered.
title: Thank You
comment: Jonathan did well when I arrived to check in at the front counter. He was able to explain my confusion regarding the price.

title: Exceptional Customer Service
comment: I was truly impressed with the customer service from all hotel staff in Philadelphia. Everyone was very helpful, professional and went that extra mile to answer my questions, provide restaurant and shopping venues and directions all with a friendly smile. Your hotel staff could teach other hotel chains many things :)

title: This hotel is a great location
comment: Nice hotel and is great location for a night prior to boarding a cruise ship.

title: Great hotel
comment: Was there for business. Food terrific as was staff.

title: Great Hotel
comment: Great location, great service

title: My room
comment: Nice room. Upgrade to Club without asking for it was nice.

everyoneShouldKnow: Absolutely beautiful location and grounds complimented by an exceptional staff.
title: Paradise in Paradise
comment: Our first trip to Hawaii was everything we could expect and more. A large part of what made our trip so enjoyable was the accomodations and service provided by your facility and staff. When we return to Kauai we will definately be staying at your property again. In fact, we joined you travels program and will look for Grandbourne properties. Below expectations on food was only based on available hours, food quality was outstanding.

title: Great Hotel Experience
comment: Wonderful Disney Experienc

title: Old, smelly but great staff
comment: I have stayed at this hotel 20+ times. Unfortunately it seems to be going downhill in terms of cleanliness. The first room I was given smelled so vile, I needed to change it after 5 minutes. The second room was filthy. I ended up cleaning the sink myself. The shower was nasty. Staff has been very friendly every trip

title: Great Hotel but confused Room staffs
comment: The hotel was great but the room staffs did not change my towels for us. We put the change card on the bed and the dirty towels on the bathroom floors to be change. The towels has a lot of stains on it but what they did was us pick it up and hung it again. In most hotels that we stay in the past the sign that we new towels are to throw old ones on the bathroom floor which I don't understand why the room staffs did not understand that. They just hung our dirty towels that we threw on the bathroom floor back up. The reason we even notice was that the stains were on the towels in the same spots. This happen the whole time we stayed at the hotel

everyoneShouldKnow: Great combination of location and comprehensive hotel services.
title: Excellent staff!
comment: This hotel has all of the facilties you could want in a resort area- including a beautiful pool, nice bar, fitness center and spa, free Wi-Fi, business centre, excellent gift shop, and convenient location right next to the beautiful convention center. Above all, the staff were extremely personable and helpful. I cannot say enough good things about them - especially Antonio and Grisell at the front desk, Milagro in the gift shop, and the staff at Choices restaurant. They make me want to stay at this hotel again in the future.

title: Hotel has great room design and service
comment: Hotel room design is modern and classy.

everyoneShouldKnow: Within walking distance to a lot of restaurants, shops, and Disneyland, California Adventures,
title: A Very Nice Hotel!
comment: My two sisters and I recently stayed at this hotel and found it to be very nice. It was clean and housekeeping exchanged our towels daily. The bathroom with the sink is a little small, especially for three women trying to get ready. It was the only place with a mirror. It would have been nice to have a mirror in another place in the room. Our tv did not work when we first got there. We called the front desk and someone came and fixed it within 10 minutes. We never had any more trouble with it. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We were within walking distance to many restaurants, shops, Downtown Disney, and Disneyland. Breakfast was not provided, so we just went to the shop on the first floor and got a muffin or breakfast sandwich. It was a little expensive, but the food was good. We ordered room service the last night we were there; and the food was good as well. Overall, our experience was well worth the stay. We were pleased with the accommodations and would definitely stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: All rooms are suites with mini fridge, microwave, and two flat screen tv's
title: Great suite in a great location.
comment: Beautiful appointed two room suites with two flat screen tvs. Clean and friendly, will definitely stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: It doesn't matter whether you get a mountain or ocean view...both are great!
title: short stay
comment: We were there to attend a function at a private residence so we spent very little time at the hotel. Thought the hotel was nice & would have liked to take advantage of all the facilities, especially the pool.

title: Expensive
comment: For almost $300/night, the remote should have worked, shouldn't of had to beg for coffee. Doorways small, bathroom had no counter space . Elevators where slow and not equipped to handle the volume of guests there got pest world.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff goes above and beyond to assist you.
title: Pleasantly Surprised
comment: I have taken many trips to Atlantic City --- since 1989 -- and have always stayed at Casino hotels. For this particular trip I was attending a conference and the Belvoir was located directly across from the conference center so I decided to book my reservation with them in spite of some of the negative reviews that is on the website. I did not know what to expect, but since it was only one evening - I thought whatever happens I could grin and bear it. What a pleasant surprise - upon entering the hotel, it was very clean and the checkin time took less than 5 minutes. I did have some confusion about the location of the events for the meeting and asked one of the hotel staff, who didn't know the answer. But he went out of his way to find the answer to my question, which I thought was EXCELLENT customer service.

title: local one nighter
comment: I'm a local resident that stayed a night at the Belvoir Waikiki. They were super accommodating, giving me an early check in and a late checkout for kamaaina. Room and view was awesome. No complaints. I would definitely stay again!

title: Facility very nice front desk not
comment: The physical aspect of the hotel was lovely - nice rooms, great restaurant, gym and pool. Found the place a bit difficult to get around in as the many paths that lead to room/front desk are somewhat confusing between all the walkways and doors. However the front desk personnel were very disappointing in their attitude from the beginning of our stay to the end - three of our party there for a family event had trouble getting the group room rate and then to add injury to insult had to wait a hour after 3 p.m. check-in time to get the room thus giving them 45 minutes to get ready to go to event at 5 p.m. When approached about wifi problem in room and not getting access on computers in lobby merely shrugged it off by saying "it happens sometimes". One of the front desk staff was extremely rude in his tone vocally and with facial expressions from eye rolling to sneering when asked about room preparation for check-in and about way to get to a room in the C building because he had to repeat both answers. One of the most important qualities of a hotel is front desk which give the first impression to guests upon arrival and sadly to say the physical hotel can be beautiful and perfect but the personnel behind the desk is what makes a guest comfortable and eager to return when in the area again. Your hotel failed this test and I would not repeat a visit nor recommend your place to anyone traveling to the area.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great pool and location on the southern end of the Island.
title: Rumfires is the week link in service
comment: Food & sevice at Lavas was very good. Food service at Rumfires was poor . I saw empty beverages lacking attention often.

everyoneShouldKnow: Beware of parking. The lot is often full. And the "deluxe corner room" isn't worth it; stay on the Club floor or a regular room.
title: A regular guest
comment: I've stayed at this hotel at least 25 times, and have stayed at Grandbournes all over the world. It's great facility with excellent and attentive staff. It has one drawback: no flat-screen televisions on the club floor. For those of us who work in the room quite a bit, this is an annoyance. Time to upgrade, guys!

title: Last minute getaway
comment: I took a last minute trip to Ca to help a family member after a surgery so there was not time to plan for a car and all the details. The Concierges was excellent with helping me locate a rental car and get directions. They even returned the car for me. All I had to do was leave them the key. Very nice stay!

title: Belvoir Burilington Vt.
comment: Very dissapointed this stay. As Grandbourne Gold members, my wife and I have stayed at this hotel many times. On previous stays we had been given comlimentary breakfast vouchers. At check in I enquired about the free breakfast vouchers and was told that I would not be given any this stay. Very dissapointing. Apart from that the stay was good.

title: Disappointed
comment: My wife and I were disappointed by the staff's general attitude towards service. We did not have any room service for the first 48 hours of our stay. We had to call for someone to clean our room. The shower did not work properly. the bar tender refused to change the channel on the television when I was the only customer in the bar because one of the other staff members wanted to watch what they wanted. I have never been in a big name hotel that was less accommodating.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient, standard Belvoir with an excellent staff
title: Staff here is Excellent
comment: My room on the Club Level floor was very nice, although just a bit noisy as there is a fire station nearby, but only when the sirens go off. The bed and linens and surfaces were all clean, just a few dust bunnies around the corners; but nothing a better vacuum wouldn't cure. The front desk staff - EXCELLENT! Personable and extremely helpful.

title: Great place to stay for a business trip
comment: Extremely accommodating, friendly staff and a great breakfast. I would rate my stay way up there if it wasn't for the long strands of hair that I found in the bath tube as I was entering it to take a shower. Even though I know this an exception rather than the rule in Belvoir Hotels, I wasn't a pleasant thing to see and made me wonder about the cleanliness of the rest of the room.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is very convenient to get to.
title: My stay
comment: We stayed one night as a break in our trip from Myrtle Beach to Voorheesville,NY. Everything was good.

title: Wonderful!
comment: I was hesitant to reserve here since I had a somewhat negative experience several years ago. However, I reserved anyway since the location was right, the price was right, and I remembered the beds were unbelievably comfortable. I am so glad I made this decision-this stay completely remedied my negative experience from my last stay. Every member of the staff I interacted with was very kind, accommodating, and helpful. The beds were just as I remembered-heavenly! We had a fantastic river view on the 23rd floor, an unexpected upgrade. I will surely stay here when I visit Chicago again.

everyoneShouldKnow: We slept very well despite a full hotel with lots of celebrating.
title: Iowa vs. Penn State game
comment: Big football weekend and packed hotel but service was superb. Five stars all around! Thanks for a great stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: location to restaurants and main highways. great rooms and good value.
title: vacation etc
comment: was warmly received on check in. hotel was in a great location and all employees very helpful re directions etc. rooms very clean and comfortable. would definetly return when in that area again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Poor customer service did not do what should be done for a very bad situation
title: No heat woke up to 50 degree room
comment: Stayed here for a getaway night for my husband and I. Arrived to a very cold room. We thought the air was on so we turned it up to 80 to warm it quick. Went to bed soon after arrival because too cold to do anything else . Woke up around 12 am freezing still. Called the front desk with no answer. Woke up every hour I would say cold and uncomfortable. Called the front desk again around 830 just ready to get out of here with no shower obviously I know this room was around 50 degrees. Was offered $25 refunded or free breakfast. I asked for the corporate number and called them . I've yet to hear from them three days later . The hotel called back and offered $25 more back. I was still I satisfied and he took off another $25 and says he sent me an email for a future stay which I have not received. So in the end I paid $80 for a room with no heat still not happy. If anyone knew at checking they were paying even $80 for a room with no heat they wouldn't checkin. Very unhappy with the customer service.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is beautiful but a 25.00 cab ride away from all the tourist attractions! If you book a grayline tour, the transportation is included and they pick you up and bring you back.
title: Nice place
comment: We loved this hotel but it is not convenient to be in downtown Nashville where all the fun is!

title: Nice Hotel - Bad Breakfast Bar
comment: The Belvoir Wilmington has very spacious suites. The hotel meets Grandbourne standards. It's clean, the staff is friendly, great location for downtown Wilmington. The only negative thing I would say would be the Bistro Bar where they have breakfast. The breakfast bar hardly had any food, what was there was beyond terrible, with horribly poor presentation.

title: A great stay
comment: I travel 2 weeks out of every month. On October 19 - 21 I cashed in some BPG points and took my family to the Belvoir Lake Buena Vista Resot in Orlando Florida. Other than some per night resort fees and additional per night parking fees, the trip was relaxing and much enjoyed. the staff were very friendly and treated us like family. Thank you for a great weekend. I wish we could have stayed longer.

title: Surprised Facility is a Belvoir
comment: Wasted starpoints to stay at this hotel. Had to call front desk four times for extra towels. Spent $20 per night for an "upgraded" room and it was below par. Smelled when we walked in. Could only imagine what the room would have been like had i not upgraded. Really sorry i wasted 14,000 starpoints.

everyoneShouldKnow: How beautifully mantained and elegant it is.
title: Love this Hotel!!
comment: This is my 2nd. stay at your hotel. We loved the new upgrades in the decor and carpet! This hotel is classy and the staff is always so helpful and act very professional.I will only stay at the Belvoir New York Hotel when I visit N.Y.C. I Love your hotel!!!

title: Great Staff
comment: We cannot say enough about the staff! So friendly, helpful & curtious every time we walked through the entrance doors everyone was happy & smiling!

title: Parking
comment: We trully enjoyed our stay...the food was very good and the parking was great ! Whenever we're in Houston for over night we'll try to stay at this hotel !

everyoneShouldKnow: Beautiful Views of the NYC skyline. Easy ferry & free ferry shuttle bus into Time Square
title: Great place to stay when visiting NYC
comment: The room was clean and we had a wonderful view of the NYC skyline which you don't get if you stay in the city. The staff was so helpful with transportation options, and the Ferry station is right outside the door! Free shuttle buses take you into the city from the ferry station. Couldn't have been easier!

title: A little noisy
comment: The room was good and perhaps great on another floor other than the 1st/reception area unless you like a lot of noise.

title: Great Conference Rooms
comment: This hotel had great rooms for our conference. Very convenient to go from one room to another.

everyoneShouldKnow: great place to host an event. Staff was super
title: Great service provided for the event, ok room
comment: Overall hotel was great deal and well worth the $89 rate, We hosted a reunion at the hotel and the service at the event was great and the food terrific.

title: Was told breakfast was included
comment: When we booked our stay we were told breakfast was included. When we got down to the breakfast buffet they sat us down and we sat down, started eating. Then they told us we had to pay. Hotel is very nice. No hot tub though.

title: We enjoyed
comment: We were expecting to stay 2 nights but due to booking mistake (many ambassadors were involved), we discovered we had only one night left. Anyway Christina at the front desk was extremely helpful. She contacted BPG people and we were able to swap points. She gave us good advise regarding dinner. we really appreciate her support.

title: awsome!
comment: Was not disappointed! Beautiful hotel. Room was very spacious and clean. Hotel staff especially check-in (I think her name was Ashley) and housekeeping were very friendly. We stayed at the hotel to celebrate my son's 6th birthday and she (Ashley)went out of her way to make him feel special! This will definitely be the hotel of our choice for any furture "staycations" and we will also reccommend it to all visiting family and friends.

title: Excellent location
comment: The hotel was a train ride from NYC. Excellent location

title: Nice hotel
comment: Bathrooms dated and need updating. LOVE the robes! Thanks! Resturant food and staff excellent.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you are a tourist and want the tourist experience, this hotel is the perfect location.
title: Fantastic Hotel & Location!!
comment: This was not my first trip to NYC but was my first time staying at the Belvoir Times Square. This hotel was wonderful in every aspect. The location is perfect, as it is a short walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, and the Theatre District. Not to mention great restaurants in the immediate vicinity. This will be my first choice hotel for all my future visits to NYC.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's a great location! Rooms are a nice size...
title: Beautiful hotel great location!
comment: I originally booked the hotel in hopes it was clean and a decent location since I was traveling with my 11 yr old daughter. It exceeded every expectation! The rooms were clean, new and a nice size. Above all the location was the best, we walked everywhere!

title: Great Stay
comment: Wonderful stay at this hotel. The room was quiet, clean and comfortable. The staff was helpful and friendly. Would stay there again.

title: Wonderful Vist- EXCELLENT staff!
comment: This was an excellent experience. I could tell the rooms had recently been renovated. They had all the amenities I could ask for. But the best part of this experience was the staff. Everyone I interacted with was friendly, helpful (and also gave good food recommendations). I would definitely consider coming back to the Belvoir . . . And the view of the ocean from my balcony was the icing on the cake.

title: I highly recommend
comment: The purpose of the stay was pleasure.

everyoneShouldKnow: Your staff is amazing, so friendly and helpful.
title: Staff and Comfort
comment: I have never been treated so warm and friendly at a hotel. The staff is amazing, the rooms are clean and comfortable and the food is unbelievable. Southern hospitality at its best!!! We were there for a convention and hardly left the hotel, in 3 days we only at 1 meal elsewhere. We didn't want to leave. Thank you for everything, and a million thank you's to the staff, they are the BEST!

everyoneShouldKnow: allows pets and has no pet fee
title: Great place
comment: Large room with a comfortable bed. Very pet friendly hotel. Super nice staff. Great room service.

title: OK stay
comment: Hotel was located close to Hollywood Studios and EPCOT. Fees for parking - $15, and service fee - $15 absurd. Because of this, I will not stay here again. Also had no hot water for showers the morning we checked out and the maid walked into our room at 8:30 a.m. after a 2 second knock. Spa prices outrageous!

title: Tired & Worn
comment: Upon arrival, we were given a room on the 6th floor, however the front desk staff never told us that we needed to take a special elevator to get to our room -- we were late for a wedding and had to ask two other staff members how to get to our room. Once inside, the room was a huge disappointment. Although the size was large, the room was very used -- bedding appeared worn out and the bathroom was awful -- stained and chipped tub, dirty wallpaper and the worst shower we've ever had. I appreciate water conservation, but this was ridiculous -- the water trickled out like an RV. Mattress on the bed was worn out, with springs that squeaked loudly with every move. The room lacked an in-room frig, local magazines, etc. Drinks in the bar/restaurant were overpriced. The best part of the hotel was the lobby. For historical luxury we will try a B&B in the art district -- only wish we had chosen one first.

everyoneShouldKnow: great beds- excellent front desk people,as well as super guys to park car, help w/ bag
title: People
comment: Everyone from the front desk, to the

title: Worst hotel experience ever
comment: Long story short...we were there for 3 nights,had to change rooms twice because of a leak and they only gave us $25.00 off of one night and access to the 24th floor that we had no time to use. Whoop de do. Oh yes...when we stay there again we can have free access to the 24th floor...Stay there again??? Never!

title: Liked the decor very much
comment: Enjoyed staying at the Belvoir Society Hill very much. It is a great location. I really liked the new look of the hotel. Pictures were very nice. Mattresses were great. Enjoyed drinks in your bar.

title: Great Staff helped make our stay awesome!
comment: We checked into the subject Belvoir after a long day at Sesame Place with 2 children under the age of 3! We ran into a myriad of problems that included a request for room change, purchasing & heating of milk and leaving our luggage at the check in counter, ALL of which was handled by the Front Desk and Guest Services staff with a smile and a 5 star attitude. All the staff on duty the date of our stay should be highly commended for their exemplary service and kindness a refreshing change in todays hospitality industry!

guestFrom: Belvoir Columbia Town Center Hotel, 10207 Wincopin Cir, Columbia, MD 21044, USA
everyoneShouldKnow: Needs work & bring up to date. Hotel caters only to business travelers not all type of travelers. If you plan on a business/family vacation this is not the hotel for you.
title: Needs maintenance & upkeep
comment: Did not meet expectations of Grandbourne Brand. Hotel rooms are in desperate need of maintenance, bedding yellowed instead of crisp white, rooms dusty & noisy, paint throughout room peeling, door to bathroom paint splatter etc. Front desk dismissive of complaints. Concerige did not know give any area info. when asked seemed to not know area attractions.

title: Better than expected
comment: I never write reviews. This hotel was so good I need to write a review. The staff was friendly. The room was luxurious and clean. The free breakfast in the morning (Club Lounge) was good. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. Belvoir will certainly get my business again.

title: Expected more
comment: The property is clean though showing its age. The elevators were inconsistent, railing missing in one. Had to push up arrow to call the car to go down. Wait staff in lobby lounge did not seem up to the task of working in a convention hotel. Bed linens crisp to the point of uncomfortable; out of softener or dyer temp set too high? Breakfast fare in Apropos good. Lap pool appreciated and used; temperature good though water was cloudy.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff has no idea what they are doing.
title: Not a place for a wedding.
comment: Our friends had booked rooms for their wedding guests to stay here since their venue was just a few blocks away. Out of about 80 guests, only a handful had no issues at check-in. The staff overbooked the hotel, on a weekend with a class reunion, a convention, and 4 weddings. They tried to put the bride's 85 year old grandmother on a cot. They disregarded my request for rooms next to eachother let alone an adjoining door as I had 2 two year olds and my mom (babysitter). After my sister checked in, the cleaning lady came to the room and said that they had checked out. The bride arrived to check into her bridal suite and the staff had the gull to tell her they didnt have a room for her. She waited an hour in the lobby with her hair and makeup done and dress in-tow. Check-out was no different. They didn't have any dollies available. I asked a doorman if I could use the one he was unloading afterwards, and he accepted. When he finished he went back on his word and went upstairs with it, no doubt in order to receive a tip from someone. So our check-out took an extra hour since we had 3 suitcases, 2 bathroom bags, toy bags, diaper bag, 2 pack n plays (cause they didnt give us the cribs we reserved, thank heaven we packed those), and several items. You might as well not make a reservation because whatever you reserve, you wont get it. Oh yah, also not a good place to go for quietness. ALthough they have signs posted for quiet hours they dont enforce it. The reunion party took to more floors then they were welcomed. Doors slamming, thumping music etc, nobody on floor 15 slept that night.

title: Nice Place
comment: clean comfortable property eith nice amenities

title: Great features
comment: I upgraded. To a jacuzzi suite. This room was very spacious and comfortable.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location - close to downtown, the airport, and the State Fair.
title: Enjoyed our trip to the State Fair!
comment: My husband and I have stayed here before and enjoyed it, so when I saw a special for the State Fair, we decided to go. Edin greeted us at check-in and attended to our every need. Our room was spacious, comfortable and quiet. Our rate included a breakfast buffet, which was delicious, and included healthy options to choose from. The work out room was clean and had modern equipment. We will definitely stay with you again.

title: Return Visit
comment: Have stayed here before. The location suits my purpose. Next time I have to be in Orlando I will stay here. The concierge in the club room deserves a "shoutout" because she is so sweet and accommodating. If my business was in Orlando I would offer her a job in customer service.

title: Friendly staff
comment: The staff is so friendly and very attentive to the guests and their needs.

title: A great hotel!
comment: Our stay here was perfect. The staff at the front desk was very friendly. Rooms and hotel were very clean. Great location to walk to everything. Valet parking....awesome!!

title: Brooklyn stay
comment: Excellent stay and services.

everyoneShouldKnow: You charge an additional fee for WiFi when motels hotels offer it free.
title: Internet
comment: I was disappointed that you charged an additional fee to use your wifi internet service. Wanted to sit in the comfort of my room and search for nearby restaurants.

title: Awesome hotel
comment: The hotel was really nice. the lobby and dining/ lounge area were very elegant. The suite was more than adequate in comfort and size. The staff was excellent. This was a great option to stay the night and fly out the next mornibg early. They provide a shuttle and the option to let you park your car there while you're gone.

title: Overall unimpressed
comment: I did not enjoy my stay at the Belvoir and continue to find some of your services/staff extremely unhelpful. Specifically, it was very inconvenient that we could not get an update on when our room would be ready over the phone. Instead, I was told I had to inquire in-person. As someone traveling from another state, this was very inconvenient. Our room had a large wet spot on the floor and a distinct odor. When we reported it, we were helped by an extremely nice maintenance man and I give him high remarks. The other major disappointment with this stay was that my debit card was charged for the incidentals fee after I was told only my credit card would be charged. At this point, I have left two messages for someone at the hotel and have yet to have my call returned. This is an issue with my bank account and I find it extremely rude that my call has not been returned nor has the charge been reversed on my card. This is enough to deter me from staying at any Belvoir in the future.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very nice hotel, very friendly and helpful staff. When our room was serviced in the late afternoon it was obvious that "someone" had rifled through my cosmetic bags in the bathroom. I reported this to the front desk and it was relayed to the housekeeping supervisor, however, I have not been contacted by anyone from the Belvoir. I felt very violated and disappointed that I have not been contacted by a supervisor with an apology at the very least.
title: Very nice hotel
comment: Nice hotel, but follow through with a complaint to the front desk was not to my satisfaction.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Location to Restaurants and Shopping
title: This hotel is conveniently located
comment: Surrounded by multiple restaurants as well as shopping mall

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel is on the gounds of Universal Studios.
title: This is a GREAT Hotel
comment: My family and I had a great stay in this Hotel. Everything was A #1. I would recommend it to anyone staying in the LA Area.

title: stay elsewhere
comment: Lousy experience - room next to the elevator. Unhelpful staff. Double charges for services that were difficult to have removed. ZERO acknowledgement of BPG status.

title: Disappointing Stay
comment: I had a 5 day stay at this hotel for my sister's wedding and was very disappointed. The room was not well cleaned, the furniture was worn, and the carpet in my room was stained. The service at the hotel was really sub-par, we had to ask repeatedly for a crib the evening we checked in so our toddler could go to bed. The staff was not very responsive to our request of additional crib sheet, and notifying us when our new room was ready. The checkout process was a mess, I had to spend additional time on the phone getting my bill corrected after we left the hotel. The location is great, being right on the circle, but the hotel need some improvements

everyoneShouldKnow: It is very accesible to all the Disney parks
title: This hotel has great amenities
comment: I enjoyed my stay at the Dolphin hotel. The service was great and the food in the restaurants was excellent.I would recommend this facility to any -one coming to Disney.

title: Wonderful hotel, great staff
comment: Just an awesome experience! I was in New York for an event and the location was great. The lady at the FD that checked me in was absolutelly great and very welcoming, sorry dont remember her name but if it is possible please tell her that me and my friend both appreciate her great attitude and a pleasant customer service. The room was clean, good size and with a nice NY view. I will definitelly recommend this hotel. Unfortunatelly we did not have time to try the restaurant, but will do the next time I stay there.

title: This hotel is beautiful
comment: I stayed at this hotel for a wedding and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Will definitely stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff is great & hotel is clean.
title: Great Hotel
comment: The staff was always pleasant - greeted you with a smile & extremely helpful. It was very clean & secure. Wish price was a bit lower but I guess that's NYC. The price was lower than others for what we wanted. Plus very near our son.

title: Review
comment: I have a major issue with Shulas and how my wife and I were treated. I have disputed the charge and may not stay in your hotel again due to that issue and no follow-up with us from the hotel manager. Overall this was very poorly managed.

everyoneShouldKnow: Its a great place to stay within walking distance of everything.
title: Great stay in Nashville
comment: I really enjoyed my overnight stay in Nashville and the Belvoir had a lot to do with it. I so enjoyed the room decor, the lobby and the view of Nashville at night from my window.. Most importantly the mattress and pillow allowed me to have a good nights rest. The location was perfect, once we parked our cars we were able to enjoy the city attractions on foot.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great outdoor walking/running path through picturesque setting.
title: Pet Fees
comment: Although pet friendly and I was staying there during a dog competition, I was at no time during the reservation process or my stay notified of pet fees. I had no problem with the nominal cleaning fee ($25) that was charged but thought it odd that no one advised me.

title: Convenience and location
comment: I generally do not review my stay, however, this establishment had everything I needed and wanted for my stay. The staff was exceptional. I have stayed at Belvoirs before and they did not come close to this level of hospitality and service. Will stay with you again in the future.

everyoneShouldKnow: Comfortable, cean rooms with frendly staff in a great location.
title: Excellent Hotel!
comment: This is a great hotel whether your there on business or with the family. Friendly staff, clean rooms and an excellent location.

title: The Staff is exceptional!
comment: We had 30 rooms book for people attending my daughters wedding. The staff went above and beyond in taking care of not only us but all of our guest that stayed at the hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Expect to do a lot of walking to get around wtihin the hotel.
title: Fine Stay
comment: Had a decent stay. Rooms are nice w/good beds & TV's. Location is good. Issues:

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location near the Navy Pier and Michigan Ave.
title: Nice visit
comment: Great hotel in a great location! The HVAC didn't work in ou room, it took 2 techs to fix it until 1:00am but we eventually were able to cool it down. Our room was small and a bit dated, but the Concierge made up for other shortcomings, they were great!

title: FeaturesGreat!!
comment: Great location, staff and facilities were all very nice. Great stay!!

title: Palo Alto
comment: It seems strange that you still charge for WiFi, parking and breakfast.

title: no free WiFi
comment: Overall hotel is great. Disappointed about no free WiFi in the rooms. Had to pay $12 a day for basic WiFi in room.

everyoneShouldKnow: An excellent choice when staying in Disney World
title: BILLING ISSUES
comment: The staff, the facility, the room, and everything was perfect until I reviewed my bill before checkout. I was billed substantially more than my confirmed reservation rate, which I do not understand. Even though I was able to show my confirmed rate in an email, I still felt like I had to fight with both the girl at the desk AND the resevation person that the girl at the desk was on the phone with (she would not let me speak to them directly) for over 20 minutes before the went ahead and did the credit. I do not know how it happened in the first place...

title: Family Weekend Getaway
comment: Came in town for a family weekened getaway. Great hotel in the heart of Chicago where you want to be! We were able to check in early (10:45am) on Friday with a great view of Navy Pier and the lake.

everyoneShouldKnow: Friendly Staff everywhere in the hotel
title: Awesome Hotel & Service
comment: This hotel experience was great from beginning to end. Front Desk is very friendly and informative about the area. I had many questions and they were very patient and helpful with all my needs. They had 2 shuttles and they were both very busy but Derrick was extremely polite and took us exactly where we wanted to go. The entire weekend was fabulous! Thank you for being such a great hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Food & beverage highly overpriced, even for the NY location.
title: Needs Improvement
comment: Room locking mechanisms don't work properly, takes several attempts to get into the rooms. Shower doors don't work and no place for your shampoo, etc. Lighting bad in the room. Food & beverage prices unusually high and poor quality. Waited 1 hour after seating to be served breakfast, only 2 other tables were occupied.

title: This hotel goes above and beyond
comment: I have been staying at this hotel 3 to 4 nights a month for the last several months while in Dallas on business. They have never let me down. If there is an issue of any kind, it was taken care of immediately. The associates at the front desk are always friendly. The rooms are very nice, very clean, and the ammenities are substantial. This is a great hotel and always my first choice when I come to Dallas for business.

title: Tribecca Treasure
comment: There are several choices in the SoHo/Tribecca areas of New York. For the location, the amenities, and the value, you can't find a better place than the Belvoir Tribecca. The rooms are nicely sized. The restaurant is great. The coffee shop provides excellent, rather low-cost options. The staff is very helpful. The only drawback is the busyness of Canal Street and the proximity to the entrance to the Holland Tunnel. Broadway, a short walk from the hotel, provides great shopping options compared to the "bargains" on at Canal Street Shops. We look forward to our next visit.

title: This hotel desperately needs a makeover
comment: The hotel is extremely dated--looks like nothing has been done since 1985. The rooms don't have a luxurious feel at all. The bathrooms are very small and the finishes are not good. Given the number of different properties in the same area, I would never choose to stay at the Dolphin again.

title: EXCELLENT LOCATION
comment: A great experience. Hotel was easy to find and conveniently located. Left my car in the parking garage for four days because I didn't need it to go anywhere because of the location of the hotel. Rooms were clean and well equipped. Staff were friendly and readily available. Far exceeded my expectations.

title: wonderful hotel
comment: i had the pleasure of staying at the delfina for my best friend's wedding. while we were getting ready for the "big day" the staff could not have been more accommodating and helpful with any requests we had (from ipod speakers to scissors, etc). the hotel decor was stunning - perfectly modern and stylish yet confortable. the rooms and the view were gorgeous as well. i would definitely reccommend this hotel and can't wait to stay there again some day.

everyoneShouldKnow: Check-in is very slow. I always have to wait for at least 15 minutes. There seem to be only 2 agents on duty most afternoons, which is insufficient for this busy hotel.
title: Close to things I enjoy
comment: The location can't be beat. It's within walking distance to theaters, Broadway, Central Park, Radio City, Lincoln Center, Rockefeller Center, Fifth Avenue. There are many good restaurants also within walking distance.

everyoneShouldKnow: The management and staff are exceptional.
title: The location, facilities, and staff at the Belvoir Uptown are outstanding.
comment: This is the second time in four years that our organization has held its meeting at the Belvoir Uptown. We returned this year because of the experience we had in 2009. The location, the facilities, but most of all the management and staff, from booking, banquet, registration, bar and restaurant, to housekeeping, everyone was courteous and professional. Our group of fifty was treated as if we were a group of five hundred.

title: Comfort
comment: One of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept on. Facility was impecably clean. Would recommend this hotel!

everyoneShouldKnow: The junior suite was well worth the cost.
title: Beautiful suite!
comment: We stayed in the junior suite and it was fabulous! Very clean, spacious and luxurious. We visited the lounge and it was cozy and we received great service. The only negative I could say is that we didn't get our coffee or orange juice that we ordered from room service but everything else exceeded our expectations. We will definitely stay there again.

everyoneShouldKnow: A delightful place to stay in a great location.
title: Great place to stay in every way!
comment: The Belvoir Kona Resort & Spa at Keauhou Bay offered just what we were looking for in a great location, beauitful views, great service and a clean/spacious room. Ray's on the Bay was a relaxing place to have coctails and dinners and to meet fellow guests to share Hawaii experiences.

title: Great Night's stay
comment: I booked this hotel for only night. Wish it had been two. It was wonderful. From the reservation's department which helped me find the best rate, to the check in to check out.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, clean and friendly staff.
title: Great Location
comment: The Belvoir is well located with easy access to shops and businesses. The hotel is well maintained with clean rooms and very comfortable beds and pillows. I highly recommend staying at this comfortable Belvoir

title: This hotel is very nice
comment: We enjoyed our stay at the Belvoir. Everything was beautiful.

title: Outstanding!
comment: Outstanding hotel! Outstanding staff!

everyoneShouldKnow: Fantastic location and very warm atmosphere.
title: Fantastic stay
comment: Check in by Olga was extremely welcoming. Felt truly appreciated as a Grandbourne member & customer. Room was lovely and location of the hotel is perfect for walking around the city. Hotel feels very warm and comfortable and all staff we encountered were so hospitable and nice.

title: Watch your luggage!
comment: This is by far the worst Grandbourne property I've ever stayed at. I am a BPG but recieved no recognition. We dropped our luggage at the curb as instructed by the bellman with the promise it would be delivered to our room. That was at 9:30am...came back at 4pm to no luggage. Searched the store rooms and no luggage. WE did find it...on the curb...where we had left it 6 1/2 hours earlier. The first room they put me in was supposed to be "partial ocean view", yet had a view of a mountainside...oppisite view of ocean. The TV was positioned around a corner from the bed whereas you could not see it laying in bed. There weren't even chairs in the vicinity of the TV. I convinced them to change my room to the one I reserved...the partial view.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location for sporting events/convention center events
title: SF NDSU Game stay
comment: Hotel location, staff and food/bar were excellent. Room was very clean BUT we had a Hospitality suite that had only a bed, tv stand, desk with chair and one wooden chair.

everyoneShouldKnow: don't pay for the breakfast buffet! not worth the price.
title: Cavalier show
comment: Your hotel was lovely, and met or exceeded my expectations for my room, and our club's use of the ballroom, etc. I would say that my only dissappointment was the food. My one time at the breakfast buffet was a real dissapointment - $21 just for me, and the food was well below average even that you would get for a free breakfast in some other hotels. I attended our club's gala event, and since i had waited in line for 20 minutes at the cash bar, I ended up at the end of the food line. imagine my surprise when most of the food was GONE! Unacceptable. the taste was average, selection not up to par.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location! Walk to Epcot and Hollywood Studios or take the boat.
title: Location
comment: Stayed there over a long weekend to enjoy the Food and Wine Festival. We walked to the boardwalk and Epcot, boat to Hollywood Studios. The grounds and public spaces very clean and inviting. The staff from the housekeepers to the front desk to the restaurant bartenders all very friendly.

title: Overall good stay
comment: Paid for a lake view and were very disappointed/confused as to how our 2nd floor room was classified as a lake view. Looking straight at the window was the 2nd story of a building directly across the street. The small sliver view of the lake was only visible when sitting on the far side of the window and looking out at a 45 degree angle. Not major, but were also shorted clean towels and didn't have garbages emptied on last day before checkout, which has rarely happened in previous hotel stays. Rest of room and hotel was very nice as expected for the price we paid. Front desk staff were very helpful and location was very good.

title: inexpensive, well loctaed
comment: Good tip is to stay on the upper floors with view of fireworks; request it. Nearby restaraunts on Katella like PF Changs and Cheesecake and CPK. City sponsored bus that takes you to Disney is supposed to pick up every 20 minutes but I found it to be very unreliable. Service in the adjoinging restaraunt is friendly and efficient food is ok-good but nothing special.

title: BOULEVARDS REVIEW
comment: My husband and I stay at the Belvoir at least once a year and has always been a wonderful experience. This past weekend was a pleasant one, but not like the past. The sheets and pillow cases were like plastic and the bed not as cozy. What really took me by surprise was the breakfast at the Boulevards Cafe. The restaurant was so dirty and each time the waiter tried giving me a new cup of coffee there was always something floating in the cup. I was quite surprised at this since your hotel is a class operation. I hope in the future something will be done to resolve the cleaniness and better quality of the food. This should be addressed ASAP !

everyoneShouldKnow: It does not have cable TV, on Digital and Analog.
title: First Impression
comment: The negatives: The parking space in front of the hotel entrance to check in an unload was extremely tight for vehicles; I got stuck in the elevator on the thirteenth floor; and no cable TV in the room, only Digital and Analog.

everyoneShouldKnow: Beautiful and clean - way above normal
title: Exhibitor review
comment: Great facility!

title: Great Trip
comment: Drove to Key West from Tampa Bay. This place is away from all the noise and traffic of downtown Key West. Shuttle bus takes care of all the driving. Took us to and from every 30 minutes. The rooms are large, clean and up to date. The pool and staff are great. Will return again. Thanks Mr. ED for not leaving us !!!!

title: This hotel is in the heart of China town. Inside is nice and very functional. The staff was responsive. Although I did not get the privilege of usi
comment: Although I did not get the privilege of using the Lounge as expected (BPG Preferred Member) I was given a complimentary breakfast on the day of departure. Thank you.

everyoneShouldKnow: They stop serving food from 2-5 ? I do not understand this... Long wait to check in
title: needs improvement
comment: 2:00 PM on Saturday afternoon I was unable to get any food to eat. i was told all facilites stopped serving food EVEN ROOM SERVICE?? I have traveled the world over and have never been to a hotel where I could not get something to eat; especially at 2 in the afternoon! Our bill was wrong and at checkout we had to wait in line for 20 minutes just to get it corrected!

title: Never Disappointed
comment: We have stayed so many times and will continue staying here when ever possible

title: Beautiful facility.
comment: The restaurant staff either needs more help or needs to be trained properly. The food was cold when delivered and I asked for water three times and never got it!

title: Loved your Location
comment: It was easy to get in and out of DC and Northern Virginia via Metro. Your shuttle service from Reagan Airport was excellent.

title: Hotel is an excellent location
comment: Staff is very welcoming and accomodating.

title: The hotel was very clean and comfrontable.
comment: The staff was very nice and helpful. The room was small, but clean and comfrontable for two people.

title: Recently Refreshed Room
comment: The refreshed room was nicely done and a great improvement. With the refurbished room, this was a good deal for the money. I have stayed here frequently and the staff is always nice. The concierge level lounge was being refreshed too, but breakfast was available in another room.

title: Beautiful Room, comfortable
comment: We stayed in the hypoallergenic room, as my boyfriend and are allergic to pretty much everything. The room had a purifier, and everything in it was indeed hypoallergenic. It was a beautiful, spacious room with a really nice view. Everything was clean. Staff were friendly. We only stayed one night and were not able to use anything at the hotel such as the bar, restaurant, pool, etc.

title: despite the ongoing construction...
comment: The hotel and staff were fabulous. Newly renovated rooms are no frills, but good quality and clean.

everyoneShouldKnow: Be extremely clear to staff on what you want.
title: Great Hotel, beware of rooms next to Elevator
comment: Hotel was a very pleasant stay. If you are a person who is very sensitive to noise, a room near the elevator (King Suite), you will experience a subtle hum that is bothersome. Hotel Staff did everything they could to accommodate us even to the point of refunding our points. SO the staff is extremely responsive.

title: conference attendee
comment: Overall, had a good stay.

title: Excellent as always
comment: The Belvoir staff as always was very professional and courteous. I have been a frequent guest for over 15 years and have never had a bad experience. I highly recommend the Belvoir.

everyoneShouldKnow: Kevin at front desk was great
title: ANTS!
comment: Friendly staff upgraded to a a suite--however there was VERY LOUD construction noise. The other issue was the room was littered with ants, both in the bathroom and in beds! UGHH

title: Great hotel!
comment: I recently stayed through the weekend while attending the Susan Komen 3Day Walk for the Cure. I was very happy with everything, except for having my bags picked up by a friend on Sunday and the bellhop had separated all of the bags, making it a real hassle. Otherwise, it was a perfect stay and I would highly recommend to friends!

title: This Hotel is great ....but
comment: I enjoyed my recent 4 night stay in San Diego and this hotel in particular was great overall. However, on the second night when I was getting ready for bed, I discovered ants in my room. I ended up switching rooms at 11:30pm that night which was not fun packing and unpacking everything at that hour. Except for this experience, I would have given the hotel 4 or 5 stars overall.

title: Wedding
comment: We have stayed here several times and will continue to return. We did have an issue this time but the staff and chef went way above and beyond to make things right.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very nice accommodations. Room/suite was large - even at the lowest priced room.
title: Nice hotel.
comment: Danny at the front desk was charming/gracious/warm/competent/professional at check out.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is rude and unhelpful.
title: Used items left in my room.
comment: My stay at the Belvoir was just sad. I worked for a travel company and have stayed at some really bad places and some really good places. Belvoir Dallas ranks in the one of the worst experience I have had. First at check the lady was cold and unwelcoming. Once we got to our room later that night we opened the door and stepped into the dark room. The ottoman was in the entryway and I almost broke my neck tripping over it (the chair it goes to was on the other side of the room. No reason for it be where it was except pure laziness). Once I got into the room I turned the air down (that had to be the most complicated thermostat I have ever used.) I went to the bathroom to take a shower since we had been at the fair all day. I walk in to find no shampoo, no soap, and the worst thing was a half USED bottle of mouthwash. I called downstairs to get some toiletries sent up. It took calling 4 times and listening to the ring for 15 min. before someone finally answered in a rude tone. I requested the items and she said she would have house keeping bring them up. Almost 2 hours later I finally hear a knock on the door. When voicing my complaints to the service desk upon checkout I was comped parking. Sure glad they saved me that few bucks.

everyoneShouldKnow: Your going to get RIPPED OFF
title: additional charges
comment: I won't stay here again because of your add on charges- parking, bottled water, sneaky taxes or service charges. I feel RIPPED OFF

everyoneShouldKnow: Hotel staff is friendly and professional. The hotel is clean and restful.
title: Hotel stay
comment: The overall stay was excellent. The price was reasonable and the service and attention by hotel staff made the stay even better. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a quality stay for both business or pleasure.

everyoneShouldKnow: The people are gracious and the food is awesome.
title: The staff of this hotel are wonderful.
comment: The guy at the check-in made me feel so comfortable and really went out of his way to help me feel at home. The overall experience could not have been any better. I would highly recommend this hotel to others.

title: Oct 19, 2012 Stay
comment: Great hotel, good value, also great for dogs. Plenty of parking, near the freeway but windows are solid so no noise, rooms in good order. Pleased with stay.

title: overall experience
comment: the Grandbourne person who checked us in was great and so was the concierge

title: A great stay in Northbrook
comment: A very receptive and responsive staff. Comfortable acccomodations.

title: Great Value for Downtown
comment: My stay in March was absolutely wonderful. I arrived haggard from a Red Eye, and the front desk went above and beyond to get me checked in early so I could catch a few Z's before a big event scheduled that evening. There are so many choices in NYC, esp. w/Grandbourne...but in my experience, this is the best value, and one of the best views in the city. Spring for club access, well worth it. An easy walk to the subway, and close to lots of downtown shopping. Looking forward to my next stay!

title: Great location and price!
comment: Great location for the Galleria area. A little difficult in-and-out because it's so very close to the Westheimer/Loop 610 intersection. Spacious accomodation with huge bathroom, and that wonderful Sweet Sleeper bed!

title: Good staff
comment: The Manager Ann from B& F was wonderful. She made our lunch time great!!!

title: Hotel facilities/amenities subpar
comment: The internet access at this hotel is terrible. I've tried to use it in several different guest rooms and meeting rooms and it constantly drops signal and is slow when it actually works. The lack of connectivity caused several disruptions to our meeting. On the plus side,. they did not charge for internet access.

title: Friendly helpful staff
comment: All personal that I dealt with were polite, helpful and did their job.

title: Great hotel in a great location!
comment: A great remodeled hotel in a great location in downtown near the Deep Ellum entertainment district. Treated very well as a BPG Corporate member with an executive suite upgrade and Club Lounge access. We will return!

title: Awesome Stay
comment: Rooms were super clean..beds were comfortable...we attended a wedding at the hotel...food was incredible..no lines at anytime at the bar...

title: The Worst Hotel @ Disneyland
comment: You would think a hotel with the Belvoir name would be an excellent place to stay with your family. Unfortunately, this one is not and I would not recommend anyone stay here ever. The air conditioner was not working for several days and our room temps reached over 80 degrees. Having to open the window in the room just to bear the heat and listening to cars drive by all night. As you can imagine we did not get much sleep and we were awoken at 0800 by the maids trying to get in our room even though we had a do not disturb tag on our door. The bathroom over flowed in our room as well as our friends room. Maintenance was at our rooms more than we were. But the topper was that staff miss handled our billing and over charged us. After several phone calls to their accounting manger he assured me it was handled. Well after 5 months and many more phone calls our issue is still not taken care. Do yourself a favor, even if this hotel is the only open in the area, dont stay here.

everyoneShouldKnow: Offers free shuttle service to Disneyland
title: Nice Hotel
comment: Our room was clean for the most part & stocked with usual bath amenities (shampoo/cond, soap, hair dryer, etc). Upon entering room I found a dirty towel on sink counter which Im guessing was left behind by housekeeping. I liked this hotel because it offered free shuttle service, which ran every half hour, to disney park & was always on time. Due to its location, there are no restaurants within walking distance. So was very limited on dining options other than hotel restaurant & deli/self serve cafe.

title: Loved the eternity pool!
comment: Eternity pool and floating "bean bags" were exemplary. Customer service throughout the hotel was also extraordinary. Everyone was so welcoming and warm, willing to help with most anything. Waikiki is a very busy area, though.

title: AHF business meeting
comment: the conference space was good, but the rooms were all freezing. The food definitely was not spectacular. The chicken was tough in the jambalaya, the crab cakes were too fishy (almost inedible), the salad greens were wilted, etc. For the Exec Chef being from France I would have expected much better. We're going to be hosting over 650 people next June who are in the food business. We need to exceed their expectations for all meals.

title: This hotel has dependable standards
comment: The staff are always efficient and friendly. The rooms are always well equipped and comfortable. The shuttle service is excellent. The local bus to the beach is great.

title: str123
comment: nice hotel clean and convenient

title: Great stay - disappointed in the parking rate
comment: Loved the room, upgrade was great. Great staff but the parking rate is really high, understand the parking situation in the city but seems like guests should get a break!

everyoneShouldKnow: large heated pool open late. Late checkout!
title: My favorite hotel
comment: I absolutely love this hotel. The pool is huge, heated, and open late. Check out time isn't until 1PM and that is a huge plus for me after a late night. The beds are super comfortable as well. I can't wait to go back and stay there again.

title: This hotel should have notified us of the convention that was happening at the time of our stay,
comment: We stayed at your hotel from Aug 30th, to Sept 2nd, when the anime fest convention was being held. It was very disappointing that a hotel with the name Belvoir, and the standards that it holds, would host such an event, without notifying loyal customers such as ourselves. On the Saturday evening, it took 50 minutes for us to get to our room, because they had invaded the elevators, and we only got there because we asked for the help of security.

title: Wonderful
comment: From the cordial valet to the front desk to the maids and groundskeepers, all were very sincere, friendly and helpful. Room was very comfortable and clean.

everyoneShouldKnow: Faces the Mass Pike ... ask for a room on the opposite side
title: Ask for an Room Opposite the Mass Pike
comment: The staff treated me very well and the appointments of the room were excellent, including a very comfortable mattress and bedding. I was generally pleased with my stay. Having said that, a few things annoyed me. First, my room faced the freeway and I was aware of the traffic noise all night. Trucks especially interfered with my sleep. Ask for a room not facing the traffic. Second, my room faced the floodlights on the front of the hotel. The curtains had a liner that blocked the light out well, which is ok if you prefer a dark cave rather than being able to see out. I like the gradual lightening in the morning as the sun rises. Third, the main elevator's doors didn't close until having been open for several minutes. There is another set of elevators not far from the first one. One of the staff told me it was to be replaced and signs had been posted pointing to the second set. Perhaps they would do better to advise guests not to use that elevator.

title: Great Location
comment: Stayed for 16 Days only complaint is breakfast never changes. They dealt with my wifes gluten free requirements very well, Location could not be better and the staff are very friendly and provide great service, Would definately use again.

guestFrom: New Orleans Lakefront Airport (NEW), 6001 Stars and Stripes Blvd, New Orleans, LA 70126, USA
everyoneShouldKnow: Don't try to leave your car unattended for a second - the parking attendants will harass you for your keys!
title: Parking Attendant Etiquette
comment: Rooms are clean. Unobtrusive stay except for parking attendants outside whom I found quite aggressive, would not let you leave the car unattended for 5 seconds while you checked in. Perhaps a "15 minute short term registration" parking area would solve the problem? Definitely put a damper on my stay and not up to my expectations of a Grandbourne property.

title: Awesome!
comment: this was a stop on a great birthday weekend for my son, and we were very happy with it.

title: Very nice hotel
comment: The layout is nive. The rooms are very comfortable.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location to Sesmaee Place. Clean and Friendly Staff.
title: Great Hotel
comment: Great Hotel and excellent proximinty to Sesamee Place.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location and comfy small rooms to relax in after a long sightseeing day or a long day at work.
title: Great location with high standard
