comment: This hotel is ideally located in Soho Tribeca. You reach the shopping district and china town within 2-3min walk. Time Square is just 15min away by train. The hotel is nice and clean. Rooms are a bit small but the view is nice for the high floor rooms. Lounge is nice with OK breakfast. Both hot and colds and fresh fruit. No fresh orange juice though which is a minus.

title: Great visit to Atlantic City
comment: The staff was really friendly. Our room was very comfortable. Very good value!

title: Could be better!
comment: If you're going to the Game this is a great place to stay. The Shuttle Service was a blessing in disquise. Oltherwise, wait for this hotel to be renovated!

title: BEST HOTEL IN MANHATTAN
comment: Great experience!!! The hotel has a very good location, we did not missed anything in Times Square, the Theater, the shopping, and the amability of the hotel personnel, we all had a great time.

title: Nice hotel very busy with college football gameday
comment: This was a nice hotel I liked the check in pods vs the large check in desk. It felt more personal and I could talk to the employee without having to lean over a large desk. We stayed the weekend of the NDSU/USD football game so it was busy, I would check the schedule of events for the hotel because it was hard to find a place to park. The rooms were clean but the sheets were VERY noisy! Hard to stay alseep when you moved in the bed.

title: Problems
comment: Our stay was problematic from the beginning. First the reservation was incorrect on the email confirmation, so we called back and changed it. Second, the room wasn't ready until 5pm and then when we went up it wasn't even cleaned, which didn't happen until 7pm. Third, the hotel didn't give us the detail on the parking charges so what we thought would be a $50 charge was in fact $94. Fourth, when we moved some beer out of the mini bar fridge to make room for the milk we bought for the kids we were charged with the beer we didn't even drink because we tripped a sensor that tracks the usage. Finally, I see now that the billed us for two nights when we only stayed one so I have to call back today again.

title: Time Square
comment: First Time in New York so my expectations were big.... I was disappointed. Our room was nice you could clearly see it had been re-done with new carpet, furniture, drapes etc. but the surroundings were old, very small... and not worth the extremely high price we paid nearly 900.00 for 2/night stay. We also stood in line to check in/out for over 1 hour. People every where, crowded, no assistance obtaning cab out front which should be the norm in a place like this. I will never return to this Hotel.. I recommend looking around. The bed was beautiful but very very hard and uncomfortable..... I felt sick after paying my bill.................

title: fantastic Belvoir
comment: The hotel was perfect!

title: Our Stay in NYC
comment: Room was very clean and the staff friendly.

title: Excellent Staff!
comment: The room was great, but the staff makes it! Eddie, Ashley, and Jon were particularly pleasant and attentive!

everyoneShouldKnow: The restaurant conveniently does not list the $12.95 buffet breakfast on the menu, and when you request it, you are not told that all juices, coffee and tea are $3 extra. Water is the only thing free for the $12.95 buffet. That just does not seem right, and the staff says nothing other than, after complaining, you are told that a recent change in management eliminated the free beverage with the breakfast buffet (that mysteriously is not on the menu)..
title: This hotel staff used to be better in meeting the needs of Preferred guests. That was not the case on my most recent visit.
comment: While I've been very pleased with the hotel staff meeting my past Preferred Plus member needs, this time they fell far short with no immediate room availability, and, when I found a just cleaned room, specifically requested it while waiting, the desk staffer - without saying a word - actually assigned me a completely diferent room with an undesireable view and on a completely different floor.

everyoneShouldKnow: They will bend over backwatds to make you happy.
title: This hotel was very accomodating
comment: The staff at this hotel were very accomodating in every way. There was an issue with our room and they were able to find us another room to move in to. They really went the extra mile. I will definitely stay there again when I come back. Again, I would like to thank your excellent staff.

title: Large rooms
comment: The room we had was two queen beds with a pull out sofa bed. The room was very large with a fridge and two tv's. One TV by the couch in the sitting are and another facing the beds on the dresser. The rooms are dated but well kept. Staff was friendly and helpful. Great location for the Rock and Roll Marathon.

title: Great Staff
comment: This is our second time staying at the Belvoir and we weren't disappointed. The entire staff made us feel welcome for our college visit weekend. The LB buffet was our reason for coming back. His crepes, french toast & pancakes just can't be beat.

everyoneShouldKnow: You can get to the T without going outside.
title: Tim
comment: Great facilities, great view, graet staff, and great location! This is the hotel we always try to stay at when we are visiting Boston.

title: AC did not work.
comment: The air conditioner blew only hot air initially. A workman was able to get it to blow cool air but it needed to be manually controlled as it would not shut off automatically. This caused a disrupted night of sleep getting up to turn the AC on or off.
Ice machine on floor broke entire time. But was accomendated with small fridge in room. Fee for parking for guests a bit expensive.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't plan to reach your room until well into the evening when checking in. And, don't expect extra service or accomidations because of BPG
title: Hotel Staff was not helpful
comment: We attempted to chek in at 2:30 on Sunday afternoon. Desk help said if we were willing to wait an hour he would give us a newly renovated room. We gave our cell number and started to explore Michigan Ave. 4 HOURS LATER! the desk manager called to say the room was NOT ready. 2 hours later we returned to the hotel and attempted to talk to new desk help. I was told I would have to wait in line again. So much for BPG advantage. I asked for a manager. Though he was able to get us a room, it did not appear to be "newly renovated" and was not worth a 7 hour wait! I am VERY displeased with this Belvoir stay, and will make sure to tell my fellow travelers about my disappointment. On a positive note, staff in the downstairs bistro were Very freindly and helpful the next morning.

title: EXcellent Stay
comment: We had room reserved closer to Disneyland, but after on night there, we picked up the phone and when back to a place where the Family was happier. The Belvoir was that place, feels more like home.

title: Amazing customer service
comment: The staff at this hotel are extremely helpful and friendly. Nyron went above and beyond to help accomodate our needs.

title: Great stay, terrible follow-up.
comment: Stay was great, concierge was always incredibly helpful, only gripe is they could be upfront about the daily parking rate. 3 stars go to the poor follow-up. Two charges appeared on my CC after check-out. Despite numerous attempts to contact the billing dept., no one ever answered and I was never called back. I will make one more attempt to get in touch with someone before I leave it in the hands of my CC to resolve.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location. Ease of travel in and out of NYC.
title: NYC Anniversary Celebration
comment: Perfect!

everyoneShouldKnow: the shuttle to Disneyland is wonderful.
title: Halloween Disney vacation
comment: next to the party at Disney for Halloween. This was the best part of our stay. The rooms are huge. The beds very comfortable. But the best part is the shuttle service to Disney. We never had an issue getting to and from Disney. Everyone was very friendly. We are coming back to stay here the next time we go to Disneyland

title: Belvoir Kona is Terrific
comment: This is one of my favorite hotels. It is small enough for the staff to make you feel very special and yet has all the amenities of a large resort hotel. The setting is beautiful, the facility is beautiful, the ambiance is beautiful, when you are there you feel fabulous.

everyoneShouldKnow: Service, staff, rooms and restaurants are 5-star!
title: Dave & Linda
comment: 5-star experience for two nights!

everyoneShouldKnow: The beauty of Keauhou is the perfect place for embracing the Hawaiian Style of life.
title: Paradise surrounds you.
comment: We had a wonderful stay and can not say enough about the warm feeling of Aloha felt from all of the staff and shop owners. We also enjoyed the massage for two on the oceanfront and it was so relaxing and done with high degree of care for our personal needs. The food was fantastic and I have a few new dishes to try in my own kitchen now. The Ahi Steak with Macadamia crust was to die for. Be sure to try their Spider Shrimp as it's the bomb. My plan is to return as soon as possible.

title: Very nice property.
comment: This is a very nice hotel for the area and offers everything you need. The gym is great and the Club level is also very nice. One of the few properties in the NY/NJ area that offers free parking.

title: hotel room needs more amenities
comment: our room had 3 drawers for 2 people, not enough. the closet was adaquete, the bathrooms did not have enough room for your things or hooks to hang a cosmetic bag, the counter space small

title: Just Great!
comment: I always stay here when I am in Pleasanton. Meets all my needs and more. Friendly and professional. Great staff in all departments.

title: A pleasant surprise
comment: For a recent trip we needed a central location. After reading many reviews, I was a bit nervous. However, the friendly front desk clerk upgraded us to a club suite. Room was great, free wine tasting and free parking for AAA members were a plus. Other than the slow elevators, the stay was a welcome surprise!

title: Not completely satisfied
comment: Hotel is in a great location and staff is well mannered and professional. Beds and pillows were very comfortable. Rooms and bathrooms are a bit small and bathrooms need more cleanliness. During my stay, I had to switch rooms and both bathrooms were not very clean.

everyoneShouldKnow: Its a beautiful hotel and everyone was extremely helpful which made our trip even better
title: Love the Island
comment: This was our 1st visit to Kauai Belvoir and we loved the look of the hotel. Even our Ocean view room was great for a while.

title: Outstanding remodel
comment: We have been guests at this hotel for many years and the recent remodel is outstanding. Most areas were upgraded and the new Ray's on the Bay restaurant was excellent. The staff overall was helpful and friendly. A beautiful property.

title: A lot of money for not much in return
comment: The hotel is under construction, so perhaps it will be better when it is completed. As of my stay (late October), there was no bar available. There was no book in the room that said anything about what amenities WERE available, how much the internet charge was, etc. Our keys were sketchy on whether they would work or not and it usually took 2-3 tries to get in the room. There was no ice machine on my floor OR the one below me. The carpet in our room was ratty looking. The beds were very uncomfortable. For over $200 a night, I expected a LOT more. I've stayed at lower tier hotels from competitors that were nicer than this full Belvoir.

title: This hotel's staff goes the extra mile for guests
comment: Why stay in Manhattan when you can stay on the Hudson with all its beauty and interests when you can commute to the City in 30 minutes?

title: Great location and features
comment: The hotel was a hub for our son's wedding activities and we enjoyed many of the services at the hotel. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Parking spots VERY tight in the garage, but there were plenty. Front desk staff varied from lovely and helpful to downright rude. Eggs were powdered for breakfast and awful. Otherwise a decent stay.

title: This hotel has all you need
comment: We were in town for the weekend just to relax and have a little fun. We always stay at the Belvoir Downtown because it is always the same great service, very clean and the staff can not be beat. It is within walking distance to everything we like about Nashville. Recommend to anyone!!!!!! Thank you

everyoneShouldKnow: Unfortunately dirty rooms, dirty club floor, staff unable to make a room change
title: Never again - dirty rooms
comment: Stayed there for one night and room was dirty, staff unable to handle the request for a room change.

everyoneShouldKnow: The beet salad on micro greens is the best $8 you'll spend in all NY.
title: The best MENU and Staff
comment: When you travel as often as I do and for such great lengths of time, you begin to look for hotels with a decent menu. I returned to this particular location on three trips totaling over 35 days. The menu was healthy, high quality ingredients, plenty of options and delicious. If I was a local resident I would eat there regardless of not staying at the hotel. An the staff at the bar, Randy and Saami, were super nice and great conversation. They made my stay personal and welcoming.

everyoneShouldKnow: The food is overproiced and terrible
title: mediocre
comment: I stayed here for work for a 4 day conference and I was underwhelmed by the facility and the staff. Granted, I realize that the hotel must stay open during construction, but being woken up by drilling going on above me every day was not pleasant, particularly after late nights. The food was abysmal and overpriced. I ate at the one restaurant (the website said there were 2-3 restaurants available) and the food portion sizes were minuscule. A cup of gumbo and a side salad racked up a $42 lunch bill. Are you freaking kidding me? I could have walked acoss the street and had a 4- course meal for that price. Leaving the hotel for the airport, the valets put me in a sketchy cab that tried to rip off myself an another passenger and the valets put another person's bag in my cab so we had to drive 15 minutes back to the hotel in order to drop off the bag. I almost missed my flight.

title: This hotel is always grand.
comment: We had a lovely stay. Four of us stayed for 3 nights. Even though the hotel was under construction we were comfortable. We didn't hear any construction noise and our room, the pool area, the public spaces were all very clean. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We love visiting New Orleans and will try for this hotel on our trip next year! Looking forward to seeing the new look!

title: Comfort away from home
comment: I appreciated the grand entrance with many nooks and crannies in which to meet friends and family. The rooms are quite spacious and comfortable and the BEDS are amazing. Older folks might want to request a small step-stool at check in as getting in and out of the beds can be a challenge because they are very high off the ground. The Club-level option was well worth it. The breakfasts were great!

everyoneShouldKnow: That they have window unit air conditioners that you must crawl up on a chair to set!
title: Guest Diane 3416
comment: My room was hot , so I called the desk after a long work day, to ask how to get the air conditioner to work. The lady at the desk was very rude and told me to open a window! I could not believe it.. The room was hot and stuffy and I was having a problem with the room airconditioner, that I might add, a person has to get up and stand on a chair to reach due to the fact that it is a window unit. Unacceptable!!! Thank you . I was very dissappointed in the hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Stay after an event at the BJCC - its worth it
title: Loved staying over after the concert!
comment: It was so nice to walk the breezeway back to the hotel after the concert for Eric Church. Our room was so nice and the bedding was plush. Enjoyed the in-house Starbucks coffee and sports bar. Food was fabulous!

title: great hotel
comment: best time ever hotel is very clean and accomedating

title: Number One Hotel Choice
comment: Belvoir is my first choice when staying with Grandbourne brand hotel. I can always depend on the comfort of the beds and the great service from the staff.

title: King Suite
comment: Loved the spaciousness of the room. Very comfortable living and sleeping arrangements.

title: outstanding
comment: As the proud father of the bride, Belvoir Jax was outstanding in all aspects of our joyfull day. The event staff, catering staff, and all hotel staff made our event perfect in every way. We booked many friends and relatives for a few days at SJ and everyone was as happy as I. Keep up the great service, food, bar,cleanliness, friendliness, etc., etc., etc.

everyoneShouldKnow: The space was peaceful, I celebrated my birthday with grandchildren and the hotel was famliy friendly Thank you for a home away from home.
title: WATER, FOOD
comment: The view from my room was beautiful and the atmosphere was friendly. The staff were very nice.

title: very comfortable suite/wonderful staff
comment: Usually don't stay downtown, but did we were in Dallas for a wedding. The executive suite was perfect for our family. Very spacious and comfortable. The staff acknowledged us by name throughout our stay. We will absolutely stay here next time we are in Dallas! A full service spa would really be a plus--please consider adding one.

title: Mr. V
comment: hotel was close to everything I wanted to see

title: Very Nice Hotel, good restaurant
comment: Very nice hotel, with an excellent Italian restaurant.

title: Nice amenities but in need of new mattress
comment: The hotel has a great location, nice amenities, large rooms and great private beach. However the bar manager was rude, although the other bar staff were great. The major complaint is the hotel needs to invest in new mattresses. The bed felt like a sheet of plywood.

title: The staff was knowledgeable and friendly
comment: We enjoyed ourselves. The accomodations were excellent. It was easy getting to and from our hotel to downtown. The staff were great, always available to answer questions and assist us in making the best decisions.

everyoneShouldKnow: bad neighborhood, no pool op, no late night delivery ( pizza )
title: mrs
comment: nummed pool was closed for constuction, shouls have notified guest or at leased Acdelco so they could pas it on

title: Room
comment: I was very surprised at the rather shabby condition of the room.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location for the French Quarter area.
title: Check In
comment: Over all, my stay at the hotel was good. However, I arrived at 1 pm and was not able to check in until 4:30pm due to my room not being ready and having to except a different room.

title: Large room!
comment: We were pleasantly surprised at how large the room was. We had a room with two double beds. It had lots of light (3 windows), very comfy. Friendly staff. The internet was a bit irregular. That is my only reason for one less star on expectations.

title: October in Seattle
comment: Great hotel and staff. Was impressed with Grandbourne lounge. A little disappointed that I was charged 4.11 for an in-room item when I didn't utilize any... overall a great experience however.

title: Great Hotel!!! A Must Stay!
comment: My family and I had a great experience at this property on our last trip there. We have stayed there many times and on our most recent stay we were really pleased with how well we were accommodated by the front desk at check-in. Our room was by far the best we have stayed in at the property. I told the person checking us in that we were traveling with children and they gave a really nice big room. I love the club lounge at this hotel and the staff up there is really great. They always recognize us and give us great service. We had a small water leak in the room and the front desk sent a maintenance person up very quickly to address the problem and all was resolved. My only complaint after staying here many times over the years is that the lobby bar closes too early on Fridays and Saturdays and the lobby bar staff are not as welcoming as the staff in the club lounge. When we come to NYC with the kids we always stay here. Overall, this property is in perfect proximity to other bars, the subway, Broadway shows, times square and central park. BPG really treats their members well and that's why we bought into an ownership share. We will definitely be back to this Belvoir in December. Thanks for making it a great family trip to the big apple!

title: Excellent Hotel
comment: I stayed in this hotel for one night. This hotel is very nice, and clean. I like the setting, it is very welcoming. My only problem was with the front desk, she was not welcoming at all. As a gold member at the time of my staying, I had to wait for a long time to be serviced. When I finally made it to the front desk, she was a bit unprofessional. Overall, I still like this hotel. First time for everything.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staffs are very friendly and willing to help if needed.
title: Romantic Weekend
comment: I have stayed in this hotel a few time. I love this hotel and will go back whenever I have a chance. I always get an upgrade as a gold member. I feel that they appreciate me as a customer. And they are always willing to help in any way if possible.

everyoneShouldKnow: ASK about construction noise and when and where you will be inconvenienced. Because you will be.
title: Construction and crowded, not a good mix.
comment: I had a recent stay, There was construction going on and lots of noise. Jack hammer like noise in my room and they told me "the desk should have told you at check in". Really, 7am to 7pm? So much for sleeping in until my noon meeting. I checked in at midnight, and as an BPG Gold got a room without a closet, just a closet bar hanging in the room. It was about as tiny as you could imagine. I was told that it was a "special selection" for being Gold. I am sorry to say if what I got is for their best customers then many of the rooms are just plain bad. Oh, and the restaurant breakfast was $25 for scrambled eggs and toast. Don't they think we care?

title: Birthday Weekend
comment: For my weeking birthday, we decided to stay at this hotel so that we can go to Disney. Elizabeth, the lady at the front desk was very professional, and friendly. After checking in, she did not charge me the resort fee because it was my birthday. That was very nice of her. The staffs were very friendly, specially Elizabeth. My birthday weekend was a bit better due the treatment and attention I got from her in regards to making sure that I was happy and relaxed.

title: Fantastic experience
comment: My stay was a wonderful experience, the bed was very comfortable, the room was good sized, but I was disappointed that the drapes/curtains did not close at all to block out the outside light. I also get nauseated by the smell of orange, so I can not use the soap

title: Great location!
comment: Great hotel. Located across the street from the convention center and next door to the outlets. Only complaint is that wireless was not free of charge. One hour complimentary service is not enough for a business professional on travel. Wireless access was availabe for additional charge in the rooms though

guestFrom: Great Lakes, North Chicago, IL 60088, USA
title: Very disappointed
comment: Not recognized as a BPG Gold Elite member at check-in, nor at anytime throughout stay. Did not let us know where things were, we had to scope out the place to find the elevators to the rooms, where our meeting was, etc. I was very disappointed and embarrassed because I talked up the BPG program and they were truly not impressed.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is very helpful and friendly as well.
title: The location was excellent
comment: We took the shutle to ABQ Uptown enjoyed shopping, dinner and visited a couple of the local Bars all within walking distance. It was a nice little get away.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's a very nice hotel but you may need to follow up to ensure problems are resolved. May not be addressed the first time you ask.
title: Disappointed in failure to correct a problem
comment: I reported a problem with the radio/iPod dock on the first day of my stay, within hours of checking in. The problem was not resolved or rectified. I was surprised and disappointed in this lack of response. Other aspects of the hotel were fine but I don't like being jarred awake by a ringing phone which was my only option.

title: Belvoir Kauai
comment: All services were excellent. Our first room was not a location that we liked and was quickly changed. We loved room 1214. What a view. I wished that we had asked for the sliding door to be checked sooner. It was fixed as soon as we mentioned it. Thank you for a wonderful stay.

title: bed
comment: Couldn't have ask for a more comfortable bed. Had no problems sleeping

everyoneShouldKnow: They treat you with respect reguardless or age, income or race.
title: Wonderful 20th wedding Aniversary
comment: I really enjoyed my time in this hotel, reason why was it was my Aniversary (20) and my wife and I were so taken care of and the Gaitherfest was wonderful. Staff was so nice and the respect level was beyond imagine.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is close to the airport.
title: Excellent, but...
comment: This is a beautiful hotel, and everyone on staff was exceptionally helpful, courteous, and professional. I did feel that the restaurant area at breakfast and the eating area in the bar in the evening were understaffed. The servers and bartender were very efficient and hard working - almost running at times to serve customers in a timely way. I feel the slow service was not at all the fault of the servers, but it should be given some attention by managers.

title: bad service
comment: REQUESTED REFRIGERATOR UPON CHECK IN AT 10:30 PM , CHECKED 30 MINUTES LATER IF IT WOULD BE COMING, CALLED AGAIN AT 12AM TO SEE IF IT WAS COMING WAS TOLD IN ANOTHER 10-15 MIN. TOLD THEM TO FOGET ABOUT IT BECAUSE IT WAS TO LATE AND WAS GOING TO SLEEP, HAD TO THROW OUT PERISHABLE FOOD IN THE MORNING, ELEVATORS WERE BROKEN! HAD TO WAIT FOR A SERVICE TECH TO COME UP AND GET YOU EACH TIME YOU WANTED TO GO DOWN. TOOK A GOOD 15 MIN EVERYTIME YOU NEEDED TO GO . PAID FOR VALET PARKING BUT HAD TO WAIT 20 MINUTES FOR THE CAR AT 6AM.......

title: Nicest People work here
comment: We stayed at this location the third week of October 2012 with my family, the location is fantastic, but the people who work here are some how magically selected, everyone was so helpful and nice , specially Addie and Carmen. My 2 daughters , 3 and 5 years old did not want to leave. The rooms are spacious and the train, bus and boat terminals are next to the hotel. The view is amazing .

title: Food from room service poor
comment: I ordered a chicken cesar salad. It arrived very quickly, but was drowned in dressing. Had no cheese and the chicken had not even been cut through properly. It looked as though it had been thrown on the plate in a hurry.

title: Hospitality Industry friendly
comment: As a Conference Service Manager for a 4 Star hotel, the experience I had was probably one of the best ever. I was taking the Baby Bar exam and the staff, location, Room Service staff, and "home" feeling, helped with the anxiety and stress of that exam. It was very comforting.

everyoneShouldKnow: exceptional service and old world character
title: Exemplary service
comment: The old world character and service of this property reminded us of places we have enjoyed in London and new York. A perfect fit for Cambridge with a staff exceeded themselves with getting us into a room quite early and even upgrading us. Their extra effort made for a perfect stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location: a marina right in front of you, and views throughout the bay and to downtown
title: Great location and view, great staff
comment: Though I would have preferred to stay in the Marina Tower rather than the Bay Tower, as the latter has fewer food and drink options and its room renovation is not yet complete, I was quite satisfied. The view along the bay to downtown (reminds me of my sister's view across Biscayne Bay to downtown Miami# and across the bay to the naval installation is fantastic. I received complimentary Internet. When I reported that the tub-to-shower valve was a bit dodgy #it could go 'past' either stop position and get a little water flow to both heads), I received many Starpoints as compensation.

title: Conference
comment: Hello. I stayed at this location for the MassMutual ASO conference and the hotel was great all around. I especially want to point out that the staff that assisted us with the conference were awesome to work with and very accomodating. Food was delicious also. I would say that it would be nice if the fitness center had windows...the tread mills face a wall.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is the friendliest and most accomodating I have ever experienced. Outstanding!
title: We were treated like royalty.
comment: My wife and I visit Cuyahoga Falls once or twice each year to visit our Grandchildren. Belvoir has bent over backwards every time to accomodate our every need at a great price. I can't say enough good about the entire staff. What a team! Breakfast was wonderful each day and the lounge was fun to visit. The housekeeping staff was attentive and kept our room in tip-top condition at all times. The only problem we encountered was that a Bridal Show was scheduled for the same week-end as our visit, which made parking a little difficult. We had to park across the stree at the overflow lot, which wasn't a real big deal. All in all, this is a great place to stay and my wife and I will be returning for sure.

everyoneShouldKnow: Not well marked from the highway
title: The staff could not have been more pleasant or helpful.
comment: We were quite pleased with our experience at the hotel and enjoyed the engaging staff and the comfort provided by the room and amenties. We rented a house for our stay and were only looking for the first night accommodation prior to our extended stay. After our experience we would not hesitate to return for a longer stay, or to recommend this hotel to our friends and family.

everyoneShouldKnow: If u need ANYthing, the staff will be as helpful as possible. They even try to anticipate ur needs,
title: Marvelous staff
comment: The concierge, front desk, bell men, restaurant workers, and a manager were all extremely friendly and so helpful! What a remarkable group of people!

title: Mr. KD
comment: Delay in getting my Preferred Plus member room and then my request for a specfic room( that a hotel desk staffer confirmed as being available) was later changed, without me being told, to another room, and on another floor, with a undesireable location, a completely different floor, and view (the hotel's lower roof). For whatever reason, the $12.95 breakfast buffet is not on the menu and all beverages - one finds out - are billed at $3 each.

everyoneShouldKnow: There is a full length mirror but it is placed so that one may only step back one foot from it. Ladies, plan your ensembles in advance!
title: Consistantly good
comment: Our New York hotel of preference..and there are a lot to choose from! This hotel is well located, well staffed and well mantained. We know there won't be any 'weird' suprises so we keep coming back.

title: Nice staff good location
comment: Beautiful lobby, nice staff. Didn't stay long enough to try food or other amenities but they looked good. Rooms are pretty small, We stayed overnight on our way to another Island. We were able to book a tour from the hotel for Pearl Harbor and be back in time to catch our early afternoon flight off island.

everyoneShouldKnow: Easy to get to all parks- awesome location.
title: Location and Price cannot be beat!
comment: We always stay "on property" at WDW so we were leary of staying in a non-disney hotel. However, we got such a great price that we thought we would try it. And we will go back. Location was excellent- in the Boardwalk area- we could take water taxis OR WALK to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. The room was large enough to be very comfortable for our family of 5. The staff was tremoundous, from check in to check out. They also have a car rental on site for those days you want to go elsewhere and it was very easy to deal with. I would love it if they had an airport shuttle, but that is the only negative. The property, pool, rooms, staff and location make this a must stay venue.

title: Great Hotel and Location....Bad Service
comment: I just wanted to comment on the horrible customer service I experienced at your hotel during check-in on Oct. 19th. I entered the lobby and was assisted by a female employee. She asked if I had a reservation and I gave her my last name. She told me my reservation was for a room with a double bed. As only my husband and I were attending this event, I knew this was incorrect. I told her my reservation was for a room with a king bed. She informed me that I was wrong and that she was completely unable to change my reservation. Unfortunately, I was not very satisfied at this juncture in the transaction. I went to the parking lot to retrieve my reservation from my car. Upon return, I waited in line (again) and was helped by the same employee. She carefully examined the printout for my hotel reservation and realized I was correct. She never apologized for the misunderstanding or even commented on her mistake. She checked me in, after giving her my identification and credit card again, and sent me on my way without even a thank you. This employee displayed a very poor attitude and unfortunately could not even offer basic customer service. Then after walking to the room, there were four dirty glasses outside our hotel room door. I was hoping no one was still occupying the room.

title: best location
comment: great.location and amenities

title: Great Hotel
comment: We recently stayed at the Belvoir on our wedding night before heading out for our honeymoon. We had a great stay and really enjoyed the hotel. We had called the week of our stay and request the 'romance package' of champagne to be in the room when we arrived. It was not, however upon notifying the front desk, they handled it extremely well and were so apologetic. It did not ruin our evening and when they sent it up, they also included a gift certificate to the restaraunt at the hotel. Overall our stay was great and would highly recommend this hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: feels like it's Closer to Anaheim than Garden Grove. Excellent Disneyland location!
title: Good Clean Hotel, Busy, Impersonal, Inflexible service
comment: This was perhaps the most unpleasant of my Grandbournes Experiences and it had nothing to do with the hotel, which is supremely located within one mile of Disneyland, has a 24-hour heated pool, has a welcoming lobby and interior space, free public wifi in the lobby, and is sparkling clean.

everyoneShouldKnow: They are not responsive to customers.
title: Broken Bathroom Door
comment: The pocket door in our room was broken and I was stuck in the bathroom for five minutes. After being freed by my wife I called the front desk. I figured they would either fix it or change our rooms. We left and went to a football game for six hours. When we came back the door was not fixed. I called the front desk and they said they would call maintenance. Never happened. Due to the small size of the room it got kinda gross. I know Belvoir doesn't care if this is a negative review. I know I'm wasting my time. The staff could have cared less.

title: This hotel is a wonderful place to stay!
comment: Clean, Comfortable, Quiet place to stay while visiting the Akron area.

title: overall this hotel has met my expectation
comment: My check in went well everything was clearly explained. Every staff member was courteous and helpful. I bumped into one of the food and beverage managers he himself was very friendly and even offered his assistance if I had any concerns. Keep up the good work!

everyoneShouldKnow: Food and food service were excellent.
title: First time Gold experience-wrong room #!
comment: At check in, was given key to room 542. Key did not work. Went down to lobby and got new key to room 542. Still did not work. Someone came up to open door and left. As we entered room, found it to be occupied by another guest, who was not in room at the time. Went back down to lobby. Then found out room # should have been 524! First time at Gold level status. Congratulations!

title: King suite
comment: Was not up to par. Staff was rude, unwanting to help.

title: Friendly staff
comment: Comfortable, quiet rooms. Staff aimed to please. Some lounge chairs facing the pond, to enjoy and relax in the sunshine would have been nice.

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel and the view are both beautiful.
title: Great hotel, highly recommend, skip breakfast.
comment: Loved everything about the hotel...the bed and linens were very comfortable...the view amazing and the staff was great. The business center was well staffed. The restaurant was excellent at lunch and dinner. I would highly recommend it. The breakfast buffet was disappointing to say the least. However, we were able to find nice places for breakfast nearby since the hotel is convenient to other nice restaurants.

title: Room Cleanliness
comment: I was at the hotel for 3 nights. The maids never made up my bed once. They never gave me clean soap or shampoo. I was given clean towels only twice

everyoneShouldKnow: Some rooms don't have a view - except for the roof mechanics !
title: Central Location
comment: Nice Hotel - it's location is right in between the restaurants, choo choo, and has a stop right outside for the free shuttle bus. Parking is a bit much at $15 a day

title: Room Service
comment: This will not prevent future, stays however we called room service and the front desk to help from 6 to 8AM and finally gave up after no results. We have been staying for over 10 years and will coninue to stay. Room service the evening was up to the usual high standards

title: Good Location, Good Staffs
comment: hotel is located in a very good location.

title: Poorly addresses identified issues
comment: I don't like to downgrade hotels based on the existence of problems. It's more important as a frequent Grandbourne customer in how those issues are addressed. My last stay at this hotel -10/2012 - I discovered that my room was infested with ladybugs. When I reported that problem to the front desk, the response I got was "sorry, what would you like me to do about it?" No offer to clean, no offer to change rooms, no offered options whatsoever. As I had only 1 night left and ladybugs don't particularly bother me, I left the front desk with a puzzled look on my face, stayed my final night with my new roommates and left.

title: Excellent staff
comment: From the time of my arrival until I left I was impressed by the staff. It is obvious that the GM is keeping a close eye on this property. The food served at a banquet I attended was exceptional.

title: This hotel was tacky
comment: Hotel presents itself falsely in its web page and over the phone regarding provision of airport shuttle.

title: Helpful Staff/Great Rooms
comment: Fantastic room with beautiful view if you are facing mountains. Very helpful staff.

title: Terrible view and breakfast
comment: My room was facing a brick wall even though I'd requested a room on a high floor facing the river.

title: Good location
comment: I stayed there because of convenience to the convention center. Unfortunately, being there on business, I had expected wi-fi in the room and was disappointed to find out it didn't. They have Ethernet, but that didn't help me since I was using a tablet. Everything else was okay, but I think the rooms needs to have have wi-fi, especially for business travelers.

title: Good
comment: A comfortable stay with nice pool and gym.

title: Wonderful stay
comment: Beautiful new hotel in a convenient location, close to everything. Excellent staff and services. Great internet connection. Would stay the next time visiting family in the Jax area.

title: Great Service
comment: The staff and the faciltiy were great. They met every expectation immediately.

everyoneShouldKnow: great customer service & nicely kept hotel
title: great services
comment: from the pickup at the airport, I was very pleased with the staff and the services I received. The shuttles to the Metro were super convenient, great views out of my room window, and a surprisingly quiet night of sleep were all very welcomed. Will stay again when I bring the family for sightseeing

title: very disappointing
comment: We made the reservation three hours before we arrived. When making the reservation, I clearly told the reservation woman that I wanted a King size bed. I mentioned that at least two times. She said "no problem". I arrived and was told that there were no kings available. I insisted and they found one.

everyoneShouldKnow: good location to universal city walk
title: Hotel is OK for location
comment: The staff is nice, and the room was nice. The maid service would constantly enter without me having a chance to say that I was still in the room. They did this often, knock, then enter, without waiting for OK. The pool and jacuzzi were nice, but were completely filthy dirty, and the jacuzzi burned my feet as one day it reached 110 degrees. Shortly after my feet were burned, the technician magically appeared and said there was a problem with the steam. Anyway, for the money per night, I would recommend staying somewhere else. Also, the food really needs an upgrade...I was on the club floor and we get the nightly happy hour, the people were extremely nice, but the food selection was not great the crackers were stale...Also, in the fitness center, there wasn't a scale and no air, and the machines stink.

everyoneShouldKnow: Major renovations almost finished. Book now.
title: Great Location - Great views
comment: Great location with excellent views and very accomadating staff. Can't go wrong staying here.

everyoneShouldKnow: The best staff of all the hotels I've ever stayed at from all over the world!
title: Great place to stay
comment: We chose this property because we wanted to be close to downtown Kona and to the Manta Rays. Beautiful property, clean, perfectly manicured lawns, fun swimming pool with slide & waterfall, even a little shallow pool area with sand. Restaurants had great food & drinks. Best of all were the wonderful hotel staff that totally made us feel so welcome. I loved that we were able to watch the Manta Rays swim while having drinks at the bar.

title: A great place to stay!
comment: Our trip and stay for two days was for pleasure. We had a need for copying material and getting it mailed immediately during our stay. The staff was extemely helpful.

title: Excellent Hotel
comment: I can't say enough about the hotel staff throughout the facility. The room was fantastic and customer service was outstanding. I would highly recommend this Belvoir!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: So close to NYC without having to pay the NYC rates!
title: Train Station
comment: The hotel is so close to the train station and provides a free shuttle. All the employees are so polite and knowledgeable. LOVE the comfortable beds. BUT I do not like Starbucks coffee and would like to see another brand or at least have the option for another coffee in the room.

title: Hotel was perfect for my needs
comment: Close to everything

title: A Nice Oasis
comment: The facility and the room were inviting, comfortable and tasteful.

everyoneShouldKnow: Friendly staff clean n comfortable rooms.
title: great experience
comment: Everything was excellent especially the food. Being from New Orleans, I love "home cooked" feeling n that is what your restaurant gave me. The breakfast and lunch plus the service really surprised me. It was excellent. Kudos to the hotel staff. I will be back!

everyoneShouldKnow: Not near the ocean but close to many tourist attractions and wineries.
title: Staff
comment: We have stayed at the Belvoir San Diego on numerous vacations and have always been pleased. In the past some of my ratings would have been excellent but not on this visit. Although the staff were very good they were hard to find. It seems this hotel was short staffed on this visit and did not have the time to spend with each request. We will definately return and hope that the next stay will be better.

everyoneShouldKnow: My room was a Joke for what I paid !!
title: Awful
comment: The room was the size of a closet and the price of a 900 sf suite

title: features
comment: good views, especially the end corner units

guestFrom: Hartsfield Jackson Atlanta International Airport (ATL), 6000 N Terminal Pkwy, Atlanta, GA 30337, USA
title: Excellent Service
comment: I love staying at the Belvoir when I visit ATL, only place I would stay.

title: Excellent place to stay!
comment: This hotel was perfect for our trip. We will stay here again next time we come to New York.

title: Exceptional
comment: The staff are outstanding!

title: Excellent hotel!
comment: Always enjoy this hotel! Excellent, central location in Manhattan. For those who do not want the typical "New York boxed room" and desire a spacious, comfortable room for your NYC stay, this is the hotel for you.

everyoneShouldKnow: The beds are very high and a little hard
title: What I expected
comment: It was pretty much what I would expect from a Belvoir hotel. There were two things that were not quite up to snuff - the spa was not working and there wasn't a sign on it. I called the front desk and they didn't know about it. The bed was so high that I had trouble gettin up on it. I'm average height so a shorter person would really have trouble.

title: Great location and staff
comment: This hotel was located a few short blocks from the river and minutes from the local bar scene. The staff were dead-on when recommending places to eat or must-see places in the area. The next time I am in Philly, I will definitely be staying there.

title: Wonderful!!
comment: Experience far surpassed our expectations. As a Grandbourne associate, I didn't expect such a great room (free upgrade!) for the amount paid. WOW!

title: Loved the hotel
comment: Thought the breakfast was great but a little pricey. We only went once as it was not a good value.

title: hello
comment: Would like windows to open

everyoneShouldKnow: its is beautiful and the location is excellent
title: this hotel is beautiful and location excellent
comment: I have been staying at this hotel for 10 years. The reason i keep returning is the beauty of the hotel,the location between Hollywood studios and walking distance to Epcot. The food at all the restaurants on property is delicious and the service outstanding. The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel, and I have.

title: Disappointed
comment: We were told at checkout in the morning that we were able to use shower facilities that afternoon prior to late evening flight. The shower facilities turned out to be outdoor showers adjacent to the pool.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's comfortable, relaxing, well maintained, with wonderful and hospitable staff. I really liked it here.
title: This hotel has wonderful staff.
comment: This was my first time staying at the Woodbury Belvoir and I was quite pleased. The hotel was welcoming, not stuffy or pretentious, and relaxing. I liked the fact that the computers were free to use as well as free Wi-Fi. My room was quite comfortable, clean, and fresh. I enjoyed the food in the Red Rock Cafe and would like to greatly compliment Kim and Mariea, the bartenders, and the rest of the restaurant staff. They were professional yet friendly, happy, and cheerful. It was a pleasure to see them every day. I will definitely stay here again in spring of 2013.

title: Very nice
comment: Very nice hotel and friendly staff. Love that it is pet friendly and very clean, well maintained.

title: We love it
comment: We have stayed there every time we come to Key West and will continue to do so

title: Excellent staff and service!
comment: Great Hotel, excellent staff and service! I stay in this hotel frequently and the staff is always very helpful and accommodating.

title: Nice hotel
comment: This is a nice clean hotel, with a friendly hardworking staff.

title: Disappointing
comment: The service was disappointing. Check in line was long and only one staff available. When asked for a quiet room, got put to a room with noisy traffic. When asked to change room, I was told that only one room on first floor available while there were many people not checked in yet. I did not feel that staff was trying to help.

title: Great location, tired hotel
comment: The Dolphin has seen better times, and I've had better stays there. I paid extra for a larger room because the regular rooms are so small. Although we were not right next to the elevator, the noise of the high-speed elevator wooshing up and coming to a loud stop was constant throughout the day. And night. Ick. Amenities were average, restaurants average. The whole experience was average, but at a high price.

guestFrom: Raleigh-Durham International Airport (RDU), 2400 W Terminal Blvd, Morrisville, NC 27560, USA
title: Belvoir Edison
comment: Belvoir has a great location, good rooms..

title: convention
comment: Would like to see a refiigerator in the room.

title: Belvoir meadowlands oct 2012 stay
comment: I enjoy the location, carlos in concierge lounge, bartender in lounge, & location of hotel. They have made improvements like screen tvs & covered parking, but some rooms need updates. They take dogs which i love.

everyoneShouldKnow: don't order room service as it isnt' hot
title: Love coming to the Chicago Belvoir
comment: I love staying at the Belvoir Towers in Chicago. The room, the bed and the amendities are so comfortable and welcoming.

everyoneShouldKnow: The club floor is the way to go...top notch.
title: Always excellent!
comment: We travel to Denver several times a year for Broncos games and choose this hotel EVERY time. Pricing is a great value for the quality of the rooms and the kind and friendly staff. The gals who run the club lounge on the 12th floor are wonderful! Rooms are clean and comfortable. The pool and gym are top notch. We will continue to stay here whenever we come to Denver.

title: hotel was fine
comment: hotel was clean but somewhat outdated. My room was on the first floor

title: Good Accommodations and Service
comment: Staff was very responsive, specially when their were a few problems. They came quickly when room needed to be cleaned, etc.

title: Worn Out
comment: It is a great location for conferences, but with all the conference traffic, has made it worn out. Needs several upgrades from the lobby to the rooms. Surely not worth the money. Would rather stay at a Disney property such as the Boardwalk, Yacht or Beach Club.

title: Belvoir San Diego
comment: Very comfy beds! Slept like a baby. Staff was amazing. Upgraded my room and gave me a free breakfast!

everyoneShouldKnow: There are other hotels that are better
title: This hotel Needs Improvement
comment: No Pay Per View in-room movies? Had repeated problems with my card key, would not work at first to open room, then would not work to get in and out of parking lot.

everyoneShouldKnow: Beautiful views, hotel is gorgeous, and location couldn't be better.
title: beautiful setting and top notch staff
comment: Breathtaking views. Lovely, open facility and very accommodating and pleasant staff. My only complaint, and I know it can't always be helped, was the amount of bugs in the room. I found some in my suitcase and had to empty my bags in the garage when I got home. Rooms could definitely use some updating, especially the bathrooms. Otherwise will stay again and have already recommended to friends who are going next month.

everyoneShouldKnow: Lots of people traffic, large hotel
title: Shopped around, best price
comment: This hotel deals in absolute volume, so check in and lobby tradfic can be a bit hectic. This is not a serene lobby atmosphere to lounge in, but rather an energetic NYC " get up And go" vibe. Taxi service, courtesy of the front door staff is quick and efficient. Rooms are very comfortable, down coverlets are on the warm side, AC worked like a charm. Breakfast prices in the restaurant are overpriced, but thankfully there is a Starbucks in the lobby...why go anywhere else?

title: Still learning.
comment: Check in was average with no acknowledgement of BPG membership.

title: Little Things
comment: Bellman upon arrival was great as was guy at front desk. Room was clean and nice. Ok fitness center. Only issue I had was when my room was not cleaned and I called to have clean towels brought to my room and after an hour they still were not delivered. Expected more.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is fantastic and the convenience to the train is great.
title: Great hotel!
comment: I love this hotel. Erveryone is so kind and always goes out of their way to make your experience a good one. I am at this hotel at least once a month. The only thing I would like to see is a regular person in the Club Lounge in the evening, but I know they are working on finding the right person.

everyoneShouldKnow: Low Value at $130/nigh and no comp breakfast
title: Poor Value
comment: Over priced for the area at $130/night and no comp breakfast. Plus breakfast doesn't open until 6:30

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent in-room dining food and service.
title: This hotel has great service.
comment: Excellent service, food and rooms.

title: comfortabe place to stay
comment: A convenient place to stay. The room was comfortable with many updates. Room service was great. Staff was friendly and knowledgeable.

title: Very nice room and Friendly staff.
comment: As a platinum member, I was upgraded to a very nice, large room. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. The food left a bit to be desired and the Club Lounge, although very spacious and nice, did not serve any wine or other libations.

title: Absolutely Perfect
comment: If you stay anywhere else you will be missing out. My husband and I stayed for a week for our 10 year anniversary. I had visions of an extremely luxurious vacation in mind! This resort exceeded all my dreams. They happily cater to your every want and need. Sunsets are so beautiful and the staff caters to make it a romantic time. No matter where we were we ran back to the resort for sunset and dinner! The first 2 days we never left the resort. I had a packed agenda of sightseeing which we had to make ourselves leave for on day 3. We compared other resorts once we were there and each time were happy with our choice. This place is amazing. Whatever you think of, they can do it!!

title: Great for overnight stay
comment: I stay here when I'm attending a meeting or lecturing at Penn. Rooms are nicely appointed, the bed and pillows are comfortable, and it's easy to plug stuff in.

title: JFK Airport Hotel
comment: The staff in the restaurant has no business waiting on the public. It took us over one hour to get a chicken sandwich and hamburger. The order got botched up twice.

everyoneShouldKnow: Swimming pool food and Restaurant was great.
title: great location
comment: We were quite delighted overall, however the lack of cups,and utensils were unavailable, this was a five star hotel exspected a cup and saucer at least.

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is convenient if you have business with WBB, Inc. and need it to be cost-effective.
title: Excellent hotel for business trip
comment: I stay at this hotel for conferences or workshops for the WBB, Inc. It's very convenient for the purpose of the conference.

title: Another wonderful stay in Sonoma County
comment: I travel here frequently. I switched to a lesser hotel at one point but the service was so poor I've come back to the Belvoir.

title: access
comment: this hotel is easy to find & travel to.

everyoneShouldKnow: This is a very nice hotel in a nice area with food and shopping very nearby.
title: Almost completely satified
comment: My only issue is with the system of overbooking bed types. When i reserve a king bed months in advance i expect a king bed when i arrive, not an excuse of first come first get. So it seems if you book a flight that arrives in the late afternoon or early evening you may be out of luck for the bed type you reserved. I could go on and on about this constant problem, but i know most of you may have experienced this before.

title: farmer
comment: nice comforterable place to stay.

title: Parking Garage Sucks
comment: Very bad system. Getting in and out of garage needs to be changed. Way to customer unfriendly. Staff needs to explain in detail how this very poor system works. If you make a mistake you have to make a u-turn in an unsaft manner and then drive the wrong way on a one way lane which almost caused an accident. I will NOT stay here again.

title: I'd stay there again...but
comment: This is a suite hotel so the living room gets used...time for a new couch. This one was just about un-sittable. Totally uncomfortable due to age. Also, bathroom sink clogged from the get go, the housekeepers had to have seen that if they cleaned and there were major stains and dirt under sink. With all that said, bed was great, location terrific and staff at desk really good.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location in Country Club Plaza and very friendly, attentive staff
title: Very friendly, attentive service
comment: I was impressed by the staff - front desk clerk and room service in particular. Room Service contacted me to ensure my breakfast was satisfactory.

title: Amazing staff!
comment: We loved the hotel, free parking, great location and amazing staff. We were in town for a conference and got called home due to a death in the family. They did not charge us a cancellation nor a late check out fee and could not been more sympathetic, offering me water and tissues for our long trip home. We will definitely stay here again!

title: Good overall but needs attention
comment: the room was excellent value for money, not large but adequate(remember it is in New york). Maid service service good, Conceigre service varied from helpful to bored(rude), coffee lounge good but why do you have to go there to get free WiFi? Please get in the 21st century Belvoir!

title: Excellent service and very nice hotel
comment: We were treated with great BPG service from start to finish-- room upgrade, quick and helpful with requests for our room (crib, etc), free lounge access and late check out needed for a delayed flight. Despite the weather not being good in Miami the day we were there, the hotel was a good spot to spend a travel day on a long trip.

title: hot room
comment: My room was so hot- could not get it to cool down

everyoneShouldKnow: Clean, nice hotel but didn't really feel like a Belvoir to me - no amentities at all.
title: Missing items
comment: No lamp on desk, lighbulbs out on two other lights, no water bottles in the room - very bare bones all together. Left my sonicare in the room and housekeeping did not find it.....it cannot be anywhere else.

title: Very nice spot near Disneyland and near by restaurants
comment: Good location. Near Disneyland. There are several good restaurants and good shopping stores near by. It is also close to the freeway if you need to get out and about. The staff we very good. Parking charge is a little high.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff from the reservationist to the check in counter, the waiters, the maids - ALL were extremely courteous, considerate and well trained.
title: Belvoir has always been exemplary
comment: There is good ambience beginning with the lobby, to the charming garden restaurant with great buffet and well chosen Hawaiian entertainers.

title: Beautiful hotel
comment: What a beautiful hotel located on the beach our room was clean and the staff was great.

everyoneShouldKnow: I tried another hotel in the area but returned to this Belvoir because of the service and the comfort that they continue to provide.
title: Staff always accomodates to type of visit
comment: I traveled from NV to Cal. The reason for my visit was to have an mri and spinal tap done at UCLA the following morning. I was greeted by a pleasant and respectful young man named DJ. Knowing it wasn't a leisurely visit, DJ made sure I was well taken care of and followed up to insure I was happy with the room I had been assigned. The hotel mgmt was kind enough to have upgraded me to a suite which made that part of my visit very relaxing up through and after my medical tests were completed.

title: fabulous location and great staff!
comment: We loved being able to walk across the street and lounge at the beach. The pool was well kept and in a great central location! Also, great workout facility with nice view of the pool!

title: good service
comment: A very good experience as always in Belvoir chain. Customer service is very good. Most of employees try to go beyond to help.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location. Next door to conference ctr and walking distance to pier, shopping, ad needle
title: AMTC
comment: Great location in a beautiful city made our medical transport conference a wonderful time! Staff was extremely attentive and helpful including the housekeeping crew. A few exceptions though:

title: Grandbourne hit a Home Run
comment: Great property. It has everything except a beach, which is only a short distance away.

title: convenient to LAX and Trader Joes
comment: Would definately use this hotel again. The staff is great and the location is very convenient to the Port.

title: Dolphin 10-12
comment: I was not impressed. I would have thought a Disney + BPG experience would be great, instead it wsa lackluster

title: Staff was very professional...
comment: I had a great experience during my stay primarily due to the staff, from front desk to club lounge.

title: Bad night sleem
comment: The beds were uncomfertable had a bad night sleep. I had to lay on 4 other beds to find a bed that didnt creep then they exchanged the bed with other bed from other room then that night had a great night sleep. I wish we would have gotten a complementary anything or taken off the parking charge of our car

everyoneShouldKnow: Needs a make over of the plumbing
title: Needs improving
comment: Poor plumbing and grumpy staff

title: Doctor
comment: Excellent hotel, would stay there again in a heartbeat!

title: Amazing resort.
comment: I'm an BPG Gold member(formerly Platinum). I've stayed at many Belvoir all over the world and this one takes the cake so far for the ocean views, golf course, cleanness and staff. Great for couples and families. A bit far from downtown Kona when compared to the other locations, but trust me, none come close. Excellent staff, great dining and not overpriced.

title: Home away from home
comment: Our daughter is working in DC and we discovered the Belvoir when we moved her to the city June 2011. I have been fortunate to find sale prices for most of our visits which has really helped us out. Be sure you check the Belvoir website for specials! I love the view driving into DC. Pet friendly so my Yorkie loves the hotel, too! I prefer Alexandria to staying on Capitol Hill. Really enjoy shopping in Olde Town! Shuttle is convenient.

title: Stay at Belvoir
comment: Very good hotel. The room is very cosy and clean, with a very confortable bed. Hotel employes are super attentious. The bathtub is weird, is just too little water in it. Food is a little expensive too, despite of being delicious.

title: Front Desk Staff Needs More Customer Service Training
comment: Front Desk Staff seems low-spirited and does not greet the customer. Inform me my room is not available when I checked in at about 4pm on 21-Oct. She did not even bother to check for alternative until requested to do so. Managed to found an equivalent room later and checked in.

title: Facilities OK
comment: Hotel offers standard facilities in good shape, but some already require renovation

everyoneShouldKnow: It is in a great location, walking distance to the malls and numerous restaurants. Very clean and comfortable.
title: Great location and very friendly staff
comment: Great location in the Uptown area of Albuquerque, the staff are very friendly and facility is exceptional.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's way too noisy... couldn't sleep... had to change hotel. Poor reaction to my concerns about noise
title: Nice, but misses the basics: be able to sleep
comment: Rail way road crossing... Train blows horn almost every hour... cannot just sleep.

title: great location
comment: Able to visit outlet stores conveniently, nice town to walk around. Staff were excellent and very helpful.

title: OK for Business stays
comment: I stay 4-5 nights at the Birmingham Belvoir every month. I use the hotel shuttle every morning to work. The shuttle is often too busy and unable to take me to my office, and I end up taking the cab. The shuttle service needs improving.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very easy to navigate the premises.
title: Organization
comment: My experience was that the entire process from ease of parking, check-in and facilities needed to accommodate my needs were always met quickly and with a smile and earnest feeling that I was not putting anyone out. The facility was perfect and everything I needed was accessible and clean...well kept and appropriate for my every need. Best place I have stayed all year.

everyoneShouldKnow: When I first tried to book on-line hotel was listed as sold out---but they take care of their regulars and can usually find a room if you call.
title: My Favorite Washington, DC Hotel
comment: Another great stay at the Belvoir Pentagon City Hotel. Staff greeted me by name and took care of my every need. They always treat me as a regular guest and upgraded me to a suite with a gorgeous Capitol view. Food and service in the club lounge are the best in ten years of staying here. I'll be back.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient location to downtown and convention center
title: The executive suite layout is very nice!
comment: The executive suite was spacios, clean and comfortable. A nice quiet room.

title: Nice stay in Des Moines
comment: Hotel staff were nice and friendly!

title: Business Manager
comment: I feel very safe staying @ your hotel. Very easy access from the interstate. Rooms are very spacious and clean. Check in and out is very fast.

title: Dissappointing wifi
comment: I enjoyed my first stay at this hotel. The location and staff were both excellent, I could walk to 30+ restaurants. My big problem is they still charge $10/day for internet service. This was VERY, VERY inconvienent. I saw 5-6 people each night trying to use the free service in the side of the lobby on tiny tables and when the tables were all used then people were trying to work with their computer balanced on their lap. It made it impossible to work at all.

title: Nice view from my room.
comment: Very good location for Ft. Lauderdale International Boat Show. Pleasant staff. My room was in the building near the beach. Quiet ... nice view. Convenient location with excellent beach access.

title: Good option
comment: This hotel was a great option for my trip, was only there 24 hours so I didn't get to enjoy all of it's features but the pool area looked nice

title: Bathroom
comment: Most everything was great. Exception I have to note is the shower was only luke warm and the tub drained very slowly, I was standing in 3 inches of water during every shower.

title: Needs refurbishing
comment: The carpets are threadbare; the place needs an overhaul. It's also has an odd layout; I had to carry my suitcase up some stairs to get to the level of my room. Staff is wonderful from the front desk to the breakfast servers.

title: Good for business travel
comment: Close to convention center and interstate. Not the best option for leisure travel since there are not restaurants open at night anywhere within walking distance. Also safety at night beyond the hotel due to its location.

title: Some great parts, some disappointments
comment: I had a 1 bedroom suite in the Boston Belvoir hotel for 1 night and was grateful for my short stay. Good points: check-in/check-out was flawless, room decor is nice, and room was perfectly clean. Bad points: only one of the two rooms' thermostats worked, only one of two TV remote controls worked, 3 calls to room service went unanswered, and room layout is terrible - bathroom door clears the front of the toilet by less than 6 inches, other doors in entrance bump each other, closet tiny... Over all not a good value and one I won't repeat.

title: Standard Shearton Hotel
comment: Overall safe clean and comfortatable full service Belvoir Hotel right off the highway and close to aiport. As many times as I have stayed there not upgraded other than once as a lifetime BPG Platnium. Rooms are dated and could use upgrades...

title: Vermont EMS Show
comment: As always, the staff were great, the room was great and the facility was great. Very disappointed that the main resturant was not open Thursday or Firday night. I understand the economy, but you had a conference in place and only the "pub" was open for meals......

title: business center needs work!
comment: I needed to print some papers but the printer was "having problems" in the 6th floor lounge and out of toner in the "business center." You can't actually call it a Business Center when it is just two public computers where people can check email!

title: Loved the location and history
comment: Short stay but was very nice. Really enjoyed the history of the hotel.

guestFrom: Long Island, NY, Merritt Island, FL
everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is very friendly and helpful
title: The staff is very friendly and helpful
comment: The staff is very friendly and helpful

everyoneShouldKnow: Right next to Crystal City Metro
title: Great stay for Marine Corps Marathon
comment: Convenient to Crystal City Metro and race start. Front desk staff went above and beyond in answering our questions and providing assistance for transportation and attractions; they also sent a special gift for the member of our party who was celebrating a birthday. Helped make our weekend in DC fantastic! Only downside are the incredibly slow elevators.

title: Beautiful Location
comment: The location and the facilities were very nice. The view was amazing and the staff was very helpful!

everyoneShouldKnow: The rooms are not well maintained, the food is marginal, and the business center is very overpriced - relative to other convention hotels at which i have stayed.
title: Overrated
comment: Phones were not set up in my room, and the closet door was off the tracks. I made 2 requests to fix, but they were not addressed. Elevators were very slow, and one was out service in the south(?) tower. Business center charges are laughable - practically fraudulent. It is one thing to make a profit on the conference business, but what you are doing is at the very least excessive. The fitness cetner was great.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great areas lounging areas on both sides of the 4th floor.
title: Great service
comment: The staff helped with a lost credit card and then even offered me water while I was waiting! There was always a person standing in the lobby with a greeting.

everyoneShouldKnow: Bad food, No wifi on the 29th flor south tower
title: Ordinary Hotel
comment: Bad food in the Draft bar

everyoneShouldKnow: You can expect the highest quality service from ALL employees!
title: another fabulous conference at Syracuse University Belvoir Hotel
comment: Staff were amazing. You don't think they can get much better each year but they do. Special thanks to wait staff member "Beth" for her amazing work during all meals at the conference and of course all members at the res desk ,consierge services and Tracy who is always the consumate professional at Reservations and guest services. I am so glad she is still with the organization. She is superb!

title: Liked the layout of the suites
comment: very comfortable rooms and clean

everyoneShouldKnow: It took 5 minutes to get hot water for a shower.,..
comment: One thing...it took at least 5 minutes to get hot water for a shower, other than that it was an A-okay experience!

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is exceptionally helpful and friendly but you have to pay extra for parking
title: Nice hotel too bad they charge extra for parking
comment: Beautiful room, very clean, excellent , friendly and helpful staff. Pay extra for the breakfast buffet because you also get appetizers in the evening included. I did not like the fact that there were not accessible stairs to access the rooms. I also feel that having to pay for parking if you are staying in the hotel is absurd. Overall the stay was great and the beds were extremely comfortable.

title: Came for Work
comment: Enjoyed the property and the room was always fresh and clean!

title: great stay
comment: This Belvoir is a great place to stay and well managed.

title: Needs improvement
comment: As a platinum member i was very dissapointed. In a three day stay, the front desk was never able to make my room key work in the "club room" and my room at the same time. There was no room service menu in my room, and when I called down, I was actually told to "come down and get one". Once I did, I was handed a xerox copy of a menu. Overall the staff was not friendly or helpfull.

title: Staff was terrific at this hotel.
comment: Location and the availability of an offered special were the reasons we decided to try this property. We were very happy with the location...only a few blocks from Independence Mall. It is in a quieter area than some of the other conveniently located hotels, too, which we found pleasant. The gentleman who checked us in at the desk gets an A++ for professionalism, friendliness, and great service. We found the rest of the staff good too. Rooms looked very clean. I had wished there was a small fridge or microwave in the room for convenience, but the way things worked out the lack of these amenities wasn't much of an issue. I absolutely love that the property is 100% smoke free - getting stuck in a smoking room is a deal breaker for us and when all rooms are nonsmoking you don't have to worry about that happening. There was a wedding one night we were there and it was noisy...the walls seem not very soundproof and we could hear not only the wedding music into the night but clearly heard conversations of the people in the next room, but this was not enough of an issue that it would deter us staying again in the future. Overall, very happy with our choice to stay here. All properties near the historic district are expensive but this wasn't any worse than others in the area with the special they were offering. If an affordable room was available on our next trip we would stay here again in a heartbeat. Unfortunately, I have forgotten his name, but to the gentleman working the check-in desk late at night on October 24th, thank you! Your customer service skills are outstanding and contributed much to our high level of satisfaction.

title: This hotel is a great place to stay
comment: This is still a great property,excellent desk staff,valet staff and each employee I encountered was courteous and friendly..Staff were readily available to provide assistance when requested.I really enjoyed my Accommodatiuons.Again thank each of you.

everyoneShouldKnow: Upgraded furnishings and bedding! Easy access to a great mall!
title: Very nice hotel with just a couple of issues
comment: I was put in the very last room of a wing next to the stairwell door. I could not get wifi in my room which was very disappointing. No business person can do without wifi in their room. The room itself was very nice. The prices at the bar were BIG city prices, not Albuquerque NM prices. So go to another bar for a drink. I was at a conference and the facilities and food were very nice. We were smashed into a small room on Day 2 with a low ceiling that made the room seem very small and stuffy, but we were only there 1/2 day. The hotel is very convenient to a wonderful mall with great restaurants and they will shuttle you over there! Front desk staff very customer service oriented. ( I watched them deal with an upset customer and they handled the situation very well.) Great fitness room! I would stay there again.

title: Great Staff and Comfortable Lounge
comment: Convenient shuttle service from/to airport; the staff was very attentive and assisted in providing for some forgotten personal hygiene items; room was clean and comfortable; and able to unwind and enjoy a good meal and a few drinks in the restaurant/lounge.

title: Wonderful experience
comment: I would definitely recommend this property. I was working a special event during my stay and did not have an opportunity to enjoy many of the awesome amenities but did have the chance to sing karaoke at Kimono's and enjoy the dueling pianos at Jelly Rolls! I had a blast. The hotel staff was very accommodating and very responsive to any needs and requests I had.

title: Average
comment: The hotel stay was average. My room smelled like stale smoke. The hotel charges for Internet access in the room, but access is free in the lobby. For business purposes, I paid for Internet access. The service in the hotel restaurant was slow at best. Room service was excellent.

everyoneShouldKnow: try to get a romm on the 14/15th floor enjoy the club lounge
title: Nice stay with our dog
comment: Upon check in girl at desk could have made eye contact, rooms were great but bathroom doors were shabby, we had to change rooms after the first night due to noise (baby youg child and dog next door) this was no problem at all Bill the manager brought up baggage trolley and new keys and moved us to the Club floor which was much appreciated, bar tender was very friendly but server was terse. over all i would stay here again for no reason at all other than i enjoyed it.

title: The staff was amazing!
comment: The staff and amenities and overall experience was excellent! I can't wait to come back! The staff was very helpful in recommendations for entertainment and eateries. It was wonderful and made the trip a memorable one that won't soon be forgotten. Thanks Belvoir Boston!!

title: Love the hotel and location
comment: Hotel is perfectly located on the beach. My family age range 19-54 love all the amenities the hotel has to offer. We love the diversity of the hotel guests, the infinity pool, the beach and proximity to the hustle and bustle of Waikiki. First hotel choice always. Staff is always welcoming and friendly.

everyoneShouldKnow: Its very clean and its nice to have a Microwave and Laundry room for customers to use.
title: A home away from home for 1 night
comment: This hotel was clean, quiet and comfortable. A microwave and Laundry room for people like me who just about live on the road! Its nice to know I can find a hotel that has a close to home feel! Thumbs up from Excellent customer service from the driver to the front desk!

title: Conference
