comment: This hotel met the needs of the conference with the exception of not enough food choices without going to the Marina Tower.

title: Great Hotel to see Mickey...
comment: Belvoir really came through for us when we went to Disney. It was conviently located near the resort with free transport on a daily shuttle. The schedule could have had a few more runs, but it was still acceptable so we did not need a rental. The hotel was with in walking distance of alot of great restaurant if you have a large family (we were 6) ... I best part was the hotel had 2 great pools as well that the kids loved since they love the water...

title: Good Housekeeping can make the difference
comment: Overall the service and accomidations where excellent. Amelia went above and beyond the normal duties of housekeeping. After one night she knew what items I used the most and doubled them up, it was very thoughtfull and made my stay far more enjoyable and relaxing.

title: Elevators
comment: Only negative is the elevators use room keys and that is a great security measure, but each elevator operated differently, highly frustrating.

everyoneShouldKnow: Its integration into the "T" public transit system is awesome!
title: Superb hotel, location, cleanliness and elegance
comment: The heading says it all. Quite possibly this is the most elegant Belvoir property at which I've had the pleasure to lodge.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenience to ferry terminal. Get your tickets at the front desk
title: Comfortable with nice pool and health club
comment: Staff was courteous and helpful.

everyoneShouldKnow: The front desk service was not good.
title: Rm 811
comment: I left my phone charger in the room by mistake and returned after my meeting and it was gone. I reported it to the front desk staff and they acted as though I was not telling the truth and just blew me off. Another guest staying at the hotel that I didn't know even commented on how they acted . I will never stay at this hotel again the front desk staff that I spoke with about the charger was horrible.

title: wonderful care
comment: Tina my room attendant for my last two stays has been beyond incredible. She not only does her job, but caters to all my needs and requests. She is kind, caring and a true ambassador for Belvoir. Give her a star

title: The staff went above and beyond
comment: I cannot say enough things about the staff at the Baltimore Belvoir North. During the July power outage, my husband and I stayed there for several days, together with many stranded folk and BGE service crews. While they may have been overwhelmed, they never showed it. They were always courteous. The service never flagged. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The breakfast was always more than sufficient.

title: Hotel newly renovated and great staff
comment: Hotel has been newly renovate and staff is professional and welcoming.

title: disappointed with the bathroom and parking
comment: the bathroom was very small and hard to naviagate the parking

everyoneShouldKnow: Do not eat at the restaurant.
title: Missing some key elements to a good hotel
comment: Every room I've been in at this hotel has a musty odor when you enter the room. It causes some discomfort. The restaurant seems to be understaffed every night and the food is practically unbearable. Never comes out as described or how you asked. (e.g. "three butterflied shrimp" in the description and you get three un-butterflied shrimp that aren't de-vained) I have stayed here a few times and it just does not meet the standards of most BPG hotels.

title: Valet Parking fee issue
comment: The ACHE sent out valet parking rate of $25.15. Upon arrival the valet service said it was about $42.00.The desk clerk upon check in said the Valet service would have to deal with the discrepancy. I presented this issue to the hotel person assigned to our conference with no results. I presented it again to the desk clerk that night who said to bring the ACHE documentation to the front desk. I again presented it to the front desk clerk on the morning of departure. On the day of check out the original fee document was presented to the desk clerk who read it and then referred us to the valet area. The charge was finally corrected after we checked out but it took us two days working with multiple people who talked the talk but did not walk the walk. Very irritating!

everyoneShouldKnow: Free Shutte to/from Sundance Square Rooms very clean.
title: Rooms Very Clean
comment: First time to stay at the Belvoir downtown Fort Worth. My husband and I were just getting away for a couple of days of R&R. Our room was VERY clean...much appreciated. Hotel provided a free shuttle to/from Sundance Square which was very nice. On the first night I had to call the front desk because there was a large and very loud dog across the hall from our room barking and howling. On the second night we ordered a pizza and drinks from room service around 10:30 p.m....we waited an hour and a half and it never showed up....room service closed at midnight ... called front desk ... they were apologetic but we never got our pizza. The a/c in our room got super loud and vibrating so we got up and went home at 4:00 a.m.

everyoneShouldKnow: The service staff can't be beat. They are knowledgeable, polite and very courteous from the bell man, housekeeping, concierage, reservations and the bar and restaurant staff. It's the people that makes this hotel a great stay. Accomadations are very comfortable also
title: This hotel is kid friendly
comment: We were a party of four with dinner reservation for 7:00 PM. While my adult granddaughter and I were freshening up after a day out with the kids. The kids were busy playing in the room.

title: Great location and great experience
comment: I wanted to thank you again for your staff's hospitality and professionalism and to let you know how much we enjoyed our stay at the Belvoir Hotel in New York City. We came to New York hoping to see as much as could of your exciting city and we definitely accomplished that. Now I know what Frank Sinatra was referring to when he said that I want to wake up in the city that never sleeps. We look forward to being a part of it again soon.

title: Pet friendly
comment: Love the pet friendly atmosphere

title: Beautiful location and resort
comment: Wild Horse Pass is a relaxing and nice resort. I'd like to return on pleasure and enjoy the golf course and pool. I was there on business for a conference. Only challenge during the stay was cell phone coverage and connectivity with internet in the meeting room. Very limited in both areas which made business difficult.

title: Great Views
comment: Great hotel in the heart of downtown Chicago. Walking distance to most major attractions downtown. You may need to take a taxi to any one of the CTA subway stops, however. Nice, spacious rooms with views of Lake Michigan. Friendly staff, great BPG program recognition, and all around great service. I would recommend this hotel.

title: watch for cold water
comment: The hotel was nice and the staff was very helpful. But if you need a morning shower watch for it being cold. I was there for 4 days and had a very cold shower 3 days out of the 4. The bathrooms were pick up but were not cleaned daily. other than that had a nice time there.

title: second experience
comment: We tried the Belvoir again for the second time. Once again, I was disappointed. I booked online through your website. I specially request a king bed. When I got there the man at the counter said"all we have our doubles". After I paid extra for a king. And the door on room didn't close unless locked. It was awful experience

title: Staff was excelent
comment: Front desk staff helped with a requested room change without hesitation. Very accommodating, very pleased.

title: Some improvement needed
comment: This started several months ago when we attempted to reserve a room for a handicapped individual. Multiple phone calls still couldn't ensure that one of the occupants of the room would have a handicapped accessible shower, let alone the requisite refrigerator that was absolutely necessary. Two occupants were to use the room, both elderly women and one more handicapped than the other. It turns out the roll-in bed that one was expected to sleep in would be difficult for a small person to to be comfortable in, let alone an adult with back problems which were extremely exacerbated after one night spent on the bed. Fortunately, an astute member of the staff suggested a room change after multiple complaints about the telephone (see below) and the guests were transferred, including the refrigerator. The problem is that the refrigerator was not plugged in at its new destination, thereby ruining the contents.

title: Room dirty, staff not that friendly
comment: When we checked in, our bathroom was dirty and the phones didn't work. Front office staff was friendly, but the DRAFT staff and the KITCHEN TABLE staff was not friendly or attentive. The woman who ran the business center was terribly rude! We had received a shipment on Wednesday evening, but had not been notified. When we inquired, she confirmed that it had been received, but that it would take 20 mins to pick up from the loading dock. I expressed that we were in a hurry, and asked if there was a faster way. She said "no" and that I would have to wait until all of the people in front of me were helped first. There was a significant line of people. The problem with that is the fact that I was the second person to walk into the business center to inquire. While she was looking for my package in the computer, several others had walked in. Again, she was truly rude. We had to leave one of our party behind to pick up the package while we went to the convention. She finally went to pick up the package, and charged us $16.00. Pretty bad.

title: Average and Below Average for Grandbourne
comment: I travel a lot and expect more from a Grandbourne property, especially when they upped my rate on me. They were understaffed and everything took forever no matter what you needed; a package pick up, room key, have a question, need coffee, and this trickled over to their bar and restaurant. They messed up my breakfast order and when I said something the next day (since I could not wait an hour for them to fix it) they sent a manager to my room early in the morning to ask me about the issue. She was very polite and I was surprised they would bother me early in the morning without giving me notice. I will not stay here again and I will definitely not recommend the hotel to any of my friends or colleagues who travel just as much as I do.

title: Services Below BPG Expectations
comment: This facility has overhauled its pool area but has forgotten about customer service. What was once FREE parking will now cost you $10. And where there was once attention paid to customer service there has been a dramatic drop related to detail. Poor recognition to BPG status.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient location, not too close to the loud action.
title: Great deal at a good hotel in a good location
comment: The hotel is quite welcoming and met all of our needs in Myrtle. Specifically, there was a concierge names Michael who went above and beyond with each effort, whilst also fetching vehicles - I don;t recall his workmate, but he was also quite good. It is a pleasure to experience an appreciative employee! keep it up

title: Okay overall, but some dissapointments
comment: Overall the Hotel was clean and comfortable, but it is frustrating that there is no easy acces to plug in any electronic devises. Had to move out the desk to access a socket for my lap top, and had to unplug a light fixture to plug in my phone charger. I was also dissapointed to not only have to pay $9.95 for internet access, but the service was so slow I could not get adequate access to the internet, wasting valuable time. I will avoid the Shereton DFW on my next visit to Dallas.

title: What could have gone wrong did go wrong
comment: Room keys didn't work at 3 am, room keys stopped working for club lounge, ice machine broken, internet didn't work, staff member tried to kick me out of my room before our checkout time (very, very insistent that my checkout time was noon when it was 3pm), staff member told me "you're wrong" before hanging up on me when I called to complain, spoke with 3 different managers on 3 different occasions and things only improved on the 3rd complaint.

title: Sand69
comment: The front desk staff were excelent, the waiters/waitresses were very efficient, but I was disappointed that I could not get a bellman to load and take out my luggage, and then there was a 40 minute wait on the valets bringing the car for me to leave. I did not expect that having to pay $20.00 for parking!

everyoneShouldKnow: friendly and most helpful staff. they make you feel at home!
title: people that work at this hotel are friendly and at your service at all time
comment: we enjoyed are stay very much everyone from the valet to the bartender( Ivanna) and the manager of zest (John) were very nice and

everyoneShouldKnow: The Staff and Location of the Resort is exceptional.
title: above expectations
comment: Was recommended by a friend who lives on kauai but was skeptical by a few reviews i read online, i am so happy i listened to him because my 7 night stay was amazing. I have never written a review before for anything but with the expierience i had there i felt people looking to head to kauai should know what the Belvoir has to offer. From the moment i arrived after a 17 hour flight feeling a little irritable i was welcomed by valet,front desk and bellhop with the most upbeat welcome. with my stay there the housekeepers always said aloha in passing, restaurant and bar staff very friendly and outgoing. The pools are amazing and can't beat the amazing beach access with poipu beach being right next door, and the best sunset spot on the island. Also within a 1/2 mile 2 shopping areas with excellent shopping for souveniers, fine art, general stores and a mix of all kinds of restaurants. Everthing a hawaii vacation should be. Props to the Belvoir staff!!

title: Average hotel
comment: i stayed at this hotel because the training i was attending was also held here. overall, no significant complaints. i kind of knew, coming in, that it wasn't going to be a hotel that was going to exceed my expectations. i don't have any unrealistic needs, so it was ok. cleanliness - ok. not all tv channels worked. not enough pc's and printers.

title: Great staff
comment: Very surprised. Staff was the best part- Olivia went out of her way to find a place for me to kayak, the time it was open and the price. She did the same for the aquarium and it was the best part of our trip.

title: Overpriced for what you get
comment: The double bed room I stayed in had fairly basic bathroom fixtures and a "very" small room and bathroom floorspace for the price. There is no way an extra cot would fit in the room and still allow walking space. The bed and pillows were quite comfortable though.

title: Needs
comment: Hotel facilities are excellent and people are friendly and helpful. Just few issues on room services..

title: Amazing
comment: Beautiful place to stay and the best beach on the entire island!

title: Great atomosphere
comment: The new renovation to this Belvoir with direct access to I-75 in Tampa were awesome. First-rate looks to boast about...maid service was a bit lacking with my room not cleaned until after 4:00pm on all days I was there so hopefully this msg will be seen by the right eyes

title: Good Location
comment: We have stayed at a number of Westin Hotels and the Belvoir in SLC came up to standard in most areas. The lo9cation to the airport and city centre we found acceptable plus the hotel has a courtesy bus service. Our only minor quibles would be that the bathroom lacked a fan and the room did not have a safe (although the hotel does provide this service at reception) we would use theis hotel again.

title: Business Conference
comment: Perfect for conference! Comfortable bed! Great location right off Route 495 in Framingham- convenient!

title: The food was not good
comment: The overall experience in the hotel was good but the food was not good at all. Also the staff coulld be a little friendlier.

title: This hotel has great service
comment: Professional, accomodating, informative staff.

title: Lifetime platnium member who was disapointed
comment: I've stayed at this property for many years as the Safari...this was my 1st visit after the remodel was completed.

everyoneShouldKnow: Resort fee/daily parking fees ok a
title: Friendly staff
comment: we came for a quick day at Disney then stayed overnight here. Check in was quick and easy. Rooms comfortable and great beds! Only issue was only one gate working to exit the hotel.

title: Great Hospitality
comment: Spent our anniversary, staff was great.

everyoneShouldKnow: Majority of the staff here works and tries extremely hard. Despite the one agent who check me in this time.
title: Convention Central
comment: When I originally check in the front desk employee didn't recognize me as a gold member and place me on a floor where the heart of a convention people were located. I went down stairs and the manager apologize and switch my room to a much quite floor honoring my status. Also in the club, employee Xavier went above and beyond when a guest let non-members in the room who took a lot of the night time goodies, he went down stairs and help me out with some crackers with the cheese and cracker plates. I really want to acknowledge him for his superior customer service.

title: upgraded to club level
comment: First surprise - they allowed me to check in early

title: Perfect stay
comment: the hotel was efficient and attentive; everything was lovely; wonderful room.

title: No free WiFi !
comment: In this day and time why are you charging for WiFi? Other than that the hotel was nice and I would stay there if necessary.

title: Met my needs for a quick overnight
comment: I was in Louisville for a conference...and all downtown Louisville hotels were either booked...or had outrageous rates for the night. Because I needed to be downtown early in the morning... I wanted to be close to my conference hotel and not fight traffic. The reviews of the Belvoir were good... and the rate I received for the night was fantastic. It was only a mile from my conference...and fairly easy to find. I didn't arrive until late in the evening...and the staff was great. So very personable. Room was clean, quiet and had everything i needed. The only downside was the wireless was out...but it was out around the entire block...so no fault of the hotel. I would definitely stay here again, if rate was right.

everyoneShouldKnow: Probably the best deal around if if you want price, comfort & elegance
title: I felt like visiting royalty!
comment: When making the phone call to reserve, my agent was so helpful and friendly! On arrival, we were given a free upgrade to a lovely room. The resturant staff went out of their way to be helpful. The whole experience was wonderful.

title: "cab" does not mean "expensive Escalade"
comment: My only gripe about this hotel was that I had requested a "cab" to take me to a close by location. Instead of a cab, the hotel provided a Cadillac Escalade, costing me $35.00 to my location as compared to the $12.00 I paid a true local cab on the way back to the hotel. I guess the hotel believes all Grandbourne members love to waste money. It would have been nice to have been given the option and not forced to pay for the upgrade in service.

title: Awesome!!!!
comment: Warm and friendly staff and reception was great!

title: Under construction
comment: At the time of our visit, this Belvoir was under heavy construction with room renovation. While the newly renovated room was beautiful, nobody informed us of the construction that was going on.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff will take care of you.
title: Wonderful Hotel
comment: This was one of the cleanest and friendliest hotels I have ever stayed in.

title: Great location but way overpriced
comment: I booked this hotel because of a conference in another hotel nearby and wanted to give a little luxary to my wife who was joining me. Big disappointment. Small room, no view, standard bathroom(it's beetter at a Day's Inn!). No pool. You may go to fitness center at surcharge. You may leave bags (at a surcharge). The one advantage was the great location near Times Square.

title: Average hotel in a good location
comment: The facilities are modest, even with recent renovations, very clear evidence of wear. The staff was kind but somewhat absent minded (dirty linens were left behind by housekeeping when I arrrived, I could not get anyone to bring me a room service menu). Food was average to below.

title: Great service
comment: The employees were very helpful in making my stay more comfortable

title: Front Desk
comment: Hotel was nicely located to Epcot. However I was quite shocked at the daily resort fee for "internet access, 2 bottles of water and access to gym" Also the fee just to park my car ($15 for self park or $20 for valet plus tax). In addition when I reviewed my bill there was a charge for the lobby lounge after I went to bed. I went to dispute my bill along with other issues and my interigity was questioned by front desk staff "Megan" I explained I did not have these drinks in fact when I checked I specificly requested I did not want any room charging priviledges to my room. Megan than pulled the reciept and asked for something with my signature on it which I provided my driver's license, and two other items with my signature. It was quite obvisous it was not my signature however she spent at least 3 to 5 minutes doing a handwriting analyasis at which time I told just charge me for the $17 as she is was questioning my interigity. She than hestatily stated she would remove the charge. The second issue was with the valet parking. I was charged for two cars and and only had one. She questioned this too. The impression I got from her was she was not there to help but question everything I brought up. After about 10 minutes they were able to get the bill right. The expierence at the hotel was an overall 4 out of 5 until check out. The check out process (which is the last impression a guest recieves) had convinced me to book another hotel the next time I am in the area.

everyoneShouldKnow: Lots of room in the rooms.
title: MJ
comment: Our stay at Belvoir Suites Columbus was excellant. Room and all aspects of the hotel were very clean. Staff was very friendly. Will definitely stay there again when in the area.

title: My room was damp and musty.
comment: I was on the first floor, corner room and my room was not only damp, but smelled musty. When I got home and unpacked from my business trip, my family was alarmed at how my clothes smelled it was that bad. thankfully I was there for only 2 days for a convention.

title: Superior Convience n Late Night Service
comment: Ideal airport property, located right in the Bradley Terminal, just outside of the TSA. Late night food n bar service superb, great bonus for late evening arriving air carrier passengers.

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent Location! WDW convenience without the Disney Dollar Drain!
title: Dolphin was Simply Super
comment: Great Staff and Super facilities. Friendly service and unique locale to meet all my Disney plans.

title: Great Service at Great Rates!
comment: I was very please with the service I received at this hotel, staff was friendly and helpful, recognized government employees, very good food, and all around great experience in the heart of Norfolk. Will stay at again.

title: Above and beyond!!
comment: I would just like to say that I am very impressed with the staff at this Belvoir location!! I am a coordinator who arranged this stay for our CEO who was coming in from Minnesota. The hotel was very accommodating on arranging ground transportation and for making our CEO feel right at home!! I even received a kudos call from her commending me on a great choice for her stay!! Thank you Belvoir DFW, you will be on our short list for future needs in the Dallas area!

title: Excellent facility
comment: The severe weather limited my use of the facility but I was extremely pleased with this hotet, its facilities and services

title: Needs Spa
comment: I was very surprised that such a big hotel did not have a spa of any type. The conceierge recommended a place which was in a shopping mall.

title: Business Mtg
comment: I stayed at the Belvoir Roanoke for a business sales meeting. The rooms were comfortable, the facilities were very nice, and the staff was very friendly and helpful

everyoneShouldKnow: If you're planning on going to the Casino this is best because you get total peace and quiet plus luxury at this hotel. The shuttle was such a fast turn around it wasn't an inconvenience at all.
title: This hotel is the absolute best.
comment: This is my second time staying on this property and each time the experience was fabulous. As an Arizona resident this will be the "Staycation" hotel next summer.

title: Poor House Keeping Service
comment: I had to request 4 times to have the down bed linens removed from my bed because I'm allergic to them. The 4th request was o the manager at which time a very nice young man named Erin came and remove the linnens and brought new linens and pillows and make the bed up. Eventhough house-keping was still there, they never came to the room to re-make the bed nor did the manager I spoke with check back to see if everything was taken care of.

title: Rooms Need attention
comment: This was my second visit to this Belvoir, which looks so nice on the outside until you get into a room. On both occasions, the windows were taped up and defective--and I had to change rooms. This recent time, my new room had 50% of the window fogged, because there was a gas leak in-between the panes of glass.

title: Great place to stay!
comment: The hotel was beautiful. It was close to the conference center as well as numerous restaurants. The staff was WONDERFUL. They gave us recommendations for restaurants multiple times and each time, it was a great suggestion.

title: nice
comment: very nice clean professional hotel

title: very comfortable
comment: The beds and sheets were great. Everything was nice and clean. The staff was great. The food downstairs was also great. The only negative I could find was the closet door had a little issue.

title: Great Place
comment: Had a wonderful stay. Place was clean and staff was wonderful!! hotel needs updating

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is wonderful, also hotel is busy and usually bustling, good for the NY experience.
title: BPG award stay
comment: Spoke with a Belvoir rep to book my NY Belvoir stay. She went out of her way to find me a club room. The room was lovely, very clean, nicely appointed. Free breakfast and nightly hors d'ouvres. My only reservation was that the room and bathroom were quite small for two women. Still, overall the experience was excellent.

title: Good - could use another mirror in the room
comment: Good, comfortable, could use another mirror when traveling with students.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's beautiful and in a wonderful location!
title: Great View. Great location!
comment: Beautiful hotel, wonderful view! Glad we upgraded to ocean view! The Poipu area was excellent! Lots of great restaurants, ocean views, etc!

title: Executive Lounge
comment: Im a 10-year elite member. On Sunday, Oct 28th, I was in the executive lounge a little after 6am.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very good food at Molly's and J Witherspoon's.
title: Enjoyed my second stay very much
comment: Convenient, well run, helpful staff.

everyoneShouldKnow: Marvelous location with stunning room views. Quiet. Impeccable service and accommodating staff.
title: Outstanding
comment: From the time to arrival to departure, the staff was friendly, accommodating and extremely helpful. The property was well maintained; my room was quiet, clean, and the shower had plenty of pressure. The room-service dinner (chowder and salmon) were prepared perfectly. Overall an great experience and for sure worthwhile to come back.

title: This hotel was very nice
comment: Everything was nice except:

title: Green Choice
comment: One of the best things about the hotel is that they offer an innovative "green choice." If you choose not to have linens and towels washed daily, you get a $5.00 coupon each day you choose to do so to spend on meals, at gift shop, etc. I thought this a creative incentive to help save the planet. THANKS!

everyoneShouldKnow: Friendly staff, clean and comfortable beds and rooms. Centrally located to major attractions.
title: Enjoyed my stay very much!
comment: I enjoyed my stay so very much. I immediately booked five rooms for my daughter's graduation in May 2013. The breakfast was fantastic ,the service and staff were helpful and friendly.

title: Pretravel Stay
comment: This is incredibly convenient to stay at the airport prior to an early morning flight. Staff accompanied us from hotel to airline desk. They were on time and had a smile on their face at 5 am! Parking is also great, and much less expensive than the airport. Will do this again.

title: Average
comment: Clean hotel in decent location. Rooms are small and have no perks to speak of . You will pay for absolutely everything here. No continential breakfast, coffee or tea etc. Just an OK place to stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: It Was Clean And Every one Was Happy.
title: Was a good Stay
comment: Keepup the good work.And keep your worker happy.

everyoneShouldKnow: Wonderful staff, great accomidations, convienent location to down town attactions, great value.
title: Belvoir Midwest City Ok
comment: All is good, my room is always clean and nice. All your staff is perfessional kind and curtious.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very nice staff but noise levels between rooms is too high.
title: Great Staff - Poor Judgement on Managments Part
comment: This hotel has a great staff and very comfortable rooms. However, the noise level with adjoining rooms is very bad. I could here all the conversations going on in the next room as if I was sitting in the room with them. Additionally, be warned that the hotel ATM machines charge $4.00 for taking out cash :-( I think between that and the ridiculous room service rates I felt like I was being nickel and dimed. Too bad because it cheapened the experience. As a result I chose to go to Wild Horse Pass next time. Not a first class experience.

title: Starhot Employee
comment: I've stayed many times when it was the Safari however when I walked into the lobby I was hit with the wow factor, not only does the hotel look great but the staff is a complete 180 from the Safari. Great Job!

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff I encountered were very friendly and helpful.
title: This hotel suited my needs perfectly.
comment: From location to exercise facility to customer service, this hotel did not disappoint me. My stay was both comfortable and enjoyable. I would definitely stay here again when I need a hotel for a visit to Kansas City.

title: Key cards are a huge problem
comment: The only negative with this hotel is that the key cards are too easily demagnetized. When we checked in, another guest was complaining their keys didn't work. Then ours didn't work -- TWICE. Every time we were at front desk (5 times), there was at least one guest there to get new keys that worked.

title: Very Accommodating Hotel
comment: When I arrived for a recent stay at this hotel, I discovered my reservation had not been finalized. The front desk staff assisted me with making a new reservation, and honored the rate I had been quoted previously online. In addition, I needed to leave a day early due to an impending storm. The front desk staff were very understanding and did not charge me an early departure fee. Great service, and super comfortable rooms. I will definitely return!

title: Very convienient and comfortable
comment: Had a litle something for everyone. Sports Bar, comfort food restaurant, quiet rooms, pleasant and helpul conceriege services, very nice concierige floor services and personnel. Some negatives, beyond their control, like dearth of restaurants and things to do in downtown Dallas. Some within their control like needing real drawers in rooms for clothes, and the doormen trying to steer people to expensive limos instead of summoning a cab as requested.

title: the hotel rooms are too small
comment: You can shut the lights and turn off the TV without leaving your bed. That's how small the room is.

everyoneShouldKnow: Rooms on the Ocean Front provide the best view.
title: Beautiful Property
comment: We returned to Kaui and Poipu on our 29th Wedding Anniversary. We enjoyed the Belvoir Kaui and our Ocean Front Room. The staff is excellent and friendly and provided us with information that made our visit so much more enjoyable. We were a little dissappointed in the limited breakfast menu at Rum Fire. Due to the limited hours of Lava's, we were unable to enjoy our complimentary bottle of champagne.

everyoneShouldKnow: Plan ahead for parking - it's in a downtown garage deck, $12 a day, and when you go to turn in your ticket at the little gate house on your way out - they don't take credit cards!! Make sure to ask the Belvoir to put the parking charge on your room, or make sure you have cash or checks (they take both). I was in a hurry that day with my schedule, and having to re-park, return to the Belvoir, and handle the parking was a real hassle!
title: Pleasantly surprised!
comment: Stayed at this hotel during a conference last week, and was pleasantly surprised that it surpassed my expectations! The room was very clean, the bed comfortable, the in room coffee wonderful - and the staff extremely friendly and helpful!

title: Enjoyed the stay
comment: This hotel was in a great location. I ejoyed my stay and the room was very nice, the bathroom could have been bigger. I really enjoyed the firepits, very relaxing after a long day. The staff was very helpful. I felt the food was a little pricey

title: Convenient Hotel in Des Moines
comment: Nice Belvoir property conveniently located just off I-35 for those passing through town. For me, the hotel was a little far from downtown, but the rate and room availability make this hotel a top choice for my trip. Rooms were clean and modernwhat you would expect from a Belvoir property. Free parking was a plus. I recommend this hotel.

title: Denied access to room
comment: Hello

title: Market week stay
comment: During Market Week this has been one of my favorite hotels to stay in, but this time something happened that it wasn't the same. The staff was not as helpful as always, the room I stayed in was not as clean and was not maintained. I hope this is taken care of as it can be such a great hotel.

title: great hotel and location
comment: We stay here when we come to San Antonio. This hotel and staff is wonderful. This last stay I had an issue with my room and went to front desk and lucy did not hesitate or question putting me in another room. This was the first proplem in the 3 years that we have stayed there. Also the bar is very nice, especially meeting Jarrod who was a great bartender

title: Excellent service
comment: Upon checking in we were greeted by Tracy at the counter . He was super helpful and got us checked in quickly. Also when we came down to get local shuttle he called driver so we could get eta as we were going to get a dinner cruise for friends wedding found that info out for us and scheduled shuttle to come get us in the the meantime while waiting he gave up complimentary drink while we were waiting, He was very helpful and made it a great experience for us!

title: Staff
comment: Staff was friendly 60% of the time. Had some interactions that were suprising from a hotel that I spent alot of money to avoid such occasions. Depsite these, others made up with thier constant smile and engaging personalities.

title: Safe and secure traveler
comment: Arrived unexpectedly a day before my reservation arrival date/time. Staff worked magic to find me accomodations on busy Friday night. Stayed both nights. Room clean and well setup. Restaurant personnel were fantastic, food (especially am buffet) very good. I'd recommend this to my friends coming to Wilmington.

title: GREAT WEEKEND
comment: The room was very nice. The beds were

everyoneShouldKnow: It's a great place to stay!
title: Great place to stay!
comment: My husband and I recently stayed at the Belvoir Universal Studios Hollywood and found it to be an excellent hotel experience. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. The room was comfortable and beautiful as well as its view. We had the continental breakfast and the evening horduerves - both were high quality and tasty with a wide variety of food and drink. We will definitely stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming!
title: The service was amazing!
comment: I was incredibly impressed with the level of service at The Belvoir Anchorage. The staff went over and above when it came to meeting my needs- even anticipating my needs. I would not hesitate to encourage any of my friends or family members to make this hotel "home" away from home. From the moment I checked in until I returned my key on the final day I felt like a cherished guest.

title: conveniently located near
comment: This hotel is only a gorgeous walk from The Boardwalk and Epcot

title: A few problems with staff.
comment: I love almost every BPG hotel I stay in, but this Belvoir was an exception. I needed a late check out, and I understood the hotel's policy that it couldn't be guaranteed until 9am on the day of check out, but the staff was very unfriendly in the way this was communicated. They just seemed exasperated and annoyed. I understand that they must get this request a lot, but the service just didn't rise to the level of courtesy that I've come to expect from BPG hotel staff.

everyoneShouldKnow: Friend staff with convenient location. Very clean rooms
title: GREAT CONFERNECE HOTEL
comment: This hotel was close to convention center and airport. Local rail was also near by so getting around was easy. Hotel food services were wonderful. Pool and finess center were execellent.

everyoneShouldKnow: Leave all your stresses behind. This hotel rejuvinates your mind and soul. My husband actually commented. "It's good to hear you laugh"
title: This hotel is truly an amazing destination.
comment: My husband and i spent a night there. It was our first time and we didn't want to leave. This hotel is amazing with endless amenities. We had a wonderful dining experience at Shulas, and then headed over to disney boardwalk for an evening stroll. The landscaping and outdoor features were absolutely beautiful. The following morning we worked out at the fitness center. We loved the facility and the shower room was very clean and included all the toiletries, even mouthwash. I felt very spa pampered. We then decided to eat lunch at the burrito/hot food bar. I got the pot roast. It was seriously the best pot roast i ever had. It was definitely a 5 star experience from the time we were greeted at the front desk until we drove away. We plan to make the Dolphin hotel our new getaway destination.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is extremely clean and comfortable
title: Room is a dream!
comment: The room space is ample and bed was wonderful. They have both a heavy comforter as well as a lighter one, so no matter how you choose to sleep, you have a cover that fits your desire. There's no transfer of any noise in the corridors or in other rooms,which makes for a very restful stay. The staff is honestly there to meet every need with a smile. I've stayed in many of the other hotels in this area and this one far outranks any of the others.

title: Very friendly staff & clean hotel
comment: Clean hotel. Had a nice time

title: Perfect for downtown area visitor
comment: I was only in town for 12 hours but was very happy with the efficient staff at check in. Very nice rooms, newly renovated it appeared. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in downtown without a rental car as it was in walking distance to everything.

title: Excellent location and staff
comment: This hotel was a five star rating for me. We enjoyed all of our trip @ the Belvoir. Right by the subway! Will stay again!

everyoneShouldKnow: Rooms have been upgraded and, but for the size, are very comfortable.
title: Convenient and updated
comment: Liked the hotel very much, including the fact that it has many current amenities. Shower curtain rod needed repair, but that was minor. Room a little small, but also a relatively minor inconvenience.

title: sabkaytay
comment: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel as the manager and staff were helpful, addressed me by name and worked efficiently to get me and others checked in or checked out. Comparatively, although they had a large group staying at their hotel; the staff was organized and provided excellent customer service.

title: Master
comment: Gift show was annoying. Prices varied with employees.

everyoneShouldKnow: Its convenient to the convention centre but there are much better and more personal ones in the old town
title: ICCA congress Hotel
comment: Booked a club room which was "ordinary" to say the least. Breakfast on the club floor was very poor and there was only one staff member. Drinks had to be paid foe at cocktail time and again there was little or no service and poor food. Moved to the congress breakfast which was even worse than club floor although it improved on the last 2 days. Eventually had breakfast in Choices restaurant which was excellent. Bar staff were poor and had severe "attitude".

title: Fantastic Location but...
comment: Upon our arrival at the Belvoir Kauai Resort we were greeted by extremely warm, knowledgeable and friendly staff. Being BPG members our room was upgraded to an oceanfront which we greatly appreciated. There was an BPG wine tasting event which we also enjoyed very much. Things took a left from there. Although we were at the resort to celebrate our 24th wedding anniversary, life back home still had to be handled. It was shortly after we arrived in our room that we discovered that the internet was not working. We called down and was told to contact the IT department. We did this 3 times in the course of 2 days trying to get coverage. A modem was finally bought to the room which improved things a bit. Later this same evening It was time for our celebratory dinner and while getting ready, I was greeted by a cockroach from behind the bathroom mirror. We immediately contacted the front desk and was told they would spray while we were at dinner. Upon our return to the room it was evident that the room had been sprayed even though we were told the spray would be odorless. With all that being said, the location of this property cannot be beat, its beautiful. I just wish my lasting impressions of the property were better.

title: What a great place and incredible staff! And special thank you to Yohan at the front desk!
comment: Everyone made me feel at easy and gave great customer service. One of the best stays in a hotel I've had in a long time!

everyoneShouldKnow: Moe at club lounge was the best.
title: Club Lounge
comment: Moe was great and courteous

title: Always happy after our stay!
comment: I have no complaints. The interior is beautiful, our dogs get to stay with us, the staff is nice and we have stayed here every time we've gone to Chicago.

title: Great hotel for this category
comment: I stayed at this hotel Oct 27-29, 2012.

everyoneShouldKnow: Rooms are old, dirty and in desperate need of renovation.
title: Beautiful location, Hotel needs renovation
comment: Mixed feelings. Love this location in Poipu. Staff is very friendly, especially valet team. Bags delivered to room immediately. The problem - and it is a big one: this hotel is WAY over due for a renovation. I've stayed twice in the last 5 years and both times was disgusted by the condition of the room. Battled ants in 2008 and last week - what appeared to be tiny roaches? Mattresses are old, carpet is stained and filthy. The bathroom walls have not been wiped down in DECADES. And the grout in the tub/shower area is nearly black with grime. The room smells old and musty. I thought my experience in 2008 was a fluke - I now know this is just the condition of this sub-standard facility. It's really a shame because the beach location is wonderful. One shouldn't have to feel like they need a shower after stepping out of the hotel shower. I would be embarrassed to recommend this location to anyone (without a huge warning/disclaimer about the rooms). For this reason, I won't return until they renovate. Too many other options available in that price range.

guestFrom: La Jolla, San Diego, CA, USA
title: Perfect location for UCSD visits
comment: This hotel is right off the highway and next to UCSD. The grounds are lush and tropical! The staff is friendly. I have never eaten at their restaurant . Parking is only 10 a day!

everyoneShouldKnow: The best location in the city
title: A great stay!
comment: Club level was great. The reception and check-in was flawless. And the room was spotless. But there were issues. I had to ask 5 people before I got to the right place for my car. And the internet was a pain. I wasn't told about how to get the internet free(A club level extra) until I paid for one day. And the dang thing kept disconnecting. But overall I was very happy with the stay. And I hope one day that the internet will be free everywhere.

title: i loved this place
comment: I was in a deluxe suite and loved it

title: Perfect Room for us
comment: We were very pleased with our room. It was well equipped, very clean and comfortable for our four days and three night stay. The food in the hotel restaraunt was excellent also.

title: Very Central to Wakikii
comment: Very Central to Wakikii, great facilities and staff met any needs requested.

title: Great Experience
comment: The staff went out of their way to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable...and they surely succeded. I will stay at Belvoir again!

title: This hotel not a good value
comment: Room was not clean . There were cookie crumbs on the carpet. We left them and they were not removed when housekeeping cleaned during our stay. The bed covers were stained in several locations. The tub took a long time to drain while showering 3 inches of water built up. When someone was using water in the adjoining rooms it was loud sound in our room.

title: Great Stay!
comment: Great stay, we always enjoy our stay here

title: one suggestion
comment: Excellent hotel and staff. Just one suggestion, there should be a clear sign in all elevators stating that the elevator does not go to the garage, even though there are buttons to push for the garage. It was very confusing to many people.

everyoneShouldKnow: Joy at the front registration desk
title: Great Registration
comment: We were met by a professional, friendly woman named Joy! What a joy she was. She was a great first impression. Room was very clean and new. Great experience all around!

title: An Amazing Weekend
comment: A beautiful hotel with a fabulous staff! It truly made the Eyecon Convention perfect!

title: Good!
comment: Very nice facilities! Accesible and comfortable.

everyoneShouldKnow: The rooms are very spacious and clean. The beds are extremely comfortable. I just wanted to sleep in it all day with the storm outside.
title: Sandy Rising Star
comment: We were in town for the weekend of Hurricane Sandy. The staff was awesome with their unwavered service. The rooms were warm when we checked-in. The weekend turned out very wonderful for our entire family even though the winds were whipping outside. We will always stay at this Belvoir when we come to Ft. Lauderdale. Thank you

everyoneShouldKnow: Overall great. But with cramped rooms.
title: Tiny Room
comment: Overall the hotel is excellent and the staff are terrific. However, my room, which was on the Club level, was very small. I could barely squeeze between the bed and the credenza. I stayed at the hotel last year (on the Club level) and I don't remember the room being that small. Also the bathroom did not have a bathtub.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Location!! I Love you have to have a key to get to the guest floors! Great Safety feature!!
title: Great Location!
comment: Right across from Scott Trade Center. Just down from Union Station! Great for a concert and some sight seeing. Only thing I didn't like was that there were not any luggage carts! Other than that....Great Hotel! Thumbs up!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Hotel staff was very courteouse and helpful.
title: Breakfast buffet needs work
comment: Air conditioner had a mind of it's own. Breakfast bar food was cold and seemed to be old. Omlete was good. Service was slow but staff was very nice. Lucy arranged for my transportation and was wonderful. Felix(driver) was prompt and courteous. A little pricy. Overall a good visit. Next time I just wouldn't have the breakfast buffet.

title: Amazing Stay in Burlington, VT at the Belvoir!
comment: We celebrated our 9th wedding anniversary and had an amazing stay at the Belvoir. Staff Members, exceeded our expectations with their customer service. Absolutey outstanding service and they should be recognized for this. I would highly recommend your hotel and would stay again! Thank you for making us your priority!

title: Stay 10/27/12 through 10/29/12
comment: Absolutely the best staff from check-in, valet, concierge, to the manager, I have ever experienced. Upgrade to club level was well worth it. Everyone in my party raved about the location and the staff. Would definitely stay here on my next trip to Kansas City.

title: My Review
comment: My overall stay at this hotel was outstanding. I would definitely return to this location in the future.

title: The hotel was okay.
comment: Your front staff were not very friendly on checking in. I do not know the name of the female who refused me my room when I first got there, but the person next to her accomodated me right away. Her. unpleasant attitude turned me off

title: Great views
comment: What a beautiful hotel with great views, water all around and a beautiful city scape. Clean comfortable rooms and courteous staff. Thank you!

everyoneShouldKnow: Very clean and beds are very comfortable. Love it!
title: Great!
comment: My room was clean and very comfortable. during our stay we ran out of toilet paper and when our room was checked it was not refilled. we had to use kleenex for the rest of our stay. toilet is very noisy when flushed. otherwise we love staying there.

everyoneShouldKnow: The housemaids couldn't be better they were fantastic, politeand attentive.
title: pleasant stay with just a few exceptions
comment: my wife and I are both Belvoir Hotel and have been for many many years. we made our reservation through the BPG website as we usually would,especially since this time we had 4 of our grand children with us. I requested joining rooms with access door between the 2 rooms since all but 1 are under12 years of age. Arriving at the hotel was a great experience for everyone.at the front desk I reminded the desk clerk that we needed joining rooms with an access door. and I was so accordingly assured everything was in order. Upon entering the rooms, the first thing we noticed was there was no assess door between the two rooms.after finally getting to the manager after being told several times by the desk clerk absolutely nothing can be done the problem was finally solved by him. the rooms where clean and adequate,but where in desperate need of new carpet. Due to the rippleing in 1 of the rooms. But. All and all a fine stay, and the grand kids had a great time.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's sprawling and takes some time to figure out where everything is.
title: The staff was extremely friendly
comment: From a speedy checkin to a chaotic rushed checkout to escape Superstorm Sandy, the staff was unfailingly pleasant, polite and patient during that stressful time. Hats off to them!

everyoneShouldKnow: How close it is to the Amway Center
title: Super Stay
comment: My partner and I went up for a quick weekend to catch a show at the Amway center located a few blocks from the hotel. Much to my surprise, being that we knew the hotel would be very busy at that time, the service was outstanding, from the moment we pulled up, to the moment we left. We will absolutely recommend this hotel to future travelers of downtown Orlando!

title: Front Desk Staff Needs Work
comment: Hotel was nicely located to Epcot. However I was quite shocked at the daily resort fee for "internet access, 2 bottles of water and access to gym" Also the fee just to park my car ($15 for self park or $20 for valet plus tax). In addition when I reviewed my bill there was a charge for the lobby lounge after I went to bed. I went to dispute my bill along with other issues and my interigity was questioned by front desk staff "Megan" I explained I did not have these drinks in fact when I checked I specificly requested I did not want any room charging priviledges to my room. Megan than pulled the reciept and asked for something with my signature on it which I provided my driver's license, and two other items with my signature. It was quite obvisous it was not my signature however she spent at least 3 to 5 minutes doing a handwriting analyasis at which time I told just charge me for the $17 as she is was questioning my interigity. She than hestatily stated she would remove the charge. The second issue was with the valet parking. I was charged for two cars and and only had one. She questioned this too. The impression I got from her was she was not there to help but question everything I brought up. After about 10 minutes they were able to get the bill right. The expierence at the hotel was an overall 4 out of 5 until check out. The check out process (which is the last impression a guest recieves) had convinced me to book another hotel the next time I am in the area.

title: SAD
comment: SAD example for Belvoir and Grandbournes, rude customer service, heat/air very loud blew all night, downstairs lobby area smells, just sad - never again.

title: Wonderful guest experience.
comment: Horrible experience at Shula's resturant. It was recommended by hotel staff; however, the service was horrible and we left after only having drinks. It was unknown when or if our meal was ever going to arrive. Once informed, the management was appropriately concerned. On a positive note, the breakfast was wonderful.

title: Internet Service
comment: I was disappointed that there was a charge for internet service.

title: Location-Location-Location
comment: Best place to stay if your destination is the fairgrounds.

title: Super stay!
comment: The best place I have stayed in years. Even with four young children we were completely satisfied with everything.

title: Great stay in Ann Arbor.
comment: We had a great stay in Ann Arbor. The room was updated and the staff was professional throughout the hotel.

title: Aggravating.
comment: The hotel was very convenient and clean. The room was nice enough. The bellmen were great. However the people at the front desk (or their computer system) were a mess. I had reserved 3 rooms for our party. After we all checked in they were never able to get the rooms assigned to the right names. I had to vouch for the others every time they tried to get in their rooms. Very aggravating!

title: The hotel staff was wonderful
comment: The hotel was very busy, but all of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful.

title: Nice Getaway
comment: This ended up being a nice getaway for our family. Room service was great...the gym was awesome...indoor pool was a big hit. We would stay here again.

title: Loved it
comment: The location was excellent for enjoying downtown Nashville.

title: Worth every dollar spent!
comment: The hotel staff treated us with kindness and respect. We were there for a College Alumni event and the staff was very helpful, patient and respectful. They made us feel welcomed.

everyoneShouldKnow: Virtually nothing has gone wrong with our stays there over 3 1/2 years.
title: Always a Pleasure
comment: Our daughter is a senior at University of Iowa. We have enjoyed many stays at Belvoir Iowa City over the years. The facilty is modern, clean and comfortable. Staff is extremely customer service oriented, and pleasant. Of course, the location is optimal for visits to the University.

everyoneShouldKnow: You can Drive to this hotel, park your car and take the complimentary shuttles to the train and not have to drive during your entire stay.
title: Outstanding Hotel close to the city and Meadowlands
comment: First, being a Grandbournes gold level, I was upgraded at checkin to be able to use the club level. The afternoon snacks and morning breakfast was very good and convenient. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only complaint I had, was the housekeeping staff did not let enough towels in our room....but we called and received them as well as a rollaway for our 6 year old daughter. Transportation was excellent as well as timely. If you want to be close to (walkable) shopping and restaurants, this hotel is not for you....

title: perfect fit for my needs
comment: great fit for us, nice gym and club level, great service

title: Elevator
comment: Unfortunately, only 1 was running and contributed to long waits. Aside from that we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and wished we could have stayed longer!

everyoneShouldKnow: Customer Satisfaction is their first concern.
title: Best Weekend In A Long Time
comment: I am sending this letter to tellyou just how much i enjoyed your Hotel. I travel alot and spent many of days and nights in Hotels. But i have to say that this past weekend stay in your hotel was the best i have had in years. Your staff was very helpful and very polite. They seem to go out of there way to make sure you have what you need, and that your stay is like room service at home. Thank you and keep up the good work.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location - perfect view of NYC.
title: The hotel was great, perfect location, front desk and housekeeping staff were great but I have mixed reviews on the restaurant
comment: The front desk staff was great. The housekeeping staff was really good. The hotel was the perfect location for my needs. However I did run into several issues with the restaurant/room service. My co-worker went to the restaurant and they were out of everything he requested for breakfast. Then the next day he sat for 15 minutes and didn't get waited on and left. Then I went to get a drink and they were out of sangria. Then I pre-ordered room service to deliver between 7:45-8am the next morning. At 8:05am I called and they said they were sorry they forgot it. I said change it to a bagel because it is easier to make and I knew I would have time to eat it. They said another 10 minutes. 25 minutes later my order still was not there. I told them I was leaving my room in 5 more minutes. They said it would be up there. I waited another 10 minutes and my cold bagel finally arrived. He said "this time since it was 3 tries of getting it right he could give it to me for free" and I said "after wait over an hour it should be free". I felt like every time I called he acted like I was overreacting. I used to work in room service many years ago and i know the pre-ordered stuff is the top priority so to tell me that after making a mistake it would only be 10 minutes and then add another 25 and then another 10 on top of that was unacceptable. I know there are mistakes but me having to call back a third time is not acceptable.

title: Excellent Staff
comment: We arrived in NY after a very long day and we were exhausted. We were met by an entire staff of people who acted like they were waiting for us! From the valet to the front desk and beyond we really felt like we were their only guests, and they were sold out. There are plenty of places you can find a nice clean room in NYC but the Grandbourne hotels service takes it from a night in a hotel to a memorable experience. Kudos to KInga and the young man who checked us in!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Little out of the way but worth it fine place had a good nights sleep
title: Business traveler
comment: Nice Property well maintained inside

everyoneShouldKnow: A majority of the staff was rude and talked to you as if you were a child
title: Hotel is not ready for conventions
comment: This was the first time this hotel hosted the Chiller event. I want to first recognize that one of the employee's Nona was definitely there to help. Most of the other staff members talked down to us as guests which I have never experienced in my 20 years of travel. I do have some issues getting around and all chairs were removed, which did not allow people with disabilities to sit and rest. there are too many issues to list, just know that we did not have an acceptable experience.

everyoneShouldKnow: Beware of thieves. A staff member went through my bags and stole a pair of earrings.
title: Ok, but expected better for The Belvoir
comment: Overall our stay was very good, with a few exceptions. Upon arrival we were greeted promptly. Our bags were loaded onto a cart and brought in for us. We then went to checkin. It was too early, so we had to bring our bags to have held for later checkin. Which was fine, except the bellhop left me in line with the cart. I proceeded thru the line with the cart and checked the bags in myself. Not very professional for this type of hotel. If I wanted the service of a Days Inn, I would have stayed there. I accidently left a pr of earrings in a pouch in a bag that I left in the car. And someone stole them.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, shopping and restaurants in the area.
title: Excellent Staff
comment: My colleagues and I stay here 2 times a year and are never disappointed. Although one room this year did have a lot of hair in the bathroom, but nothing can be perfect and we were still happy.

title: Staff has set the bar
comment: This hotel was beyond expectations. The room was nice, clean and smelled good. With the humidity on the island I expected it to smell musty but no way. It was great. The staff was excellent from cleaning to front desk to the valet. Each were more than happy to help with information or a simple hello welcome. Even at the busy cruise ship time. I definately will be back.

title: very comfortable
comment: The only thing we struggled with was the TV which is advertising hotel and extremely difficult to get to regular TV stations. Reprogram for ease of customers please!

title: Didn't Recognize My Recent GOLD status?
comment: Hotel was in a great location, but a little run down. Good for Vandy Homecoming, but they did not recognize my status now allow for late check out?

title: Large, clean rooms!
comment: The Belvoir Fort Worth hotel surpassed our expectations. The rooms are large, very clean, and there is a safe in the closet! It is across the street from the Water Gardens and close to anyplace you want to go in Sundance Square.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location to avoid high costs of NTC
title: This Hotel is great location next to NYC
comment: Great location for NYC at reasonable cost.

title: This hotel has a great staff.
comment: Check-in was swift and friendly! The chef was excellent!! Hotel services were prompt and friendly! Valet was nice and friendly too!

title: outstanding staff
comment: The staff at the front desk should be a role model for other Grandbourne hotels!

title: Excellent Room
comment: We had a very nice suite that was spacious with all the amenities. We participated in the year of birth plan that made the stay much more affordable. Overall and excellent experience and hotel.

title: Beds are the Best!
comment: The best was the most comfortable that I have ever experienced in any hotel.

title: good hotel ok staff
comment: my husband, young son, and I recently stayed at this hotel. We have stayed here before and especially enjoy the club lounge it is definitely worth the extra couple bucks. We also opted for a suite this time which met our expectations the only downfall was being next to the elevators. Also there was only one shower towel and when we asked for more the staff completely ignored us! They also tried to charge a fifty dollar bar tab to a room and had to argue with front desk to remove it. Aside from that the motel is great and situated next to restaurants and shopping and very comfortable bed!

everyoneShouldKnow: Forgot to mention the great view of our wonderful sunsets.
title: Great Time
comment: This was my 1st time there. I was greatly impressed with the facilities and the staff. The restaurant was truly great, good selections and great prices. The rooms were spacious and the mattress was so very comfortable. Hope to try it again.

title: Wonderful hotel!
comment: This was a great hotel in a great location. I will definitely stay here again.

title: Wedding Weekend choice
comment: We chose to stay at the Belvoir for our wedding weekend because of a great stay a few years back. I was counting on a stress free stay since we had so much stress from the wedding already. From the moment of check-in, however, our stay was anything but stress-free. There was only one cart available when we unloaded so we had to wait a few minutes for one to be available to us. Then at the desk, we were less than an hour before rehearsal and they would not let me check in because the reservation was under my husband's name, even though I called twice before to confirm that there would be no issue. The gentleman at the front desk offered no options or help of any kind, which made me even more upset. Finally we were able to get up to our room and when we did, there was a soaking wet towel in the bathtub. Housekeeping did come up to take care of it right away. The elevators were incredibly slow. We waited at least 5 minutes each time, even though there are 3 elevators. Then on check out, there was a waiting list for luggage carts so we ended up taking our belongings, including my wedding dress and steamer, down in a few loads to the car. Positives: the food from room service wasn't bad and the bed was comfortable. There was no mini-fridge, which was disappointing, and the room we stayed in was pretty worn. On our previous stay, the room was much nicer. I would recommend the hotel for one reason, the location. You can't beat it but I wouldn't pay for this hotel if it wasn't where it is.

everyoneShouldKnow: Ease of access to the highway!
title: This hotel has great features
comment: My party was very happy with the room and the service.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is absolutely beautiful, and the staff is awesome, from valet parking to room service.
title: Awesome experience
comment: Enjoyed this beautiful hotel to the utmost. Cannot wait to come again. Just loved it. Especially the food and the young lady that delivered our breakfast on Sat morning.

title: The customer service was horrible
comment: It seems that employees are never prepared for the large capacity crowd that Magic City Classic weekend brings. There is never enough staff and those who are there seem very irritated and frustrated. It comes across very negatively and as extremely poor customer service. Even the manager didn't seem to know how to handle situations. Several of us had to come back to the desk, because the rooms we were given were not what we reserved or agreed to receive. This has happened to me for the past 3 years in a row. The manager tried to joke and rush to action before even comprehending my concern. Finally, however, he did get it right, but it took over 30 minutes. Next, valet completely bent my license plate. After calling it to their attention, they tried to say that it was not them. However, the plate was not bent when I first left my vehicle with valet services. They attempted to straighten it back out, but it is still slightly bent. Breakfast this year was very subpar what I'm used to having at the Belvoir. So much so, that I refused to do dinner there as my family and I usually do. There were no apologies and no show of concern for any of the issuesI I encountered. It is absolutely sad that our universities keep putting us at an establishment that doesn't seem to care about showing common courtesy, respect and proper professionalism.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is conveniently located and has an incredible staff
title: This hotel exceeds every expectation
comment: Thank you for providing luxury at an affordable price.

title: Clean hotel
comment: The hotel was very clean.

title: Staff
comment: The staff was super friendly and welcoming.

title: EXCELLENT STAY
comment: My family and I went up to the Houston area for softball select tournament and we were in and out of the hotel the entire stay. Service was always good and the club lounge selections were always full. I would recommend this hotel for anyone. Workers were very professional and the rooms were very quiet.

everyoneShouldKnow: Your employees like working there; if the employees are happy, your clients are happy.
title: WOW! Experience
comment: In our organization our goal is to give every client what we call a WOW! Experience; going above and beyond expectations. We live by it. Candice provided that for us at our employee retreat there last week. She made sure all our needs were met, checked to see what else she could provide, followed-up immediately and was fun to work with (very important!). We have employee retreats every year and our stay with you was problem free. Yay! You have a keeper in Candice and everyone who assisted us from the moment we pulled up to the moment we packed our cars to leave. If you want to provide her a WOW! Experience, please help her find the pair of shoes she's looking for :)

title: Great hotel with excellent staff
comment: The staff and their managers, Angelique & Sol, provided warm service that made me feel special!

title: Customer service was lacking
comment: I have several issues with this hotel. First, my luggage was "delayed" when I arrived and was delivered to the hotel later that night. Although I called several times to request that they notify me when it arrived, they never called or left a message on my room phone like they said they would. I had to call the next morning at 630am only to be told they did not have my bag. Except when I asked them to double check, and oh, they did have it! Also, my roomate and I asked specificially that I pay for the first three nights and she pay for the last night...they split the room rate for each night between us anyway and we had to have this corrected off of our credit cards. On Saturday they did not come to clean our room, and by 4pm we called to request that they please come...finally an hour later they came to clean. On a positive note, the room service people were friendly and efficient and the food was great both in the room and at the restaurant. Another nice thing was the comfy beds.

title: mrs
comment: every thing at the hotel was grea

everyoneShouldKnow: Check where your room will be
title: Staying in the Basement
comment: We had an early morning flight out of San Diego and after 3-great days on Coronado, we spent our last night in San Diego close to the airport @ the Belvoir. I contacted the hotel via telephone and received a great rate for the one-night. Little did I know that great rate meant a room BELOW the lobby, in a room farthest away from the lobby elevators, in a facility w/o a pool and no patio service @ the Marina site. Now, I will say the F&B Mgr. was very helpful, as was our waiter @ the Harborside rest. Both their efforts were appreciated. On check-out we were told the Hotel was full, but heard no-one else on our basement floor.

title: Excellent stay
comment: The staff was great, the location was awesome and the lounge was amazing

title: Accomodations
comment: The hotel is beautifully located. I had a view of the marina and the airport. I loved the view but hated the 6am wake up to the landing airplanes. The hotel food is ridiculously expensive. There are no vending machines in the hotel so if you have a late night beverage craving, either pay the outrageous rate in the room refrigerator or do as the hotel receptionist advised, walk off the property to a neighboring deli (at 1130pm) who had a vending machine.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location square, great rooms, no fridge
title: Lovely rooms
comment: We stayed two nights in the hotel for a wedding. I live the room decor. I usually avoid chain hotels and prefer boutique hotel and the rooms here gave the feel I love. The beds are comfy, staff was very nice, and it has an overall great feel. We did not use the pool,work out room, etc. We really enjoyed our stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's centrally located, has all the amenities you would want, the staff is extremely courteous and helpful and the rooms are comfy and clean.
title: this hotel has many amenities
comment: I was greatly surprised at all the amenities our room had to offer. Especially nice was the bath puff for the shower and the shower gel. I've never had those in a hotel room before. Our room was extremely clean as was the bathroom and our every need was met. The beds were comfy and so were the chairs which made for watching TV late at night extremely pleasant. I'll stay again and recommend this hotel to my friends.

title: Marine Corps Ball
comment: This was a beautiful hotel but there was something that made me not want to come back. Last weekend October 27 we had our Marine Corps Ball. We were suppose to get a bad storm so we called and spoke with the manager and he said as long as we came after midnight we would be able to get in our room. We arrived there at three in the morning. My husband went in the get our room and the front desk said there was a room available and remember speaking with us. Well the security did not allow us to get our room that we reserved and was available for us. He was rude and treated my husband

title: Anaheim Belvoir
comment: Nice hotel, good location for Disney. Walked one way, took bus the other way. Room was comfortable, almost too big to be honest. Wish they had dedicated some of the large room space for a larger bathroom would be my only complaint.

everyoneShouldKnow: The numbering of the floors in the elevator were confusing to say the least. We got off on the wrong floor several times... lol!
title: Wonderful Place in Paradise!
comment: The new lobby is beautiful and we enjoyed the live music they had in both the lobby and the restaurant which has great new furniture and a wonderful view! The fitness center is the most amazing place -- it made it a pleasure to work out in paradise with a view of the sunset! We loved the pool, and the business center was great as well! Loved the new furniture in the room and on the patio too! The staff was nice and they were generous with the late checkout thanks to BPG!

title: Great Motel for Marine Corp Marathon
comment: From the moment we checked in the front desk was so very accommodating

title: Best accommodation in area
comment: There are only two 4* hotels in the area and this Belvoir is by far the better. The staff and service are more friendly and what minor problems arise are quickly resolved.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good locale for large groups. We were there for softball tourney and several rooms filled w/ like families
title: Good hotel but...
comment: $10 a day for internet is crazy. Less expensive hotels include it free. Shouldn't have to go to common areas downstairs to use it. The hotel was nice, and the staff was very nice.

title: eCW conference stay
comment: Enjoyed the stay. Was passed by the shuttle driver two times. Waiting over an hour and finally a nice man drove to just come get me.

title: Very Nice hotel
comment: Had a great visit to the hotel with my son and my dog. Everyone was very friendly to all of us and welcomed our dog. I would stay there again.

title: The cleaning staff needs to be checked
comment: Upon check in, when we got to our room, we noticed that the sheets had not been changed. There was hair on them and they were very wrinkled, like they had been slept in. The bathroom floor also had hair on it. We called housekeeping to change them, and they came up. However, the housekeeper only changed 3 of the 4 pillowcases!!! How disgusting!! It makes me wonder how many rooms they have done this in!!! If we stay there again, we will bring our own pillow cases.

title: Great Value
comment: The hotel was convient to all Disney facilities without the higher cost for most hotels "on property". Complimentary transportation was available but on a very limited schedule which made planning harder. Pools were fun for the kids and room service was great.

title: temperature control
comment: The thermostat was adjustable but it did not seem to changethe temperature of the room. the room was chilly even at 85 on the thermostat

title: bathroom
comment: Bathroom size was not good. Anyone over 150 lbs would have a hard time using the toilet and shower. Way too small compared to other motels/hotels. About ten inch between commode and tub, About 30 -36 in fm tub to wall with door needs to be opened also.

title: comfort
comment: have stayed here 40 times

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient to downtown stores and resturants
title: Always been a good experience
comment: My daughter attends University of Iowa and this is my preferred place to stay when we're in town.

title: Comfortable Room
comment: I stayed two nights for a conference being held in the hotel. My room was comfortable and the bed was extremely comfortable (with plenty of pillows and high quality linen). However, my room overlooked the atrium and it was very noisy on both nights. Apparently, there were two big events going on, but that was small consolation for my lack of sleep. I think the rooms that face onto the atrium need some extra sound-proofing, or some other method has to be devised to limit the sound. I'd advise anyone booking the hotel to ask for a room that faces outwards from the atrium, not inwards.

everyoneShouldKnow: that you can wait in the bar for 25 minutes for lunch, dozens of open tables, with servers walking around you and nobody will stop to take your order, then look shocked when you walk out. Not my section is not an excuse, no management staff checking on customers is worse.
title: xx
comment: poor restaurant service, elevators very poor elevator landings very poorly kept

title: Very comfortable stay during Wash U Parents' Weekend
comment: Although the hotel was fully booked, everyone was calm, friendly and helpful. Room was spacious, clean and comfortable. Highly recommended!

everyoneShouldKnow: Perfect place to stay if you like to play at the casinos. We use this as our base to play both casinos there and for a day trip up to Atlantic City
title: Great place to stay
comment: Great room at a fair price. Staff is friendly and the Hotel is Super Clean.

title: Great hotel for conferences!
comment: I was one of the exhibitors for a conference for about 200 people in late October. The staff, helping in the exhibit hall of the hotel, was extremely helpful when I needed extra storage room, return merchandise, clean-up etc.

title: 2nd stay was just ok
